name: Zong
description: Karl-Heinz Schmiel's entry into the flicking games category. This is a children's game. Ages 8 and up Players are racing to achieve the goal at the end of the shuffleboard-like game board. Instead of throwing the usual 2-sided dice markers (1/6; 2/5; or 3/4) a player can toss the special 2-sided marker (spiral/lightning bolt). If a lightning bolt is tossed, the player may use a striker to flick a player's piece from their position on the score track.

name: Tryopoly
description:
Tryopoly is a property-purchasing game -- similar to Monopoly -- but played on a triangular board, with hexagonal tiles that are placed on the board as the game progresses. Players roll a die and move 1 to 3 spaces towards the red corner or the blue corner of the board, depending on which color was rolled. Property tiles may be bought and placed onto empty spaces that have been landed on or passed over. Existing properties may be moved in the same way, usually to form a TRYOPOLY: where all the property tiles within a group occupy the same row, and command a much higher rent.

The properties in this game were meant to be local and recognizable to the players, so there is no "official" version of this game. Each version features a different city (such as Cleveland, Kansas City, and Washington D.C.) and the businesses and organizations found there.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Sequenz
description:
The game has 4 sets of 20 thick wooden tiles in 4 colors, which are numbered from 1-20. The 4x5 fields of the board also show the numbers 1-20.

Object of the game is to score the most points, but these points are given at the end of the game only! The game ends when all 80 tiles are placed on the board, but only the top tiles are valued; adjacent tiles of the same color give bonus points.

To reduce the influence of luck, the hand of 10 tiles is not filled randomly, but can be taken from 10 open tiles. Anyway, it's a game where you need a good memory, because you should remember which tiles have been played already and thus can't help you getting some bonus points.

This game is very easy to learn and play, but it's not so easy to find the best strategy.

name: Racing Snakes
description:
From the box:

"It's a simple game, just race across and back again.
Shake the dice and move your snake, but then some care you'll have to take.
Round the tree you'll have to go, see what colour you can throw."

Each player has a snake which consists of six plastic hexagons and a head piece. Players are also given a tree, the hexagonal base of which matches the color of the head of their particular snake. The trees serve as markers, defining start & finish points and course layout.

The plastic hexagons which form the 'body' of each snake come in six colors; these correspond to the colored dots on the sides of the die used for gameplay. Snakes move forward depending on the color thrown on the die; the color thrown becomes the TAIL of the snake and all hexagons situated behind this are moved to the front of the snake. The hexagonal segments must remain in the same sequence throughout the game.

The first player to complete whatever course was determined prior to the game starting is the winner (generally snakes start adjacent to their tree and return).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Saber y Ganar
description:
Based on the TV contest Saber y Ganar (To know and To win). Ages 12 and up

3 competitors play, answering questions of general culture during diverse tests.

Content:

- 6 game pieces
- 936 questions cards
- 3 marking boards
- 1 rules book
publishers: Borras Plana S.A., Falomir Juegos, Simba Toys

name: Street Fighter II
description: Danger lurks around every corner as your Street Fighter struggles to save humanity from the dreaded villain, M. Bison. Choose your Street Fighter character pawn. Then race across the 3-D city gameboard in pursuit of enemy World Warriors. Challenge them by rolling special dice in the Battle Arena. Every winning battle gives you more strength for your final showdown with M. Bison. When you're powerful enough, storm Bison's fortress for the ultimate battle. Do you have the power and courage to destroy him and become the greatest Street Fighter of them all.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bubble Brain
description:
Bubble Brain, "It's the Thought that Counts!"

It's the players task to make up funny captions for the goofy photos included.

Players write captions for photos and then try and guess which player wrote which caption. The first player to make it around the bubble-shaped board wins. Bubble stickers are also included so players can use their own photos, in addition to the 300 included.

name: Devil's Advocate
description: A reader reads a statement from a card, and the remaining players have one minute to debate it. Each debater then plays a card that indicates i) whether he believes the reader will agree or disagree with the statement and ii) the number of points (1,2,or 3) that the debater is willing to risk on his guess. Each correct debater keeps his card with its points. The next player becomes the new reader. The first player to 21 points wins.

name: The Funny Farm Game
description:
The object is to collect the animals from the farm. For this, the items hidden under the straw must be memorized.

The player that collects his assigned animals first wins the game.

Four animals are placed on the circular board (sheep, cow, horse and pig). The rest of the animals are placed in the barn.

Next to each field on the board, a straw card is placed with the hidden items. On each of these an object from the farm is depicted. Of each item there are two cards.

Each player is dealt three cards with the animals to be collected. On each turn a player rolls a die and selects an animal to move. After the move, the straw card next to the animal is turned to show the item. The the player selects any other straw card and turns it as well. Following results can happen:


The items on the cards are the same, and the animal that was moved is one of the assigned ones. The player then takes the animal into his collection and ends his turn.
The items on the cards are the same, and the animal that was moved is not one of the assigned ones. The player then takes a new animal from the barn and places it on the board and ends his turn.
The items on the cards are not the same. The player then ands his turn.


After this all open straw cards are turned back again.

The player that has collected all his assigned animals wins the game.

Variant for younger players: The assignment cards are not used and whenever two matching items are found, the player takes the animal. When all items are taken, the player with the most animals wins.

—user summary

Country life is great, isn't it? The familiar farm animals and the great 3D pieces give you great fun in this exciting game for children. The cards tell you which three animals you need to bring your plot to graze. You can take an animal whenever you find two similar objects from the farm. The player, who is the first to get all three animals, is the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Farming, Memory
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pict it
description:
Each player is given 7 cards.
One player think of an answer that could be formed by a certain number of cards, show them to everybody to see and says a theme, other players have to find the answer.

Like Concept, but with cards instead of a board.

—user summary
publishers: Païlle Editions, Play it a game

name: The War to End All Wars: Box Set Edition
description:
The War to End All Wars is a World War I territorial strategy game. A variant of the Axis & Allies board game system, it offers an easy to play D10 based combat system and territories with resource values for production.
The War to End All Wars presents the First World War in a couple different ways. The first of these is a historical simulation that offers alliances, political structures, and entry times for the various nations designed to mirror the actual historical chain events that transpired in real life. The second scenario is the semi historical scenario and makes allowances for player choices and deviant actions by many nations. This scenario can see Japan get more active in the war, the US and/or Italy possibly enter on the Central Powers side, the Ottomans stay neutral or even join the Allies, and much more.

While not a complex game that breaks down the individual national armies into named brigades or divisions, the level of historical detailing in The War to End All Wars is enough that multiple professors now utilize this game to help teach the WW1 era to middle, high school, and even college students.

The War to End All Wars comes with:

1) 2 piece 17" x 44" color game map on thick glossy paper. Map provides an enlarged game area for Europe, then smaller map zones for Asia, Africa, and North America to allow for representation of the entire global war.
2) 40 page Rule & Scenario booklet
3) Score pad with 30 nation sheets
4) 1D10
5) Approx. 190 Plastic Unit Stands
6) 1,100+ Card Stock Land & Sea units for:
-- British Empire
-- French Empire
-- Russian Empire
-- German Empire
-- Austro-Hungarian Empire
-- Ottoman Empire
-- Italy
-- Japanese Empire
-- United States of America
-- China & Neutral nations
-- Ports, Ind. Complexes, Trenches, & Misc.
-- Generals, Resource Chits, Incorp. Markers

Expanded by:

War to End All Wars: World War I Expansion with War of 1812 and Mexican War
The War to End All Wars: The Great War in Africa
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Predator: The Forest Food Chain Game
description:
From Back of Box:

"Predator is a whole new idea in card decks based upon the natural food relationships in a temperate zone forest. An animal takes what it eats and is taken by what eats it. Plants, as basic producers of food score higher energy points than animals. Play a variety of food chain games and adaptations of old favorites. Card deck of 40 illustrated cards. 2-6 players. Ages 8 and up."

name: Alex & Co
description:
This game is named after Alex Randolph and jointly published by the Europäische Spielesammlergilde and the Spieleautorenzunft. The game has been announced for Essen 2010.
The cards show famous game designers and the games they designed. The number of game cards for each designer varies; the goal in this memory style game is to collect as many games from a given designer as possible.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Scene It? HBO
description:
From the Publisher:

Add HBO clips and trivia cards to your Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game game!

Presenting the HBO edition of Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game featuring HBO's critically acclaimed and award winning series, movies and stand up comedy that everyone's talking about. The Sopranos, Sex and the City, Curb Your Enthusiasm, Six Feet Under, Band of Brothers, Chris Rock: Bigger and Blacker, they're all here along with the rest of your favorites.

Game Pack Includes:

DVD with scenes and images from your favorite HBO shows and 700+ on-screen trivia challenges.
288 trivia card questions.
4 Category Reference Cards
1 Die


Expands:

Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Four Field Kono
description:
This is one of the new mini-leather travel games by HiKu that comes with a a leather game board in a 7 by 7 cm wooden box. This is a small tactics game from Korea.

Korean abstract strategy game. In Denmark it is also known as Gok.

The board consist of 16 squares, 4 by 4. Each player has 8 pawns, which are placed with the 8 whites at the top 2 rows, and the 8 black at the bottom 2 rows.

The are two ways of moving:

Move one square, vertical or horizontal, into an empty square.

Jump over one of your own pawns and land directly on top of an opponent's pawn, vertical or horizontal, and thereby taking the opponent's pawn out of the game.

The goal is to take away all of the opponent's pawns, or to force him into a situation where he cannot move.
publishers: Baolin, Guild Publishing, HiKu Spiele, L. P. Septímio, Nyt Nordisk Forlag, W. Forster Games

name: Dice-Ball Baseball Game
description:
Dice-Ball Baseball Board Game 1930's.
manufactured by the The Educational Toy Company in Kitchener, Ontario, Canada
The game is approx. 20 X 20". with a green felt type playing surface with the layout of a ball field and spaces
for outs,runs, hits, etc. The board shows players in old uniforms and hats.

There is a single die which has a pair of smaller dice inside the larger one. That single large die is labeled on 4 sides and also has 2 clear sides that you can see into. The marked sides show a STRIKE, a BALL, a FOUL Ball and these are in fact the results of the die roll if those sides how up on the roll.

BUT If the clear side of this large DIE is rolled you can see inside of the die and what you see are a pair of dice, one colored red, and one colored green. If you can see dice instead of a pitch then what has been rolled on those dice determine the results of the play.

Also one of the Clear sides also has red dot on it. The results of the dice looking through this side of the clear facing are different than results determined if looking through the clear side without the red dot.

The results code shows what happens depending on the dice roll and if men are on differing bases.

Information about this game was gathered and approval given from BUTCH7999 and his BASEBALL GAME SITE.

name: Air Traffic Control
description: A London-New York flight in a very original multi part and long board. 2 to 9 players play as Air Traffic Controllers flying 747's from the U.K. to the USA., game based on true-to-life air traffic services.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Gnav
description:
A classic game with roots back to 15th. century Italy, where it was called Cuccu. 300 years later it came to Scandinavia under the name Gnao. Slabberjan is a Dutch game that is similar to Gnav, while the Swedish version (1741) is known as Kille.

This is a well-known game in Norway, and can be played with cards or beautiful, hand-made playing pieces.
The cardgame is actually Damm's oldest game that is still in print.

Players are each dealt a random card with a rank, which they keep face down. There is a round of trading, in which you may force a trade with a neighbor. Some cards trigger special effects during trading. After the trading, the worst card loses the round. The heart of the game is in judging whether or not to do a forced trade in the interest of being not-worst.

name: Kreuzwortwürfeln
description:
There are 14 dice with letters. You have to write words with these 14 letters in crosswords. Rare letters count more points than usual letters.

Kreuzwortwürfeln is a word dice game.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Berliner Spielkarten, Noris Spiele, Simba Toys

name: Buzz It! Demonstratiespel
description:
This is a small demonstrationgame for Buzz It!. You can also expand Buzz It! with it. There are 10 cards with extra questions and a rulebook in this game.

In Buzz It! and in this demogame you get 10 cards wich each hold 2 questions. You divide the cards equally between the players and each at a turn asks one of the two questions on a card.

Each of the other players now has to answer the question at their turn. Each player has 5 to 8 seconds to give an answer that the quizmaster has to accept. (In a normal Buzz It! game you can use the timer for this). The players have to keep giving answers until one player runs out off time. If this happens that player gets the card with the question as a negative point. The next player can now ask a question, this goes on until all players used all off their cards. The player with the less negative points wins the game.

name: The Big Lockdown
description:
The Big Lockdown is a tongue-in-cheek card game inspired by people’s experiences whilst in Lockdown during the global pandemic. The game is filled with references to life in lockdown including toilet paper hoarding, home schooling, and work meetings conducted from the toilet.

The aim is to build your stockpile of supplies whilst avoiding infection.

Deciding which of two decks to draw from lets you decide the risks you're going to take. Winning the game is the about balancing these dangers: do you stay at home, safely consuming supplies, or will you venture into the daunting outdoors to build your stockpile?

Players can collect cards that gain them supplies, allow them to loot other from other players and give them a chance to force other players into risky positions.

A fun and funny game for the whole family to enjoy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Push Your Luck, Stock Holding, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Trading

name: Passe-moi un sapin
description:
In Passe-moi un sapin, each player is given a card with 3 words.

If another player says one of the word on the card, he receives the card as a penalty, as in the game Say What!?

The player with the most cards at the end receives a special card and must do what is written on it.
publishers: Ludik Québec, Productions du lampiste (Productions of lamplighter)

name: For the Record: 80's & 90's Edition
description:
From the box:

You were looking for a fun game that covers the broad spectrum of music from this era? Look no more - it's here! For the Record 80's & 90's Edition covers everything from rap to reggae, alternative to country, pop to punk and more! The multiple choice format and clever board design make For the Record challenging enough for trivia buffs yet equally fun for people who simply love music. For the Record brings back the music & culture of the 80's & 90's with electric excitement! Another #1 smash hit - from the request line to you!

name: Rrrats!
description:
From the publisher's website:

May the greediest rat win! Roll the dice and get cheese! Roll the dice and lose cheese! In this family game, it pays off to be both careful and greedy. All players are rats that aim to collect as much cheese as possible. Player rolls the dice, and either gets cheese from the table, from another player, or loses everything. The trick is to stop rolling when you’re still winning. With simple rules and a simple set-up, Rrrats! is an addictive game for the whole family.

name: UNO Quatro
description:
UNO Quatro is a classic four in a row game with an UNO twist!

On your turn, play a tile in a column and try to make four in a row by matching color or number. There are three action tiles that can change the game. Swap lets you swap the positions of any two columns. Minus 2 removes some of your opponent's options. Lastly, Push pushes the bottom tile out of the column.

Pay attention to what you play- everyone shares the tiles and you might set up your opponent's victory!

—description from the publisher

name: Tricky Trucks Game
description:
From the box:

Thomas has collected four trucks from the sheds and is setting off around Sodor to fill them up with important cargo. Help Thomas load up these tricky trucks by choosing a station and using the loading chute to load them up. Be quick to load up your tricky truck, switch the station lever and win the game!


Tuut, tuut, here comes Thomas is a battery operated action game. Thomas the Tank Engine and four different colored wagons moves around the board and each player has 8 balls that they need to drop in their "launcher" at the exact time so that it falls in "their" wagon. To complicate matters a bit, the wagons are only open in a short time.

Unlike Looping Louie (perhaps the best known battery operated action game amongst the BGG users), there are no interactivity between the players, so you only need to concentrate on your own balls and wagon.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains

name: The Magic of Football
description: Make the best team as coach, play the tournament and bring your team to the final.

name: Zeg geen Ja, Zeg geen Nee
description:
Players have to answer questions as quickly as possible but are not allowed to say Yes or No (Ja or Nee in Dutch). There is a timer. When all questions on a card have been answered without Yes or No, the player can keep the card. When the time is over, the next player can attempt to earn as many cards as possible within the time available.
The player who finishes with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Number Mastermind
description:
If you are familiar with Mastermind, then you know how to play number mastermind. In place of colors, there are numbers.

Players try to deduce the hidden 3 or 4-digit code. You present a guess to your opponent and he/she indicates how many numbers are correct and in the right place and how many are correct and not in the right location.

You continue with subsequent guesses until you run out of turns or until the numbers are decoded.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Baby Boomer Master Game
description:
This is a Master Game, complete with board, die, moving pieces and scoring wedges. The cards are the same as in the popular Baby Boomer Edition Subsidiary Card Set. The board is the same as from the original 1981 Trivial Pursuit. In some printings, the background color of the board is the same garnet shade as the box. In others it is blue, identical to the original board.

The categories are:
Television
Stage & Screen
Nightly News
Publishing
Lives & Times
R.P.M.

name: Because Potatoes
description:
Meet Pata TENSLIP, King POTATO, Pata TAPOIL and Rocky POTATO in crazy adventures! Four types of potatoes have crazy accessories : crowns, boxing gloves, slip ... or nothing ;).

Each player has three cards in hand and one card is placed on the table to start the game. One by one, place a card that has a common point with the last card placed on the table. Win the fold by placing a card on the potato which has something in common with the previous one but nothing in common with the starting potato.
The game ends when the deck is empty. The player with the most of potatoes wins the game !

There is also 5 variants to increase fun and challenge!

name: Romeo und Julia
description: A lavishly produced trick taking game themed around some play that no one has ever heard of. The three suits are hearts, Montagues and Capulets. There are also cards for sleeping potions, poison, stabbings. Players secretly declare whether they want the lovers to wed or to kill them off. (The lone Shakespeare card is in fact a bid towards killing them off...)

name: Magic Cauldron Game
description:
Players aim to be the first to fill their cauldron in this mathematically educational game for children Ages 4 - 8.

The ingredients cards each have a number on the reverse. When a player has his turn, he turns it over to reveal a number.

Sum cards are spread out on the table. The player drawing an ingredient card, has to find a sum (using =,-, x) that equals the number on the ingredient. They then rub the "magic black ghost" on the back of the sum card. If that number equals the one on their ingredient, then they get to add that card to their cauldron board.

You need 10 ingredients to fill your cauldron and win the game.

You can play an alternative version whereby the sum cards are turned over one at a time and the ingredient cards are spread out on the table.

name: Monopoly: America's National Parks Edition
description: This is the classic game of Monopoly with an America's National Parks theme. It uses images and names of 22 of America's National Parks, and has appropriately themed pewter tokens: Fishing Reel, Mountain Bike, Camera, Tent, Hiking Boot, and Canoe.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cross Over
description:
A short abstract game published by Schmidt International in the Seventies. Each of the two players tries to be the first to connect two opposite sides of the board using a series of plastic tiles.
Each player can start from everywhere on the board, and can choose freely which two sides to connect with the tiles.

name: Papercuts
description:
Description from the publisher:

A Party game for the rude and well-read.

Everyone knows that the only thing better than reading a book is pretending you've read it at a party. So gather some friends, some booze, and play Papercuts, a party game for the rude and well-read. To play, the Editor reads a question card, and the Writers submit their funniest answer cards for the Editor to choose from. Then, everyone complains about how no one will publish their genius novel.

Papercuts is compatible with Cards Against Humanity and other similar games.

name: Test Drive
description: A rather bland variant of the older Dealer's Choice. Buy and sell cars and try to get a dealership. Prices are fixed which reduces the bluffing and strategic value. A roll of the die also helps as players travel around a board and follow instructions.

name: Clintonopoly!
description:
Another "Monopoly" clone, but set around a theme of the Clinton Presidency. Plays much like classic Monopoly, but things are replaced: you collect "Hush Money," get sent to Sen. Fulbright's office instead of jail; pay Capital Gains Tax instead of a Luxury tax; and so on. The game isn't particularly harsh, though, more like light satire.

A "Hush Fund" (read: Free Parking) is an official rule of the game, paid by all fines that are not rent.

The game revolves much around the "Whitewater" deal (remember that?), and is billed as "The Great American Sell-off Game." Properties include major monuments and governmental properties, such as the UN, Whitewater, Air Force One, and the Washington Monument.

Of trivia interest: Only a month after I bought this game, the Arlington Cemetery (pay cash = get plot) scandal hit the Clintons. We had lots of fun buying the Arlington Cemetery after that.

name: Superman III
description:
Basically a cross between "Blackjack" and a competitive version of "Bingo." Lay out the 25 Adventure cards in a 5 x 5 grid, then start dealing out the 52 Number cards to each player one at a time at the players' discretion. If a player is dealt a sequence of Number cards that add up to 8, 9, 10, or 11, they can turn over one or more Adventure cards and place a counter of their color on them, or displace an opponent's counter from an already-revealed Adventure card. If a player busts (is dealt a sequence totaling more than 11), he or she has to remove one of their already-placed counters. The first player to get counters on all five of the Adventure cards in any row or column is the winner.

The approximate playing time printed on the box is 5 to 15 minutes. The box recommends the game for children Ages 6 - 12.

Although the box says, "Based on the Movie," the game uses comic-book art rather than art or stills from the film, and in fact doesn't seem to have anything to do with the movie at all. No Richard Pryor, no fractions of cents, nothing.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Moovit
description: A fast-paced sound and card game. Try to match the animal or color AND make the animal's sound from cards in your hand. The point is to discard while matching cards fast and try and get out of cards before the time is up. If the timer says Moovit before you are out of cards, you draw 4 cards and the next player goes. You must make the sound of the animal on the card each time you put down a card. If you don't, you're penalized by drawing 2 cards. Things get a bit more complicated as you are not supposed to make the animal sound when you play a red card. There are other special cards that reverse direction and other effects kind of like Uno. Easy to learn and play.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Electronic, Party Game, Real-time

name: Soccer Drama
description: Soccer Drama does not have your usual soccer board. Players are moved up and down lines along the field to get within a scoring area allowing them to draw a card for score. Certain spaces present blocking and penalty opportunities.

name: Real-ity Estate
description:
Two to six players deal in alternate dimensional 'real estate' in this game that was published in Intruder magazine #3.

Players move around the board trying to gain access to property in other dimensions. Players may recruit armies, fight for possession of dimensional 'real estate', plunder other players, and may have to overcome pitfalls along the way.

The first player to control points in all nine dimensions is the winner.

name: Cargo
description: With Cargo you are a forwarder and international trader. You buy goods an world markets, and , as a forwarder, you organize suitable means of transport, work out the routing, take over the forwarding jobs such as filling out the freight documents, customs clearing and shipping advices and in this way ensure streamlined progress from dispatcher to consignee. You will also have to struggle with the problems involved in forwarding but with good calculations, good counting and also a little luck you'll become a forwarder and businessman of worldwide experience...

name: Rags to Riches
description:
RAGS TO RICHES is a dice-based stock trading game where each player races to accumulate enough wealth to build his/her own luxury mansion and "retire" to a quiet life.

The mechanics of the game are quite simple. Players move around the board, buying and selling stock shares in hopes of creating a profit for themselves so that they can make even bigger investments later on. Stock prices are always determined by a dice-roll, so prices move up and down quickly and randomly. Certain "safe" stocks don't move around in price that much and offer higher dividends, while riskier stocks are much more volatile, but tend to offer higher returns. The challenge is for each individual player to determine how much money he/she can afford to risk in any particular situation since an unlucky dice roll can wipe that player out.

There is also a simple, yet elegant means of borrowing money in this game. Players are allowed to borrow money from the bank as long as they pay back double the borrowed amount by the time that his/her token completes two full turns around the board. This helps to make the game more strategic since players will often find themselves in need of extra cash which they can only borrow with a pretty high interest penalty.

Overall, RAGS TO RICHES is a nice blend of strategy and luck (probably 70% strategy, 30% luck). The games typically last around 120 minutes (depending on who is playing) and usually keeps everyone in the game until the very end.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Domination
description:
"The two greatest challenges facing the military leader today are imparting professional knowledge to the solder and subsequent application of that knowledge in a training environment and/or on the field of battle . . . Training Technologies is committed to making that first great challenge much less difficult for you by enabling you to obtain a solid grip on the fundamentals of military knowledge; and we hope that by mastering 'Domination' you will become a much more knowledgeable and professional soldier/leader."

A trivia game in the style of Trivial Pursuit (fill your jeep with passengers by answering questions in various areas of military knowledge). Features 100 Q&A cards with questions in six different categories. The Domination questions come in six categories: Leadership, Soldier Skills, Weaponry, Military History, Tactics, Friends and Foes. Veterans and hardcore military buffs will appreciate questions such as "When utilizing the leaf sights of the M203 grenade launcher, what is the maximum range you are able to select?"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Dr. Ruth's Game of Good Sex
description: Dr. Ruth has been providing clinical chicken soup for decades, now you can experience her humor and common-sense practicality playing a fun board game. As couples move their pawn around the board, accumulating Arousal Points as they visit Dr. Ruth's Sex Clinic, stop to Ask Dr. Ruth, and answer questions relating to each other's sexual awareness. With easily learned rules, the game provides unlimited hours of amusing and informative dialogue for couples.
categories: Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Mouse House
description:
The object of the game is to get your 3 mice, who start in one of the corners, into the Mouse House in the middle of the board.
2 die are thrown and you can then move one mouse the combined amount, or two mice, one the distance of the first dice and the other the distance on the second.
Mice must move in a straight line and can only turn if they meet an obstacle (a pawn piece).
The order of play is
1. Place an obstacle.
2. Roll dice
3. Move mice

The first person to get all 3 mice home is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Traumland
description:
A trick-taking cardgame with themed cards from fairytales and novels.

There are four color suits in the game numbered 1-11 and two special cards; the "Divine Card" and "The Dreamer". The Dreamer can be played as any value, the Divine card can be played at any time in order to kill-off a suite and can only be trumped by a 1 of any suit or the Dreamer card.

During the game rounds players attempt to gain tricks by playing higher level cards of the same suit, in order to rise up on a ranking chart to level 12. Each trick won corresponds to one ranking. If a player arrives at level 12, he has not necessarily won as if another player reaches 12 later that round, that player is deemed the victor, underlining the importance of timing the trick taking.

name: Route NL
description: Players each run a Dutch passenger railroad company. Each company has claims which are moved around the board; these determine where the railroads can run routes, and also earn money for routes than run through them (no matter who runs them). Each passenger transported also pays a variable amount. Players can invest in bigger trains, bus companies to transport passengers from cities without train service, and headquarters buildings (which earn more money when included in routes). The object is to have the most money.

name: Where's the Beef?
description: Where's the beef is a combination roll and move/memory game. Food tiles are randomly placed faced down on the board, a Big Bun restaurant, which is the layout of a typical Wendy's. Players take turns moving through the restaurant. When they come across a face down tile they can secretly look at it. Some tiles prescribe certain actions. Others are food, and have no effect. Afterward the player returns the tile to the original position. The object is to be the first player to find the 4 hidden The Beef tokens. When a player believes he knows the locations, he or she announces it, and attempts to flip over all 4 beef tiles. Failure to do so results in a loss, success results in a win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Swamp Thing: Battle For The Bayou Game
description:
BATTLE FOR THE BAYOU

A game of strategy and chance for 2 to 4 players ages 7 and up.

Join SWAMP THING™ and his heroic companions Tomahawk™ and Bayou Jack™ on a perilous journey to the heart of the bayou. Dr. Anton Arcane™ must be confronted, and his evil plot to destroy the bayou must be foiled.

Along the way, you will encounter The Un-men™, Arcane's hideous henchmen, and at last, face Dr. Anton Arcane in the final climatic clash of this exciting Swamp Thing adventure!

Equipment:
• Game Board;
• 36 card SWAMP THING Deck;
• 8 HERO Cards;
• Battle Die;
• 4 Pawns;
• Complete instructions for play.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: In a Spin
description:
This is a simple Memory variant.

There are 16 animal cards, one of each animal, and a "die staff" containing 4 dice. Each die can show 4 different animals.

The aim of the game is to find all four animals in one game turn. A player turns the dice, and lays the staff down. It now shows 4 animals. The first player may now reveal 4 cards to try to find these animals. If he succeeds, he receives a reward chip. If he reveals an incorrect animal, all animals are turned face down, and the next player can try to find them.

The first player with 5 reward chips wins the game.

Winner of Deutscher Kinderspiele-Preis 1993

name: Change the Word
description:
The game consists of a large number of cards, some are syllable cards with one, two or three letters on it. The rest of the cards have a single letter, which are also marked with a points value.

The single letters are displayed alphabetically. The syllable cards are shuffled and one turned over as the starting piece.

Each player takes it in turn to add a single letter to the word, to make a longer word. Each player scores the value of the letter card they added.

The game finishes when no one can add a letter to make a word.

name: U.S. Rails
description:
Simulates the folding of American railroads into Amtrak.

A standalone game that requires many components (including the board) from Rail Baron in order to play, but is not an expansion or variant.

name: Road Block
description:
In Roadblock, players try to build the most wide-spanning road network while blocking their opponents from doing so.

The players begin the game with 5 road tiles in hand and each turn they draw a new one. After laying down their first tile, they extend their road network each turn by playing a tile to continue the road from the tile played in the previous turn. Players can also take their turn to play their tiles on their opponent's road. If a player is unable to continue from a tile played in the previous turn, he or she can continue his or her road from the last intersection or the very first tile.

The game ends when a player has built a road network that spans at least 12 tiles across; curves at the ends are excluded from the count. The player that has completed such a road has won the game. The game also ends when all tiles have been drawn and played. If no players have not completed a road in the manner mentioned before, then the one whose network spans across the most tiles is the winner.

name: Four Function Snap
description: A unique card deck designed to teach children children basic math concepts using snaps and pairs. Covers addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, as well as a few square roots, squares, and cubes. Ages 7 and up

name: Wide Open
description: Race fans! Your goal is to collect all of the cards that will allow you to run WIDE OPEN and race to the finish line. Roll the dice, hit the right combination and take the checkered flag. It's real racing action! You must qualify to race, roll out of pit stops, and beware of racing hazards that may shift the lead on any turn. Watch out! There's always the chance of a wipe out. Have fun... It's Awesome!

name: 38th Parallel
description: A strategic simulation of the Korean War by Simulation Design Corporation. Came in a ziplock bag. Contents: 1 map, 228 counters and rules.

name: The Saddle Club Showjumping Game
description: Players vie to be the first to successfully complete all 10 jumps on the course. Roll the die and move your horse. Land on a Judge space and receive Judge's card to help or hinder you.

name: The Amusing Game of Innocence Abroad
description:
This game was designed by a woman known to history only as "Mrs. Shephard." This is the first game produced under license by Parker Brothers. (Source: The Game Makers: the Story of Parker Brothers by Philip Orbanes)

The board is a stylized map illustrating activities which an American Tourist might engage in as they travel around Europe. The players start in the houses at the top left of the board, each with two tokens, and using a "spinner" or one or two dice, travel through the "shopping district", making purchases for their trip. Exiting the "shopping district", they take a cab to the Depot, and begin their trip on the railroad to the city. Some spaces have red dots, and include instructions that the players must follow, such as taking alternative routes (which can be shorter or longer than the main path), or moving to other red dots on the board, either forward or backward. Midway on the track (at the center of the board) is the "Centerville Depot" which a player must enter, and spend more for a meal. The end of the game has several water routes branching off from the railroad, which must be taken if they are landed on. If a player lands on another player on the railroad or a water route, the player landed on is sent back to the Depot.

Players have two tokens, and a choice about which to move, which affects how much debt they incur, and whether they get stuck into bad situations.

The winner of the game is the first one to reach the end with both tokens, unless the second player reaches the end with both tokens, having spent less than half as much as the first player.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Tell-A-Story
description:
Let´s Play! There are many stories waiting to be discovered and told! Each player uses their memory skills to try to be the first player to collect all five story cards about a single character. Once all of the players have collected all of their story cards, they arrange their cards to tell a story of their choice. Maybe the kitten unraveled the sweater and rolled the yarn into a tidy ball. Or maybe the clever kitten started with the ball of yarn and knit his very own sweater! Encourages children to develop their imagination and creativity as well as logical thinking and language skills.

Ages 4 and up

Awards

1990 Årets Børnespil, Childrens Game of the Year Denmark
publishers: Mál og menning, Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburger

name: Triple Flips 8: Auto Racing
description:
Triple Flips 8 includes Indy Pit Stop, Le Mans 24 Hour Race, and Off-Road Challenge Race.


Indy Pit Stop simulates an Indy 500-style race between 2-4 players. This is a roll-and-move game with some unusual pitfalls along the track. Once you have car trouble and have to make a pit stop, you roll a die to determine what the pit crew finds wrong with your car. 1-3 indicates a refueling is in order; 4, tire change; 5, spark plugs; and 6 means it's overheating. The various problems can take different amounts of time to fix.



Le Mans 24 Hour Race is a 1-player game.



Off-Road Challenge Race is a roll-and-move race game with some zany track elements. Spaces such as "Other cars go ahead 4" and "Go behind lead car" provide unusual interaction of the vehicles.

name: Air Trix
description: Race against the clock to score points in this fascinating jet stream action game. Maneuver the ball on a cushion of air through the rungs of the ladder, onto to barrel on the seal's nose, through the weather vane into the bucket and finally into the helicopter cockpit to pick up the mail. You score points for each stunt. The player with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Las Vegas Junket
description: Feel all the excitement of Las Vegas when you play Blackjack, Craps, Roulette, Baccarat, Big Wheel and those wonderful slot machines. This game is for 2-4 players.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scooby-Doo! Bobblehead Game
description:
Players draw menu cards that have a list of various snacks. The active player then deals out a number of snack cards appropriate to each player depending on where they are on the game board. The active player then draws snack cards one at a time from the draw pile. If he doesn't need the card he passes it. If it’s a snack he needs he keeps it and passes a different card from his hand. Cards continue to pass around the table until a player has all the snacks on his menu card. He then grabs the Scooby-Doo bobblehead from the center of the board. The other players now grab the Mystery Machine tokens, however, there is one fewer tokens than there are players.

The player grabbing Scooby advances along the board using a spinner (3, 4 or 5 spaces). Players who grabbed a token move one space. The player who got nothing does not move at all. The first player to reach the Finish space is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Vive la difference! de Remy Martin
description:
Remy Martin produce Cognac and this promotional game, published with Ravensburger, is for the connoisseur and bon vivant amongst you (them that knows a bit and likes a good dinner).

The game is a roll & move tour around Europe, trying to land on the given city and answer a quiz question. Players collect gourmet cards and coins, worth victory points. Answering questions correctly allows players to make jumps around Europe.

The production is superb, all in the style of Remy Martin's luxurious corporate packaging of black with red & gold highlights. The map of Europe is black with gold lines, the cards are black with photos of delicious meals, the dice are black & gold. Even the box inlay is black velvet. The player's tokens are casks, the city marker is a tiny cognac bottle in a clear plastic case. And the 20 golden coins, held in a small leather pouch, are proper weighty metal coins, stamped with grapes and the company's logo and date 1724.

The rule book (a full color magazine) has rules in French, English, German, Dutch, Italian & Spanish. The rest of the booklet is a lavish product promotion, showing how the cognac is made and the product range. All in all, a nice bit of promo for both Remy Martin & harmony in Europe.

name: Bargain Day
description:
-From the Rulebook-

Players enter the store in the mad rush of Bargain Day by the throw of seven on the dice, which represents the early seven o'clock opening. They gather around the Information Desk to receive information regarding purchases they wish to make; then move through the store, making purchases at the least possible expense with the money provided. Having done so, they must call some other member of the family by telephone to assist in carrying home their purchases.

The player who shops most economically; that is, the one who has the most money remaining at the end of the game, is the Winner. As prizes are offered for the fastest shopper, the player who reaches the sidewalk in front of the store (in the company of some other family member of the family) is usually the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivial Pursuit: Bild Edition [German]
description: Not much to say about this one - it's Trivial pursuit. This time with 1800 questions (300 cards) dealing with a quite famous German boulevard newspaper named "Bild"-Zeitung. Categories include headlines, gossip, Germany, sports etc.

name: Göring's War
description:
Goring's War was published in Panzerschreck Magazine #8 as a mini-sim. It is a fast and simple game portraying air-to-air combat in WWII during the Battle of Britain.

The game consists of 5 pages of rules, 20 counters and a game map; the counters must be mounted and cut out prior to use. A regular deck of cards is required to play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: (T)Raumschiff Surprise Periode 1: Das Spiel
description: The game is based on a successful movie of the same name. Each player gets a number of chips with which to bid on cards of various colors. Bids are hidden and simultaneous, high bid gives his chips to the lowest bidder (in case of a tie, the next highest non-tied player wins). Each card, once obtained, has an assignment / action on it that must be carried out. There are also Taxi cards that make players do certain things and bad cards (Jens-Maul Cards) that are awarded randomly but in typical party game fashion: when a bad card turns up, each player has to run to the anti-gravity machine (set up somewhere else in the house, for example) and press the button. Whoever is randomly selected by the player has being the heaviest (i.e. too fat to float) gets the bad card. Each bad card increases the number of cards in a single color needed to win by one: normally you need three of a kind, so having one bad card ups it to four.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Quote Unquote
description: Quotations are read aloud and everyone tries to identify the same famous people. Players do not have to recognize the quotes to guess the identities. The quotes themselves are clues. Each quotation card contains the names of three famous people that are related in some way. On their turn, players choose any of the three hidden identities and slide the door that reveals the next quote. The players may then guess the identity of any of the three personalities on the cards, thereby scoring points.

name: Wer Hat Die Kokosnuss?
description:
From the box bottom: "Today the monkeys in the bush are acting up like mad, because they want the most nuts. The winner will be the one who brings his own monkeys together with 5 coconuts back to their hiding place by lucky throws of the dice and with the help of a good memory."

A simple dice race game with some real-time & memory elements.

As with all the Simba games released around this time, the game has functional components that are not up to the usual designer game standards.

1st Place 1989 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Dice, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Randonnée
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #13

Skier try to get first at the end of the hike while keeping as much energy as possible. There is a variant where some players are smugglers and others customs officers.

name: Roll Out the Gun Barrels
description:
Roll out the Gun Barrels (ROtGB) is a free game from Cheapass Games. Downloadable from http://cheapass.com/free/games/rotgb.html

From the website:
Well, here's a very cheapass way to simulate large battles without having to deal with maps and counters and fifteen hours per turn. Obviously, it can't cover a lot of things, but if you want more detail, get a regular wargame of some sort.

Basically handfuls of dice of different numbers of sides represent different size units on a battlefield. Different 'fronts' can be declared. ROtGB uses the Button Men mechanics renamed as 'Direct Assault', where the value on a single attacker die is equal to or greater than the value on a defender die and 'Flanking Maneuver', where multiple attacker dice add up to exactly one defender die (one of the flanking dice must be at least half the value of the defender die to keep a horde of d1's form overcoming it.)

Both players roll at the same time (identifiable dice or seperate rolling areas help.) Players take turns attacking. After successfully attacking (wherein the defender die is removed from play and the attacker scores the number of sides,) the attacking dice are re-rolled.

A fun way to use a big dice collection. Advanced rules liek Terrain and Reinforcements round out the game. Scenarios for medieval and space combat are there as well.

Simple, fast and fun!

name: Monopoly: Berlin
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Berlin, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pigtails & Ponytails
description: Be the first player to put three barrettes of the same color in your doll's hair without getting caught with the curler.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Nautical Nonsense
description: Players must correctly answer questions from each of four categories by landing in each of the category headquarters which are located in each corner of the playing board. The play then proceeds back to the center of the playing board for the game winning question.

name: Police Chase
description: Police Chase Game is a Milton Bradley game for ages 6 and up. Join the race for the rooftop robber! A bandit has stolen the priceless jewel and hidden it in one of the buildings downtown. He jumps from rooftop to rooftop to avoid the Police. You are a police officer on his trail. Your job is to travel through the city to gather the evidence and get a warrant. You must also recover the stolen jewel. Along the way you may meet one of your partners who can help you find what you need. Once you've collected the evidence, a warrant and the jewel, you can capture the robber and bring him to justice.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: San Francisco: The Tour Game
description:
Roll and land on 31 different attractions in San Francisco
using our personal Trolley Car on a main board. See all the 31 attractions and be the first to return to the airport to win. Cards help and hurt your progress as you move on the board. Score cards for each player spell out "I enjoyed everybody's favorite city" as you uncover each attraction.

name: Axe & Arrow
description:
"Rules book for large-scale Ancient wargaming with miniatures. Includes 11x17 cardstock play-aid with charts. Zip locked."- from the 24-page book

"These rules are designed to give players the feel of Ancient warfare on a large scale. They include the most commonly used units and their capabilities to allow you to make up the Ancient army of your choice and get to playing quickly." - from the introduction

name: The Peter Rabbit Game
description: This is a simple track game based on the classic children's story. The gameboard depicts Mr. McGregor's garden. Vegetable chips are mixed and placed near the board (number side down), and the Mr. McGregor pawn is placed on a random garden space. On your turn you turn over a Vegetable chip and advance your Peter Rabbit pawn along the garden path the number of spaces shown on the bottom of the chip. If you land on a "bad" space, you lose your next turn. If you land on the Mr. McGregor pawn, you move backwards to the nearest "bad" space. After you move, you place the Mr. McGregor piece on any "good" space (hoping to block an opponent). Vegetable chips are removed as they are used so it's possible to deduce which move numbers remain. The first player to make it through the garden and reach THE END wins.

name: Spider-Man 2 Make a Match Game
description:
Spider-Man is a basic Memory game with a few twists. First, there are 48 cards, including two 'Wild Cards' that may match with anything turned over. Second, there are two pairs of 'trick destroyers' that take a trick away from a player. Finally, there are 5 pairs of 'Take Spider Man' cards that allow a player to capture the Spider Man figure.

Spider Man is worth 4 Tricks at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blitz Commander
description:
"Blitz Commander is a game representing Operational Level Warfare during World War 2. It is a universal system, in that its rules can be used to represent any given battle or period of fighting during the War. Designed to be played with plastic or metal miniatures (Axis and Allies Europe minis work great), the paper counters included with the game can be used as a rather makeshift substitute."

Part of the Microgame Design Contest 2002.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Graskönig
description:
The players are trying to collect cards with marijuana themes, to became the biggest producer and dealer of these drugs.

Graskönig (Weed King) is a game by stoners for stoners. And since stoners have turned most of their brains into smoke, pretty much everything that makes up the game is stolen and not new. Players try to grow as much grass as possible to get the most points in a round. After four rounds the game is over.

Each player is dealt 15 cards and in turn you may draw a card and discard one. If a player thinks he has good cards, he knocks and all subsequent players are allowed to draw again. Now, all 3 cards must be laid out. You try to place light (energy), grass and a dealer here. The dealers have the values ​​from 1 to 5, the light 25, 50 or 100%, and grass 10, 20, 50, 150 or 200. All of the cards played are added up for your total points for that play.

In turn, players now play attack cards on either the light, grass, or the dealer with other players who can defend themselves if they have the right card. If a player has to remove a card, he must play a substitute immediately or he gets nothing from the round. What's different is that at this point you can't play any more grasses, only when everyone has passed. Then points are calculated. For example: 300 grams of weed x 3 dealer's stars x 50% = 450 points. There are some cards that can improve the result or detract from it: the raid doubles all points, the hemp allergy halves them. Whoever has the most accumulated points after 4 rounds is considered the Graskönig and wins the game.

name: Das Prestel Säulenspiel
description:
From Prestel web-site:

"May it be an Ancient Greek Temple, or a Roman Palace; a Renaissance Cathedral or an Opera, the columns always had a special part in the architecture. In this tile placing card game you will control the money, the construction and placing of the columns to make a perfect construction."

name: Angelina's Dress-Up Card Game
description: This is a collection of variants of 4 popular card games with an Angelina Ballerina theme. Included are themed variants of: Memory, Crazy 8s, Go Fish, and Spoons.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Novel-based

name: DampfHammerHart
description:
Secret training of the "Wilden Fußballkerle".

But where are they? First you have to find two characters from the team and then they must score a penalty.

Sounds easy, buy it's not, with Markus the goalkeeper and the Damp-Hammer-Chip playing against you!

One with a good memory and one who is able to prove his dexterity with the penalties will win the secret training.

name: Fun House
description: Based on the 1980s kids game show of the same name, 2-3 players/teams play several "skill games" involving the components (such as a mini ramp, golf club, etc.) and answer questions for spaces on the board. The first player/team to reach the finish wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Battle Command
description:
Generic land battle strategy board game. Box measures 20" x 11 1/4". Single-fold mounted color game board with 21 x 19 one-inch-square grid superimposed to regulate movement. Terrain represented includes Mountain, Forest, Plains, Fords, and Rivers. Multi-square Airfields also represented.

Miniature plastic pieces include Tanks, APCs and Airplanes (six Tanks, six APCs and three Airplanes per side; complete set of each in Yellow, Brown, Green, and Blue). The APCs are eight-wheeled turreted vehicles strongly resembling a USMC LAV. Tanks resemble a cross between the US Army M-109 SP gun and an Israeli Merkava tank. Airplanes slightly resemble early speculative depictions of a Stealth fighter with twin tails and an unflattering forward-swept projection on the leading wing edge.

All of these units are moved according to the roll of two six-sided dice. Die results are added together; the sum ("dice units") is allocated among friendly pieces for movement.

Terrain costs vary for Tank and APC units. Pieces may be moved in any direction including diagonally, but may not stack together or pass through an occupied space.

All unit types have a "range" of two spaces. Tanks may not attack Airplanes (unless all friendly Airplanes are destroyed). Airplanes must be "airborne" in order to attack (they must "take off" down the "runway" of their "airstrip").

Combat is resolved by die roll, "attacker" and targeted "defender" each rolling one die. The result of subtracting low roll from high roll is referenced to a "Battle Chart" yielding a result of "Safe," "Disabled" or "Destroyed." APCs are destroyed on a difference of "1" or more. Tanks are "disabled" by a difference of "1" or "2" and "destroyed" by a differential of "3" or more. Airplanes are "destroyed" by a differential of "3" or more vs. another Airplane or an APC or a "4" or "5" if beaten by a tank. Airplanes are "disabled" by a "1" or "2" differential vs. another Airplane or an APC.

Destroyed units are removed. Disabled tanks are turned on their side. "Disabled" tanks may be "captured." A friendly or enemy APC may "capture" a "disabled" tank by moving adjacent and surviving until the next friendly turn. At the start of the next friendly turn, the tank is turned rightside-up and is considered friendly to the capturing player.

Disabled Airplanes "crash land." The "disabled" Airplane travels three spaces in a straight line (in any direction the owning player chooses) and is turned upside-down. During this "descent" the Airplane may "pass over" other units, but the space it "crashes" in must be vacant. An APC (friendly or hostile) may "recover" the downed Airplane in the same manner as a Tank is recovered; however, when the Airplane is turned rightside-up, it is immediately returned to a friendly Airbase parking space.

"Disabled" pieces may be attacked and destroyed instead of being captured if a player so chooses.

A unit may only inflict damage on the first unit to attack it in a given turn. If a piece survives an initial attack and is attacked again, it rolls in defense as usual, but will not inflict any damage on its attacker even if its die roll is higher.

Airbases may be captured by disabling or destroying all hostile pieces on the Airbase and then occupying at least one square of the Airbase with a friendly Tank or APC.

The object of the game is to be the last player with a surviving APC unit.

Rules include options for a short game with less equipment. A small paper insert, dated 1991, provided a simpler version using the same movement rules but capturing by simply moving a piece onto an opposing piece space, moving and capturing until all "dice units" have been used.

The box art painting accurately portrays the pieces inside. One of the modernistic tanks advances firing, evading a near miss while the moon lights APCs crossing a stream to the rear in Ardennes-type terrain as jets swoop above. The title "Battle Command" appears in large red letters all the way across the top of this illustration. In smaller white letters across the bottom: "A Fast-Playing Game of Strategy, Daring, and Chance!"

In the lower right corner is the logo of "Precision Toy," white letters superimposed over a line of evergreens with the title and evergreens "reflected" oppositely beneath. The back cover features a large black-and-white photo of the board and components. "Precision Toy" was located in Julian, CA 92036. The game was made in USA.

name: Krimi Party: Nachtflug in den Tod
description: One of the party games with a murder mystery theme that hit the German market in the late eighties.

name: Match of the Week
description:
MATCH OF THE WEEK is a boardgame based on the game of Soccer and uses a simplified version of the actual rules used for Association Football.

Any number of players may participate but the playing pieces represent two teams of 11 (10 field players and a goalkeeper), as in Soccer. Teams take it in turns to move their players and the ball.

The movement of players and the ball is determined by the roll of two D6 in the colours of the two teams (blue and red). Either one playing piece, or a combination of pieces are moved forwards, backwards, sideways and diagonally the number of spaces corresponding to the score on the dice of the colour of that player's team.

After the players have been moved the ball is then moved (assuming that a players piece is next to it) the number of spaces shown on the combination of both dice. The flight of the ball is affected by the direction in which it is "kicked" and the presence of friendly or opposing players in its flight path.

Particular rules apply to the kick off, kicking the ball in the air, dribbling, free kicks, penalties, throw-ins, goal kicks and corners. Even the infamous offside rule is included.

To score a goal, the player must kick the ball across the goal line between the two posts.

The winning player (team) is the one that scores the greatest number of goals with in a pre-agreed time limit, or is the first to reach a pre-agreed number of goals.
mechanics: Action Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: På Kryds Og Tværs
description:
This is a Danish word game using thirteen dice showing letters, including Danish characters (æ, ø, å).

Play is similar to Spill and Spell, where players try to fit letters into words crossword style, and points are deducted for letters that are not used. However, unlike Spill and Spell, letters have different point values.

The game comes with 13 wooden dice, a sand-timer, a dice cup, a scoring pad and rules.

name: Kriegspiel
description:
The game consists of a battle between French and English troops. The army consists of artillery, cavalry and infantry who are used on a tiled board. Artillery is slow but powerful, cavalry is fast but weak and infantry are in between. Take care of the artillery because unguarded cannons can be taken over by the enemy!

By moving and advancing the troops one can attack the other (with dice).

name: Megatrópole
description:
From the game box (edited):

Megatrópole is a strategy game where reasoning and luck are needed. The various possible paths to reach the "Crânio" fortress and the need of money management and equipment acquisition result in various strategies during the game.

name: High Wire Harry
description:
High Wire Harry is a children’s balancing game that can prove difficult for the shaky handed player.

Each player is given a set of eight “props” – 2 chairs, 2 stools, 2 picture frames and two umbrellas. On his turn, a player rolls the die and places the corresponding prop either on Harry’s crossbar or on Harry’s coat hanger (which is “balancing on his forehead). Once the prop is placed, the player must roll Harry down his tightrope by using a lever located at one end of the board that tips the tightrope forward and backward. Press too quickly and Harry smashes into the building, probably losing his props. Press too slowly and you’ll fail to ring the bell that signifies a successful roll (and suffer the derision of the other players!). Any props that Harry drops become the active player’s and will have to be loaded on Harry again.

Once you have loaded all your props, you have to take Harry for one last run, this time with his pet monkey riding on his hat!
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Milton Bradley

name: Infernal Machines
description:
From the publisher:

Each player is a quality assurance agent in a factory that makes goofy gadgets from widgets of questionable quality. But they're no ordinary inspectors -- they're SECRET quality assurance agents with their own agenda! The object of the game is to ship as many of your own widgets as possible while scrapping other players' widgets so you can secretly resell them. The catch is that if another player exposes your secret inspector identity (which can be deduced from which items you are allowed to take off the assembly line), you're fired! The player with the biggest widget hoard at the end of the game wins. Optional rules adjust the ferocity of gameplay and the difficulty of deduction.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Memory

name: Taktika Logical Soccer
description:
A football (soccer) game which emphasizes the tactical aspect of the sport, with just enough luck involved to keep you thrilled.

Short rules summary:
The board is made up of circles resembling positions a footballist can take on the field. The circles are connected by lines which the footballists and the ball may travel along.
Each turn, both player rolls a die, and divides the result between his footballists. For each point a footballist may be moved to an adjacent circle. After that, the ball must be moved the same total amount of spaces. Unlike footballists, it can only change direction if it hits a freindly footballist. The ball's required movement may force the player to give the ball to the opposing team.
In addition to that, the ball goes to the opposing team anytime a 1 or 6 is rolled.

Has some similarities to Street Soccer, but predates that title by many years.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Box Office
description:
From the Rules:
"The Box Office theatrical board game is based on producing plays for the stage. As a player, you become a producer seeking to win by earning the most money by producing plays."

"The Box Office theatrical board game has been developed by Canadian Cultural Consultants Corporation as a fund raising tool for Canadian and American theaters."

As producers, players move around the board, which represents various North American theaters, seeking to produce plays to which they own the rights. If producers don't have the right compliment of actors in their "stable", they may have to barter with other producers to borrow an actor with the right talents.

Another part of the game board are a few 'Make Or Break' spaces, which add in a number of random events, such as losing or gaining an actor, or added box office revenues.

Winner is the producer who first reaches a certain dollar number, which the players pre-determine.

Rules specify four players, don't know why it couldn't be played with fewer.

name: Swoop
description:
From the box: Swoop - A Game of Star-To-Star Strategy. Ages 8 and up, for 2 to 4 players. Instructions en Francais a l'interieur.

This is an abstract game with a light theme. Each player has six spacemen (colored tokens) that start the game around the edge of the circular board on spots of cooresponding colors. Players take turns moving their spacemen one at a time, a token can move one space left, right, inward but not diagonal nor outward, trying to get them into their home that is in the middle of the board and facing the opposite side as the starting position. Checking is when a spaceman lands on an opponent's spaceman freezing it in place, and when it moves off, the checked or frozen spaceman is sent back to its starting location.

There are also star spaces that are check-free for the spaceman that occupies it. That spaceman cannot be frozen or sent back to the starting locations.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Schmackofatz
description:
Help the animals to find their food. The goal is to be the first to collect three food cards of one animal. Six different, wooden animals are arranged in front of seven cards. Players move any animal to the empty (7th) card and see if the card matches the animal. If it does you get the card; if it doesn't you put it back and try to remember what it is for future turns. The difficulty lies in the constantly changing circle of cards. Ages 5 and up.

Also Known As: Rastytasty, Le festin des animaux, Smikkelsmak

name: BOOOO-opoly
description: BOOOO-OPOLY! It's Creepy! It's Ghoulish! It's a Scream! Boooo-opoly is a classic property trading game made for celebrating Halloween. Players buy favorite Halloween properties, collect Haunted Houses and trade them in for Full Moons. Sounds easy enough, but add Fright Fees, Bats in your Belfry, or get caught soaping windows and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun! You may win the Jack-o-lantern carving contest or eating Slimy Spider Tacos at the Monster Mash! Whatever happens, it's going to be frighteningly fun! For 2 to 6 players, ages 8 and up.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Gayopoly
description:
A gay-themed Monopoly variant. From the website (www.slypussproductions.com):

"Play the ultimate tourist and own a gay monopoly! We're queer, we're here, we're everywhere! The game for today! We're running for office, we're parents, we're business owners. All this, while going to the gym, maxing out our credit cards, singing too loud while driving our car and using our cell phone!

48 different businesses to visit! Spend money, or make money. Play the ultimate tourist and become the 'Queen of the Universe.'

The ultimate in role playing - 6 different characters to play: Ivana Munch, Freeda Knight, Jim Freak, Amanda Bee, Ian D. Middel, Lou Cinda Booty.

In order to get 'Out Of The Closet' all you have to do is sing. Over 50 of your all-time ultimate divas in the deck. Your favorite songstresses of yesterday, today and tomorrow.

Contents: 2-sided boardgame, 6 cell phone game pieces, 2 rainbow colored dice, 1 sandtimer, 1 plastic tray (holds 600 Queer Cards), 76 Diva Detour cards, 72 Whatever cards, 48 title cards, 48 employee cards, 48 supervisor cards, 48 manager cards."
categories: Dice, Economic, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Overlord
description:
Overlord is a "2 player game of pure 3D strategy".

The game is played on a 7x9 board with a crenellated wall located on the middle row between the two players. Both players have 14 pieces located in the back 2 rows on each side of the wall and attempt to capture the opponents pieces by landing on top of them. Pieces move and stack in various ways, and the game is won when one player is reduced to a single stack.

name: Pisaturm
description:
With 42 wooden rods ( six color groups of seven rods each) you should try to build as high a tower as possible. The color die decides if you have to put new rods on top of the tower or if you can pass the die to the next player without adding rods.

The game starts with 2 different colored rods placed parallel on the playing surface.

The first player rolls the die, if rolls the same color as one of the rods on top of the tower, he can pass the die to the next player.

If he rolls a different color as one of the two rods on top of the tower, he must place to new, differently colored, rods on top of the tower. These have to be placed at a right angle to the others.

You continue to play like this clockwise in turn.

The game is over when the tower collapses. The player who caused the crash loses the game.

name: President
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

The worst fear of a Secret Service Agent is when the President of the US decides to leave an established motorcade and work the crowd. In this game, one player plays the President and his two Secret Service Agents and the other represents a crowd with an unknown assassin. Can you get the President through the crowd alive?

The President starts in one of the two center squares on one side of the board. He then places one Secret Service Agent on each side of the President. The crowd starts with 6 crowd members anywhere on the opposite half of the board.

Goal: The President player must exit from one of the two center squares on the opposite side of the board. The crowd player must assassinate the President.

name: Das Bodensee Spiel
description:
from the cover:
1000 Questions about culture, history, landmarks, people, nature....

It was produced by Ravensburger Free time and promotion service, so it's a sturdy box.

name: King O' Kings
description:
The board is set up something like a plus sign. The center area is called "The Arena" and it is 4x4 grid with alternating black & white squares like a chessboard. On each side there is a 3 x 4 "Safety Zone" which serves as the starting area for each player. The safety zones are also arranged with alternating squares, although the squares are gray and the color of your pieces.
Pieces move diagonally away from their "safety zone". No piece may enter any safety zone once it has entered The Arena. The goal is to move your pieces into the arena and create kings.
Initially, all pieces are "pawns" and can move only diagonally forward (away from their safety area). Once they enter the arena, they can move diagonally in any direction but may not leave the arena.
A player may create a "prince" by landing on an opponent's pawn with one of his pawns. The stack of two pieces can then move either 1 or 2 spaces, still diagonally, but may move forwards or backwards. It may not enter any safety zone (it must remain in the arena).
A player creates a king when his prince takes a pawn or his pawn takes a prince (princes may not take each other). A king is a stack of three pieces. Once formed kings are removed to the scoring area.
The game ends when there is no possibility of additional kings being made. The winner is the player who has the most kings.
Note that while the game says it will play 2-4 there are no rules offered for any number other than 4.

name: Slap Dragon
description:
Another in the Patch Products' series of "Big Deal" card games...

From the Publisher's web site:

Slap the Dragon! Slap him fast! Slap again when the pictures match! Simply put, those are all the rules in this adorable picture identifying and matching game for the little ones! No reading required.

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 2 Players

No. 6627
Ages 4 and up

name: Aventuria
description:
The players each take different a role - prince, princess, juggler (x2) - and work together to retrieve treasures from the dragon's lair.

The game board shows the path to the dragon's lair, which is located on an island the players can only reach by a raft. Players roll and move their pieces, but there is a lucky and an unlucky side to the dice. If they roll the unlucky side, the dragon is moved and might capture them; if they roll the lucky side, they can move their own piece.

If a piece reaches one of various unlucky fields, it is stuck there and can only be freed by another player who announces a "lucky roll" - if successful (the die lands on one of the lucky sides), the stuck player can move out of his/her field. If unlucky, the dragon moves as usual.
The players must reach the dragon's island, retrieve the treasure and return to their home base to win.
