Contents: 1 board, 4 pawns, 4 special dice, 1 dragon
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hasenjagd
description:
Players play in two teams: The hares try to flee to their safe warrens, the predators - eagle, hunter, fox - try to catch them.

Contents: 1 board, 1 die, 5 pawns
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: India's Epic Mahabharata Game
description:
India’s Epic Mahabharata Game is a track game based on the most magnificent epic of Indian mythology. Players gain support from one of the two warring families, either the Pandava or Kaurava. To win, players must obtain 1 Celestial Weapon card, 1 Flag or Conch card, 8 Virtue Cards and 18 Coins.

Players roll 2d6 to move around the board, each square of which is an event. Warrior squares grant the support of individual warriors (such as Arjuna or Karna), or require a Joust (if the warrior square denotes someone who is in the same family as those that support the player) or a Fight (if from the other family). Karma squares confer a card with random events, such as “you grab 2 Coins from each player!” or “Give up 2 coins to receive 2 Virtue Cards.” Prowess squares give cards that confer either Virtue cards (needed to win) or Wrath cards (which cause a Virtue discard) to the various warriors. Many squares are a people (Krishna, Queen Kunti, etc.) or places (Indraprastha, Abode of Yama, etc.) that confer a random event, often a Blessing or Coins. Subtracks allow special 1d6 movement through Exile or Trial where players can obtain the key winning elements of Celestial Weapons and Flags/Conches.

The cards and board both relate some of the many events from the epic. The designer is a noted educator, and this was clearly intended to be an educational game.

name: Napoleon
description: One player plays the 21 pieces of the French army (including Napoleon). The other player plays the 25 pieces of the English army (including Wellington) and the 12 pieces of the Prussian army (including Blücher). The game depicts the battle of Waterloo, and is played on a somewhat abstract map with squares and lines between them to symbolize movement possibilities. All French and English pieces have their fixed starting positions on the board. The Prussian pieces have numbers on them, and come into play on a square marked "P", on the game turn with their number. The game is played over ten turns. The goal for France is to hold two specific squares marked with red crosses. The goal for the allies is to hold two squares marked with blue crosses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: World Bowling Tour
description:
From rules: "As a Pro Bowler, you enjoy being on tour, playing tournaments, earning your living by doing what you enjoy most...bowling. You have as a goal, gaining a reputation as a top professional bowler and insuring that you can always earn a living through bowling."

Players move bowling pin shaped pawns on a track that looks like a bowling score sheet, participating in tournaments as they go, collecting money for setting records or meeting sponsors, paying money for purchases or hospital bills, investing in pro shops, and sometimes falling into slumps. For tournament play, a separate pawn shaped like a bowing ball moves along a separate tournament track that looks like a bowling ball knocking down two pins.

To win, players need to collect money and place first in at least one tournament.

The box cover pictures Don Carter and Paula Sperber, who endorse the game and were apparently popular bowlers back in the day.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Blue's Room Talking Game
description:
Let's Play in Blue's Room!

Where's Frederico? Do you see the art supplies? Search through Blue's Room to find tokens that match your three cards. You can find them in one of the four sections of Blue's Room: Doodleboard, Dress-up Chest, Silly Seat or Boogle Woogle. Plus, Blue helps you hunt by telling you which color spaces you can search! Match all three and find Key to win! For ages 3 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Swordplay: Pirates
description:
Yo ho ho, Me Hearties... Yo Ho!

Cutlasses at the ready... No quarter!

Swordplay: Pirates is a fast paced card game of Swashbuckling combat on the High Seas. Send your bilge-sucking opponents to Davy Jones' Locker with a wide array of blades, black powder weapons, and combat moves suitable for any Sea Dog worth his salt.

Swordplay: Pirates comes complete with everything needed to play including Pirate Cards, a Combat Deck, Damage Markers, and rules for two player duels, multi-player battles, and combining Swordplay: Pirates with Swordplay: Arena.

name: Musingo
description:
A Musical Surprise Game. Musingo by Mattel. Stock #461.
For ages 5 to 10.
Players use one of four different bingo cards and a plastic monkey counter. A racetrack around the perimeter of your bingo card has some squares with coin icons and some with music box icons. Roll your D6 and if you land on a coin icon, take a coin from the bank. Land on the music box icon and, if you have a coin, place it in the slot in the music box and turn the crank. After the Musingo song plays, a slot-machine-like roller will spin and display up to three notes in one of the five colors of the bingo card rows and columns. Cover a square on your bingo card matching the color(s) displayed on the music box. First person to make a row, column or diagonal wins.
Contains: 4 Monkey Playing pieces; 4 Individual Musingo Boards; 1 die; 48 Musingo Markers; 50 plastic coins; and the 'Musingo' man, an 8 inch plastic music box shaped and colored as mustachioed organ grinder.

name: Adopt-A-Dog
description:
From the rules:
Take home your new best friend! In Adopt-A-Dog, every player gets a chance to adopt and nurture a lovable puppy. Once players sort through the dogs' items and collect 3 of their dogs' favorite toys, players can take home and care for their new pets!

For ages 3+

Adopt-A-Dog is a VERY simple set-collection and trading game for very young children. It plays fast and is easy for young children to learn. I would not suggest this game for children over 6 as they will get bored very quickly.

name: Pippi och sjörövarna
description:
"An exciting adventure game"

You're sailing the South Seas with Pippi and the pirates, on an exciting cruise on Pippi's ship Hoppetossa. While visiting a small island, Pippi's feet start to tingle strangely - it's time for a good old brawl and fight after a long sailing! Challenge the five pirates - Pollus, Hot Tin Pan, Oomalat, Dummerkopfen and cook O'Malley - into a dice duel on the gangplank. You'll also need gold coins from the island to bribe them. If you win the pirate you'll get to push him into the sea - but if you lose, it's YOU who'll end up in the drink, and need to swim back to the island for some more coins from Pippi's famous suitcase! Once you get to the ship itself, you need to face ALL the remaining pirates one after the other - unless you're lucky and they're all swimming already, in which case you win an instant victory and get to hoist the flag in Hoppetossa's mast!

name: Baseball Card Game
description: This is a card game from the 1950-60s. Players set a line-up and draw cards one at a time. Each card shows a result based on the player in the respective line-up slot. Normal baseball rules apply.

name: Gundam Collection Tactical Combat
description:
Gundam Collection Tactical Combat is a miniature tabletop wargame with collectible components.Players collect teams of Mobile Suits ( Giant Robots) with different powers and abilities from the Anime Gundam , and battle each other on a tabletop using rulers and 1/400 scenery.

Actually , there are two miniatures systems: the first , and older, using the statistics in the base of the miniature , and a new and more advanced system called Tactical Combat with specific and expert rules.

The scale is 1/400 ( 4/5 cm).
categories: Collectible Components, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Da Vinci Code Sudoku
description:
Sudoku using Ancient symbols from the Da Vinci Code.

Players take turns by calling out 1 type of symbol, they then place as many of that symbol as they can. Be careful, if your opponent spots an incorrect tile placement on your board, you get a penalty point.

Comes with Magnetic Sudoku Board, 216 Magnetic symbol tiles and book of 50 puzzles.

name: Canyon
description:
This Heyne travel game is played on 2-piece board of 8x8 round points. The 4 center points and 2 adjacent points are omitted; they form an impassable canyon.

Both players place their 15 tokens in one edge of the board and try to reach the other side - around the canyon. Jumping over tokens allows for faster movement of the tokens and jumping over an opponent's tokens eliminates them.

The game ends, when all (remaining) pieces of one player have reached the opposing edge. Every token scores points - the further the token gets the more points are scored. The player with the most points wins the game.
publishers: Heyne, Interplay (Board Game Related), Palet spil

name: Old World, New World
description:
Discover a New World... And Fight for It!
Players start as a small island nation off the coast of a large continent. They receive initial resources, colonists, cash and a ship to search for a rumored new land.

Turns are taken by choosing specific roles which allow movement, technology advances, and investment in the Old World or influence on the continent, outfitting ships, investment cash, and diplomatic efforts. Only two roles are chosen per turn and then all movement and actions are played out. Players must explore the New World and found farms, posts, towns, and harvest resources. They then score points and generate income shipping new goods to the Old World, and then can score points shipping supplies back to the New World. Nations must also balance defense against rival nations while protecting their investment in the New World on land and sea. OWNW is different each game. Explorers and ships reveal new hexes that have a type of terrain and a potential special resource. All terrain has a carrying capacity, which cannot be improved until the player builds farms. While exploring and settling the New World, players also play technology advances back at home which improves ship speed, manpower, reduces cost of men and goods, and allows for special buildings.

Game features:
-role selection.
-known and unknown map.
-hex based discovery, changes each game.
-carrying capacity per hex which may be modified
-resource extraction and management
-shipping goods, soldiers, colonists.
-tech advancement.
-piracy and conflict on land and sea / all units are unarmed until you decide to arm them!
-colonization, simple building tech tree.
-Area control through role selection of Old World for endgame points.
-multi-path scoring: building, influence, shipping, exploration.
-basic units and characters with special abilities.
-'touring' mechanism for specific mapmaker, envoy, etc... characters.

This game is still in development.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Phase Order

name: Scrabble Junior: The Disney Edition
description:
Scrabble Junior: The Disney Edition is (as the name would suggest) a Disney-themed version of the Scrabble Junior family. The game features a two-sided gameboard and 101 letter tiles. The words to be created are printed on the gameboard, and the players take turns placing up to two letters per turn onto those words, always placing the next letter of the word in order. Points are scored for being the player to place the letter tile that completes a word. The game is obviously aimed at children (ages 5+, per the box).

From the game box: "Match up letters to create popular Disney words! Can you spell out Jasmine? Or maybe you can finish the word Simba. Use your letter tiles to build crosswords on the picture-filled game board. Each time you finish a word, you get a scoring chip. When all of the tiles are played, the one with the most chips wins! Have twice the fun with the two-sided board. Flip over the board and build words like Mirror and Fawn."
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Tri-Memo: The Lord of the Rings – The Two Towers
description: This game is an average run of the mill memory game with a twist. In the game you are trying to match characters from the Lord of the Rings Two Towers movie. Instead of finding a matched pair on your turn you must find a matched trio of pictures. This makes the game somewhat more difficult than the traditional matched pair style of gameplay. Don't fret though, rules are included to play the routine memory style game of matching pairs. The game was published by BETEXA which is in the Czech Republic. FEVA, located in the United Kingdom, was the distributor. This game is hard to find and most likely would appeal to collectors of Lord of the Rings themed games.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Ushuaïa
description: Ushuaïa permits the players to dive in the world of expeditions around the world. The goal is to arrive first at the final destination. The board represents a planisphere, within the squares players can move by kayak, 4x4 car or even with a balloon. Each player draws an expedition card that determines the expedition that he has to complete (the card determines the start and finishing point). During the game players also draw adventure cards that can help or slow their expeditions.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wei and Wu: Three Kingdoms
description:
This is Japanese wargame on the wars during the Chinese Three Kingdoms period (220–280).

Uses the same system as Taiheki.

200 counters.

1 turn=1 year(for a total of 10 turns)

name: Sailors Knot
description: Its basically "Shut the box" but in addition you have to tie the knot thats corresponding to the number rolled. If you fail to do so in the time limit you are also busted.

name: Kiékoi
description:
A board game for children (4+ years).

In their turn, a player picks a card showing an animal. Then they have to find it by touch only from an opaque bag. If they find it before time runs out, they can advance.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction

name: Perils of Pauline
description: Roll and move game. Games includes Blue, Red , Green and Yellow male characters, a PINK Pauline character and a Black villain character. Object is to free Pauline and then win her heart.

name: Animal Soundtracks
description: Comes with 4 double sided game boards (9 pictures of animals on one side, 9 animal names on the other allowing non-readers to play against readers), some counters and a tape of animal sounds. Start the tape anywhere then put a counter on your game board whenever you recognise the call of one of your animals. First person to complete their board wins.

name: Napoleonic Battles
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple, generic Napoleonic battle game in which the British and French battle over cities at opposite corners of the mapsheet. Each side has infantry, cavalry, and artillery units, with each player being allowed to select the composition of their forces using a point system.

name: Peace In Our Time
description:
From the company's web site:

Six Nations must solve internal affairs without creating conflicts within their own borders.

As the game progresses, hot spots could develop — and by game’s end several or all of the Nations could be at war. The game is then lost.

Each Nation creates a balanced territory so that a balanced world results in which population does not exceed land and resources and work is available for everyone. On the religious, cultural and political side, all sectors are also in balance with no particular sector dominating another. The key to achieving this balance is Right Education, in which intelligence and compassion are nurtured. How well the players use Right Education and deploy the other factors within their borders while making trades to assist each other across borders will determine the degree of success in establishing firm and lasting peace in our time.

Best for group play.

Includes: 6 nation charts, 2 sets of cards (110 total) consisting of population, land/resources, work/technology, religion/culture, politics/military and right education, die, rules. © 2006

name: Around the World
description: Travel! Travel! Travel! The object is to travel around the world by answering questions correctly and gaining tokens to fill up your Global scorecard. Players roll the dice and "travel" according to the number on the dice. Players navigate their travels through the spaces they land on. Players need to correctly answer four questions in each category to win. The first player to "travel around the world" and fill in their Global scorecard wins. The more places you travel the more fun it is to play!

name: Monopoly: Northern Ireland
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Northern Ireland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Schlaue Farben-Schlange
description:
The name of the game translates to "Smart color queue".

For the preparatory school - recognize colors

Putting play around recognizing color successions

The players set alternating Farbkarten on the queue. Everyone tries to put the color sequences which are shown on the small cards lying before it. There it means watched out! The queue will look ever longer and all players strained, which colors to line up gradually together.

name: Happily Ever After Card Game
description:
Help Ariel kiss her Prince before sunset so she can become human and live happily ever after.

Collect one Ariel, one Prince Eric, one Kiss, and one Princess Ariel card of the same color to win! Be the first Princess to help Ariel live happily ever after!

Ages 4 and up
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Political Game
description:
This game is set in the Spanish political environment of the late eighties and early nineties.

Description from the box:

Politics are like a game, and every day, in front of us, politicians compete to acquire power. The competition is at its best every four years, like the Olympics, when the elections come. The contenders must make an effort; it's the final sprint and the goal is near.

Now, for the first time, you can participate in this struggle for power with The Political Game (El Juego de la Política).

In this game, you'll lead a political party and must win the elections. To do so, you have to make a political program, taking left, right and center positions on issues such as NATO, taxes or autonomy. You'll have to get money, needed for the electoral campaign, to pay publicity, meetings, or launch attacks against other political parties to snatch votes away from them.

In The Political Game, an ideal game for groups, like in politics, agreements with other political forces are indispensable.

You'll have to negotiate with the other players, make agreements with them, and betray them if you're interested in doing so. You may loan them money to attack your most fierce rivals, and exchange favors or information. Everything is valid in your effort to win the elections!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Matte-Kryss
description:
Mattekryss (Math scrabble) is a Scrabble-like game, only with numbers.

Each player always has seven tiles on his stands and try and make computations on the board. Each tile is placed next to two other tiles and must be the result of a computation (addition, subtraction, division or multiplication) of these two tiles. Some squares are pink, and restricts the type of operation to perform.

Contents:

Game board
106 tiles with numbers
Four stands

name: Storm Over Leyte Gulf
description: This is a area impulse movement wargame using a modified Storm Over Arnhem/Storm Over Stalingrad system to simulate the Battle of Leyte Gulf 1944.

name: Fast 'n' Furious Pro Football
description:
Fast-Action Games created many "quick-play" sports simulations where the outcome of a contest could be decided with just one or two dice rolls. These games made it easy to play an entire series of games in a matter of just a few minutes.

This game covers professional football. Teams from the past (NFL, AAFC, WFL, USFL, WLAF, AFL) were extensively researched to create ratings for just about any team a person would wish to play.

Fast-Action Game Description
PROFESSIONAL FAST ’N’ FURIOUS FOOTBALL
(Revised Edition)
This action-packed PRO FOOTBALL board game now includes over 2,000 teams:

EVERY NFL team since 1920!
EVERY AAFC, WFL, & USFL team!
The CFL since 1907!
ARENA & the WLAF, too!
All AFL leagues: 1920s, '30s, '40s. & '60s.


Recreate any season and ,see if von can lead your FAVORITE team to victory! Or play the greats against one another: could the 1962 GREEN BAY PACKERS beat the legendary 1923 CANTON BULLDOGS? Stage DREAM playoffs to find out which team is the GREATEST of all-time!
Complete game costs only $15 postpaid

name: Weird U.S.: The Game
description:
from the back of the box: "Have you ever wondered where the Weirdos gather? Welcome to Weird U.S., where colorful characters like the Melon Head, Skunk Ape, La Llorona, Bunnyman, Frogboy and the Killer Clown journey to not so far off places like Midgetville, Crybaby Bridge, Danvers State Hospital and the Land of 2093 Milk Jugs in their attempts to collect travelers and be the last Weirdo standing! Based on the stories from Weird U.S. by Mark Moran and Mark Sceurman. From Weird books come Weird games."

Players move around the board trying to gather travelers while dodging being exposed by Mark and Mark and battling the other Weirdos.

The game is rated Ages 8 and up.
categories: Dice, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Freeway Frenzy
description:
Freeway Frenzy is a board game inspired by Utah's road construction over the past few years.

The object of the game is simple: Drive into town using a freeway system and city streets to do your errands, then be first to return home to win the game. Construction barricades and other driving hazards may force you to detour, while you try to block other players with hazards of your own.

name: Prison Break
description:
In this (French) game you will incarnate Michael Scofield or one of his fellow captives. Of course you will put all your efforts into escaping from Fox River Prison.
Demonstrate speed and strategy, because at the end of first phase of the game called “recruitment of allies", you may be eliminated from the team and you will be designated to represent the character of Sergeant Bellick instead.
Reflexion, co-operation and persuasion will be your assets to be able to escape without being caught by Sergeant Bellick who wants his revenge…

The game consists of:
- 1 map
- 8 pawns of personage
- 78 eventcards (chance, handicap)
- 34 chips guards
- 27 chips tools
- 1 die
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Antarctica (Second Edition)
description:
You are about to experience a journey of epic proportions. The world has changed. The polar ice is all gone and every major city that had a harbor before the Great Melt has vanished. You organize and rebuild your home-land. You assemble exploratory fleets as rumors of a green
Antarctica abound. Tremendous storms and other continental survivors cross your path.

If you prevail the prize, ‘Antarctica,’ is yours.

REBUILD YOUR NATION, BREACH THE STORMS, SEIZE ANTARCTICA
SURVIVE GLOBAL WARMING!
categories: Adventure, Educational, Environmental, Territory Building, Wargame

name: Nightmare Before Christmas Party Game
description:
The Nightmare Before Christmas Party Game allows 2 - 4 teams to experience all the excitement of Jack Skellington's Halloweentown. At each location, the teams try to perform fun activities in order to earn Challenge Cards. The first team to score 12 Challenge Cards wins the game!

Game contents:

Game Board
Timer
Pads & Pencils
Tokens
Score Boards
Character, Challenge & Trivia Cards
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Channel X
description:
The last entry from the Pepys company in the line of the "Double Feature Games".

Game consists of 52 playing cards, 6 little channel and 6 little advertising company cards. Furthermore there is 300.000 GBP in "Pepys Currency".

Object of the game is to make money by selling advertising time on TV and by renting out TV programmes.

Gameplay is rather complicated for a Pepys game.
From the predealt hand of cards (5) players try to find three cards with the same index number. In order to achieve this they can draw from the open or from the unexposed stock pile.
You have to have the appropriate time card before buying a programme, and to get this, you can open a bidding round if the exposed programme card is to your liking but you do not have the time card you want.
By the way you try to advertise for other players ad companies.
Round ends when a player has a complete hand, consisting of 3 programme cards and 2 ad cards. Certain rules apply for those, too.
Now players receive funds from the authority or from other players, depending which companies products they advertised.
Game ends after given rounds, i.e. at least 6 for 2, 3 or 6 players.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cracker Jack Game
description:
Cracker Jack Game combines memory and luck to match up Cards with Surprises to win.
Play follows these steps:
1. Spin the Spinner
2. Get Cards
3. Look for surprises
4. Match Card with surprise to keep the toy surprise.

Player with the most surprises,wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kitchener Waterloo On Board
description: Kitchener Waterloo On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the cities in Ontario, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Centre In The Square's School Program and Community Ticket Program.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Crocodile
description: In this abstract strategy game each player has 4 pawns, each one in a different corner of a game board depicting a jungle and divided in squares. On the game board are various S- and L-shaped tiles with an illustration of a crocodile on them, that act as barriers. Every turn a player gets to move between 0 and 3 crocodile tiles, decided by a special oblong die. A player can move the crocodile tiles out of the way to clear a path, or move them to block an opponent. The player may then move the 'father' pawn 4 spaces, the 'mother' pawn 3 spaces and the two 'children' pawns 2 spaces each. The first player to get all four of his pawns touching wins the game.

name: Fancy Nancy Dress-Up Game
description: Based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor. 2 to 4 players Ages 3 and up take turns spinning the spinner to collect fancy items of clothing to dress up their dolls with. The first to finish dressing up their doll wins. No reading required.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Vencer o Morir: Kundt's Pocket at Camp Via, Dec. 1933
description:
Vencer o Morir (to win or die) covers the largest single battle of the Chaco War in December, 1933.
Known as the Battle of Campo Via, the Paraguayan’s had massed (with the knowledge of the Bolivians’ air reconnaissance) twice as many divisions aimed at the thinly defended lines and no Bolivian reserves. Just north of Alihuata, the Bolivian lines simply dangled. The warnings Kundt received from his own commanders along the front were all ignored. Fearing the worse, the Bolivian commander, Banzer, ordered part of his
artillery, his tanks and ammo to be moved south to Saavedra.
The battle began Dec. 3 and ended on the 12th.

Game Scale:
The map scale is about 2 miles per hex.
Each combat unit is a battalion sized unit. HQ’s are represented by a Paraguayan or Bolivian flag.
A game turn represents one day.
Tanks and Armor cars represent one of each type.
Artillery are batteries.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: I'm a Little Teapot
description:
Each player gets a teacup, and a tea tray with spaces for four cookies of different shapes. You win by filling all of the spaces with cookies.

A little teapot acts as spinner to indicate which shape of cookie players may take, and also (using colored balls that pour out into its spout) to indicate which player gets to take a cookie of his choice.

name: Sliders
description:
Explained in Gladstone's Games to Go, Sliders is an abstract strategy game played on a 1x9 grid with coins (or similarly small objects). Players determine the amount of coins in 8 stacks as well as the maximum movement (slide) along the grid by secretly writing down numbers and adding them together. The player to move the final piece into the 9th box (Home) is the winner.

From Gladstone’s Games to Go:

Part of the appeal of Sliders is the strange sense of ritual at the beginning of the game. Secret numbers are scrawled, then revealed, and finally, a miniature landscape of towers is constructed. If you play in public, casual observers will first be mystified, then drawn to you. Be prepared to let others in on the fun!

name: Spaceship Battles
description:
A space battle game based on Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition) rules, Spaceship Battles was originally published in Games Workshop's White Dwarf magazine, issue #225, and uses a variety of cardboard counters that are moved and fired by distance measuring.

This seems to be the concept game to Battlefleet Gothic. A few pictures of Battlefleet Gothic models and drawings were supplied in the article.

name: Supergrips
description:
Game based upon the game show "Supergrips".

You have a wall of combs with opposite sides of the same color.

You have to stick lettersticks behind the combwall and then answer questions relating to the different letters that show up. For each question to one letter that you answer right, you can stick one of your tiles into the wall.

The first player (or team) that can build a continous line between the opposing sides, wins.

name: Wazzuopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Go Cougs!
Will you pay $250 for Martin Stadium? How about $150 for the Cougar Country Drive-in? If so, WAZZUOPOLY is the game for you! Other bargains include Butch, the Palouse, French Administration Building and The Coug. Buy, sell and trade Washington State University in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of WSU.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: El desafío del desierto PARIS-DAKAR
description:
Published by Factor Games and Iberian Nissan Motor S.A.

The object is to obtain the major possible punctuation in three stages of the game that correspond to three tours of the Paris - Dakar, each of them with more difficulties that the previous one. Ages 6 and up

Content:
- 16 player pieces
- 2 pieces of setback
- 1 dice
- 60 instructions cards
- 102 supplies cards
- 1 board
- instructions

name: On the Farm
description:
From the publisher:

At the cow's and pig's home.
Who will help the farmer and his wife to feed the animals?
If the sun is shinning the animals want to pass the time in the meadow, but if it is raining they quickly return to their stables.
Three suggestions for playing, assigning, puzzling and observing closely.
A Game & Puzzle growing with the child.
For 1 player and an adult.

name: Svenska MAD's Götebörsen
description: Similar to The Monopoly Game and The Mad Magazine Game. Published by the Swedish MAD Magazine department as a supplement in the Swedish MAD Magazine (Svenska MAD) No. 4 1976. It was later reissued as a supplement in Svenska MAD´s stora julpajare 1982.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Witchlord
description:
(From the Introduction to the Witchlord rulebook)

Witchlord is the natural adaptation of fantasy role gaming converted into a board game. There is a distinct advantage to fantasy role gaming from a board; and that is it gets rid of the need for a Game Master or scenario creator. The board, cards and matrix tables contain all the information necessary and the dice determine the outcome of your adventure. No human arbitrator is necessary.

All the passages, rooms, treasure and monsters are randomly generated. This makes no two adventures ever the same. Each time you enter the Witchlord's Castle you can expect a completely different scenario stocked with new treasure and monsters. As the player moves around the board, he will receive information about the configurations of the Witchlord's Castle. This will enable the player to plot his progress on the graph paper given.

The player will choose one of the six Adventure Classes to play. this determines the player's spell and weapon capability.

The player's objective in the game is to collect proficiency points. This is done by the slaying of monsters and the collection of treasure. Encounters and treasure are dictated by the playing cards and matrix tables. When the player reaches the 10th stratum or proficiency level, he must do battle with one of the Witchlord's generals. If the General is vanquished, the the player has won and earned safe passage out of Witchlord's Castle.

The Witchlord Game can be played as a single scenario, or as a campaign game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zipher
description:
Numbered counters valued 1 - 4 are placed upside down on the gameboard. From the middle of the board a pawn is moved according to the number of squares mentioned on the start counter. An even number makes the pawn land on on counter, an uneven number lets the pawn get next to a counter. The start counter can be removed from the board and is the first gain of the first player. When the pawn lands on a counter, it is turned upside down, then the pawn is placed upon it, so the number becomes invisible. The player must name the right number in his next turn. When he is right the player may take the counter as a win, when wrong he loses a turn. When there are no more counters that can be gained in one turn, the game ends and the player having acquired the highest total when adding the number of the counters won, is the winner of Zipher.
NB the game is a 3 player game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Pelle Svanslös på strömmingsjakt
description:
In this backyard is a battle about delicious fish. You are a cat and you are trying to pick up as many fish as possible, but be aware of the bulldog and bill and bull. The first to take 5 fish to safety will win this game.

Contents:
1 boardgame
4 playing pieces
32 cards
12 fish cards
1 guessing marker
1 black playing piece
1 die
rules

name: It Was a Dark and Stormy Night
description:
Players or teams move their markers around a board according to the roll of a die. The spaces on the board are 12 categories of literature. A marker lands on a category, the first few lines from a work in that category are read, and the player with that marker tries to identify the work. The first player or team to identify eight works wins.

Equipment
» Game board
» 4 player pawns
» 30 book tokens
» 12 categories of clue cards with divider cards
» Die

name: Monopoly: Braunschweig
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Braunschweig, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bowling Knights
description:
There's a problem in the kingdom! It's big, it's green, and it breathes fire. All of the king's knights are trying to protect Princess Sarah, but are they any match for the beast?

In this fun table-top bowling game, kids try to knock down as many knights as they can without knocking over the princess.

name: Chameleon
description: This is a game played on a Hex board wherein the winning condition is to form a line of either color connecting your two sides. You may play either color piece on your turn.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building

name: Leap Frog Dominoes
description: This is an educational variation on dominoes. Each domino has two three-letter words, with a corresponding picture, such as box, cat, and pig. There are six different ways to play, including rhyming, where the box must match with the fox, or the bug with the rug, etc. The different play objectives allow for greater variation in the learning experience. The game claims to be rated for ages 3 and up.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Serve and Volley
description:
A simple cards and dice game on a tennis match, for 2 players.
A 60 cards deck, one six sided die and a few coins are all you need to play.

name: Bop Bop 'n Rebop
description:
Box Description: Fast and furious fun for 2 to 4 players. Ages 5 thru adult. Knock it and sock it! While you try to block it! Don't let the puck scoot through! Players drop a puck onto a spinning turntable and try to protect their goals. Don't let the puck scoot through - because if you do, you lose a point. Three points and you lose the game.

General Description: Consists of a central turntable that spins when the game is turned on (battery powered); on this is placed one of the game's two plastic disks (large and small). Players operate one of four plastic sliders that they may use to block the opening on their quarter of the circumference by sliding it back and forth, much like a hockey goalie. As the turntable spins, the disk will bounce about the edges. Each player must prevent the disk from escaping through their opening by operating their slider. Points are acquired for failing to block the disk from escaping, leading to player elimination. Two plastic barriers are included to block player spaces that are either not being used or have been eliminated.

name: Na sowas! Wissens-Spektrum II
description: Who knows the answers to 7.200 questions? Nice Party-Game for players who love to answer very hard questions.

name: Top oder Flop
description:
As manager of a records company, the players try to contract worldwide famous artists. With these artists the players must produce records and bring them to the first place on Hit parade. The winner is the successful manager that produces at least four golden records of four different artists.
On a board very similar to Monopoly, the very creative and beautiful E-guitar tokens of each player can run following dice numbers only on the external part. There, they can contract artists and promote the artists’ career by means of interviews, tourneys, etc. Special Top oder flop places allow the players to bring their artists works to the Hit Parade, located on the internal section of the board. Here, the players try to increase the success and popularity of the artists under their management, aiming the Gold Record.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Gegen den Wind
description: Be quick sailing around the island. Act quickly when the wind dice roll and the wind changes direction. If you end up on a whirlpool you can even ask for help from the weather god... but who knows if he'll respond positively or negatively. This is just one of the possible surprises of this exciting sailing game.

name: Bilderschlange
description:
Bilderschlange (Picture Snake) matching game by Selecta is similar to a cross between a jigsaw game and dominoes.
The objective of the game is for children to find a picture that matches with a picture on a tile already played. As play continues, the row of pictures grows slowly. Encourage storytelling during play. The clown needs his umbrella, the tower needs a roof and the moon needs the sun.
Picture Snake matching game requires children to think logically developing cognitive and reasoning skills. Picture Snake is manufactured in Europe by Selecta Spielzeug and consists of 20 large wood tiles (2"x4") with beautiful painted pictures. In step with Selecta's history of quality, this game is of excellent quality featuring hard beech wood and child safe finished surfaces that will withstand years of children enjoyment!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Bloodbath at Chosin
description:
This is a free wargame included in the 2008 Nov issue of the China magazine 'Tank and Armored Vehicle'. It simulates the famous battle between the US and the China at Chosin Reservoir in 1950 during the Korean War. It is in fact a trimmed-down boardgame version of an online wargame also designed by the same company.

The components include:
A 10" x 14" Map
112 counters
Rule on the back of the Map
publishers: Oriental Flagship (BEIJING) International Technology CO., LTD

name: Mini eller maxi
description: The goal of the game is to score points by associating from categories such as "famous love-couples" etc. You either get point from associating the same as your competitors, or uniquely, depending on how you roll the dice.

name: Garage Band: The Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Did you know that Aerosmith was sometimes called the American Rolling Stones? Or that Barbara Streisand's mother said she wasn't attractive enough for show biz?

The famous bands and musicians of the 60s, 70s, and 80s! Garage Band: The Game gives you 4 clues that start out vague and get specific. If your team members guess the famous name on the first clue you earn 20 points. Guess it on the fourth REALLY specific clue and you earn only 5 ponits. Be the first team to earn 300 points and win the game!

name: Shepherd
description:
Co-operative game playing for very young children.

From the rules:
"Paul, the Shepherd, has spent the day tending his sheep and lambs. He was helped by his dogs. As evening approached and it was time to bring the sheep and lambs into a pen for the night, Paul busied himself with putting the logs together for the pen while the dogs rounded up the sheep and lambs. It was a game they all enjoyed. The dogs hurried about trying to get the sheep and lambs into the pen before Paul could lay all the logs together to close the two entrances. See if you can help so the dogs can win again."

The players try to drive home the sheep by using their dogs. They have to achieve this before the shepherd completes a pen in the middle of the game area (which is variably set up from tiles, some of which are the sheep). The building speed is determined by the same die that also moves the dogs which can proceed to the next tile of the color that was rolled. As so often with Herder games, players can pass their die results to other players. All players win or lose together (if the pen is completed before the sheep are in).

Game play is varied by the fact that the meadow is completed by the forming of paths using 28 interlocking tiles that feature the sheep, poppies, etc. The number of tiles can be reduced to make the game easier for younger children.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Limousin
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Limousin region, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ísland: íslenska spurningaspilið
description: A trivia game about Iceland. There are six categories of questions: History, culture, nature, geography, sports and miscellaneous. Collect a token from each category to win. The players roll a die to move and then they must answer a question from the category they land on. If they answer correctly they get a token and when they've gathered tokens in every colour, they can head to the capital (center). First they need to get to a corner of the board where they answer a question of their own choosing. Then there are two coloured spaces from the corner to the center. When the players get to the center they answer a question of the other player(s) choosing. A correct answer in the center means victory!

name: ran: SAT.1-Fußballquiz
description: ran - SAT.1-Fußballquiz is a trivia game about football, respectively soccer. In their turns, the players throw a dice, move across the board and answer one out of 999 questions concerning football. The one, who reaches the finish first and can answer three questions consecutively is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Kod DaVinci, po sledam velikih tayn
description:
Card game with a field. In game it is necessary to create hiding places and to hide in them relics from other players. Players can open anothers hiding places, and also place in the hiding places of a trap. The board makes hierarchy of monks of secret order.

Game is published under the license for book Dan Brown "The Da Vinci Code".

Game structure:
Cards:
Relics - 12,
Traps - 36,
Breaking - 36,
Unexpectedness - 8,
Professional - 8,
Score Points - 8,
Relics - 12,
Counters of players - 8

Field - 1
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Renaissance, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Takat
description:
The board is made up of 7 circles arranged in a hexagonal grid making up a large hexagon. Every other circle on the outer ring is coloured red. Although the board can be made up of Hexagons instead.

The white player must get 1 stack of six. The stack can be made up of black pieces as well as white pieces, or can be made up of just one colour. Even if the black player makes the stack, it still counts.

If white immobilizes black, then white wins. Black must immobilize white.

An entry into the About.com: 2002 Unequal Forces Game Design Competition.

name: Plus Minus
description:
The game consists of a dice cup like in Yahtzee, with 6 ordinary dice, a timer, a notepad and a pencil.

Players roll the 6 dice and then everyone must use all 6 numbers to reach a particular score before the timer runs out.

You start with 1, and move on progressively to 2, 3, and so forth until 10. The first player to successfully reach 10 wins the game.

Each of the 6 numbers must be used exactly once, and you may Add, Subtract, Multiply or Divide as you please!

When the time's up you check whose calculation is actually correct. This player moves on to the next target score. Everyone else must redo the score they just failed.

name: To Bethlehem: The Christmas Game for the Entire Family
description:
To Bethlehem - The Christmas Game for the Entire Family

"If you're looking for something to bring your family together at Christmas, this game is for you!" - The Family man

The object of the game is to help families talk, laugh, act goofy, and spend time together as they focus of the real meaning of Christmas.

The game is a roll the die, move the pawn and do what ever the game square you land on tells you to do. Landing on a square marked "Around the Campfire" requires drawing a card and interacting based upon what the card is asking for. Such questions can include things like what is your favorite Christmas smell and what is the strangest Christmas tradition you have heard of? The ultimate goal is to reach the square with baby Jesus.

Pieces include:

The Game Board
10 Plastic Pawns
1 Six Sided Die
72 Plastic Gold Shekels
Campfire Cards
Trader Moe's Deed and Parking Passes

name: Witt And Wisdom
description:
Players move into spaces containing proverbs and maxims as they travel around a laminated plastic map with a space galaxy theme.

Players draw "Humor & Wit" cards or Laff-A-Lott" cards and try avoid the Black Hole or the Time Warp. The space marked "Cosmic Cave" functions like the jail in Monopoly.

Designed to be "not competitive, confrontative, ethnically or gender oriented."

Made in Canada

name: Batman Game: The Adventures of the Caped Crusader
description:
A "fast exciting game" where the players assume the role as the caped crusaders to fight against the most villainous criminals.

How to play:
Each Player Has a Playing Counter.
Play Starts in the Batcave and Players Move Around the Board according to the Spinner.
Look Out For Batman's Adversaries such as Joker, Penguin, Two-Face and Catwoman.
Follow the Instructions on the Board.
The First Player to Return to the Batcave Wins the Game.

Contents:
1 Game Board.
1 Spinner.
4 Playing Pieces.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Denys Fisher Toys, Hasbro Industries (Hasbro Bradley)

name: Wendy: Im Galopp
description:
In this game each player must gallop as fast as possible, his horses from the paddock on the edge of the stall in the middle of moving schedule. But this is easier said than done, because sometimes horses can collide.
Wendy:im Gallop is one of three children' games from the new Wendy-home series published by AMIGO.

Contents:
1 Board
29 Characters
16 stars

name: Disney Princess Mix and Match Game
description:
Help each Princess collect her treasures.

This game comes with four Princess boards - Ariel, Snow White, Cinderella and Belle - and eight treasures for each. There are two levels of play - boards face-down (in which case you have to remember whether the treasure is the right one for your princess) or face-up (in which case the treasure can be found somewhere in the picture on the Princess board). A tile is drawn from the top of the stack, and a player claims it for their board if it is their princess' treasure. The first player to collect all 8 matching treasures wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Wedding Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Something old, something new, something borrowed, something blue.

The Wedding Game, originally published in 1880, is a card game chronicling a Bride and Groom's trip to the altar. As in any wedding, players pay and receive according to directions, along the way picking up assorted bridesmaids, groomsmen, the Parson and a clerk while avoiding the Lawyer, the Bride's Aunt and a rejected suitor. During the game, if the lawyer is encountered, the wedding is postponed. Amazingly, little has changed in over 100 years.

The game consists of twenty-four charmingly illustrated character cards, twenty-five pay cards and complete instructions.
publishers: F.G. & Co., John Jaques of London

name: Hollands Glorie
description:
Hollands Glorie is a game about tug-boats on the North Sea, inspired on a novel with the same name by Jan de Hartog. The gameboard depicts the North Sea, with six harbours and six offshore platforms. At the start of the game, eighteen ships are placed at sea.

A Weather Card is drawn, which shows the weather in different areas, and two ships which are in jeopardy. The players attempt to reach these ships and tug them to a harbour. If a player succeeds in doing so, he collects a number of coins as reward. At the end of the game, the player with the most coins wins.

Movement is determined by rolling two dice. In fair weather, the a tug-boat moves a number of squares equal to the sum of the two dice, in unstable weather only the number shown on the highest of the two dice and in a storm only the number shown on the lowest of the two dice

Rolling doubles results in a special event. On a double 5 or 6, the weather shifts and new ships are placed in jeopardy. On any other double, the player draws a Log Card, which will often have some one-time effect or give him a special assignment with which he can gain coins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gänget bygger koja
description:
"The gang builds a hut"

Players build teams which try to build small huts in the forest as fast as possible. They collect boards and tools and then try to build. The team which manages to build their hut first wins.

The huts are actually built as 3D models of real, thin plywood.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Monopoly: Suomi
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A version of Monopoly based on the Finnish cities. (Suomi is the Finnish name for Finland.)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chip In
description: Variation of a rather old game concept. Each player has a board with numbers from 1-11 (but no 7). On each of these, a chip is placed. The player rolls two dice and can take a chip if one of the fields with a number he/she rolled or the one with the sum of the two dice still has a chip on it. If not, he/she adds a chip to any of the fields. If he/she rolls a seven, he/she has to put one chip into the middle of the table. The first player to completely clear his/her board gets all the chips from the table and those remaining on other players' boards. After several rounds, the player with most chips is the winner.

name: Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss
description:
- The game to the 2nd movie -
The three ??? - The Cursed Castle: The big game to the motion picture film - exciting search for hints in the cursed castle.

The three ??? are on the trace of the Cursed Castle's secret: Where are hidden secret doors, what about the strange carpet and where is hidden the mysterious invention of the castle's owner Mr. Terrill? But attention: An eerie ghost strolls through the castle and it is quite tricky to get along the cursed castle!

Not to be confused with Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss – Die spannende Jagd nach dem Diamanten that came out in the same year, from the same publisher, about the same film, but from different designers.

name: Battles Fantasia
description:
Get your classic group with fantasy adventurers (Fighter, Sorceress, Rogue, Priest) and fight against an opposing team.

Make combat moves and cast deadly spells by creating card combinations for each character.

"Battles Fantasia" is card driven battle game for 2 players using standard decks of cards and some markers. It's fast, easy and free! Print the rules, get your deck of cards and some markers and you are off to war!

name: Metropol
description: Players spin the roulette to see what site in the big city - The METROPOL - they visit. Most are empty lots ready for development. Buy the site and you can build houses and skyscrapers on it to claim rent from other visiting players. Whoever dominates the city and manages to run everyone else bankrupt is the winner.

name: Cocoa  A  Gogo
description:
The object of the game is to earn the title of Cocoa-a-Gogo,the premier chocolate bean producer in the world.

There are two stages to the game. The first stage involves traveling around the outside track on the board collecting six cards ,resources needed to build your cacao plantation. In the second stage, it takes 20 beans currency to buy the way in, and is played inside the inner board; reaching the center is the key to win the game.

Cocoa a gogo is a Kids roll'n move family game: negotiation is the key to get the items (resources).

name: Go! Go! Go!
description:
An umpired tactical miniatures wargame based on modern counter-terrorist operations as portrayed in first-person shooter computer games.

Excerpts from the rules:

"This figures game is closely modelled on the first person perspective computer game called Counterstrike."

"This version is played with maps and figures to allow some freedom of action and interaction with the environment not available in the computer game - and to allow people not very good at this sort of computer game to get some of the enjoyment of it. It is also handy when a multi-computer LAN isn't immediately to hand."

"The players are in two teams, Counter Terrorist and Terrorists. The game is just about an assault - which has a time limit - in which either the objective is secured or the operation is bungled."

"Each player team has a separate map of the operational area, and a set of figures representing their them, and the rest of their team, and the enemy."

"Ideally, a separate map for each player should be used, but if space and time are limited, a map per team is ok. It is important that the layout of each map is screened from the opposition."

"Game Control updates these maps each turn, showing what they can seen from the team's perspective. Strict observance of lines of sight must be followed and enemy figures not in sight are removed from the map."
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Schützt unsere Umwelt!
description:
Text on the box (translated from German):
The game:
Knowledge, guessing, imitating, laughing, rolling dice, tactics, luck ...
you really find everything in this game about life and environment!
It is exciting, fast and is fun to play again and again. Want to bet?

The game consists of a board showing a track of 60 spaces between "start" and "finish" and 3 places for certain piles of cards. Additionally the box contains 126 cards (66 "Pfiffikus", 30 "Rüffel" and 30 "Belohnung"), 64 reward marker, 1 bag made of cotton, 8 wooden figurines (4 girls and 4 boys, each in blue, red, yellow and green), 2 wooden dice (one to use and one for replacement) and a rulesheet.
Looking at the components it seems to be a fair simple game of "Roll and Move" (sorry, I don't have the rules). I guess that the shuffled cards have to be placed on the corresponding place on the gameboard from where a card is drawn and read to the player who ended up on a certain space. Each space of the running track shows one of 3 symbols: a question mark, an exclamation mark or an explosion bubble.
The question mark belongs to the Pfiffikus-cards. In this pile you find action cards giving you a special task to perform (like balancing a figurine on your left foot while walking once around the room) or question cards. The player receives reward chips for giving the right answer or fulfilling the action task.
Rüffel-cards are showing the exclamation mark. On them you find a description of what you might have done wrong (like wasting energy etc.) and the punishment you receive (lose markers, go back etc.).
Cards for Belohnung (meaning reward) are showing the bubble. They are listing exemplary behaviour and a reward for it.
Seems to me that you are winning when you reach the finish line and have more reward markers than the others.

name: Squares
description:
Another implementation of the traditional game of Dots and Boxes. In this instance, the game plays out on a cross-shaped board. On a player's turn that player adds a "fence" to the board. Whenever a player's fence-play finishes a full square around a box, that player claims the box with a token. The game continues until there are no further moves, and the player who has claimed the most boxes wins.

Similar to the game Boxes.

name: Transigo
description: Transigo is a card driven abstract racing game for 2-6 players. Each player has 2 of the 8 colored pieces and the players try to keep it secret which pieces they have. The goal is to get the pieces through the track and obtain the best combined position for the two pieces. Each turn a player plays a movement card. All cards contain the colors of two pieces that are both moved. Subsequently, each turn, the player also repositions his/her block piece.

name: Partner
description:
From Box:
Partner is a psychological game for 3,4,5 or 6 people.
Its purpose is to identify among the players, pairs of people, tastes, feelings, habits and tendencies have significant affinity.
With partners, therefore, not only form ideal couples in terms of sentiment, but their combination of persons who may have an effective agreement in other areas, such as business, entertainment, cultural interests and so on.
The game involves at any time all participants, who, responding to questions on the board should form a "chain of understanding" with another player.
Once it is formed a pair examined the psychological aspect.
Partner with discover in a fun and enjoyable nature of your relationships with others.
The results are surprising and unexpected!

name: Sonnenwürfel
description:
While the game looks like a simple roll and move game for the very young at first is actually more than that, as players have a few options. For instance, a roll can be re-rolled, but the original roll has to be given away to another player. The die has symbols instead of colors and numbers. The goal is to reach the sun.

The game was published in two versions, one regular sized, one giant one (150 cm game board blanket, "meeples" up to 16 cm high).

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Smile Squad
description:
From the card box:

Smile Squad is a two-player card game for kids ages 6-11. Players compete to be the first to score 32 points or more - the number of teeth in a healthy grown-up smile - while learning important dental health information. By matching cards, players command heroes to perform actions that defeat villains.

name: Colonnade
description:
Colonnade is a two person game which uses a 1x8 board, 12 red checkers and 12 blue checkers. The board is initially set up as shown in the figure.

You can pick up any one of your checkers from a stack, carrying the checkers above it along, and place it onto an adjacent stack that’s topped with a checker of your color. (A stack can be of height 1.) Complete such a move with a discard. I.e. if two like-colored checkers are adjacent in a stack, discard one of the two checkers.

You can also move a checker down to an unoccupied square. You can't slide a bottom checker sideways to an unoccupied square.

The last player to have a move available wins. I.e. if you don't have a move available on your turn, you lose.

name: Philadelphia-opoly
description:
How do you make a game about Philly? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Philadelphia we could into this box. It’s full of amazing history, sports, heart, just one more cheesesteak and...lots of fun! looking for a great way to experience Philadelphia? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play... Buy your favorite Philadelphia properties, increase Your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Go Philly! You may soon be the mayor of Philadelphia... or you may be stuck in the traffic jam of your life!

GET YOUR GAME ON! THIS IS PHILLY... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Monopoly: McDonald's Happy Meal
description: Mini version of Monopoly. The game money has been reduced to single-digit denominations. The McDonalds square is bad (which seems unusual). Part of a set of mini boardgames.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Heads and Tails
description:
This appears to be a reproduction of an older game. From the rules:
"Heads and Tails is the ideal family card game suitable for all ages. The box contains 48 cards which form 24 complete pictures and the cards can be swapped around to make 576 different pictures."

In the game for several players, the cards are dealt out completely to all players and players lay down as many complete pairs as they can make. Subsequently, players play one card to the table at a time, trying to match a head to a tail - in this phase, any head and be matched to any tail.

In the game for one player, the player stacks the heads in one deck and the tails in another and reveals one from each deck simultaneously if they match, the pair is set aside, if not, the next pair is revealed. The player goes through the deck as many times as necessary to pair off all cards.

name: KLOO
description:
Using foreign word cards players must discover the meaning of words and place them in sentences to score points and chase each other around France or Spain on the way to the capital. The game uses sophisticated Discovery Learning Techniques to make language learning faster and a lot more fun.

With KLOO you can in fact play 16 different games. Some are quick-fire quizzes. Others are akin to classic card games like Rummy, Whist and Patience. Players immerse themselves in the game of their choice but quickly learn a second language as they play. KLOO is currently in English to French and English Spanish.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Game System, Racing, Travel, Word Game

name: Junkyard Races Character Cards
description: Character cards to use with the Race-Kart Crew optional rule (see pages 17 & 18 of the rules booklets). Best used to randomly determine who gets which character

name: Komputer
description:
A 2 player board game.

The purpose of the game is to find as many combinations as it’s possible which sum is exactly 10. Every combination has to consist of exactly three digits situated on three neighbouring areas connected with edges or with corners. Each area can only be used once in a combination.

Players take turns finding such combinations. Upon finding one the active player may place his pawn on the board on the first or the third digit of the desired combination (never second). On any one area can only be placed one pawn. Therefore such area can be part of combination, but cannot be chosen to place a pawn on it.

The winner is the player who has found more combinations (indicated by the number of pawns on the board). If both players used the same number of pawns the winner is the player who has situated his pawns on areas which digits sum up to a higher number.

name: The Wreckers' Tower Game
description:
First title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go Down to the Sea".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained within the book in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find: the book, a set of playing cards consisting of a rucksack; codebook; torch; measure card; map — and to refresh you on your journey, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

name: Anything Goes
description: 'Anything Goes' is a silly charades-type party game. On your turn, you draw two cards that tell you which two actions you have to present simultaneously. For example, you might end up "doing laundry" while "tight rope walking." All the other players write down guesses as to what you have acted out. After the players have written their guesses, the actor for the round reads all them of them out loud and gives an award to one player. The award category is chosen at random, and could be something like "funniest" or "strangest." It is not necessarily about correctly guessing what the actor presented. The player who collects the most awards wins the game.

name: Deepsea Desperation
description:
(from the game) THE OIL IS RUNNING OUT! The days of easy drilling are long gone and oil companies are searching in ever deeper, riskier and more fragile places just to secure our daily fixx of capitalist cog-grease. The battle is on to protect these areas from the next 'Deepwater Horizon' and with a couple of dice, a few coins and a friend, you can re-enact this struggle. It's Greenpeace vs. the Oil Company, trying to establish marine reserves in the very territory the other player wants to exploit. Through a mix of strategic lobbying, exploration, occupation and reserve creation, one of you will triumph. But beware: too many blowouts and you'll have a deepwater slaughter on your hands. And if all the animals die, you both lose!


You only need some coins and 2 dice to play. Everything else is included in the files. Game play takes place on a grided map of the ocean, containing squares of varying depths of water. One player takes on the role of environmental activists, Greenpeace, while the other, the role of a Big Nasty Oil company. Greenpeace is trying to establish marine reserves in the very places that Big Oil is trying to drill. You see, oil (in the form of coins) is available everywhere, but severely limited in shallow and medium depths. So once the easy oil runs out, the oil company is pushed into deep water. Drilling involves rolling two dice, one after the other. If the second number is larger than the first, this drill results in profit (coins equal to the difference in the two numbers) but if you roll a double, it's a blow out. Blow outs are more damaging in deeper water and any blow out might affect surrounding wildlife (animal counters are distributed randomly for each game). If any one species gets totally wiped out, both players lose.

Each player has 3 strategies to choose from each turn and there is enough variation to ensure that no single outcome is guaranteed (although a lot of animals consistently die).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Enclosure

name: Früher oder Später
description:
Früher oder Später is a card game issued by the Bundeszentrale für politische Bildung of Germany. The game has 61 cards, each one depicting one event of German history from 1949-2010.

The game contains two variants. The first variant is a simple guessing game if the hidden card from the top of your stack is earlier or later than the current open card. The second game is a bit more interesting for gamers. One player reads an event and the other players offer one of their events which should be as close as possible to the first event. The first player then decides which event is closest to his event. If he's right, he and the other player can keep the card. Otherwise, only the player who has played the closest card, can keep his card. Winner is the player who first gets 5 cards.

name: The Penguins of Madagascar: Return to the Habitat
description:
An elite strike force with unmatched commando skills! The Penguins of Madagascar have a mission, to get back to their habitat before the Zoo opens. Help Rico, Kowalski, Private and Skipper get back to the Habitat and WIN!

For anyone who love the Penguins, this simple game is for you. You play one of the four Penguins of Madagascar and your goal is to reach your habitat base as fast as you can.

The game curve is fast as it is geared to a younger generation, though is can be enjoyed by any age. Ostensibly, this is a simple roll-and-move game, but the added aspects of the magnets in the board and the pieces adds an interesting variability not seen in many games. The idea is a simple one: get to home base. The difference is that there are several "turning" points on the board that alters you path of direction. Either you move ahead, jump forward, or are send backwards.

Overall a game that can be played and enjoyed by all.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Slovensko Junior
description:
Junior version of the game Slovensko (Slovakia), questions and answers for children from age 10.

On your turn, roll the die and move your playing piece as many steps as the die shows, to either direction. The space that your playing piece lands on shows from which category you will answer a question.
You must collect 1 correct answer from every category and after that there is one final question. To win the game You must answer this correctly.

name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
description:
Can you keep it from falling!

Leaning Tower of Pisa is a stacking game. Players first take turns adding pieces to construct the entire tower, then if it is still standing, pieces are removed one by one (not from the top level) until the tower collapses. The loser is either the player who adds the piece which causes the tower to fall in the construction phase, or the player who removes the piece causing the collapse in the removal phase.

The tower itself is made up of eight levels, each level having six pieces which can be removed, a central support piece and a flat 'floor' piece. The full tower stands about 33cm tall (13in).

There is also a sloping base piece which can be used for a more difficult challenge. Starting with this piece means that the whole tower is on an angle (like the real Leaning Tower) and is much more unstable.

name: Kalandozás a vadnyugaton
description: The theme of the game is adventure on the Wild West. The players roll either one or two dice and move accordingly on the board. At the yellow junction the players can decide which way to go. If they land on a colored number they read a story and get a special item. The player with the most items wins. It is a simple game for children.

name: Squirrels!
description:
Playing as one of six unique Squirrels your mission is to add eight acorns to your personal stockpile in the Big Tree so you won't be hungry in the winter months.

Forage and fight other Squirrels for acorns as you avoid such dangerous things such as power lines, cars, and kids with BB guns.

Setup

The playing space consists of nine location cards in a grid. The Big Tree is always placed in the middle with the other locations being placed at random. Then each card starts with a certain number of acorns noted on the card.

Each player receives a stockpile card with scoring chip, a random squirrel card, and a pawn.

Gameplay

On your turn you can choose three actions from the following:

1.) Forage for an acorn - (Roll d6 under forage)
2.) Move one space orthogonally to a new location
3.) Attempt to steal an acorn from another squirrel at the same location as you (Roll d6+skill - Highest wins)
4.) Add an acorn to your stockpile. (Only at the Big Tree)

Whenever a player rolls a six that player draws an event card and follows the instructions on the card.

Will you be the first Squirrel to stockpile eight acorns and be ready for winter?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Libido
description:
The game is won by the richest player, and on the way to this goal, try to get your opponents to take their clothes off.
The rather psychodelic board has two tracks. You start on the outer track and when you age a little, you move on to the inner track.Dice are used for moving on either track.
When you land on squares, you must follow the instructions, Example: A Blank Square - you can buy a bed and place it in the square. Anyone now landing on you bed, loses one item of clothing.
Players can play with cards that resemble clothes so that if they have to lose apparel, they can lose a card instead.

name: Dance Charades
description:
You’ve seen the sprinkler, you’ve even seen the lawn mower, but you have never seen anything like this.
You get a 40 second song clip during your turn. You dance as many items as you can.
For the items other people guess correctly, you get one point.
BUT HERE IS THE TWIST! You get rewarded points from others if your dancing is awesome. Everyone else has tokens and can reward your dancing awesomeness with up to three tokens per turn.
This keeps people dancing and not just charading.


What comes in the box:
300 dance cards
Score pad
300 tokens
Audio CD with 40 songs
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: ZAP 'EM (Zombie Attack Prevention and Extermination Machine)
description:
You are an inventor and engineer in a small rural town. When news comes of a wave of zombies sweeping over the region, you immediately turn to a way to stop them. By creating the Zombie Attack Prevention and Extermination Machine (which, with your characteristic acumen for catchy names, becomes the ZAP ‘EM), you have enabled your town to weather even the most severe zombie invasion. Unfortunately, the ZAP’EM is rather expensive to run, and after building it you are pretty short on cash. You decide to turn your ingenuity into a money-making scheme.
