By renting out your zombie-slaying capabilities, you can become one of the richest and most respected people in town. That is, assuming you can kill all these zombies in the first place...

At the beginning of the game you will place tiles representing homes, buildings, and terrain features-and, of course, zombies. As the zombies spawn and move around the board terrorizing (and killing) the inhabitants, you must chase them down and ZAP 'EM! If you are lucky, you may even earn some cash! Win the game by killing every zombie in town. You can also keep track of your high score (the amount of cash you have at the end of the game.) Other options include varying difficulty levels and a campaign system that allows you to string multiple games together.

name: Ungeheuer Indiskret
description:
Objective: try to understand the thoughts of the other players
- collect as many (matching) chips as possible.
Within of many dragons dominated (illustrated) Europe (map) you see very nice & cute drawings all over the board.
The players try to be right with their guesses about the linkage of attributes and drawings.
Example:
The two adjectives 'enviable' and 'fiery' can be related to
'Flamenco' in Spain or to a 'love couple' image in Denmark.
If you match the active player's decision you score (chips).

name: Mein Tag
description:
Mein Tag (My day) is from Haba My Very First Games Series. It contains 2 games with the day- starting theme.


Waking up and starting the day!


A first funny color placement memory game for two little sleepyheads. The players have to search for a tile that matches the color of the last one to have been placed.


Ready, steady, let the new day begin!


On the die appears: One, two or three dots? Take your figure and move it forward on to the end of the tiles. The die shows the tired face, go over to the next player. The player who reaches the red tile first wins the game.

name: Lotte lauamäng
description:
Somewhere in Europe, near a big sea, there is a small village called Leiuatajateküla (Inventors Village), where it is thought as honor to be able to build and invent your own stuff. Every year they have a competition for inventions.
Who is the best inventor in the city? Maybe someone who can build a plane from paper and a string or a tractor from a old trumpet. Join in to take part in the best ever competition that ever was. This is a fast and tricky board game for 2 to 5 little inventors and fans of Lotte (Estonian animation), in where you have a lot of fun and no one will get hurt. Game fits for smaller and larger players, for academic and for school kids. Who wouldn't want to adventure with rabbit Adalbert and cat Bruno?
Be the first to finish your invention and score most with it to win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spot It!
description: Children's game to keep them occupied on a long car journey. Each child id dealt some cards (the number could vary depending on the time available). Then it is a simple mechanic of spotting one of the items on the cards in their hand. First to spot all the cards in their hand, wins.

name: Phineas and Ferb Funniest Card Game Ever!
description:
Goal: Players try to match the characters to the correct scene. The player with the most points from completed scenes when the last card is drawn wins.

The game comes with 2 decks of cards (68 blue-backed and 12 green-backed) plus 9 cardboard characters. To start the game players claim the characters one at a time and are dealt 3 blue cards. Then a green card is turned up. Players take turns drawing 1 blue card and playing 1 blue card. Here are the different types of cards in the game:


Green-backed cards = These cards give special responsibilities to the player who holds Agent P or Dr. Doofenshmirtz. For example "Say 'Ahh, Perry the Platypus!' before you start your turn. If you forget, you turn is over!" These cards also give the indicated player an extra penalty or bonus. For example "You may play 1 extra card." A new green-backed card is flipped over and takes effect whenever the Agent P or Dr. Doofenshmirtz character moves to another player.
Blue-backed Character Cards = These cards move the characters around. For instance "Take 1 character from another player."
Blue-backed Power Cards = These cards give you special card-play powers. For instance "Take 1 random card from each player."
Blue-backed Challenge Cards = These cards allow you to do weird challenges against other players. For instance "Challenge another player to a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. If you win, take up to 3 random cards from the other player.
Blue-backed Scene Cards = These cards are how you score points. If you have the character(s) shown on the card you can play it for the number of points indicated on the card. For instance the "Unfair Science Fair" card is worth 10 points if you currently hold Baljeet.
Blue-backed Special Cards = The Mom card forces everyone to discard everything and draw 3 new cards. The 50 Bonus Points card gives 50 points to the player holding it at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mc Chain: Was sagt die Kette?
description:
Objective:
be the first making correct guesses, thus ending the race
1 active player draws a cards and tries to form the chosen (1 of 3) term with a chain
2 very first player giving the right answer (within fixed time) gets points, together with active player ==> move correspondent meeples forward
3 points to be acquired: depending on difficulty; hints are allowed, but combined with penalties
4 position may limit choice of questions

name: Poker Kids
description: To learn the basics of poker fun there are 70 cards in 7 colors with numbers 1 to 10 in this game. Players bet with chips and collect different sets of 3 cards: best card, pair, row, three of a kind, color, three of a kind flash. Game lasts 10 rounds. Round lasts until the deck is exhausted. The player with the most chips is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Act the Adverb
description: This is a published version of the familiar party game. One player reads an adverb off a card and then is told by a second player to perform an action in the manner of that adverb. The second player then tries to guess the adverb. Play alternates and continues until, the publisher suggests, ten words have been read.

name: Johnnys Farm
description:
This game is a cooperation between tractor company John Deere, toy car company Siku and Schmidt Spiele.
2-4 very young children drive a toy tractor around a farm. For this, they roll a die which shows different symbols. For a fruit/vegetable symbol, the active player drives to the respective field, flips over one of the chips on that field and checks whether it matches his/her trailer color. If so, he/she can keep it. If not, s/he drives around the farm house. If s/he rolls a farm house symbol, s/he drives to the stables and takes care of a table of his/her choice. This action consists of acting, making animal sounds, etc. The first player to fill his/her trailer is the winner.

name: Punaisten ja valkoisten taistelu Suomessa 1918
description:
Published for the Christmas market of 1918, Punaisten ja valkoisten taistelu Suomessa 1918 ("Battle of the Reds and the Whites in Finland in 1918") is one of the first Finnish board games. The game portrayes the Finnish Civil War between the Whites and the Reds between January and May 1918.

The game itself is fairly simple roll and move war game. The board is full of special locations that have benefits and harms for the different sides of the conflict.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Paquet voleur
description:
Paquet voleur is a board game adapted from the television version. Strategy game, knowledge and bluff. Who will be the big winner? Combining general knowledge, strategy, luck and courage, this exciting game is for players with cunning and good bluffing who will try to get the pellets containing the largest amounts of money and gain access to the Final Round. Strategy, thinking and nerves of steel are the party!

The goal is to accumulate the largest amount of money by collecting the money contained in pellets. Each round you get a new pellet and you must decide to either keep it or try to steal another player's pellet. That player can try to block that theft by correctly answering a general knowledge question. At the end of each round a player is eliminated until someone reaches the final round in which he or she will try to make more money in that single round than any other player.
categories: Bluffing, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Chicken
description:
A press-your-luck game for two to four fearless poultry fans

by Shawn Storie and Jonathan A. Leistiko

Object: Draw as many points as you can without drawing more than one chicken foot.

You Need:

A __Chicken__ deck (available on the website)
A way to keep score (ex: paper and pencil)


Each round is divided into two phases: Bid (you bid how many cards you will draw from the deck — highest bid wins) and Draw (winner of the bid has to draw what he or she bid).

When drawing, the drawing player gets to keep any number cards he or she drew face down in front of them. If he or she draws any Chicken Feet, the chicken feet must go face up in front of the player.

At the end of the round, the drawing player tallies his or her score. If the player had no chicken feet, the player gets the sum of the points in front of him/her. If the drawing player had one chicken foot, he or she will add an extra 10 points to his/her score. Two or more chicken feet? The player subtracts the points in front of him/her from his/her score.

If a round ends and at least one player has 50 points or more, the game ends. The player with the most points wins. If any players are tied, play another round with all players.

name: Die wilden Fußballkerle  Schuss ... Tor!
description:
Objective: be the first scoring as many goals as agreed (3 or more)
- acting simultaniously/ 2 players or 2 teams (red and blue) -
game board has to be prepared (each row - 6 in total - is filled up with 5 slides/different numbers)
ball must be moved (from the attacker) into the next closer row in direction of defender's keeper: attacker nominates 2 (of 11) meeples with hidden numbers ==> multiply both to move ball upon a matching slide/area; defender acts in a similar way; if successful (same result) defender becomes attacker; if not, attacker gets closer to the goal ==> additional turn (with less meeples on both sides).
Close enough to score? - use goal & keeper chips in a similar way.
categories: Children's Game, Math, Party Game, Sports

name: Lakebilly Card Game
description:
There's a huge floatin' shin-dig happenin' across the water. She's gonna be elbow to elbow over there so we need to round up a bunch o' boats, fill 'em with boozed-up locals, and get their asses over there before dock space is gone!

Lakebilly is a rude and crude party'n game that is easy to learn, very social, and hilarious. You play the captain - your job is to fill up as many boats as you can with boozy locals and deliver them to the lake party as fast as possible.

Stay sharp. Dock space is limited and all of the other captains on the water are rounding up their crew too. Make sure you bribe the locals with beers to get them aboard right away. Watch out for sabotage! The other captains will steal your boats, mutiny your crew and do anything to stop you from getting to the party location.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Nautical, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Voting

name: Ertappt und geschnappt
description:
The biggest vault in town is empty! Was it Gloomy Gary, Burgling Beth or Wicked Wally? The players investigate who left the fingerprints on the crime site and who has an alibi. Only the player who can quickly combine numbers, identify the right suspect and, with the right operation card, take him into custody will win the game as the best
crime solver.

In the quick reaction game Nabbed!, twelve criminal suspects are arranged in a circle, with a police officer placed next to one of the suspects. Each player receives operation cards numbered 1-6.

Each turn, someone reveals a profile card that shows three suspects, then another player rolls the die. The symbol on the die tells the players which of the three suspects on the profile card is the criminal. Players race to count the number of steps the officer must go to reach the criminal, then reveal the corresponding operation card from their hand. The player who reveals the card first checks whether the answer is correct by moving the officer the indicated number of spaces. If he was right, he collects the profile card; otherwise all other players receive a profile card. Whoever collects six profile cards first wins!

name: CryptidsTV 2
description:
User summary

A stand-alone expansion to Cryptids TV. Contains more (biligual Japanese/English) monster description cards and more headlines, notepads and cards necessary to play the game. Timer and pen is not included.

Cryptids TV is a party game where players draw imaginary creatures
based on a short description and a newspaper headline, and then, on a timer, present each other's creations as if they were show hosts on a TV show.

Can be combined with the material in CryptidsTV.
categories: Animals, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction, Word Game

name: Bird's Chess
description:
This game was invented by Henry Bird in 1874.

The game is played on a 10 by 8 board. Players have, in addition to the usual pieces, two additional pawns and an guard and equerry

The guard has the combined moves of rook and knight. The equerry has the combined moves of bishop and knight. Pawns can promote to queen, guard, equerry, bishop, rook, or knight

name: Contra
description:
An Othello variant. The players play on an orthogonal board. Also, the rules differ in that when opponent's stones are turned over, the line formed by your two stones may contain empty spaces as well.

White starts with one piece in the center. Then any space may be chosen. The board contains a 7 x 7 grid without the corners and the 2 spaces nearby, which gives 37 spaces for the 37 doublesided pieces.

name: Monopoly: Sydney Edition
description:
Sydney has its own version of Monopoly, launched on 31 October 2012! This edition features a locally inspired Chance and Community Chest deck and iconic playing pieces.

The game features 22 landmark Sydney sites selected by the public, with the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House sharing the top Mayfair position on the board.

The community chest features a $100 prize for best float in the Mardi Gras, but beware of the chance cards or you may find yourself with a $15 fine for travelling in the T3 lane of the Spit Bridge.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Winning Moves Australia Pty Ltd

name: Icarus Twins
description:
Icarus Twins is a futuristic, unmanned rocket race in which you attempt to out-distance your opponent within seven seconds without totally destroying your rocket.

Players take control of one of two different rockets: the Tiamat or the Fatboy. Each rocket uses a different press-your-luck dice mechanic that caters to different playing styles. Players who enjoy high risk and high rewards will feel at home with the Tiamat while players who like to calculate the optimal path to victory will enjoy piloting the Fatboy. During the game players will roll dice to increase the speed of their rockets, but pushing too hard may cause your rocket to disintegrate before the race ends.

The game uses a persistent ranking system and lifetime record cards to track each player's accomplishments between games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Abiegnus
description:
This Looney Pyramid game uses Volcano mechanics in an arrangment and manner inspired by Enochian Chess. Abiegnus is played on a 5x4 board that is set up to emulate the Tablet of Union from the system of angelic magic developed by Elizabethan adepts John Dee and Edward Kelly.

The name Abiegnus is from the mystical mountain of the Rosicrucian brotherhood.

Options and variants for this game include solitaire and competetive play, divination (fortune-telling), and different color schemes to support variant occult traditions.

name: 90's TV Trivia
description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1990's style TV, this retro quiz will take you back to the greatest days of television, featuring classics such as The Simpsons, Sex and The City, and Friends.

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Monopoly: Basel
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Basel, in Switzerland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Qube: Svenska språket
description: 500 questions about the Swedish language in 5 different categories, such as dialect & slang and funny synonym. Besides the cards with questions and answers the game also includes category cards to determine from which category questions are asked. All cards fit in the little cube shaped box.

name: Winnetou 1
description:
Objective: be the first moving all your (4) meeples into your target zone.
- moving by turns -
active player moves forward according die roll; ending on a space with clear text follow instructions printed on the board. Opponent's meeples may be sent back to starting position with a matching number.
remarks:
Illustrations are from the movie 'Winnetou 1' (Rialto/Jadran Farbfilm)
categories: American West, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Monopoly: Chelmsford
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Chelmsford, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Gruffalo Word Rhyming Game
description: A shedding game for young children themed around "The Gruffalo" by Julia Donaldson. Players attempt to get rid of all their cards by playing a card which rhymes. However since rhyming cards are the same colour younger children can match colour instead. The Mouse and Gruffalo cards allow players to play a non-rhyming card. Alos included is also a bonus set collection game called "There's no such thing as a Gruffalo" where players try to be the first to collect the animals from the story.

name: Die Pinguine aus Madagascar: Auf und Davon!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

You'll need both speed and a good memory to play Die Pinguine aus Madagascar: Auf und Davon! All the photographs of the penguins have been scattered, and only someone who is quick and can easily remember which cards he has in hand will manage to return the photos to the right order.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Marvel Avengers: Captain America vs. Loki
description:
Use up all your cards to win in an epic battle between Captain America and Loki.

There are 4 types of cards: Captain America cards and Loki cards are numbered 1-5, there are also switch cards and wild cards.

Players are dealt 5 cards and the first player selects a card to play, then players take turns playing 1 card. If a Captain America card was played previously, the next card played must be a Captain America card with a higher number. If a Loki card was played previously a Loki card with a lower number must be played. You can play a Loki card on a Captain America or vice versa if the numbers on both are the same.

A wild card can be played at any time. When a wild card is played that player plays a second card of their choice. The switch card can also be played at any time. This card changes play from Loki or Captain America to the opposite character. The next player may then play any value of the new character card.

If a player cannot play a card they draw a card. If the drawn card is playable it can be played otherwise it goes in the player's hand. The first player to play all their cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: What Would You Do for a Klondike Bar?
description:
What Would You Do for a Klondike Bar?, subtitled "The Original Game of Minor Skill and Major Will", transforms the advertising jingle for a frozen treat into a game that challenges players to do wacky and potentially embarrassing things.

On a turn, the active player rolls the challenge cube, then chooses one other player to participate in this challenge, which is a theatrical challenge (e.g., ask someone on a date while grunting like a caveman), a creativity challenge (e.g. think of a new use for bacon), or a speed challenge (e.g. write down three TV shows that start with your first initial). In the first case, the opponent acts, then the active player follows; in the other cases, players have thirty seconds to complete the challenge. In the speed challenges, the first player to complete the challenge wins, while in the others the remaining players vote on who completed the challenge in the best way. Ties are possible.

The player or players who win the challenge roll the flavor die once or twice, winning one of the six flavors of Klondike bars if they're lucky or stealing a flavor from someone else who is unlucky. The first player to collect all six types of bars wins.

name: Stromberg: Das große Bürostuhlrennen
description:
Stromberg: Das große Bürostuhlrennen (Stromberg: The great office chair race) is based on the German comedy series Stromberg and the corresponding movie.

In this mad race office chair right through the Capitol, the players, as Ernie, Tanya, Ulf & Co, race through the capitol. The reward is the parking space at D2. That means: step on the gas, and don't hesitate, even if the boss is in the way...

name: GeoPicnic
description:
GeoPicnic
Do you know what is the name of this province? And the name of the capital?
Have fun learning and practicing spanish geography. And win 10 Picnics (points) for each correct answer.

Includes 52 cards, a plastic sandwich box, and "Picnic" tickets.


GeoPicnic
¿Sabes cuál es esta provincia? ¿Y su capital? ¿Y la comunidad autónoma a la que pertenece?
Diviértete aprendiendo y practicando un poco de geografía de España. Y gana 10 Picnics (puntos) por cada respuesta acertada.

Incluye 52 cartas, sandwichera de plástico y pack de billetes Picnics.

name: Star Draft
description:
"Ships in space. Lots of them. There was peace, then shots were fired, and then there was war."
-Official statement, as provided by Anonymous Pilot-

Indeed, there was peace. But once a package is opened, up to 16 various Pilots (players) have stumbled into the growing conflict, and each turn shots are exchanged until only 1 leaves the battlefield alive.

Each package (the game comes in booster wrapping to provide a random drafting feel similar to various card game tournaments) includes the instructions and enough randomly assorted Pilot cards for a full game of 2-16 players (16 players means that each player only gets 1 Pilot for a game, but additional packs or fewer players allow for more Pilots per player.) The front of each card includes their ship name, their health/damage values, and up to 4 actions (1 on each card edge)that the played Pilot can choose to take for a turn.

Combat and damage plays out in a form similar to Rock, Paper, Scissors with a couple of twists. Each turn, all players play a Pilot card from their hand face-down, with the action of their choice being pointed towards the center of the group of players. The active player then chooses a target, and both of them flip over their Pilot cards and resolve the combat, the loser reducing and keeping track of their remaining health. If the targeted player has chosen a "Pass" action, then the target becomes the player in the direction of the Pass and they participate/resolve the combat instead. These steps continue until only one player has any Pilots remaining.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction

name: Donkey Racing
description:
The seaside would not be the seaside without donkeys on the beach! This wonderful game from the height of the Victorian era is full of superb graphics and of course is great fun to play as well. It will provide hours of fun as you learn the antics of the donkeys!

The game is spin/move. Players spin the indicator and may not move initially until they obtain a "donkey boy." Whenever a player spins a 6 or "donkey boy" they get another turn. Every few spaces there are different circumstances to overcome on the game board. To end the game a player must spin the exact amount of spaces necessary to move to the finish line.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mad Science 101
description:
Mad science is just like any other kind of totally legitimate field of study. Before students can get to work on their grand schemes, unholy abominations, and giant fighting death robots, they have to get through freshman year.

Mad Science 101 is a game of combining contraptions where each player tries to expand their masterpiece, sabotage their opponents, and complete their mad professor's mad assignments. The first to finish three assignments passes the class and wins the game!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement
publishers: Black Tie Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Scouty: ErdBär und RäuBär
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the dice game Scouty: ErdBär und RäuBär, each bear has his favorite dish, with Erdbär loving strawberries, for example, while the polar bear thinks ice cream is the best. The robber bear, however, just wants to cause mischief, so while searching for bears and their treats, you need to be sure not to catch the robber.

name: Dynasty
description: A card and board game based on trump taking. The cards are comprised of six suits. When the game begins all suits are of equal value. The player who lays out the highest number takes the hand and then moves their pawn one space forward on the game board. Every fifth or so space is marked "Dynasty" and a player landing on this space may select one of the trump tokens to place at the lowest possible space on the "trump track", in the center of the board. As the suits are added to the track, the order in which suits may trump each other follows. For instance, the first placed (and therefore lowest on the track) suit is jesters. Jesters can trump all cards. The next placed suit (set above jesters on the track) is kings. Jesters will still trump all cards but kings, kings trump all cards. If a player lands on a "dynasty" spot and all six suits have been set, they may swap two suits. Game ends when one player has traversed the entire board.

name: Pick Nick!
description:
In Pick Nick, each player has two or three insects that they want to move out of the garden to safety. Nick the bird, however, has other plans and will peck at exposed insects to send them scurrying back to the starting line.

To set up, players takes two insects for a short game and three for a longer game; place the leaves into their holders and set them next to the game board so that they cover certain spaces. On a turn, a player rolls the die, then adds one of his insects to the movement track. Once all of a player's insects are on the track, he moves any one of his choice on his turn based on the die roll. If he rolls Nick, he makes the bird pick up one of the insect tokens with his beak, ideally catching one of the opponents! That player must start over with that token. Whoever reaches the end of the track with all of his insects first wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Racing

name: I Spy Puppy World
description: Players race against time to find the objects cleverly hidden in colourful illustrations that match the pictures on each card drawn. The player who collects the most cards is the winner. The game includes 6 game boards and 50 different object cards.

name: Yo' Bro
description:
The game of smarm, swag, and popped collars.

You are a freshman in college. You want to get into the most Bro fraternity on campus, but how can you show up the other pledges?

Popped collars bro. Be the first person to sport a killer ten layered pop collars, and they'll have to let you into the fraternity over the other posers!

When you start the game draw five cards. On your turn you draw one card. You then can play one card, or attack once per turn.

You have slots for two hands, one chest, one head and your feet, and can accessorize each of those items. That's 5 slots. You can not wear more accessories then you have slots, unless a card says otherwise.

You win the game when you have 10 popped collars worn.

name: Monopoly: Wolverhampton
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Wolverhampton, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Liar Kingdom
description:
Translated from description on publisher's website.

This is Liar Kingdom. Funny people lie for the good of the kingdom, but the poor citizens despise them for their lies. YOU are the authority of darkness, dominate in the shadows of this crazy kingdom. Even the king is afraid of you. Nobles and slaves alike will die not even know your existence. You are invincible and your power is absolute, but one question has been asked that might change the kingdom's fate:
"Who among the kingdom's people has the most power?"
Using only three cards and three "declaration chips," play a game to earn victory points faster than your opponents.

Each player plays one of their three cards face down and one of their three chips face up on top of the card. The face up chip can be the true identity of their played card or a lie to try to trick the other players into believing what they are playing. There is an optional round where players can change the chip on their card to a different one. Then the cards are revealed and the way they interact decides who won the round and receives VP. Also, if you were lying or telling the truth with your chip determines if you receive or lose additional VP.

Designer's summary:
暗殺者、王様、奴隷のカードを１枚ずつ持ってゲームをします。プレイヤーは順番に手番を行います。自分の出すカードがどれかをチップを出して宣言する。任意のカードを裏向きで出す。全員がそれを行ったら勝敗の判定を行います。自分の出したカードが次のとおりだった場合、勝利します。暗殺者を出して王様がいた場合、それを１人敗北させて勝利します。王様を出して自分を殺す暗殺者がいなかった場合、奴隷を全員敗北させて勝利します。奴隷を出して王様がいなかった場合に勝利します。勝利したプレイヤーは得点を獲得します。勝利しなかったプレイヤーは全員敗北。宣言と異なるカードを出していたプレイヤーはマイナス点を獲得します。誰かが８点以上を獲得するとゲーム終了。得点の高いプレイヤーの勝利です。

Each player has 3 cards and 3 tokens, each of which represents Royalty, Assassin, and Slave. Starting player declares a card he will be playing by placing corresponding token face-up, then plays one card face-down. He may lie about the card he's playing. Then next player does the same, and so on. When all players are done, reveal all cards they played and resolve the outcome. If one or more Royalties are in play, each Assassin in play kills one of them. Successful Assassins win the round. After the assassination, if one or more Royalties are still in play, survived Royalties win the round, otherwise all Slaves win the round. Winners get points, and players who have lied and still didn't win the round lose points. A game ends when a player gains total of 8 points. A player with the most points wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Bunnings Warehouse 2007 Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bunnings, a company in Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Boardcraft
description:
Boardcraft is a modular board building and manipulation game. Set in an eclectic fantasy world, players build a board during the game, but can also change the board throughout the game. The board is consisted of 3x3 tiles with a random assortment of different terrains on them, including grass, water, marsh, boulder and lava.

Each player can also change the board in unique ways by swapping tiles, removing tiles or rotating tiles. This is most important because there are lava squares and players always need to be aware of how those tiles can change and move so they don't end up in lava and die.

There are also items to take including Weapons, Armor, Potions and Boardcrafting cards. On a turn, a player can make an attack, pick up an item, as well as play a "Genesis action" which means they can add a tile to the board.

The goal is to collect achievement points by completely missions and killing other players. Missions are randomly distributed and might be anything from collecting items, to performing in game actions such as pushing someone into water.

Players can play in teams or free-for-all in completely new environments each game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Härjapõlvlaste Riid
description:
Härjapõlvlaste Riid (Quarrel of the Leprechauns) is based on an Estonian fairytale.

There are berry-cards with values 1-10, the Leprechauns with values 1-10 and some special cards in this game.
Also a die that shows how many cards player must draw before the round.

In her turn player plays a card on the table. The next player must play card with higher value on that card.
If a stronger leprechaun was played on the berry, he eats it and all cards played in this round are discarded. Then a new round starts.
If a player can´t play a suitable card he must pick up all cards from the table and a new round starts.

The objective is to get rid of all cards first.

name: Circus Express
description:
Let's take a ride on Circus Express, the first circus on rails! But... what happened? Who mixed all the coaches?

In Circus Express, players play tiles from their hand to try to build the same pattern on their hand and on the table. The first player that builds the right train is the winner!

name: Flatten out Monsters
description:
Monsters invade! Heroes are ready to defend in groups of two, but these heroes are out of control and need an intelligent leader to lead them to victory. Can you do it?

Flatten out Monsters is a new type of memory game in which you need to memorize only six cards! Can you effectively lead the heroes and flatten out the monsters?

To set up, monster cards are placed in a 3x7 grid and double-sided hero cards are placed in a 3x2 grid in front of the monsters. Heroes in the same line — that is, a line of two hero cards — will fight the seven monsters lined in front of them. On a player's turn, he must swap two hero cards, then flip them to the reverse sides. These two cards activate the cards in the same line with them and become the attacking groups, then you resolve the attack on the monsters one by one in each activated line. If the two hero cards show the icons needed to defeat the first monster in line, they win the fight and score the monster card. Then they fight against the second monster, and so on until they fail. Play continues in clockwise order until at least two lines of monsters are all defeated, and whoever has the most monster cards wins!

name: Relic Knights: Princess Malya
description:
Heir to the throne of Ulyxis, Princess Malya speeds across the galaxy searching for an end to the Darkspace Calamity. Her cypher, Mr. Tomn, guides her along her path, offering only cryptic clues and riddles about their final destination.

Gifted with rare and mighty gifts, Relic Knights are the ultimate leaders for your cadres. More than just powerful game piece, these stunning models are beautiful centerpieces for your miniature collection!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Ultimate Brain Challenge
description:
In the Ultimate Brain Challenge you'll need to muster all your mental dexterity to solve riddles, brainteasers, and conundrums. The game includes challenging categories such as Brain Bending Conundrums, IQ Squares, Picture Problems, and Word Mixers.

The goal is to be the first player or team to pass 10 challenges. There is a time limit of 4 minutes per card challenge, but a shorter time limit can be set for faster game play.

name: Die Montagsmaler
description:
This game is based on a German TV game show.

The game is played in 2 teams.
On teams turn one member is chosen.

He looks on a card what he has to draw. His team members try to name the Thing as fast as possible. If this is right the drawer takes the next card and starts drawing this.
This continues till the time has gone (hourglass finished).
Each card gives 1 Point and the other team, makes the same with new cards.

The game ends after each Player was the drawer.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Desafio Everest
description: It's a fight to reach the summit faster than the other player! The spinner determines the colour of the holes you can use to attach your climbers' limbs each turn. The more risky movements you made, leaving limbs unsecured, the quicker you'll ascend, but also, the easier the other player would make you fall if he lands in the same spot from the other side and kicks you out of the hole. The first player to take his two climbers to the summit, wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Toronto Maple Leafs
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Toronto Maple Leafs, an ice hockey club.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Game Without Decency
description:
Draw and read a scenario card out loud. Players each select the cards from their hands that they think will win them the round. The person that read the scenario picks her favorite card for the scenario. The person that was picked gets a point and reads the next scenario card.

The player with the most points (White Cards) at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Invizimals Desafío X-Tractor
description:
Become a member of the Alliance of Hunters, travels the Invizmals world and capture the most powerful ones, train them and make them evolve to fight the X-Tractor commander ... but beware, the journey is full of dangers.

A game based on the Invizimal license from Sony where the players has to stop the invasion of their world capturing Invizimals and fighting with them again the X-Tractors using their power dice and cards. Combats can be made too using an specific App.
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Yaochu!
description:
User summary:
ヤオチュー! (Yaochu!) is a simplified Mahjong card game using only Ones, Nines, and Honour tiles to form an 8-card hand. Each player has 25 points at the start to take from each other. The game ends when all the players have taken turns to be the dealer twice or when a player's score drops to 0 points or below.

Publisher summary:
一九字牌だけの麻雀カードゲームです。
8枚のカードを揃える簡易版の麻雀カードゲームです。
それぞれ25点の点数を持って、点数を取り合います。
親が2周するか、誰かの点数が0未満になると終了です。

name: Corsica (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these. There are hikes and flights in addition to the train rides.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets. There are also facilities to gain double points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Where's Wally? The Board Game
description: Finding Wally is never child's play but it's even trickier when there's a board made up of four movable sections and a ticking timer to battle against! If you know a fan of the red and white jumper-wearing character, then they'll love the chance to show their stripes in this exciting fast and furious search and find game where they'll say goodbye to school holiday boredom and so long to rainy day blues. Great for girls and boys alike aged seven upwards (and fun-loving grown-ups too!), the Where's Wally? Board Game is a race against time where being eagle-eyed and speedy is a winning combination! Players must find the picture on the board which matches the picture on their card. It might sound simple but try doing that when the sections of the board have been rearranged and there's a constant tick telling you that time is running out. The aim of the game is to be the fastest player to find and cover Where's Wally? pictures on the board with a Wally token. The next player tries to do the same and so the game continues until the timer stops. A card with a number '2' on it means double the challenge - you have to match the picture on your card to the picture on the board twice before play moves on. And if you collect a card with an 'R' on it, the direction of play is reversed and the four sections of the Where's Wally? board must be rearranged too. Simply super stripy fun for Where's Wally? fans who like a challenge!

name: DDR-Spiel
description: Small quiz game about DDR. The game is just deck of 54 question cards. In every card there is 3 multiple choice questions with 4 choices. On the other side of every card there are answers to questions and small explanations. The game does not include rules how to count points.

name: Bluffing Fighter
description: In Bluffing Fighter, the player superheroes compete against one another to see who outlast everyone else.

name: Minions
description:
32 cards, four of each family (color) that make it possible to play two games:

Action Game:

The object of this game is to get rid of all your cards as soon as possible. Each player gets 5 cards and the rest go in a pile face-down with 1 card turn up next to it. In a player turn he must play a card with the same colour, number or symbol as the face-up next to the draw pile. When a card with a symbol it's played, the action related to that symbol must be performed. Then the next player goes.
When no card can be played, the player must take the top card from the face-down pile. If that card matches it can be played, if not the turn moves for the next player.
You win if get rid of all your cards.

Family Game:

The object of the game is to get the most families of minions you can (4 of each colour makes a family). One player ask for a type of card to any other player. If he can form a family he displays it in front of it and can continue until one player can group all the families he has in his hand at any given moment.
If a player asks a card and the other player does not have it that player's turn ends.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cards Against IT
description:
Cards Against IT is a fan-made version of Cards Against Humanity that is designed for Information Technology Professionals. Like the regular game, a player selects a red card with fill-in-the-blank text and each player selects one of their white cards to try and find the funniest result. The person playing the red card chooses the funniest response.

The game can be played independently or integrated with Cards Against Humanity. Unlike the original game, the humor is very tame in nature and is designed to be Safe for Work so it could be played in the office. The cards all relate to funny situations that people who work in Help Desks or other IT fields might encounter.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Big Brain Academy Tangram
description: Tangram Puzzel for 1-4 players. Who has most brains? Think to become fit! This tangram puzzel exist out of 7 tangram pieces, who need to be used to create pre-defined figures within a time-limit. When time is up, it's the other player's turn.

name: Jippijaja Quiz: Original
description: Jippijaja Quiz is a party game with 550 questions about sport, fashion, music, history, movies and more.

name: Let's Go Digging
description:
Players are archaeologists digging in rural areas and working together to unearth artifacts from different historical periods.

A dig area is formed in the center of the table by creating a tableau of face-down cards in 4 rows of 6 overlapping cards. Only the top card of each row is available for play action. Players are then dealt a hand of action cards that allow them to move cards in the tableau, search the dig field, dig in one column of the field, or transfer cards to the collection site (in a separate area). "No Trespassing" cards will block digging in a particular column and force a player to play a (limited quantity) "Permit" card in order to access any artifacts locked above that card.

The game ends when the 15th artifact or dirt sample card has been moved to the Collection Site or when players are blocked from moving any more cards. Players count how many complete collections (groups of 3 cards representing the same historical period)they have managed to gather.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: なないろのおと (Nanairo no Oto)
description:
In Prismatic Note, players move around seven piles of colorful musical notes, trying to be the first to collect all seven colors.

A player's turn consists of moving to a new space, and using a "spell" card to activate one or more piles, giving the players on those piles a card. Duplicate colors cancel each other out. The game ends when one player has exactly seven colors.

name: Angry Birds Go! Jenga: Trophy Cup Challenge
description:
The popular Angry Birds app comes to life in this epic Trophy Cup Challenge Game! Can you triumph in this fast-crashing game? You've only got 1 bird to take down the 3 pigs, and you've got to topple the egg-shaped trophy to take down the piggies on their perches! Load your kart and target the pigs just right with your launcher. When you topple the trophy you'll become the feather-flying champion of the Trophy Cup Challenge Game!

Trophy Cup Challenge Game challenges you to take out a Jenga trophy with your bird and launcher
Game includes 3 pigs. Topple the trophy for the Angry Birds win.

Game includes kart, bird, 3 pigs, launcher, ramp, base, trophy, winged block, 7 blocks, crown topper and instructions.

This is part of the Angry Birds Series
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Joudo-Sugoroku
description:
User summary:
浄土双六 (Joudo-Sugoroku) is a traditional Japanese game originally produced during the Muromachi period (1336 to 1573) and later developed into Tobi-Sugoroku in the Edo Period (1603 to 1868). As with the later Tobi-Sugoroku (and Mawari-Sugoroku), the original designers' and illustrators' names are lost to history.

Joudo-Sugoroku is themed on the Buddhist tradition of re-incarnation. Joudo means 'The Pure Land', that is the celestial realm or pure abode of a Buddha. The players are human souls, wandering through the many Hells, gradually gaining enlightenment through training and meditation, to finally ascend to the Pure Land.

Game-play is based upon the text in the squares on the scroll. The players roll dice (labelled in Chinese text for the numbers 1 to 6) and move as instructed, so a player does not move from one square to an adjacent one, but instead jumps across the network. (Sugoroku means literally 'double-six').

An edition has been produced by 望月哲史 (Satoshi Mochizuki) for Plenluno (プレンルーノ) and uses the classic artwork and language of the "Sugoroku Ruiju" game held in the collection of the National Museum of Japan in Tokyo, but also updated into modern language. The game is produced as a large sheet poster, with additional playing pieces, and is available at Spiel 2016.

The game is played by 1 to 8 players, aged from 5+ years and takes around 20 minutes to finish. It's a roll-and-move racing game using dice, with mythological and educational themes.

Game description from the publisher:
江戸時代に遊ばれていた「飛び双六」の現代語訳版です。
日本の東京国立博物館に収蔵されている「双六類聚」を現代語に翻訳しました。
人間界から出発し、地獄を巡り、修業をして悟りを開き、仏になることを目指す双六です。
江戸時代、お寺などで遊ばれていた双六です。
400年以上前のものの復刻版です。
盤面は仏教の死後の世界を表しています。
地獄をさまよったり、修行や瞑想をしたりして、悟りを開いて仏を目指します。
輪廻転生を繰り返し、仏を目指しましょう。
categories: Educational, Mythology, Party Game, Racing, Religious

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Family Expansion #1
description:
Description from the publisher:

Did your family play the heck out of the Watch Ya’ Mouth base game, so your kids recite our funny phrases by heart? No problem! Watch Ya Mouth Family Expansion Pack #1 replenishes your repertoire with plenty of fresh phrases for extended kid-friendly gameplay.

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
A belligerent bison is on the boardwalk!
Mother baboon and her fluffy babies.
Playful porpoises surfing waves.
Watch Ya Mouth Family Expansion Pack #1 comes with 155 family-safe, family-fun phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of sticky-fingered quality time.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Poteau Rentrant
description: Poteau Rentrant is the second expansion for Blanc Manger Coco. It contains 40 question cards and 160 answer cards.

name: Lecker Mammut!
description:
It's time to hunt lots of delicious mammoth to prove which primeval genes still reside in us. Are we descendants of a legendary chieftain, or were our ancestors simply common members of the tribe? Whenever prey appears, you need to tighten your grip on the club because morality is known only after eating, and a catch is never fully safe from the greedy fingers of the other tribes.

All the cards in Lecker Mammut! are distributed evenly among the players, who stack them face down before them. The starting player of the round begins revealing cards from their stack one by one face up in the middle of the table. As soon as three of the same animals are revealed or three animals of any type in front of the same background, players must race to hit them, with the fastest hunter collecting all cards that match and placing them face up in front of them. As the round proceeds, players accumulate several piles of prey in front of themselves, scoring one point for each prey card when the round ends. After as many rounds as players, whoever has the most points wins!

name: What The F*ck: I Never Have
description:
Description from the publisher:

Hours of outrageous fun! The classic ?I Never Have? game with 552 What the F*ck? styled statements. Get your friends to admit the most f*cked up things they have ever done! When you believe players are not admitting to something f*cked up that you know they've done, you get to coerce them into taking their drinks. For 3 or more players.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Canada 2017 (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are also choice cards which may help or hinder you.

There are 9 challenges which can give you extra points if you complete a particular tour.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: add two routes together: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Would You Rather...? Kinda Clean Party Edition
description:
Would You Rather…? Kinda Clean Party Edition is the game of crazy choices and demented dilemmas! Your goal is to figure out which dilemma the other players would rather do. There are two ways to play: Classic Dilemmas give you two outrageous options to choose from, and Fill-in-the-Blank Dilemmas have missing words that you provide. Once the group has revealed their choice, turn over your previously selected Voting Token to see if you matched. With over 1000 dilemmas to choose, Would You Rather…? Kinda Clean Party Edition is where outrageous choices are all part of the game.

FEATURES
Fill in the blank, you pick the words. Expect the unexpected.
A or B dilemma cards offer two different options to choose from.
Over 1000 dilemmas! Outrageous choices are all part of the game!

name: Tipsy Tower
description:
Description from the publisher:

The classic block stacking game with an alcoholic twist. 54 blocks in total, each block has 1 of 36 different rules and games written on the bottom. Attempt to pull a block from the tower without knocking it over, then play the game or follow the rule described on the bottom of the block. Included are the classics: story time, moose, make a rule. In combination with some newer rules: god, most likely to, nicknames. 36 different rules and games in all. Will you be the last one standing?
publishers: Game Factory Europe AB, Should We Drink Tonight

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Family Expansion #2
description:
Description from the publisher:

Did your family play the heck out of the Watch Ya’ Mouth base game, so your kids recite our funny phrases by heart? No problem! Watch Ya Mouth Family Expansion Pack #2 replenishes your repertoire with plenty of fresh phrases for extended kid-friendly gameplay.

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
A belligerent bison is on the boardwalk!
Mother baboon and her fluffy babies.
Playful porpoises surfing waves.
Watch Ya Mouth Family Expansion Pack #1 comes with 155 family-safe, family-fun phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of sticky-fingered quality time.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Get Reelz: R-Rated Expansion Pack
description: This expansion to the original movie-themed party game offers 20 new 'R-Rated" cards (160 words) to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Fly (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Fly can fly from any position to land on any bug that that your opponent placed.moved or f lipped on
their last turn. This includes bugs on top of a stack. It then
moves one space down into
an empty adjacent space at ground level.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Torschuss-Panik!
description:
Left right forward, another goal!
Who will be the first to dribble his balls forward
and to reach the hoped for goals? .. Beware of the opponents,
who stop the run by a nasty foul play ..

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!
Game play: The running coasters are mixed well and then placed in any arrangement as a large playing soccer-field (always edge to edge, as a grid). The start- and goal-coaster should be layed out to the two ends of the soccer-field. Every player chooses his color and put his 3 balls onto the start coaster. The players has to roll a dice and move their balls into the goal. Each time the ball reaches a new field, the player has again 3 attempts with the dice. Note: Players on one same field can be tackled (foul-play) and the playing fields with the number 1 gives the chance to score with a fast 11-Meter-Tor (goal). The first player who has moved all their own balls into the goal, wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)




Links rechts vor, noch ein Tor!
Wer schafft es als Erster alle seine Bälle nach vorne zu dribbeln
und die erhofften Tore zu erzielen? .. Vorsicht vor den Gegenspielern,
die durch ein fieses Foulspiel den Lauf aufhalten wollen ..

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: Die Lauffelder werden gut gemischt und dann in beliebiger Anordnung als große Spielfläche (immer Kante an Kante, als Raster) ausgelegt. Das Start- und Torfeld werden dann an beiden Enden der Spielfläche passend angelegt. Jeder Spieler wählt eine Spielerfarbe und legt seine 3 Bälle auf das Startfeld. Die Spieler müssen einen Würfel werfen und ihre Bälle ins Tor bekommen. Jedes Mal, wenn der Ball ein neues Feld erreicht, hat der Spieler erneut 3 Versuche mit dem Würfel. Hinweis: Spieler auf einem Feld können sich foulen und die Spielfelder mit der Zahl 1 können ein schnelles 11-Meter-Tor ermöglichen. Der erste Spieler, der alle Bälle im Tor hat, gewinnt.

name: Dicey Peaks: The Yeti
description: The Yeti is a constant threat while climbing Yeti Mountain. With the Dicey Peaks: The Yeti, this promotional monster can threaten the safety and very sanity of opponents as you conquer the mountain.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Plop: Het Kabouterbos
description:
Based on a popular Belgian TV-show (Kabouter Plop), Plop Het Kabouterbos is a game where players choose a character from the show and try to make a path from the forest to their homes. The first player to reach his home is the winner.

Each turn, players pick a card which can be:


a piece of road (to complete the player's own path or to mess up the competitor's path)
a shovel to remove a card from the board
a picknick basket (pass one turn)
a gnome cap (allows the player to move)


—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Do not Short Circuit!
description: A logical game that teaches the basics of electrical engineering. Repair the device by restoring the maximum number of electrical circuits and lighting the bulbs and LEDs. Use resistors, transistors and diodes to get the maximum benefit. Skill up your electrician's experience to the maximum and win! The main thing is not to short circuit!
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Kroko Dinner
description:
Kroko Dinner! Who can collect the fish quickest with the crocodile mask?

Description provided by publisher

name: Angry Birds: Power Cards
description:
Angry Birds: Power Cards starts out like a game of Top Trumps however the player is also building a structure with cards they win and then need to find a pig to launch at.

To build structures: When a player wins a card they can build a structure with the card they won. Building supplies are wood, ice and stone, and your entire structure needs to be the same materiel.

Slingshot round: After a pig has been added to a players structure, players read out the slingshot value on their cards and see who wins.

Last player with cards wins.

name: Bull Shit
description:
Bull Shit is an incredibly exciting party game for 2 to 6 players.

Be the first to get rid of your seven cards by performing the commands dictated by the surprising 8-sided dice. Challenge your friends, match your bluffing skills to perfect timing and a healthy dose of luck, and who knows, you could be the new bullshitt(ing) champion!

—description from the publisher

name: Tark Naine Taskus
description:
Tark Naine Taskus is similar to Tark Mees Taskus but instead of categories there are different word games on one side of the cards and letters on another side.
E.g. players must form sentences where all words start with the same letter from the top card or make a poem where each verse start with the same letter.
For some cards need you to be the quickest, other cards need creativity.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game

name: Superfight: The Walking Dead – Negan Mini-Deck
description:
Welcome to pee pee pants city! This 18 card mini expansion for Superfight adds new cards from the Walking Dead comics, with a focus on Negan and his very special lady.

Included in The MegaBox subscription service.

—description from the publisher

name: CATAiN: The Most Longest Unco
description:
CATAiN is a Japanese parody of Settlers of Catan. The goal is simple. Only you can create the world's longest poop (unco)!

Roll dice to collect food resources (Meat, Vegetable, Fruit, Potato, and Milk) and use those to deposit poop logs on the intestinal wall tiles. Single poops, double poops, thick poops! The world is your poop oyster!

After a modular number of defecations (excretion timing in Japanese parlance), a winner will be decided by the longest deuce passed during the game.

Use action cards, enemas (GANCHO!), and laxatives to alter the board and pace of the game.

As Crap Games so eloquently said during the game's debut, "Aim for the Asshole!" Can you make the World's Longest Poop!?

—description from the Publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Polarich
description:
Stay Calm, Act Fast!

Everyone hides one or more white cubes and shows them all at once.
You must add up the number of cubes and immediately take one of the three figurines!

In Polarich, you add up the number of cubes revealed from the cup and race to take the corresponding Polar figurine. Not only competing by speed, you can also have a bit of strategy by changing the number of cubes you hide.

Everyone receives a cup and some cubes. 3 figurines (Penguin, Inuit, Polar Bear) are placed at the center of the table. Each player hides one or more cubes in the cup and turns the cup down on a table. All cups are lifted at once.

As soon as hidden cubes are revealed, players add up the number of the cubes on the table, and get one of the three figurines corresponding to the sum of the cubes by putting their cups over that figurine.

The player who got the correct figurine first receives gems. When you’ve collected 5 gems, you win and the game ends.

The game varies by the number of players; how many cubes players get, the sum for the figurines, the gems received. There are also penalties if you claim the wrong figurine.

ポラリッチは、カップから現れたキューブの数を合計して、合計値に応じて決められたコマを早取りするゲームです。単にアクションの速さを競うだけでなく、自分が隠すキューブの数を変えることによって少しだけ戦略も立てられます。

それぞれ、カップといくつかのキューブを持ちます。3つのコマ（ペンギン、イヌイット、シロクマ）を机の真ん中に並べます。
各プレイヤーは一個以上のキューブをカップに隠し、カップを机に伏せます。
みんなで一斉にカップを持ち上げて隠れていたキューブが見えたら、素早くキューブの個数を足し算して合計を出します。合計に応じて決まっているコマをいち早くカップで取った人が宝石をもらいます。

誰かが5個以上の宝石を集めたら、その人の勝ちでゲームは終わりです。

-description from designer

name: Rush to Flush
description:
Card game where players are trying to complete a Royal Flush (A, K, Q, J, 10 all in same suit.

Players are dealt seven cards. On each turn players first draw from the to of the draw pile or discard pile. Then player discards one card to the discard pile. If card is an action card then you follow instructions of the card. As soon as player acquires a Royal Flush (regardless if it is their turn) they take a chip for the suit in which they have a Royal Flush. Play continues until all chips have been claimed. Winner is the one with the most chips.

—user summary

name: Air Bears
description:
If you are in luck and plan your flights well in Urlaubär: Inselrennen, you can get your bears to their holiday destination first and win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Penny Soccer
description:
The object of the game is to score a goal by flicking a penny into the small hole located at your opponent's end.

You must play the angles and work around your opponent's men (fixed pegs in the board). You must control your speed too, because if hit too hard it may bounce back and give your opponent an easy shot.

name: Hypothetically Fun
description:
It’s like an icebreaker married a flamethrower! Hypothetically Fun is a game of open-ended and discussion-provoking questions spanning five different topics and 350 cards.

Rules and more available: https://breakinggames.com/products/hypothetically-fun

name: Hard West: The Board Game
description:
It's a horror strategy game settled in the old wild west. In a world where everyone is hostile and making allies is not easy. Luckily there are still some people eager to join your cause. Doesn't mean really that they're good folks. They just have their own business too. You and your team of gunslingers will struggle in intense gunfights obtaining own goals. The world of Hard West is full of bandits, demons and other supernatural beings.

This is a game that requires strategic thinking, clever planning, and exemplary execution to succeed. To triumph, players must explore dangerous locations, discover and defeat enemies, and collect equipment and treasures. Hard West is a board game that can support between 2-6 players. Is a great social game that's quite easy to learn but really quite difficult to master. You'll be surprised to see how your friends around the table can easily pick up the rules.

Day or night? Our cardboard platform has been designed to meet all your requirements. Each site has been adjusted to various scenarios that we have prepared just for you. So what? Western or horror? The choice is yours. There are 12 different figures for a base version of the game. Each has own distinguished features. Players can choose between cowboys, adventurers and demons. Each character has set of special forces and abilities. Inside the box you will find more than 50 special cards that are insane game changers. Many of them work as a unique ability that allow you to take action in form of response on your opponents turn what makes it hard and unpredictable.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Galactic Keep Solitaire Warrior
description:
Visit the outer rim of a dark sci-fi world in Galactic Keep Solitaire Warrior, a quick, simple, solo card battling game.

Set out a grid of nine cards in three rows of three, flip a card to reveal your warrior. Overtake as many other cards as you can in attack-vs-health battles, or choose to attack your warrior with a face-down card to strategically gain the most points you can. Heal your warrior with the "Healing Nanobots" card (once) and watch out for plague cards which instantly kill your warrior, granting you no points. Clear the deck and rack up the highest score you can!

FUN FACT: In the GALACTIC KEEP UNIVERSE, the name of this popular battle solitaire game is commonly translated as "Death Rise" or "Death Toll" from the native Pakall name for the game, "Fher’Bek"!

The game is comprised of a 35-Card SOLITAIRE WARRIOR deck with 31 WARRIOR cards, 3 PLAGUE cards, and 1 FULL HEAL card (plus 1 RULE card). Also included in the game are 4 six-sided dice that can be used to track the remaining health of damaged warriors.

—description from the designer

name: Autocomplete: The Game
description:
Based on the hugely popular web game "Google Feud" and jam-packed with the strangest internet searches known to man, Autocomplete: The Game is an autocorrect guessing game that will keep players on their toes. Featuring multiple gameplay options and 300 prompts — from "My dog ate..." to "Can you 3D print a..." — teams have one minute to correctly complete the top ten internet searches for any given prompt. Packaged with a 60-second timer, this game has all the necessary ingredients for a rambunctious family night or a lively party with friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Venture Capital
description:
Venture Capital is a 15 minute bidding game for 2-6 players, with an additional solitaire mode. The game is played over 15 rounds: each round, all players bid on a given startup, and once all 15 startups have been acquired, the game ends. Whoever has built the most profitable portfolio is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Escapoly
description:
It is an Escape Room Game. A clown, a serial killer, has to be caught, else he will kill girls. He sends you a letter to reach his den but you have only one hour.
The game is divided in two parts, in the first (optional) a master hides in a room some clues. When all clues are found the second part starts. It is a classic escape room game with riddles. A website is present to validate your response. You have one hour to solve all riddles, plus you will have points if you finish before and if you do few errors in riddles solution.
In Escapoly there are three adventures independent each other. Game isn't legacy and material is reusable.

—user summary

name: The Chicken or the Egg? Game
description:
Sushi or caviar? Spaghetti or meatballs? This fun and fast game answers the age-old questions of “which came first”? Each of the cards not only poses the face-off questions but also give a quick history of the answer. Smart and funny, this game will add laughs and some knowledge to your next game night.

—description from the publisher

name: Lélekpillangó
description:
What better adventure than getting to know ourselves and our fellow players? What makes the other happy, what makes him happy?
During the Spirit Butterfly board game, players try to figure out which of their players to choose from. The Soul Butterfly will test how deeply we know others and ourselves. With its unique, special beauty cards and situational situations, it offers many gaming surprises to newcomers to the world of board games.

There are two ways to play the game. Basic game and situational game version.
For the base game, the board must be placed on the A side. Each player chooses one color and receives the corresponding tip puck and puppet. The starting player receives a gray marker card and one of each player's suit. The butterfly card 60 and the gift card 21 must be shuffled and placed face down on the board. This will be the draw deck.
The dealer draws one less card than the number of players and puts it face up. Place at least one face down card on each card. You can also use gray for a card you think is not close to any player. The players then try to guess which card the dealer intended for them by using the tip disc. Depending on how confident you are with one or two point sides. Then the markers turn and the evaluation follows. For correct tips, the player's dummy moves on the scoring bar to score points.
In the situation version, if the dealer is on a situation field, you will have to draw two situation cards and read one of them. You will need to place your marker cards accordingly. The dealer on the smiley field acts according to the basic game. While a player on the doubling field will score all points, but in the case of a dealer, the player can decide whether to play the turn normally or draw from the situation cards.
The winner of the game is the one whose puppy crosses the finish line first or moves to that field.

name: Cookie Crumble
description:
Fast grabbin' cookie making fun!

Be the first to make your cookies in this silly game of cookie makin' fun. Grab the ingredients you need to make your cookies. Collect sugar, flour, butter, eggs, and your cookie flavoring to win the game. But watch out for the rotten egg - he ruins the whole batch of cookies and you have to start again!

—description from the publisher

Each player receives one of eight recipe card which details their personal goal for the game. A recipe card has the name of the recipe (e.g. Oatmeal Raisin Cookies) and five ingredients the player will be searching for (e.g. sugar, flour, oatmeal & raisins, butter, and eggs). The deck of 36 ingredient cards is shuffled and placed face-down in the middle of the play area, where it's scattered to make all cards accessible.

Play is simple and chaotic. Players grab at cards, one at a time, from the center and look at them. If they need the card, they keep it. If they don't, they put it back.

Among the cards are four "rotten egg" cards. If a player draws a rotten egg, play temporarily stops while the player who drew it mixes all their collected ingredients back into the center. Once done, play resumes as normal.

This continues until one player has collected all five ingredients.

—user summary

name: Flowers Over Towers
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Flowers over Towers, the city has been abandoned, and you, as nature, are retaking the towers with your flowers. In this competitive area control game, players attempt to have the majority number of flowers in each tower, so they can claim it as their own. However, instead of rolling all the dice each turn, only the dice that were used get rolled, leaving the unused dice as they are for the next player.

On your turn:

Roll the dice that were used last turn,
Pick two dice,
And then put a flower on the tower which is equal to the sum,
Fill two river spaces that are not next to the same building,
Or crumble the top space of a tower you have a flower in.
Will you try to claim a tower for valuable points, with the downside that it grants one of your opponents two flowers to place? Or will you try to flood the river, which causes the game to change and reward the player who has claimed most of tower eight with a win? Simple mechanics lead to some tough decisions in this quick game.

Flowers over Towers requires three standard six-sided dice; having differently colored pens for each player is recommended. Components include one shared sheet per game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Map Reduction, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Kaptein Sabeltann: Sjørøverspillet
description:
Compete with the other pirates (and Captain Sabretooth) to find and captures the most diamonds.

Each player rolls a dice and moves the pirate ship the corresponding number of spaces. You can steal from another pirate, forfeit your turn, or go hunting for a chest full of diamonds.

When hunting for diamonds, the player draws a treasure map. The map contains the number of diamonds the player must randomly choose from a treasure chest filled with diamonds in different colors. The treasure map also shows which diamond Captain Sabretooth will steal from you.

The pirate with most diamonds in the end, wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Robin Hood: Legends
description:
Robin Hood: Legends adds a campaign mode to Robin Hood: Hero of the People.

Played over 6 stories or legends, you recruit your merry men, rob from the rich to give to the poor and fight the Sheriff and his guards.
