Each legend has it's own victory condition, however, failure to complete a legend doesn't eliminate you from the game.

Can you play through each legend to beat the Sheriff of Nottingham at the end before the bounty on your head reaches 1000 gold pieces?

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Novel-based

name: Not It!: The Cryptid Hunters Edition
description:
The Cryptid Hunters Edition of Not It! is a game-in-a-dice-tower party game that requires quick decision making as players try to get rid of all of the cards in their hand by playing them based on what comes out of the dice tower.

On their turn, players will act as the Scout seeking to drive cryptid creatures out of the woods and into the open by launching three unique dice through the dice tower. In fast-action fashion, the other players must lay a card from their hand that does NOT match the face of any of the dice. The last player to do so must take his card back into his hand. And if the Scout spots any cards that DO match the dice he gets to claim that card as a trophy and the player who laid it must take a penalty card. The first player to play of their cards will end the game and then players will tally their scores. Trophy cards are worth 1 point, and any cards left in their hand are worth negative points. The best cryptid hunter wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Race

name: Mens Erger Je Niet! Dierenvriendjes
description:
Dutch

Het klassieke Mens Erger Je Niet! spel voor de allerkleinsten! Op de dobbelsteen staan symbolen die corresponderen met de velden op het bord. De kinderen hoeven dus nog niet te kunnen tellen om al mee te kunnen spelen!

Er zijn twee varianten; één voor de echte kleintjes waarbij alleen de pionnen thuisgebracht moeten worden, en één waarin ook tegenstanders van het bord gegooid mogen worden.

Geschikt van 2 tot 4 spelers van 4 tot 8 jaar.

English

The classic Ludo game for the little ones! On the dice are symbols corresponding to the spaces on the board. So the children do not have to be able to count to play!

There are two variants; one for the real little ones where only the pawns have to be brought home, and one in which opponents can also be thrown off the board.

Suitable for 2 to 4 players from 4 to 8 years old.

name: Spotlight Slam
description: One player acts and others guess. When the others guess what the acting player is portraying, they try to snatch the right card from the table by smashing it with clubs. The fastest smasher gets the card. First player to collect 5 cards wins!

name: Kutyavilág kártyajáték
description:
A dog tactical card game in which a lot depends on luck and sometimes you can spot players in a really heartless way.
As long as you moor your dog with a leash, you can cheat your teammate’s most valuable dog. Have the strongest deck of cards and you have a win. Exciting, varied board game full of cute dogs, labrador, fox, boxer and poodle.

You just don't want to go out with the dog because it's raining or the wind is raging? You know that can't be an obstacle for a real owner? But even if there’s no urge to take your kennel for a walk at this moment, you can still play a good one with your friends or family with the Dog World card. Grab your imaginary leash, then get started! The winner will be the one who collects the most reward points.

name: O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão: Escândalos
description:
The game is based on the invention and narration of strange and bizarre stories, from the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “Where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To Who?”, “With What? it's because?".

In this expansion “O Homem que Mordeu o Cão: Escândalos”, players set out in search of even more bizarre and scandalous stories to tell, at the right time, and make their listeners laugh.
There are many possibilities! Put creativity to the test.

This game can be played on the main game board or individually.

Using as an expansion, the rules of the board game will be used.
Using only this box, our board will be replaced by two special dice.
The "Action" dice will be rolled and we will do whatever it takes on the face of that dice. "Star", forces us to tell the story in front of us, steal letters from another player, be punished by the other players in our next narration, or maybe change the theme and then we launch the second dice to see which theme will be changed.

We have time counted by the hourglass and if we get away with it and manage to convince the other players, we earn a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game, the player with the most prestigious coins wins.

name: Clue: North Pole Edition
description:
A holiday twist on the classic detective game! In Clue: North Pole Edition, instead of solving a murder mystery, players attempt to solve the mystery of the missing presents.

Players move from building to building at the North Pole to solve the mystery of: who did it, with what, and where? Players are dealt character, item, and location cards after the top card from each card type is secretly placed in the Sleigh Room in the middle of the board. Players must move to a location and then make an accusation against a character saying they did it in that room with a specific item. The player to the left must show one of any cards accused to the accuser if in that player's hand. Through deductive reasoning each player must figure out which character, item, and location are in the secret file. To do this, each player must uncover what cards are in other players hands by making more and more accusations. Once a player knows what cards the other players are holding, they will know what cards are in the hidden in the Sleigh Room.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Destination Great Britain
description: Drive your taxi around Great Britain, competing with other drivers to collect the most fares and finish first.

name: Whac-a-Mole Match-a-Mole
description: Whac-a-Mole Match-a-Mole is a fast-paced matching and smacking game where players take turns revealing cards from their decks until they spot a match between the color and icon of the face up cards and the mole tile in the center of the table. When that happens, players race to hit the center mole tile with their mole smacker. A small suction cup under the mole smacker will pick up the mole tile. The player to successfully collect the tile keeps it. When all the tiles have been collected, the player with the most mole tiles wins.

name: Gudetama: The Lazy Card Game
description:
In this game featuring the lazy egg character Gudetama, players start with 6 face down cards in front of them, called their "plate." The cards are either a numbered card, from -2 through 9, or one of the 10 Breakfast Special cards which allow actions such as revealing or peeking at cards. On their turn, players replace cards from their plate or take cards from the Draw pile.

Players want to get their cards to add up the lowest possible amount by the end of the round, in order to win a Bacon Blanket. The first player to collect three Bacon Blankets wins the game.

name: Metaphora
description:
This game triggers creative thinking through the production of metaphors and riddles.

Shuffle the cards and lay them face down in piles in the centre of the table. Each player takes a coloured writing card. Keep the other game materials close at hand.

The youngest player starts and is the first narrator. He/she thinks up a name (person, animal or thing) and writes it on his/her writing card without showing it: this will be the mysterious object. Then he/she draws a card from one of the piles and places it face up in the centre of the table, clearly visible to all players.

At this point the narrator has 1 minute to think up a way to describe the mysterious subject starting from the picture on the card face up on the table. As soon as he/she has thought of a sentence he/she pronounces it aloud. At this point, the narrator turns over the hourglass and all the other players must try to guess the mysterious object. Each player can say its name aloud.

When a player guesses correctly, the round ends and points are awarded. If no one guesses in time, a new round begins and the new narrator becomes the player to the right of the last one who narrator.

Here are some examples: if the mysterious object is a BOOK and the uncovered card represents a TABLE, the narrator say "it is a paper TABLE", or "it is a TABLE with a cover" and so on. If the mysterious object is a pair of TROUSERS and the uncovered card represents a LEMON, the metaphor or riddle could be: "it's a LEMON made of fabric" or "it's a LEMON that is peeled by unzipping it."

Both the player who guesses correctly and the narrator earn one point. The player who reaches 5 points first wins. Before starting the game, the players can also decide on more or fewer points in order to win. Scores are recorded and updated on the scoreboard by using the erasable marker.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Timer, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Ride: Gioca o Muori
description:
Ride is an adrenaline-pumping card game inspired by the film of the same name released in September 2018. As the two protagonists of the film you will have to be able to get to the finish line safe and sound, only one of the players will win, but the collaboration to be able to reach the finish line at least alive will be essential!

Play your cards wisely, help your ally in desperate moments hoping that he too will do the same with you, under penalty of a scorching defeat by the Dark Rider!

After preparing the decks, each player chooses a Rider (or one is assigned to them at random), taking the relative Card (if it is the first game, mount the appropriate characteristic clips on the card), the Rider marker to be placed on the first card of the Path.

There are four different phases that follow each other in a precise order: Route phase, Dark Rider phase, Events phase and Rider phase. The first essentially creates the path that the players will be required to tackle: in each Path phase, 4 cards are added in front of the leading rider and all those in the queue of the last rider will be eliminated. If there are no tiles behind them, the first one will be eliminated and the rider on it will suffer a penalty.

In the Dark Rider phase, on the other hand, the action passes into the hands of the mysterious antagonist who will act following the action diagram shown on his card depending on the result obtained by rolling the RIDE die. It should be noted that this disturbing element will not be present immediately in the game, but will appear the first time a Rider should pass on a Path card with his symbol.

Should the Dark Rider not be present, the Events phase will take care of complicating the players' life: here a card will be drawn from the relative deck and covered place on the Path. It will be revealed, and activated, should a player end his turn on that specific card. Note that there is nothing to prevent different Event cards from hitting the same route segment: in this case, all effects will be applied.

In the last phase, the players can take turns taking action. After drawing 4 cards (or less depending on certain situations) they will be forced to play one. Therefore, according to a precise schedule they will have to: apply the indicated effect and advance by a number of Movement Points equal to, or lower than, those provided by the card. Having determined the card on which you decide to end up, you will have to apply any reported effects, reveal and activate the Events and, if possible, fight against the other Riders.

The aim of the game will be to accumulate more points than the others and, not secondary, to stay alive.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Physical Removal, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Five Lines
description: Five Lines comes from ancient Greece, where it was known as Pente Grammai. Around 600 BCE, the Greek poet Alkaois referred to the game in one of his poems, and clay game boards have been found dating to the same period. During the decades around 500 BCE, the Athenians wrote that Ajax and Achilles played the game during the siege of Troy. For that reason, it is sometimes called "the game of heroes". The game became very popular in Rome, where the board uses spaces instead of lines.

name: 2 von 4: Hol sie Dir!
description:
The somewhat different dice game, 4 dice, game instructions and XL game block with 150 sheets in a slipcase.

A fast and exciting dice game for the whole family. The basic principle is simple: Whoever fills out his game sheet completely and collects the most points wins!

In each round, only one player rolls the dice, but the other players are also allowed to take 2 out of 4 of the numbers rolled. But only the player who rolls the dice is allowed to fill in the number on the red dice.

Caution: "2 out of 4" is addictive! Therefore, in addition to the dice and the game instructions, a huge XL game block with 150 sheets is included! And now get to the dice when it's time: 2 out of 4 - Get it!

name: Conteur de pipes
description:
Conteur de pipes is a game where you need to tell a story that is true or completely false depending on what you get. The others players need to know if you are bluffing or not to gain points.

—user summary

name: Kazoo That Tune
description:
In Kazoo That Tune players try to hum tunes with their kazoos for they teammates to guess.
One player each round is the "kazoo artist" and gets two minutes to hum their way through as many tune cards as possible.
Each card features two different pieces of music; an easier piece and a harder piece. The easiest one grants 1 point and the other 2 points.
After a certain numbers of round (determined from the start) the team with most points is the winner!

name: トリッククエスト (Trick Quest)
description:
トリッククエスト (Trick Quest) is a trick-taking role-playing game from Japan. Players have RPG roles such as mage or fighter, and progress along an adventure path by winning tricks. When a player wins cards in suit matching their character, they can improve their abilities.

Each player gets a RPG character and work together to complete the quest. Players move along a path on a game board, and where the path diverges, they can split or stay together. Players can work up and down the path, repeating sections to build up their characters.

As players face each challenge, they play a trick-taking game. The suits correspond to the characters; armour for the martial artist, tools for the mage and wizard, ornaments for the monk and so on. By collecting cards in their suit, a character can get Trick Points (TP) and use them to upgrade their abilities, and to level up to unlock higher strengths.

Players win the game by completing the quest, finding the legendary GodBird and ridding the world of disease.
user summary
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Lanzarote La Geria
description:
Lanzarote La Geria is a set collection game for 2-4 players.

Devil of Timanfaya has hidden the stones from vineyards of La Geria. Players have the task of retrieving the stones and protecting their vineyards.

At the beginning, each player draws a vineyard board. Vineyards have different bonuses for specific suits of cards and attack or defence bonus.

Each turn player draws 2 cards from the deck or the face up tableau. Then they choose to play a set of cards, attack other player or pass. Additionally, they may also play any number of olivine cards (special powers).
A set of 2, 3, or 4 identical cards gives 2, 5, or 9 stones, respectively. Player may get additional stone for their suit. There are 4 suits: sun, water, volcano, and peasants. A set of 4 different cards gives 7 stones.
To attack, a player plays an attack card and add its bonus to a dice roll. The defending player rolls another dice and may choose to play a defence card afterwards. The totals of attack and defence are compared. The attacker takes number of stones equal to their advantage from opponent's vineyard.
If player doesn't play a set or attack, they pass.
Then they may discard unwanted cards and draw an equal number from the deck.
The players continue until one gathers 25 stones in their vineyard.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Wall: Omicidio sulla 168^ strada
description:
Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions... the answers may surprise you.

The Wall: Omicidio sulla 168^ strada is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall: Omicidio sulla 168^ strada (Murder on 168th Street), a high school student, promising basketball player and very popular, is found dead along the road that every day took him from the field, where he trained early in the morning, to school.
He lived in a poor neighborhood, but everything points that it isn't just a simple robbery.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Toinc
description:
Come and meet Toinc, a super card game that will take you inside the American football field.

The objective of Toinc, as in the game of American Football, is to conquer territory as an attacking team and reach the opposing Endzone to make Touchdowns. And, of course, the defending team will try to stop this with all the vigor of their defensive line. And if they regain possession of the ball, they become the new attacking team.

Toinc is a card game for two players, where it brings the magic of American Football with all its elements and moves, but without being complicated. Build your attacking hand with explosive plays, but don't forget to leave someone to defend your Quarterback from the opposing team's players. The strategy in the assembly of your hand is fundamental to attack and defend successfully, conquering more points than your opponent.

—description from the publisher

name: F.C. De Kampioenen quizspel
description:
Choose your favorite champion, answer the questions and get to know your favorite TV series even better!
Collect 6 character cards and be the first to arrive in the champions' canteen to become the super champion!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Peaky Blinders: Il Gioco di Bluff
description:
In Birmingham's dark alleys, the Peaky Blinders thrive their illegal business under the noses of their rivals and the police! In the shadows, however, their opponents are doing everything possible to reverse this balance of power!

In this game of bluffing and secret identity set in the Peaky Blinders universe, two teams compete against each other: the Shelby family, who will have to collect as many banknotes as possible before the end of the 5th round, and Billy Kimber's men, who will have to stop him at all costs! Who can you trust, though, with Inspector Campbell always lurking nearby?
categories: Card Game, Mafia, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Finale Ending, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Desert Shield: Iraq's Invasion of Kuwait and Saudi Arabia
description: Desert Shield: Iraq's Invasion of Kuwait and Saudi Arabia is the first in a series of three wargames (Desert Shield, Desert Storm, and Operation Iraqi Freedom) that encompasses the Gulf War at the divisional scale. The primary mechanism of play is the Activation Cards that give players the opportunity to operate within the political environment of the Gulf War (in addition the the military realm). It is not enough for players to simply engage in combat; every decision must be weighed against possible political repercussions. Iraq may invade Kuwait, but can the Iraqi player play the proper political cards to foment division among the potential Coalition partners so as to control Kuwait, or at least control Kuwait long enough to leverage additional options? Can the Iraqi player actually invade Saudi Arabia before the Coalition partners prepare Operation Desert Shield? Might Iran become embroiled, or even Israel, or possibly even the Soviets if the region becomes thoroughly destabilized? Players must not only fight and win ground campaigns, but must do so deftly within the present political environment (as created by the card play) to maximize their chances to win the game. Perhaps the Gulf War might never happen, or perhaps an entirely different kind of war will erupt, a war that might see a larger war throughout the Middle East.

name: Helsingin peli
description: Helsingin peli (also in Swedish: Helsingfors-spelet) is a roll and move board game. Published game included a game board with 60 squares, and a rules booklet. Players were required to provide their own game money, suggesting that the game has been played as a low stakes gambling game. In the rules booklet there is a description for each game board square, including the information of money gained or lost in that square.

name: Po Prostu P Pojedynek
description:
"Simply S: Scribble is a dynamic game for 2 teams in which you come up with as many words as possible that match a random category and that all start with the letter S. Which team will think of the most unique words and win? Find out!


Po prostu P Pojedynek to dynamiczna gra dla dwóch drużyn, w której szukacie jak najwięcej słów pasujących do wylosowanej kategorii i jednocześnie zaczynających się na literę P. Która z drużyn wyjdzie z pojedynku zwycięsko i wskaże najwięcej unikatowych haseł? Sprawdźcie to!"

name: KAPOW!
description:
The superpowered card game!

KAPOW! is a fast, thrilling card game in which you have to pit the might of your superhero squad against the world, in your quest to become the very best in the universe. The heroes in your team might not exactly be A-listers – but what they lack in talent and useful, appealing superpowers they more than make up for with enthusiasm. And weaponry.

Lead an unlikely cast of characters as you smash through your opponents’ defenses, knock out their headquarters and barricade yourself against counter-attacks. But be wary of that grotesque gang of supervillains lurking in the shadows – they play by their own rules and want nothing more than to put a dent in your plans.

Now, more than ever, we’re all holding out for a hero – or even better, a team of them. And while KAPOW! might not be a game about the heroes we need, it’s definitely one about the heroes we deserve.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Stat Check Resolution, Take That

name: ReWording
description:
ReWording is a postcard word game that is for 2-5 players. Designed by Ian Howard.

In this competitive word game, players anagram and embellish words to secure the most points at the end of the game.

Each turn, the active player either: adds a new word by writing it in one of 5 sections on the shared postcard board; OR builds on a previously-added word by adding and rearranging letters. A player may instead pass, dropping out of the game.

Once all players have passed, score each section of the board individually. The player with the most words in that section scores 1 point for each word they didn’t write. The player with the most points wins!

name: Project GAIA
description:
GAIA, the super AI designed to protect the Earth, has identified the biggest threat of them all - HUMANKIND.

In this semi-cooperative game, each player controls 2-6 characters with which they journey across the Earth and space. Your mission is to shut down GAIA by discovering a special reboot code. This is done by navigating the Earth while GAIA pours her wrath over it, and by finding the Code Tiles hidden there. For each active Code Tile discovered the players earn Victory Points. The players have to cooperate to successfully perform Space RUNS to the different destinations: the Moon, Mars, and the GAIA Space Station. Code tiles are hidden on these as well.

Each turn a player chooses a character to move on the Earth or one of the destinations, trying to reach the Code Tiles and play Action cards that also give them Victory Points. While moving they have to steer clear of the spaces destroyed by GAIA's attacks. Reaching a functioning space vessel and gathering a suitable crew is also essential.

There is no time to lose, as GAIA is wreaking havoc on the Earth with natural disasters and deadly drones. If the reboot code is not discovered in time mankind is destroyed and GAIA wins. If the reboot code is discovered, the single player with the most Victory Points earned wins the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That

name: One Trick Pony
description:
Howdy partner! This cowboy is keepin' a watchful eye over his farm and isn't afraid to hogtie any varmint who tries to mess with his herd. His lasso is fast, so step lively! Take turns trying to sneak his animals across the fence - but don't get caught! His magical, spinning lasso will stop eventually to rope you in! Whoever rounds up the most animals at the end is the winner!

Includes 1 One Trick Pony, 1 Cowboy Hat, 1 Hay Stalk, 1 Rock, 1 Fence, 15 Animals, 1 Spinner, and Complete Instructions - Requires 3 AA batteries, not included

name: Lion Square
description:
The player has one herd of gazelles and tries to drink the water at the place near the Lion square without being dealt the damages. There are carnivores in the Lion square.

Players try to minimize damage on their side by strategically placing carnivores on Lion Square.

The players place cards one by one in a 3 x 3 area, and scoring, the players get the penalty points from them.

The game ends when all nine cards are placed, or the turn begins the turn player who has no cards left in their hand.
Then, the three cards on your side will be penalty points. Furthermore, all cards that are "taken" during the game are worth -1 point per two cards.

Repeat this until any player reaches 0 points or less from 20 points, and the player with the most points at that point wins.

name: WeyKick Minigolf 280
description: You no longer have to wait for good weather now, because with WeyKick Mini Golf the beloved sport comes into the house. With the help of a club, the ball must be put in the with as few attempts. For 1-5 players. Includes an attractive wooden game field with 5 distinct minigolf holes, 1 stainless steel club, 2 stainless steel balls, and one scorepad. (Adapted from the publisher's description.)

name: Pigs In Pants
description: Pigs in Pants is an Educational Take that style matching game. The main aim of the game is to match "pants cards" in your hand with "pants cards" in play. The winner is the player how has the most cards at the end of the game. The pants cards and player boards are very thick card stock more akin to tiles than cards.

name: The Adventures of Harley
description:
Centered around the family dog, Harley, who likes to hide our Favorite Things, The Adventures of Harley is a co-operative children's game. The goal is to move Harley around the board and turn over cards from four stacks, revealing Dangerous Animals (Bear, Raccoon, Skunk, Porcupine), nasty Briar Patches, Dog Powers (Bark and Sniff), and Favorite Things (such as gloves, sneakers, socks, etc.). Dangerous Animals and Briar Patches block Harley's travels to the various locations as he tries to find the Favorite Things. As a co-operative game, everyone loses together or wins together!

Ages 5-9.

name: Dinosaur Race
description:
Match, count, and race your dinosaur to the finish line.

An exciting game where all the dinosaurs move simultaneously towards the finish line. Each turn, a four-arrowed roulette is spun and each of the players has to look at their result and find how many matching dinosaur tokens they have. Then all players move simultaneously their resulting number in the circuit. Afterwards, all the drawn dinosaur tokens are returned to the pool while turning them upside down, so a different pool is configured and next turn can start.

Race for your position on the podium to collect a shiny medal!

name: Connect 4: Dunk
description:
Summary:

The game consists of a tower with an funnel on top and two catapults. One player plays yellow, the other red. Both players now try to shoot their disks into the tower. The first player to sink his/her four disks wins the round, the first player to win three rounds or get four disks in a row is the winner of the game.

---

Attack the tower
With this intense version of the classic CONNECT 4 game, even the most confident players will be challenged. Launch your discs into the tower and take down your opponent by being the first to sink four shots. For an even greater test of your speed and strategy, race to line up four discs in a row. You’ll have a blast with this rapid game with two levels of difficulty, but there is only room for one champion in this head-to-head shootout.

Bring it on!
Get ready to test your skill and speed with this fast-paced version of the classic CONNECT 4 game. Develop your strategy for your disc launcher placement and slam-dunk your discs directly into the game tower. Be prepared for a head-to-head shootout with your opponent as you master the rapid-fire action. Keep collecting and shooting discs until you sink four discs to win a round. Winner of three rounds wins the game or you can amp up the action and win instantly by placing 4 discs in a row! Do you have what it takes to be the champion?

Ready, set, launch!
It takes strategy and speed to go head-to-head with your opponent as you aim and fire your discs into the CONNECT 4 tower. Develop strategic locations for your disc launcher and master the rapid-fire action in order to bring down your opponent in this intense game of CONNECT 4 DUNK. The tower’s release lever lets you collect your discs easily and quickly for continued rapid fire. A handy scoring marker is built right into the disc launcher. Win three rounds for the long win or get four discs in a row for an instant win.

Includes 5 red discs, 5 gold discs, tower, 2 legs, 2 feet, 2 launchers, 2 funnels, release lever, and label sheet.

Features:
• Tower structure amps up the need for speed and strategy in this challenging version of the classic CONNECT 4 game!
• Individual disc launchers provide quick release for fast-paced action!
• Defeat your opponent by winning three rounds or win instantly by getting four discs in a row into the tower!
• Tower is easy to set up and comes with stickers for decorating.
• Remove the funnel from the top of the tower for an even bigger challenge!

name: Linx
description: The object of Linx is to build chains of cards connecting any two of the four Anchor cards on the table. A chain is a series of cards where each card is linked to both of its neighbors by either a matching number or a matching symbol.

name: Finger Soccer
description:
Traditional Brazilian soccer (football) game for 2 players.

Players must use their fingers to "kick" a regular coin - the "ball" - over a wooden table representing a soccer field, where metal pins - soccer players - are placed at regular spaces.

The opponents alternate kicking (normally one kick each), trying to get the ball past the pins and to the opposite goal - represented by a small hole at the edge of the wooden field.

Quite simple, as most traditional games, but still fun.

name: Gold Rausch
description:
Gold Rausch is a card game, using some game mechanic known from the game "Memory". It's played with 2 to 4 players and each player incarnates a gold seeker. This gold seeker is represented by a gold seeker card laid-out in front of each player. The players get a tool card and a whiskey card as well. These card are placed left and right besides the gold seeker card with the backside up.

In the middle of the table you can find the river, where to search the gold. This is shown by river cards, which are laid-out in 2 rows with 5 cards each. You can see the river, but not the gold printed on the other side of the card.

If it is your turn, you have to turn a around a river card. If it shows gold nuggets you have to find the tools printed on the card. For that you turn around the cards which are next to the gold seekers. If you turn around the right tools you get the river card with the nuggets. If you do wrong your turn ends. After that a new river card is placed in the middle. If you turn around a river card showing gold teeth you don't have to find tools, but whiskey bottles.

The game is getting harder, because every time a player shows a wrong tool, all players with a open tool card change this card with another player, so that the tools are now located somewhere else.

If all river cards with gold are used the game ends and the player with the most gold nuggets and gold teeth win the game.

name: Across Words
description: The Electronic Talking Word Race Game! A rousing, high-fiving, laugh provoking, quick-thinking, adrenaline rush of a game! Players race to make the word that solves the clue. The talking "emcee" sets a lively pace from start to finish.

name: Oar Else!
description:
Stranded in shark infested waters, race to shore or find the items necessary for an immediate rescue. Play as a "team" or jump overboard and go it alone, overcoming torrential storms, blabbering parrots, pirate attacks, and simply losing your mind. Hoard food for an end game bonus. Oar Else! is a "cooperative" card game for 3-5 players, ages 8+.

Everyone starts together, adrift at sea in a lifeboat. The game can be played cooperatively by paddling to shore together in the boat, collecting cumulatively fifteen paddle cards. An alternate win is for the group to find three out of four items necessary for the boat's immediate rescue.

However, players also have the option to jump overboard and "go it alone", taking their paddling contribution with them in the hopes of either paddling to shore before the boat or by achieving their personal immediate rescue scenario.

Once the boat reaches shore, food cards are used to break-the-tie. When food cards are drawn during a player's turn, they do not get to keep the card. Instead, the others in the boat must bid on the card by using cards from their hand.

Thank you to Chris Baylis at the Games Gazette (http://www.gamesgazette.co.uk/gg/main.php?p=content/Board+Ga...) for writing this great review of Oar Else!. I appreciate his honest and constructive feedback and have since revised the rules in the hopes to make learning the game easier.

Rules revision: 2.19.14: http://www.flatcar6studios.com/oarelse/pdf/oarelse_rules_201...

Download and print the combined set-up card: http://www.flatcar6studios.com/oarelse/pdf/OarElse_CombinedS...
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: 2 Minute Dino Deal
description:
The Time Scoop works! Now you can reach back in time to seek out prehistoric monsters. Your goal is to sell these dinosaurs to theme parks and zoos, earning enough money to start up your own Mesozoic Park before your rivals can do so.

You have just two minutes to sell off the dinosaurs and make the most profit. Every 30 seconds, your options become more valuable – but the longer you wait, the more you risk another player stealing “your” dinosaur!

name: Arthur Goes to the Library
description: Based on the Arthur the Aardvark book (and cartoon) series. Players test their memory by matching illustrated cards with tokens representing books on a bookshelf.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: MoMo & Friend Running Up & Down
description:
MoMo & Friend is a speedy and funny party game that challenges your cognitive skill. Are you ready to activate your brain?

Are you ready to activate your brain for listen the comment, visual process the cards, reasoning skill to make a right decision in a second?

The dealer plays a card and gives a command: either “UP”, “DOWN” or “STAY”, then all other players will play a card with the correct “Button” number, which matches to the “Floor” number and command just given.

Be careful, it’s easy to make mistakes!
Let’s train our brains together!

This game includes and advanced mode.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Number, Party Game

name: The Honeybee Tree
description: This game consists of several plastic pieces and a large six sided die with 6 different symbols. One must roll the die in order to add pieces to his/her tree and things must be added in order in the appropriate places. There are five different piece types: branch, leaf, blossom, butterfly, and bee. All have a symbol on the die. The sixth symbol on the die is a beehive that allows any piece that the roller desires to be placed on the tree. The winner is the first to successfully construct a tree.

name: Was ist was
description: Was ist was is a quiz game based on a popular German series of science books for kids. It works like many other quiz games, as you can keep a card if you can answer a question on it (there are different categories, such as animals, technology, history etc.). However, there is a special movement mechanism that determines how far you can move on the game board: There is a pawn on an outer section of the game board which you can move forward by one or two squares. The number printed on the square you reach is the number of squares you can move, so you need to keep an eye on your own movement and of the possibilities you open for the next player(s). You can also challenge an opponent if you reach the same square as he or she, and if you are successful, you can take a card from him or her.

name: Walt Disney's Tomorrowland Rocket to the Moon
description:
From the inside-box-lid copy:

"Each player is the owner of a rocket ship designed to reach the moon. In order to launch the rockets, players must first reach the Rocket Launching Platform. Then each player is given a chance to show how well his rocket is made by trying to fly to the moon."

Each player has a thick wooden disc which represents a rocket ship "of such modern design that they closely resemble 'flying saucers.'" A cardboard backstop is placed at the corner of the gameboard where the moon is located; once a player's rocket ship traverses the path on the gameboard and reaches the Rocket Launching Platform, that player flicks their rocket towards the moon. Points are awarded for how close the rocket gets to landing on the moon (i.e., being completely inside the drawing of the moon, without touching its border), with a bonus for being the first to the launch pad.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Space Exploration
publishers: Bell, John Sands Pty Ltd, Parker Brothers

name: Goren's Bridge for Two
description:
This is a two-player version of Contract Bridge.

Each player gets a "Dummy Rack" that holds a hand of 13 cards (seven face-up and six face-down) to act as his or her partner.

Play proceeds as in normal Contract Bridge except that the dummy hands may not bid or respond. When a face-up card is played from a dummy hand the face-down card beneath it is turned up and made available for play.

name: Diabelski Krąg
description:
Diabelski Krąg is a tactical game in which (in it's basic version) two players compete to either defend or kill a infantile princess of a fantasy kingdom untill the dawn for 3 nights (time is randomly simulated after each turn). The "good side" are four powerful mages, while the "evil side" are eight demons.

Though tactical, the game is pretty random, since the demons change their statistics every turn due to the changing phases of the moon and stars. Demons can change their status, there are 8 stages of it, from 100% material (they can be hurt and they can fight) to 100% spiritual (they can fight only using psychic attack, but can pass through the walls, etc.). Demons can use fireplaces to move, cast a curse, use pentagrams and holes to hell. Mages can use garlick, Torch of Ithilien's Temple, Ilih's Weed, wand, salt, Magic Book, Elvish Drop, pray and exorcise.

One of the last games by Sfera.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Munchkin Panic: Potion of Mwahahaha! Promo Card
description:
Promo treasure card "Potion of Mwahahaha!"

Card text:
"Play at any time to destroy a Tower.
Keep this card with your slain Monsters and add 5 to your score"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Pocket Pitch & Putt
description:
Pocket Pitch & Putt is an 18 card microgame with 6 small tokens and part of The Stocking Stuffer Collection.

Gauge your shots and read the green to outplay your fellow golfers!
Pocket Pitch & Putt is a tiny golf simulator above the rest. Power and Control have to be managed to keep your shots out of the rough and away from the dreaded sand trap. By anticipating your opponent's condition cards, playing your own, and reading the wind you'll stay on the fairway and make it in under par! The game includes both the 'Front 9' for casual golfers and the more advanced 'Back 9' for seasoned veterans.

In turn order, players choose where to aim their shot and play one card from their hand to affect the result. The other players also play cards to affect the outcome. If the active player has any Control over the shot, they may disregard one or more of the cards played. The shorter the shot, the more control a player has. After the cards are applied, they place their ball token on the aimed spot and the next player goes. In between rounds players draft the cards used in that round for future use. When players make it in on each hole, they move to the next. When all players finish a hole, the last player to finish gets to keep that hole card for future use. The game ends when the first player makes it into the 9th hole. For a full 18 hole game, score is kept and the game is reset for the 'back 9' at this point.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Japanese Castle
description:
Calmness and concentration.
Just one right motion and the card will be fixed in the needed position.
Step by step, card by card – in front of you a fragile and elegant tower of a Japanese castle appears.

Japanese castle is a three-dimensional meccano and a competition of skill and accuracy. Laconic fascination of traditional Japanese architecture, ancient European card-building passion and a native Russian talent of constructing magnificent edifices without any nail are united in this game.

The game concept is familiar to everyone who has built a card castle at least once: vertical piers are leaned together and horizontal cards are placed at their top becoming a base for the new floor, and it continues till there are no cards left or one clumsy movement ruins all the construction. Moreover standard cards called heki which are used only for walls there are some other building elements: gamen screens (twice bigger than heki) and yanegae overlaps with the special fixed stops for heki. Vertical cards stay at their places because of it so castle levels can be built as a tower one right above another, not only like a pyramid. Yanegae cards are of two sizes – small ones with the space for one leaned pair of heki (this construction is called karigoya) and big for two pairs which can be placed transversely to each other as well as parallel. The last variety of big yanegae with two perpendicular pairs is called antei and works as the basic unit for the most of constructions.

Rules offer many varieties of the game: for one player or for the company of 2-4 builders. There can be up to 8 players if two game kits are used. Solo gameplay is simple – you need to build a castle as high as possible. There are no strict rules – you can use any element conditionally to your imagination. Competing versions usually offer to build a tower of exact height in a pelter or make the most solid building – in this case players jolt the table trying to ruin opponent’s castle and not to damage own. Especially amusing version tenders to take your castle and move it to another table keeping it all-of-a-piece, of cause. There is also some kind of gameplay resembling Jenga – players put some cards into a heap, place a few karigoya at the top and try to pull the cards out of the heap without busting the buildings.

Building castles with special elements is easier than with common cards but still the same interesting. Japanese castle can be even built by a child nevertheless nobody suggests to play it in the after-party morning.
The game differs favorably from the common cards by design – building elements show off the authentical Japanese pictures and interiors from the rich collection of the “Yugen” antiques gallery. Japanese castle will give you hours of creativity and excitement and maybe can become a first step to a high-altitude card building champion title for someone. Theoretically 5 Japanese castle game sets will be enough to build an eight-meter tower – the last registered record doesn’t haul a bit to this point.

name: Angry Birds: Space – Planet Block Version
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Build, blast and lift-off with this exciting addition to the Angry Birds Space collection! Players still try to build structures indicated by the cards before opponents can knock them down, but a new planet launcher and construction pieces allow for exciting variability and new play. Game features new birds and pigs from one of the best-selling digital apps.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: I'm With Stupid
description: Being dumb is now fun with the I'm With Stupid Trivia Board Game. One of the most internationally recognized logos and sayings for over six decades, the global t-shirt phenomenon is now a multi-player board game. For ages 12 and older, the adult board game features bizarre and “Stupid" trivia with attitude. This game is designed for three or more players and will have everyone entertained. The I'm With Stupid Trivia Board Game includes one game board, a card box, 300 “Stupid" question cards, six game pieces with stands, one “Stupid" hat and easy-to-follow rules.

name: The Simpsons 2 Trivia Game
description:
This is basically the same as the first Simpsons Trivia Game, but with different questions. The game contains purple and green (!) cards with trivia questions as well as the same character die and poster as the first game.

This version also has different character card games: Who's Who in Springfield, Whose Wise Remark is That, and The Answer is a Question. A sheet of quotes from various characters is included for the second game.

name: Zombie Labyrinth
description:
The zombies are shuffling though the spooky paths of the cemetery in search of brains. Get on this ghastly adventure and try to hoard the biggest amount of brains! But watch out for Dr Bizarre- he will try to steal your brains for his sinister experiments in his freaky lab! This game includes a puzzle-like game board that takes a different shape every time!

Players take turns spinning the spinner and if they get a colored lantern they move to the next lantern of that color in any direction. If that space is next to a brain token - pick it up and put it in your jar. The brain tokens have 1-3 brains on them, but is not revealed until the game ends. If they get Dr Bizarre they move him to the next purple lantern, and if he comes across any zombies that player loses all of their collected brains. The game ends when a player reaches the goal-space. Then the players turn their collected brain tokens over and the player with the most collected brains wins!
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Lumpy Cubes
description: Each player has a set of four cubes. A card that depicts an arrangement of four cubes is drawn. The first player to match his cubes to the pattern on the card gets the card. The first player to collect three cards wins.

name: Wrestling Superstars Game
description: Players must win two matches with two different WWF stars. The game features 12 superstars of the 1980's WWF.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crosswalk
description: In this Icehouse game, two players are racing their trios of pyramids in opposite directions along a five-square line. Pedestrians line the path to block you or your opponeent. During your turn, you roll a die and MUST use all your movement points that turn. You can move either your own pieces or the pedestrians. The first player to get their trio home first wins. Crosswalk may not look deep, but it is surprisingly fun and replayable.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Trek Tactics: Movie Mini-Game
description: In Star Trek Tactics: Movie Mini-Game, players go head-to-head, with one or two players controlling Captain James T. Kirk and Mr. Spock and trying to repel a Klingon assault on the U.S.S. Enterprise. The other player controls the Klingons, of course, and wants to see Spock and Kirk reduced to atoms floating between the stars.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Sum-Up
description:
Players are dealt a hand of card and attempt to form the highest scoring equation in each of the four rounds -- addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. For example, a player holding the cards 0, 0, 4, 4, 6, 6, 6, 8, 8, 9 could form this equation during the addition round and score 864:

800 + 64 = 864

Using every card is not mandatory. During a round, players pass their hands, so each player plays every hand once, eliminating the luck of the draw.

"Challenging Game of Creative Equations"

Belongs to the 3M Gamette Series.

name: Thunderbirds International Rescue Game
description:
Take command of INTERNATIONAL RESCUE and be the first to complete your mission! Evade the evil Hood and save the day!

Object:
To be the first player to complete The Mission by rescuing all your colored pegs and returning them to Tracy Island.

Sample Mission:

Race Through Space

Two scientists are trapped beneath the ocean in a diving bell. Time is running out as their oxygen supply is used up. Their position can only be determined by the monitor aboard TB5 in outer space. Unfortunately, all communication with TB5 is non-functional. The component for its repair must be picked up from the city and taken to TB5 in the custody of its inventor, Dr Hiram Hiram, who can make the repair.

Can you save the day as International Rescue? Or will the evil Hood wreck your plans?

Warnings:
Not suitable for children under 36 months due to small parts (standard in Australia)
Colours and contents may vary from those illustrated (required since Thunderbird 5 and FAB1 are both illustrated on the cover but are not playing pieces!)
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Rockets
description:
Players race their rockets to the moon, 20 fields from Earth. Each player holds six random number cards. A first card from the draw pile is flipped over. Players now take turns playing cards on this discard pile. If the number played is higher than the current top card of the stack, the player moves his/her rocket forward by the difference between the cards in fields. If it has the same value, the player must move another player's rocket by one field. If the played card is lower, the active player has two options: Either move his/her rocket back the difference, or draw the difference in cards (this is the only way of getting new cards).
A round ends when either a player has reached the moon, or someone runs out of cards, or the stack is used up. Then each player deducts the number of cards in his/her hands from the number of the field his/her rocket is on, and scores that number of points. Play as many rounds as there are players. The player with highest overall score is the winner.

name: Brit Quiz
description:
A simple quiz game that requires, as the name suggests, knowledge of British trivia...

Players take turns to roll a die and move that number of spaces round the board. The player then tries to answer a question determined by both the color of the space he or she lands on, and the actual number rolled on the die. If the question is answered correctly the player moves forwards an additional three spaces as a reward. There is no penalty for getting the answer wrong. 'Up The Creek' is a special category that asks the player to perform an activity rather than answer a question. If the player fails to carry out the activity to the satisfaction of the other players, or refuses to even try, he or she has to move backwards three spaces.

The winner is the first player to complete a circuit of the track around the board.

Question categories are:

Orange - History & This And That
Yellow - People
White - Places
Green - Showbiz
Blue - Slang
Red - Sport
Brown - Up The Creek

name: Take Ten
description:
This is a simple children's game to learn counting to 10.

The game components are very simple: a flimsy cardboard gameboard consisting of 4x4 connected circles and 66 cardboard circles: one side blank, other side a number from 1 to 7 or a joker.

Gameplay is very straightforward: circles are mixed with blank side up, each player draws 3 circles. On his/her turn the player plays one circle on the board and draws a new circle. If a line (horizontal/vertical/diagonal) is completed and the sum of the 4 circles is 10, the player picks up the 4 circles. Game ends when the draw pile is exhausted. Player who has collected most circles by completing lines of 10 wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Number
publishers: BSM Jeux, Claxon, Didacto, Orda Industries Ltd., Schmidt Spiele, Semper, Spear's Games

name: Monopoly: Edinburgh
description:
Another city Monopoly edition to appeal to tourists and locals!

From box:

"Monopoly, the great property trading board game finds its home in Scotland's capital city. You can play the classic game with the street names, landmarks and locations which give the city its distinctive character.
From Edinburgh Castle to the Palace of Holyrood House, the Royal Mile descends the sloping rocky ridge on which the medieval Old Town of Edinburgh was built.
Scotland's story reverberates through every close and wynd on the historic thoroughfare. Each summer provides a dramatic backdrop to the annual Edinburgh International Festival, the world's largest arts and cultural extravaganza.
The cramped and irregular architecture of the 'Old Town' stands in contrast to the neat symmetry sought by the planners of the eighteenth century 'New Town'.
The city's cherished open spaces, the imposing heights of Arthur's Seat and the gentle panorama of the Pentland Hills combine to create a sense of spaciousness rare in urban areas."

Not that the above tells you anything about the game!

In addition to local streets, most properties have been branded/sponsored by appropriate businesses (for example, Jenners on Princes Street).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Finger On The Trigger!
description:
The quick thinking 'Electronic' name game. Be the first to hit the button, and say a name that fits the card and letter. The fastest player keeps the card and the most cards wins the game! Includes one electronic unit with lights and sounds and 30 cards.

—description from the publisher

In this game with an electronic game board, the players need to figure out words in different categories the fastest. Ranging from movies and artists to body parts and flowers, this game challenges to think fast and react even faster.
The electronic game board says a letter out loud, and the fastest player to press their button gets to say a word in that category starting with that letter. The player with the most wins in the end wins.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Electronic, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game
publishers: Amo Oy, AS Company, Bizak, Dorcy Irwin, Joker AG (Austrian publisher), Jumbo, Lansay, Vivid Imaginations

name: Verdict II
description:
Revised version of Verdict which appeared in 1961.

Components:

Prosecutor's Solution Wheel
Defense Counselor's Solution Wheel
12 Surprise Witness Cards
Rules of Evidence Sheet
Reference Sheet
Prosecutor's Case Book
Defense Counselor's Case Book
8 Pawns 4 red 4 blue
Gameboard
Die
Instructions


Summary of Play (from Verdict)
1. Prosecutor selects case.
2. Prosecutor offers physical facts. Prosecutor solution wheel is consulted if defense objects.
3. Prosecutor examines witness.
4. If Prosecutor pawn lands on cross examination space Defense has option to cross examine.
5. Prosecutor may continue examination.
6. Defender examines one of its witnesses. If Prosecutor objects Defense Counselor's Solution Wheel is consulted.
7. If Defense pawn lands on cross examintion space Prosecutor has option to cross examine.
8. Defense may continue examination.
9. Prosecutor and Defense alternate examining witnesses.
10. As soon as one lawyer has 3 pawns in the jury box a surprise witness card is revealed.
11. First lawyer to get 4 pawns in the jury box wins. If neither does a retrial is necessary.

Re-implements:

Verdict

name: Cardcaptors Trading Card Game
description: Assembling a team of Cardcaptors, you will clash over the escaped Clow Spirits that roam the Earth. You will have to be canny to manage your resources correctly as you battle with your Capture, Strategy, and Reinforcement cards.

name: Colony Clash: Insect Warfare
description:
Colony Clash: Insect Warfare is a card game where each player builds his own deck of cards over the course the game. Two to four players can play this game. Each control one of four species (Ant Colony, Royal Mantis,
Beetle Settlement, & Fly Monarchy).

Throughout the game, players build up their army by purchasing it using the food resources. Players use these cards to secure their hives and food production, defeat their enemies, and win the game by amassing their assets by the end of the game.

name: Battle of Souls
description:
Battle of Souls is a 2+ player trading card game. In Battle of Souls you deploy (summon) warriors of different ranks and warrior sects to drain your opponents soul points (life points) and win the game. The theme of the game carries alone with historical warriors such as Samurai, Mongolian, Roman etc..

In Battle of Souls, each player starts with 8000 life points which in our game is referred to as soul points. The objective of the game, or otherwise stated the win condition is to be the first player to reach 16000 soul points.

This is done by dealing damage to your opponent from the attacks of your deployed (summoned) warriors.

Each time your opponent takes damage of any type, including any cost to activate an effect, you gain that much SP (soul points) and vice versa.

This mechanic insures that there will always be a definite victor and never a draw game.
The second win condition is if one player runs out of cards to draw from their decks, they lose the game.

GAME FLOW:
Each player starts the game by drawing 5 cards from their deck to their hand. The first play to take a turn draws one additional card at the beginning of their turn. Each turn the player is able to deploy only one fighter (warrior, elite warrior, warlord, legendary warrior) to their side of the field. The first player to take his/her turn may not attack on that turn. The last player to draw is the first that can attack.
The fighter cards are ranked in the following order, along with deployment requirements:
Warrior > No special requirements
Elite Warrior > Tribute a warrior that has 3 kill counters on it (kill counters are gained whenever a fighter destroys another fighter in battle)
Warlord > Tribute an Elite Warrior with 5 kill counters on it
Legendary Warrior > Tribute a Warlord with 7 kill counters on it, in addition to an Elite Warrior and Warrior on your side of the field.

Equipment cards can be played face up or set face down to be used at a later time. Some are one time use and others are continuous

Tactic cards are played face down on the turn you play them from your hand and may be activated by flipping face up on any turn after they were first played as long as the effect conditions are met (if any)

Battlefield cards are played face up and only one Battlefield card can be active on the field at any time. If a Battlefield card is in play when another is played, the previous one is destroyed.

FIELD LIMITATIONS:
On the field, each player can have a maximum of 5 fighter cards in play 1 battlefield, and 6 total equipment or tactic cards

PHASES:
The game phases are as follows for each turn
Draw phase > Player draws a card
Ready phase > All fighters that are currently in rest position (This is the position a fighter is changed to after a successful attack) are switched to attack position
Main phase > Player can deploy, special deploy, activate equipment, battlefield, or previously set tactic cards as well as utilize any effects whose condition is met.
Battle phase > Player sends his/her warriors to fight
Main phase 2: do the same as the first main phase with the exception of deploying a fighter if the player already did so during the first main phase. Special deployments are limitless and can be done any number of times up to the max allows fighters in play.
End phase: player ends their turn and discards a card from their hand if they are carrying 7 or more cards in hand.

name: Space: 1999
description:
It's essentially Chinese Checkers with a rotating board. The goal of the game is be the first player to move your 4 spaceships home. During your turn, you can move 1 piece, by either moving 1 space, or 'jumping' over any ship or ships, checkers-style.

After you move, you then roll a die and the board spins from 1 to 3 spaces left or right! The end-game usually consists of everyone moving their last ship back and forth until a lucky die roll is made.

Note: There are separate game pages for the 1975 card game from Whitman and the 1974 board game from Omnia, as well as the Italian game Spazio: 1999.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Silo 14
description: "Can your highly trained group of commandos stop terrorists from launching the missiles that will start a nuclear confrontation? In this game the fate of the world is in your hands as you fight your way through a missile command center to stop a maniacal General and his followers before the seconds count down and World War III is sure to begin."
publishers: Centurion Games, Jersey Devil Game Company, Inc.

name: Emperors of Europe
description:
Emperors of Europe can be played at several different levels. The Total War scenarios are designed so that the player of any country has a good, but not necessarily equal, chance of conquering Europe.

The Historical scenarios present challenges to the players in the form of restrictions. However strict historical imbalances have been modified in order to provide a quick and fun game system. Depending on the scenario, a game can be completed in two to five hours.

name: Banana Jump
description:
In Banana Jump, the baboon is jumping from tree to tree around the edge of the game board to circle the clearing. At the same time, the other animals are gathering in the clearing.

Each player "owns" one type of animal (but can place any type during play). On a turn, a player rolls two dice. If he rolls a color symbol, he can place an animal in the clearing, provided the assigned space for that animal in that color is currently available. (The columns have to be filled in a certain order.) If a baboon symbol is rolled, the baboon jumps to the next tree; if a banana is rolled, the baboon moves back (to eat a banana) or any animal can be placed.

Every time a player fills a row or places one of his own animals, he gets a coin. If the baboon circles the board first, it wins (and all players lose); if the animals fill the clearing first, the player with the most coins wins.

name: Jälkipyykki
description:
All participants answer the same yes/no question about personal opinions or things done in the past at the same time by inserting a note in to the answer box. Then everyone makes a secret quess about the total number of "Yes"-answers. Those who get the correct answer get one point. The game ends when someone has 10 points.

Questions are designed for adults and might concer even outlaw things.

name: Two Some
description:
In Two Some, you and another player answer the ultimate "me or you" questions to see how well you know each other, either playing with just the two of you or going head-to-head against up to three other couples.

Each round, two cards are revealed to the group, such as "avoid when hungry" and "better poker face", or perhaps "laughs at own jokes" and "knows more types of plants". Each player simultaneously chooses which of the two cards they feel they are better at than their partner. If both players on the same team choose different cards, they are on the same wavelength and score. The team with the highest score after twelve rounds wins.

Break the ice and find out whether you are the perfect pair or perfect strangers!

name: Templaria
description: Similar to a classic game (Scopa) and located in the history, with cards of Templars and Santo Graal.

name: Littlest Pet Shop
description:
Kitty, puppy, bunny and turtle are waiting for you at the Littlest Pet Shop. You may be able to take one home if you can match its pet card with its matching color Pet Food or Pet Carrier card. Once you have a match, spin to see if the shopkeeper will let you take that pet home. First player to collect 3 pairs of matching cards and 1 pet wins.

This is a different game from the 2005 Littlest Pet Shop Game
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Grow Jogos e Brinquedos, Milton Bradley

name: SuDoKu: Battle Lines
description:
SuDoKu - Battle Lines is a strategy game where players battle for territory on the game board using color coded, numbered tiles.

Based on the very popular Sudoku number puzzle (where each 3x3 grid, each row and each column must contain all the numbers 1 to 9), this game adds the extra dimension of player combative interaction. For those who enjoy solitaire games, a number of Sudoku puzzles are included - ranging from easy to extremely hard.

name: Star Trek Game
description:
The object of the game is to move your spaceship pawn from the Earth to three of six orbiting planets and be the first one to return to Earth. The game is played on a 36 by 36 grid with the Earth at the center. Players get fuel cards numbered 1 through 10 to control their movement. Each turn, you play one fuel card to move your ship that number of squares either horizontally or vertically, but not both.
There are also two fuel ships. Every player on his turn rolls a die and moves one of the fuel ships. If you land next to a fuel ship, you can retrieve any one used fuel card. When you are out of fuel, you can only move one square per turn. You also retrieve any 3 used fuel cards on every planet you land on.
Each planet has a series of 10 to 12 dots that describe its entry/exit orbit. To leave Earth, you have to follow the 12 orbit dots before you enter the vertical and horizontal grid of open space. Likewise, when you want to land on a planet, you have to start on the outermost orbit dot and follow the orbit down to the planet's surface. Sorry, no transporters in this game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Sätt sprätt på en miljon!
description:
Sätt sprätt på en miljon, styled on covers as "Sätt sprätt på en milj000.000n", was produced in-house by Swedish Alga with the same theme and overall structure as Go For Broke: players are heirs tasked with quickly spending (within arbitrary limits) a small portion of a heritage, hoping to win the remainder.

As in the older game, players move along spaces following instructions and participating in various activities like gambling and stock market speculation. Differences include the game track being broken up into themed sections, some of which players may loop through; in the use of event cards; and in the several card- and die-based minigames that take the place of spinners. There are also touches like each player role having a quirk with a minor mechanical effect.

The winner is the first player to get rid of all their money, with the rest being ranked by how much money they have left (i.e. the player second closest to winning finishes last).

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Income, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers

name: Road Trip
description:
Road Trip, the fast family game of wacky words, comes in a camper-shaped box. It is for 2-4 players or teams.

From the publisher:

Can you rattle off three towns that start with the letter "P"? What about three fast foods that contain the letter "B"? Or, finish the "Tale of the Trip" by filling in the blanks with words beginning with "A"? How's this: "When we stopped in Albuquerque, I bought an Armadillo to give to Aunt Alice!"

Complete each word challenge and be the first to motor across the USA! "Rest Stop" cards add to the fun along the way, with lucky breaks and the occasional pothole. You'll find yourself asking "R" we there yet? and saying wish "U" were here!

Road Trip game contains 120 Challenge Cards, 40 "Rest Stop" cards, 7.5" x 20" Vintage Road Map Board, 30-sided Alphabet die, and 4 retro Station Wagon movers!

name: Love Tubes n° 1: Romeo + Juliet
description:
Steaming sex or a passionate romance...

The Romeo and Juliet love tube is the fast track to romance and adventure, in the unlimited universe of sexual fantasy. It’s time to see how far you and your partner can take the pleasure principle. Romeo+Juliet is a game with intimate questions and lust arousing chores for two. The winner can expect extravagant indulgence, the loser can look forward to glorious punishment...

1 game board
1 book of questions and chores
1 book of romantic and adventurous punishments
2 counters
1 twenty sided love dice
1 rulebook
1 bag

name: Oxford: Cambridge Boat Race
description:
Light trick-taking card game. Two separate decks, one for Oxford and the other for Cambridge, each with three suits of eight cards, plus three incident (wild) cards.

At the start of each hand, a player chooses the precedence of the suits. Only five tricks are played with each hand, this stops card counting and makes the game more luck-dependent.

Tricks count both for a boat (corresponding to the deck used) and for the player. Players that win a trick select which deck will be used and therefore which boat will win the point.

The first boat that scores 26 points wins. Players then score double for points won from the winning boat. Score is kept on an attractive pad with maps of the Boat Race course.

name: National Geographic's Mission: Survival
description:
Test your mastery in real-life situations as you explore the world. This fast-paced board game takes you across mountain, rain forest, ocean and desert to complete vital missions.

Dangers await when piranhas attack as you cross a river, a camel flattens your canteen, an avalanche blocks the trail. Encounter these hazards faced by actual explorers.

Stay cool when you land on a question space. Sample questions include:
Where is the world's largest pyramid?
MEXICO, Costa Rica or Egypt

What is Australia's driest desert?
SIMPSON DESERT, Great Victoria Desert, Great Sandy Desert

In Jules Verne's book Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea, what was the name of the captain?
Captain Ahab, CAPTAIN NEMO, Captain Hook

For 2-6 players, Ages 9 and up.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quest Júnior
description: Quiz game for kids inspired by Trivial Pursuit. The mechanic is like a race where the players must answer questions and advance the pawn if the answer is correct. The first player to reach the last space and answer the chalenge question correctly is the winner.

name: KLOAK: The Undercover Strategy Game
description:
On your turn, move any piece on the board one space in any direction. For the small pieces, the adjacent space must be open to move. For the big pieces, you can move onto any open adjacent space or onto any adjacent space with a small piece. As small pieces are moved and covered (kloaked), you have to remember where they are. Be first to align two sets of three small pieces of the same color and win!

—description from the designer

name: Politrics
description: Typical UK board game, Monopoly clone, roll & move, draw chance cards, hand paper money around. This has a theme of politics & directorships, and two tracks, like Poleconomy (qv), with the highly original idea of sleaze and satire.

name: Strawberryland
description:
From the game box:

Huckleberry Pie is being mischievous and has hidden some berry important things that belong to Strawberry Shortcake and her friends. You can help Strawberry Shortcake, Orange Blossom, Angel Cake, and Ginger Snap seek out their things by using your memory skills. The first player to collect his/her belongings and land in the Strawberryland space in the center of the board wins.

Ages 4 and up, 2 to 4 players.

name: In oder Out
description: Players try to guess whether a certain thing (Range is e.g. from Pizza to Gene technology) is "In" or "Out" at the moment. One player chooses one topic/thing etc. from a given card and reads it out. Depending on the square the player stands on the others have to guess either whether the thing is "In" or "Out" generally or the players opinion about the given thing. If you guess correctly you move on - otherwise you have to go backwards.

name: Cinderella Glass Slipper Game
description:
From the box:
"Will you be the first Cinderella to go to the ball? Collect 5 different cards and the Fairy Godmother will help you transform your cards to get ready for the ball. If you collect the invitation, the coach, the horses, the footman & the coachman as well as your ball gown, you will be the Cinderella who goes to the ball!"

Players move Cinderella pieces around a board, in the center of which is a glass slipper on a cushion. Land on the fairy godmother squares, press the slipper and it may transform the humble cards you have collected (mice, pumpkin etc.) into the things you need for the ball.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: FIB-OR-NOT?
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

We all love to share stories with our friends and family, it's a favorite pastime across many generations. But haven't you ever wondered if some of the stories you hear are FIBS . . . or NOT?

This notion is just what makes FIB-OR-NOT? so fun to play.

FIB-OR-NOT? is the outrageously funny game of telling stories. Whether the stories are FIBS . . . or NOT, is all up to you. There are no right or wrong answers and there is no questioning your knowledge of trivial facts.

How to Play:
Players select subject cards and take turns telling stories.

Story Teller - The objective of the game is to fool the other players. Either your real story is so outrageous that it sounds like a fib, or your fib is so believable that it sounds real. Move forward one space for every player you fool.

Listener - The objective is to properly guess if the story is a FIB . . . or NOT. Guess correctly, and you move forward one space.

The first person to reach the FINISH square is the winner.

The game is easy to play, it's entertaining and it's educational.

FIB-OR-NOT? makes a great Party Game and a fantastic Family Game too.

Have fun, laugh and FIB . . . or NOT.

name: UFO
description:
To start the game you arrange twelve UFO cards face up in a circle, with a Planet card inside it. UFO cards are divided in colors and have numbers on them.
The aim of the game is to play UFO cards from your hand in order to win the cards composing the circle. The cards you take score points.
A card played from the hand can be played only on the UFO card in the circle next to the Planet card. Playing a card gives you the possibility of moving the Planet card accordingly to the value of the card played.
UFO cards are played one at a time and the effect produced by each card is resolved before another card can be played (this gives you the possibility of building a strategy).
A card from the circle can be taken only by cards of the same color. Different colors simply take the place of the card on the table.
Simple math can be a valuable asset in sorting out a strategy.

name: Touchdown A Minute Football
description:
Touchdown-A-Minute Football is a Micro Box game. You pick from a set selection of six sided dice that have different faces on them to give your team the best chance at beating your opponent. Play a full season, or start up a league, it's all part of the game.

You decide how to run your offense. You set your team, control the quarterback, the ends, the receivers, the front line - and pit them against a defense that is ready for anything, and determined to bring you down! Touchdowns, Point After Attempts, Field Goals, penalties and more are all in this amazingly fast dice game.

Touchdown-A-Minute Football is a dice games published by Fast Forward Entertainment. The authors are listed, copyrights are to William W. Connors and Tim Brown.

name: Hundsgemein
description: Players control gangs of nasty flees out to prey upon unsuspecting dogs that are wandering through a seedy section of the city. The fleas are placed on a 7z7 grid while the dogs wander the streets between the rows and columns. Fleas are placed picture-side (flea-side) up, with no identical fleas allowed on adjacent squares. After the grid is filled, the fleas are turned over, displaying the color of the player who placed them.
