The player with the most fleas on both sides of a street captures the unsuspecting dog on that street. Points for captured dogs are totaled, and the player with the most points wins.

name: Explorations
description: The goal of the game is to collect the maximum number of victory points by becoming citizen of various cities of the world. In order to become a citizen of a city, a player must travel around the globe to learn the city language by collecting "language cards". The game uses "lite brite" pegs to indicate which player is a citizen of each cities.

name: Managing Your Money
description:
Managing Your Money appears to be a long out of print promotional game released by the Cuna Mutual Insurance Society. The object of the game is to be the first person to repay the 2,000 dollar credit union loan and collect 2,000 dollars in their savings account. After gaining a vocation card, the players move clockwise around a board.

The spaces are outlined with various bonuses and penalties -"Pension Payment: collect 50 dollars" and "Extended Sickness: do not collect salary when passing Credit Union office" and so on. There are two smaller separate tracks - Hard Times and Goodtimes, that the player can access if they land in the right spot. Along these tracks, the player can enjoy extra benefits or suffer additional major blows to their pocketbook.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Nak Naks
description:
Each collectable Nak Nak figure can be posed in over 80 different stacking poses. Object is to see how many NAKNAK figures you can stack.
Each Player takes turns rolling 2 dice, one die determines if u stack your Nak Nak on the ground or on the stack on top of another Nak Nak. The other die determines what body part of the Nak Nak that need to be touching the stack or ground.
If a player drops the stack the player who went before him takes the Nak Naks that fell off the stack, Last player with Nak Naks Wins.

name: Monster Madness
description: Roll the dice and move that number of spaces and follow the instructions on the space. You may choose to re-roll the dice a second if you want a better roll. You may also choose to re-roll a third time, but you are then required to accept the last roll and move. If you roll a lightning bolt at any time, you must go back on the path to the last lightning bolt passed and your turn is over. The first player to reach the 'lab slab' by exact count and be energized by rolling a lightning bolt becomes a 'Super Monster' and wins the game.

name: Sadurangam
description:
Sadurangam is played in India and Sri Lanka on a 5x5 board of cells with a winding path that spirals to the center. Players pieces start in the boxes on the sides of the outer ring of the board. These middle squares along each edge and the square in the center of the board are safe places where pieces cannot be attacked. Movement is determined by coins, casting sticks or cowrie shells (traditional).

On a turn, the player throws four cowries and may move a coin from 1 to 8 places according to the result. If the player lands on a space occupied by the opponent, the opponent's coin is "cut" and must return to the starting space. Once a coin has returned to the space before the player's starting space, provided the player has cut the opponent at least once, the coin moves to the inner ring and continues around the board and then into the innermost square. The first player to move all of their coins to the innermost square wins.
publishers: (Public Domain), Carrom Art, Kala Raksha, Kreeda, Ludens Spirit, Ramsons

name: Dinosauriespelet
description:
Dinosauriespelet is a Swedish children's game.

Each player plays a dinosaur. There is also a Tyrannosaurus moving around the board, disturbing the players. Each player has a cave of their own. The goal is to collect eggs from the top of the mountain in the middle of the game board and bring them to your own cave, while avoiding the Tyrannosaurus. Under certain conditions, it is also possible to steal eggs from other players.

The eggs are in the form of wooden disks with 1-3 eggs painted on one side. When playing, these are placed upside down, so when picking up an egg disk from the mountain, you don't know if it's a good or bad one. The player with the most disks doesn't necessarily win in the end.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Hollywood Players
description:
Each player is a Hollywood producer eager to make a big name for themselves by being the first to clinch the top four Hollywood Awards for best director, actor, actress and of course movie.

Your gonna be stuck with the movie your given so make the most of it and hunt for the best Actor, Actress and Director for your Movie's Genre. Naturally, if your cast/crew are familiar with each other , chances are your gonna grab some awards!

Its up to you to decide when the movie awards will begin - do you have the right cast/crew to grab the awards or will you hunt a little longer just to be sure?

HOLLYWOOD PLAYERS is another card game in Van der Veer Games' QuickPlay DBGC (Don't Busta Grey Cell!) series.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Math, Memory, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Monopoly: Taiwan
description:
Typical regional Monopoly game.

Place names are specific to Taiwan.
For example:
Boardwalk - Mt. Taiping
Park Place - Taroko
Reading RR - Taipei Train Station

The 8 tokens are bronze colored and included in some of the Parker Brothers Anniversary Editions. While these are not the standard Monopoly fare, there is nothing uniquely Taiwanese about them.

The board and all the cards are printed in English and traditional Chinese. Prices and currency are all 10x standard Monopoly, too. (10, 50, 100, 200, 500, 1000, 5000)

Each property on the board has a full-color picture of the actual locale and the board has a nice background in the center.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Truth and Triumph
description:
A game to test your Christian knowledge. Based on the mechanics in Trivial Pursuit, players travel around the board answering questions in one of 4 categories - Old Testament, Wisdom, Life of Christ and Church Age (which is pretty hard when it comes to the post New Testament questions!).

Expanded by:

Truth and Triumph: Challenge Edition

name: Monopoly Junior: Lemonade
description: A newer version of Monopoly Junior which has revised gameplay. Gone is the spinner & the dials of the original edition - instead, players work placing lemonade stands onto streets. There are two streets in each color, which form an unbreakable monopoly. Gone as well is the "Loose Change" space from the amusement park version of Monopoly Junior. This version plays quicker & cleaner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Village Wolves
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Dice Crash
description:
Players stack dice chosen by one of them and score points when the tower holds... or lose points if it collapses. The difficulty depends of course on the size of the die, but especially on the order in which it is placed and the tower on which it is placed. And these two conditions are dictated to the player by the face value of his die.

The first player rolls the dice and chooses, following a few simple rules, which ones they will give to their opponents and to whom. The player who rolls first becomes the first player and, in turn, will try to score points and cause his opponents to fall by forcing them to try risky balances.

name: Harry Potter: Exploding Snap!
description:
A fast paced game with explosive possibilities! Act quickly to get rid of all of your cards! No taking turns! At any moment, the game may explode and change who's winning! This card game based on the Wizarding World of Harry Potter is for 2 players ages 5 and up.

Exploding snap card game
2 players
Ages 5 and up
Imported

All information is subject to change including but not limited to artwork, design, release dates, edition sizes and prices.
This item was created for and sold in the Universal Orlando theme park. Available here for a limited time.

name: 20 sekund challenge
description: Two teams, one judge, over 400 crazy challenges and only 20 seconds to not get beat! In the 20 second challenge, players will have the opportunity to try their hand at completing a series of non-obvious, surprising and crazy tasks. The faster you tackle the challenge, the less time you leave for your rivals. An amazing party game that will make you laugh to tears!

name: Zoofari
description:
In Zoofari players draw cards and move along a colourful zoo board in order to reach the Flamingo Oasis.

Each turn, a player draws a card and moves to the next coloured square as shown on the card. Some cards allow a piece to move to the second square of that colour while others cause one to move to a specific spot somewhere in the zoo. As well, there are "shortcuts" pictured on the board that skip a certain area of the board and there are hazards that require a player to draw a certain card before moving again.

First to the end is the victor.

This game is strikingly similar to Candy Land.

name: Send!
description:
A UK National Distribution Game

From the rules:

Each player has a factory, all producing similar products. Each sends these products to customers all over Britain. Some parts are too far away to supply direct, so distribution depots are built to to cut delivery costs. Profits can be used to build more depots, to make more profits. At the end, the player with the most total wealth (factory, depots, stocks and cash) is the winner.

Some copies (perhaps all - it is impossible to say) came with a Germany map that used slightly different rules.

name: Kahootz
description: Introducing... The sound making, second-hand drawing, tongue twisting, face making, people directing, acting out, gut busting, laugh so hard that you cry, one of a kind, gotta have it, more fun than you ever had playing with your friends and family hoot of a charades game!

name: Criminal Minds: Unknown Subject
description:
UNknown SUBject is a fast-paced social deduction game based on the hit TV show Criminal Minds! Play as familiar FBI Behavioral Analysis Unit Agents to identify the killer in your midst, or work against the goals of the BAU to get away with your crimes and escape! Investigate, use the profile, and accuse your fellow players to come out on top!


FAST & EASY—The average game takes about 20 minutes and once you get started it's easy to play over and over again!
FAN-FAVORITE—UNknown SUBject is full of nods to Criminal Minds, from the characters to the profile you build, with simple enough gameplay for fans to play alongside those unfamiliar with the show!
NEW GAME EVERY TIME—With different characters and different roles for each game you play, no two playthroughs are exactly alike!


SOCIAL DEDUCTION—Use your knowledge of your fellow players to try and uncover the Unsub or convince the group of your innocence!

BE THE CHARACTERS—The game includes J.J., Garcia, Morgan, Reid, and Rossi alongside the Eyewitness and Unsubs!


—description from the publisher

name: Novo Dice
description:
Your cargo bays are empty. The Novo Dice dealer has the best supplies - but the lion is no typical trader. He doesn't sell his wares, he gambles for your cargo space instead.
Take the right chances and rocket fuel, robots or strange travelers are your reward.
But if you push to hard, you'll end up with the trader's space trash instead.
Novo Dice is an easy dice game
for 2-4 space adventurers 12 and up
with 15 to 30 minutes time reminiscent of a slot machine with a set collection twist.
Novo Dice was made as an advertisement gift and isn't available in retail.

name: Slots
description: Dice rolling version of one armed bandit machines, gamble against an opponent. Contains 10 slot dice, betting chips, rules and scoring sheets.

name: The Checkered Game of Life
description:
Around 1860, Abraham Lincoln grew a beard. A young printer, Milton Bradley, who had been making a living selling pictures of a beardless Lincoln now found himself without a salable product. He turned to making board games, and invented The Checkered Game of Life.

Similar to Snakes and Ladders, The Checkered Game of Life has players moving on the board depicting virtues and vices. Unlike "Snakes & Ladders," players have (limited) movement choices during the game.

Each turn, players spin a top to generate a random number, then consult a chart which gives them 2-4 movement options. If a player stops in a space which gives them points, they record these points on their chart.

The winner of the game is the first to accumulate 100 points.

This is the long predecessor to The Game of Life which is produced by the company that bears his name.
publishers: D. B. Brooks & Bros., Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Milton Bradley

name: Unser Bauernhof
description:
A simple game suitable for very young kids (Ages 4 and up): you race around the range using a color die. Collect as much animals from the range before the sun sets (or there are no more animals left).

But caution! If you don't build a fence for your animals, the animals might run back to the range.

name: Código Lyoko
description:
Fantasy game related to the french cartoon TV serie called Code Lyoko.

The players need to collaborate in oder to defeat X.A.N.A., a virus that attacks both the real world and the web world.

Codigo Lyoko uses two boards, cards and dice.

The game goal is to find 4 diary parts, belonging to Franz Hopper, lost in the virtual world. These diary fragments are the clue to fight against the supercomputer called X.A.N.A.

But it is not easy because there are waiting for you hundreds of virtual monsters (counters and cards) and dangers. The players, 1-4, have to face these threaths through the board related with the virtual world moving from level to level. There are 5 levels, each one with different landscapes. The last one is the place where Aelita (one of the main characters), should activate a virtual tower using the Lyoko Code in order to came back to the past.

It is important too to take an eye in the real world (second board) because X.A.N.A. is trying to control the heroes friends in order to win.

Summarizing, the players have to fight against monsters and face dangers using dice, looking for the diary parts moving through the board and bringing Aelita to the 5 level in order to came back to the past.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Shabadabada Cinoche
description:
New version of the game Shabadabada but here are more about songs from movies that are played.

Shabadabada Cinoche is a game that caters specifically to cinema lovers who have a solid understanding of classic films.

Two teams compete using predetermined words.

As soon as a player sings part of a song which contains the current word, the other team must find another song containing the word. As soon as a team fails, the other one wins the card.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: Star Wars: Galactic Connexions
description:
A Star Wars themed collectible disc game. Players use character discs and their Star Wars knowledge to battle for points.

Each disc has four abilities (Attack, Honor, Deceit, Intelligence) and an ability level from 0 to 5. Players can connect their disc to another on the board if their disc's ability level is higher. The player earns points equal to the ability level marks on both sides of the connection.

When playing with the Star Wars Story Connexions rules, additional points are awarded depending on the rim color of the new disc.

The player with the most points wins.
categories: Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Trivia

name: The Lion Guard: Roaring Rescue Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

A Surprise Slides Adventure.

Journey through the Pride Lands, helping friends along the way!

Friends of the Lion Guard need a helping hand to get to Pride Rock, and only Kion, Beshte, Bunga and Fuli can find the way. Race along the Pride Lands' paths, gathering stranded animals, but watch out - the paths can change at any time!

Roaring Rescue is a simple spin and move game for 2 to 4 players ages 3 and up.

name: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
description:
The family game Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them takes you into the magical world of the famous film series. In the roles of the most popular characters, you try to recapture the escaped beasts in New York. You can collect powerful spells and magical artifacts that will help you in your hunt.

Exciting event cards bring unpredictable twists to the game. With a total of three different game modes (ages 4+, 7+, 12+), two competitive and one cooperative, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them offers magical experiences for all ages.

In the most challenging mode (coop mode for ages 12+) the players work together to capture the escaped beasts. Each player can spend up to 4 action points to move between locations, fight against enemies (Salemers) to liberate occupied locations and gather resources the are needed to capture the beasts. If all beasts are captured, the heroes win. If the Salemers get to strong, the heroes loose.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: ADC Blackfire Entertainment, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Topi Games

name: The Triple Match Card Game
description:
This easy-to-play card game designed for children Ages 5 - 8shows the importance of sharing, saving and spending. Through play and discussion, the game reinforces a healthy, balanced use of money and helps your children become more comfortable with money issues.

Five cards are dealt to each player. On a turn a player either draws a card from the discard pile or the top of the deck. If the card matches one of the six spots on your hub you may place it on the correct spot. If the player has no cards which their hub, the player discards one card.

Distributed by Thrivent Financial for Lutherans as a part of their Financial Footsteps series.

name: Strokes: The Golf Game
description:
From the box:
STROKES will delight everyone from non-golfers to golfers just starting out...to regular golfers and even Professionals! Conforming to the "Rules of Golf", STROKES will provide all players hours of enjoyment. Play for Tournament STROKES "Dollars". Select your game - Skins, Stroke Play, Matchplay, Foursomes, Stableford and mode. It's Fun to play and educational too! Now get ready..step onto the Tee and meet the challenge of STROKES - The Golf Game.

The aim of the game is rolling doubles on two diffident coloured die. If you fail to get a double then then the player can choose to add the two die together within the rules (8 is the maximum total) to advance the ball token down each hole. Like golf the player farthest from each hole has their turn. When you land on the green, you can either try to roll any double to one put" or draw a card and look at the result. Under certain conditions, like landing on a bunker space without rolling a double, you need to draw a hazard card. Each hazard card has a section that applies to water, trees or sand that you must follow (depending on your situation)

name: Card Master
description:
An exciting tactical card game!

Assemble your monster army to fight on one of four different battle maps. Use planning and tactics to outplay your opponent. Will you use a turn to reinforce a position with a stronger monster? Is this the time to use your one time power attack? Can you unleash a devastating chain attack? Or is your opponent leading you into a trap?

Battle to have the most monsters on the map and control more territory than your opponent.

Six different ways to play, a variety of different rules making the game easy and fast for younger players or more tactical and longer for experienced players.

Four maps included and more can be downloaded at a later date.

Are you cunning enough to defeat your opponent and claim the title of Card Master? There can only be one!

Game Time: 5 to 10 minutes
Ages 7 and up
2 Players
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Parker Brothers Mystery Game
description:
Hasbro released this "ultimate 'Mystery Game'" under the Parker Brothers brand label. It is a murder/mystery game which plays with virtually identical mechanics to Clue, with some notable exceptions.

The object is to deduce who committed the murder of an unnamed victim, with what weapon and in what room. There are 6 possible suspects: Madame Rubie, General Umber, Mrs. Azul, Mr. Pine, Sir Use, and Dr. Rose; 6 possible weapons: Cast Iron Pan, Golf Club, Butcher Knife, Revolver, Wrench, and Hammer; and 9 possible rooms: Entrance, Game Room, Spare Bedroom, Master Bedroom, Garden Room, Theatre Room, Sitting Room, Dining Room, and Kitchen. Cards representing these elements are shuffled separately, with three randomly drawn from each category and placed in the center of the playing board, with the rest dealt to the participating players.

Three to four players take on the role of detective and roll a single die to move around the board via a delineated path, moving separate suspect tokens and weapon tokens into the rooms as they make suggestions. The player to the left must reveal any cards they may be holding to disprove the suggestion, until all players have passed.

The game itself measures 10.5" square, with miniature playing cards, and "token" cards representing the 6 suspects and weapons. Four player pawns are included in Red, Orange, Blue and Green. Thought there are substantial similarities to Clue, there are some notable rule differences: the corner rooms no longer provide a "secret passage" to the opposite room in lieu of a move; and players may now land on the same space occupied by another player.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rymdimperiet
description:
Rymdimperiet (Space Empire in English) is one of the few games the Swedish publishers "Äventyrsspel" did on their own without licensing an already exciting American game. The gameplay in itself is simple and each player will play the part of a space trader shipping goods across the galaxy. The goal of the game is to generate a net of 150,000 credits and return to your home planet before any of the other players.

Players move on already existing trade routes which they later can choose to buy to make their own for a set price. Once a trade route has been bought it will earn that player revenue each time another player is forced to use that particular route, as well as create safe passage way for your own trading ship when traveling in the sense that you do not have to pay the expenses to another player and give them the edge.

Trade routes are different in length and usefulness and players will also be given the option to upgrade their ship to go in Hyperdrive, thus allowing them to move around the board to their destinations faster. The game uses a table where you look up the revenue from each trade between the starting planet and the goal for your shipment.

The element that makes the game difficult is that you cannot actively choose your trade route. It is randomly generated by dice rolls through a table to see to what area and which planet on the board you have to go to. This is also where owning and buying trade routes plays the part of a tactical element.

Re-implements:

Rail Baron
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Entenballett
description: Four ducks want to dance a ballet. Each player is given an equal number of cards showing dance positions. (There are two sets of cards to provide easy or hard challenges according to player ages.) Each turn a player rolls the die and turns one duck a space to the left or right for each duck showing on the die. When the ducks are configured according to one of the cards it is discarded. The first player to run out of cards wins.

name: Misfits
description: This is a newer version of a much older, traditional English children's game. There are 60 cards and they depict the hat, face body and two legs of a silly, cartoon-type character. At the start, each player has seven cards and the first to shout that they have a hat starts. The idea is to create full characters (5 cards per character). It does not matter which hat goes with which face, goes with which body etc...but legs must match! Each new character must begin with a hat and players must play a card each turn if at all possible. Each time you play a card, you draw another, and the winner is the player with the most completed characters after every card has been played.
publishers: Rocket Toys and Games, Spear's Games

name: Ms. PAC-MAN Game
description:
In the Ms. Pac-Man Game, one player takes control of the titular character and the others play as ghosts, taking turns to move in a maze. Ms Pac-Man's goal is to eat the pellets on the board and the ghosts try to capture her.

Moving according to the results of flicking a spinner, Ms Pac-Man gobbles (removes) pellets by moving over them. The ghosts move according to the result of a die roll. They start in their strong state and capture Ms Pac-Man by moving onto her. When a ghost captures Ms Pac-Man, the ghost's player takes control of the titular character and removes his or her ghost from play; the former Ms Pac-Man player puts the ghost of his or her color into play. Ghosts turn weak if an F2 is rolled on their die, or if Ms Pac-Man gobbles a Power Pellet (located at the four corners of the maze). Ms Pac-Man can capture weak ghosts and gain an extra turn by doing so.

The first player to have his or her quadrant clear of pellets wins the game.

name: Doink!
description:
It's high flying pig fun with Doink! Carefully balance the five colored pigs on the platform, and deal out the farm animal cards. Try to match your cards by color or by farm animals, but watch out for that Doink card! Now it's a frenzy to grab the colored pig that matches the most cards in your hand! Be the first player to get rid of all of your cards to win! Doink - the card game where pigs DO fly!

—description from the publisher

name: Awkward Family Photos Greatest Hits
description:
Highlights
Simple gameplay and no movie knowledge required
Perfect for game nights with friends and family
Easy instructions

Contains 100 hilarious images and 330 memorable movie lines

We all have them…awkward family photos. They make us cringe and laugh and wonder, "What were we thinking?" Well, inside this box are 100 of the most hilarious, classic and cringeworthy photos carefully curated from the archives of AwkwardFamilyPhotos website. And you'll get to choose from 330 of the most memorable movie lines ever uttered on the big screen to caption these unforgettable images. With simple gameplay and no movie knowledge required, get ready for an award-winning game night. Behold Awkward Family Photos Greatest Hits! Box Contents: 100 Awkward Family Photos, Card Box and 330 Movie Line Cards.

Every player is dealt eight cards featuring a movie line from one of hundreds of popular movies. One player, ‘The Critic’, picks the next Awkward Family Photos card and places the card on the table for everyone to see. All other players decide which one of their eight movie lines best captions the photo, by placing their selection facedown in the play area. ‘The Critic’ reads each card aloud and picks the movie line that he/she thinks best captions the photo in play. The player with the winning card wins the round! First player to get 10 cards win.

—description from the publisher

name: Il gioco del campionato
description: This is a simulation of a soccer tournament. Players manage their teams and play each other by rolling dice. The more balls players roll with the special dice. The more balls they throw with the special dice the more goals they potentially can score.

name: The Anyville Horror
description: An asymmetrical board game in which one player plays a nasty monster while the other player(s) take on the roles of family members defending their home from the evil intruder. If the monster can kill the whole family, he wins. If the family gets the monster first, they win. The monster has certain advantages, special abilities, and is unidentified until he is seen by a family member, but family members can utilize items around the house (like moose-heads, ties, and remote-control cars) to attack the much stronger monster. The game uses scalable rules ranging from basic (Go Cower Under Your Blankie While Crying For Your Mommy), Intermediate (fearfully challenging) which adds in monster powers and more complex combat rules, and Advanced (Hero Worship) which adds in even more combat rules, monster abilities, and allows one or all family members to be significantly stronger than the rest.

name: Roll and Score Tic Tac Dice
description: Players roll two dice, and may keep none, one, or both of them. After two rolls, the number must be entered on the scoresheet in one of sixteen cells. A "7" is entered as an "X" and prohibits scoring in that row or column. A "2" OR "12" is a wild roll, and any number may be entered. After all the cells are filled, points are scored according to the combination of numbers in each roll, column, and diagonal. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Fighter-Bomber: The Game of Mustangs and Messerschmitts
description:
(from the box)

"A Military Strategy Game"

"A military game of logic, luck and tactics for 2 players"

"Your assignment, strategist, is to shoot down your opponent's squadron before he gets yours!"


In this aerial combat game, players must move their Fighter-Bombers across to the opposite sides of the board (the 'target areas') and release their bombs in order for their planes to gain maneuverability and become Fighters.

The second goal is to use your Fighters and your friendly Flak to shoot enemy planes.

As soon as your first set of three Fighter-Bombers enters the opponent's half of the board, a further three enter the game on our side.

Movement is defined by three dice numbered (blank), '1' or '2' apiece, each dice defining movement for one plane.

Enemy planes are shot down by 'over-flying' (jumping) them.

At the end of their movement turn, intruding planes are also subject to 'flak bursts' (color form type markers preset by players on a replica of their half of the battlefield, and slid under the transparent cover sheet which covers the gameboard).

Any planes sitting on 'flak bursts' after the replica map is slipped under them are destroyed!

First player to succeed in shooting down his opponent's squadron of six planes wins the game!!!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, World War II

name: Mental Disorder
description:
Imagine yourself as an eccentric psychopath, being diagnosed with schizophrenia and having the opportunity to submit to toxic lifetime maintenance medication every day for the rest of your life. Or how about sending someone you just met into an insane asylum because you as a licensed alienist have legitimate authority to clinically diagnose and scientifically influence judgment. These and many other fascinating scenarios, including "the care of Lunatics" await everyone who endeavors to journey into the hideous realm of Mental Disorder.

On your turn you may:

Make a "prognosis" on another player.
Diagnose your neighbor.
Submit to Voluntary or Involuntary Treatment.
Influence diagnostic battles with Mental Healthcare Professionals and Publications.
Use defensive mechanism.
Role dice and draw Random Events.


Game ends when a player acquires 100 Insanity Points (IP) or more. The survivor with the least acquired IP at game end is generally the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Horror, Humor, Math, Negotiation, Party Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Voting

name: The Flintstones Game
description: A very generic "spin the spinner and move" type game with a Flintstone theme tacked on. The few spaces on the board that differ from the normal spaces tell the player to move ahead so many spaces, go back so many spaces, lose a turn, or draw a card (which tell the player to move ahead so many spaces, go back so many spaces, or lose a turn).
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric, Racing
publishers: Alga, John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley, Triotoys

name: Hast du Worte?
description:
In Hast du Worte?players in turn reveal letter tiles, until one recognizes a word which can be formed using some of the tiles. On top, one can "steal" a word from another player, if all letters from the other player and some from the active tiles can be used to form a new, longer word.
The player with the most letters wins.

name: Conquest of the Ring
description:
Conquest of the Ring, "A Middle Earth Game for the entire family" by Hobbit Toys and Games, Inc., 1311 Healy Street, Kalamazoo, Michigan.

Conquest of the Ring is a fast action pursuit game in which each of two to four players compete for the ONE Ring of Power. Located in the center of the playing board, the Ring waits to be claimed by the first player who traces his way through the maze from the point of beginning in his Hobbit Shire. Once claimed, the Ring is placed over the successful player's pawn and the chase is on! To win the game, a player must successfully elude the pursuit of his opponents and carry the Ring back to the starting space of his Hobbit Shire.

name: The Battle of Bunker Hill
description:
"Stand in the redoubt on Breed's Hill with Colonel Prescott, Joseph Warren and 1600 New England Militia as they await the British attack. The cannon fire from British warships in Boston Harbor has set Charleston ablaze, and dense smoke clouds the field. British general Sir William Howe has landed 2,000 British regulars, including the elite grenadiers and light infantry. The red clad soldiers form their lines. The assault begins as the redcoats advance uphill through the tall grass. Will the ill-trained Americans defeat the British attack, or will the redoubt be overrun by the forces of King George? Refight the Battle of Bunker Hill in this adaptation of an 18th century game.

The game of 'Asalto' or the 'Assault game' is a variation on the game 'Fox and Geese'."

2 American playing pieces on 9 squares defend against 24 British pieces that set up on 24 squares.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Civil War, Educational, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Addiction
description: Lettered dice are rolled down a stepped slope and placed one per turn into a squared grid to form words in crossword fashion. Each letter has a point value and players score for completing valid words.

name: Winter Olympics VCR Game
description:
Welcome to the Winter Olympics!

You have become an Olympic athlete! Compete in nine different events to score points and win medals.

The game consists of a board, videotape, cards, plastic medals, and pawns. On your turn you watch a 10-15 second random video clip of one of the nine events. At the end of the clip is a section with rapidly changing point values. You then pause the VCR and score whatever points are shown, double them if the space on the board you are on matches the event you just watched. You will then be given the number of spaces to move your token on the board which represents a mountain with three different ski trails down it and ski lifts back up. You can begin to collect medals by accumulating 500 points in a certain event and then landing on a special space for that event to collect the next medal. The first to do this in each event gets the gold for that event, the next the silver, and so on. There are also spaces on the board that can set you back or have you draw a card. The cards can add to your score, set you back or be a lift ticket, which entitles you to move back up the board at any time. After all nine gold medals have been won the game is over and the player with the most points wins the game.

This is a great game for the whole family and the replayability of this game is very high. Even after going through the tape many times each game is still unique.

Do you have what it takes to win the gold?
publishers: 3 Star Entertainment, ABC Sports, Mindscape Games

name: My First Board Games
description: Four simple board games for young children: The Colorful Peacock, Going to the Zoo, The Fire Brigade Game and Farmyard Animals. The games progress in level of skill required. No reading or number skills required. Ages 3 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: UNO: Ren and Stimpy
description:
Basic Uno-themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Eediot" card. This card is played like a wild card but it allows the player playing it to designate another player to make him hold his cards backwards so that everyone else can see them till a card with Stimpy is played.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Ultimate Baseball Trivia Board Game
description:
From the instruction booklet:

As the name suggests, this is a trivia game for baseball fans who want to test their knowledge about America's first pastime.

While the game does focus primarily on MLB teams and players, it also includes questions on baseball history, international baseball, minor league baseball, and other professional baseball leagues.

One feature, which many people appreciate, is the 'rookie' category for novice baseball fans. This allows everyone to play and have a chance at winning.

name: The Movie Game
description: According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": Players move between two tracks in search of a writer, producer, director, star, and studio deal. They then jet to a third track for the film distribution in three countries. The player reaching "box office" still in possession of all these, wins.

name: Jeopardy Dk
description:
The classic Jeopardy game in a Danish setting with 1200 questions on Denmark.

Awards

2004 Årets Voksenspil, Adult Game of the Year Denmark

name: Europa på boks
description:
Europa på boks
A trivia game based on what you know about Europe. You are sent on a mission. The first one to fulfill their mission is the winner.
To do so you have to use every bit of knowledge you have about Europe, its geography, languages, cultures and flags.

There is also the possibility to challenge an opponent and steal cards.....if you know or remember the answers on that specific card.

The game contain 330 cards, 2300 questions, 50 mission cards, 2 dices, 1 notepad.

name: How to Be a Complete Idiot
description:
From the rules:

The object of the games is to lose your marbles.

Each player is given a set of marbles and a set of idiot cards. Each round of play a Fnerd card is turned over. Each player plays an idiot card, and the winner will lose the number of marbles marked on the Fnerd card. The player of the worst idiot card becomes the Psychiatrist, moves the token around the board, and gains the number of marbles shown on the space where it lands. Additional bonuses and penalties are paid out as instructed on the idiot cards, and a fresh round takes place. Play continues until one player has lost all his marbles - the winner!

name: Vultures
description:
VULTURES - Let Us Prey!

"You are a vulture soaring and spiraling high in the sky, scouring the desert, with a scavenging eye! But so are your friends - they've mysteriously turned into vultures as well!

Apart from being the most dangerous inhabitant of the desert you are also the hungriest, and when it comes to luncheon vultures will stop at nothing to get what they want.

The purpose of the game is to collect carcasses, and to do so without getting attacked. Vultures get very cross with each other at feeding time and have very sharp beaks.

When you have collected five carcasses and got back to a tree you have won!"

A simple game where players use cards played from a hand to "fly" and "waddle" around the board, "fight" with other vultures - all with the aim of finding "carcasses". Guidance is given in the rules as to the appropriate sounds and gestures to be made on the discovery of food, and when engaged in a fight!

name: Police Alert
description: Players move around the playing board trying to solve as many incidents or crimes as possible. However, the incidents and the locations can change quite suddenly. Points are accumulated for the various incidents and the player with the highest score wins when all incidents have been solved.

name: The Woods Are Full of Them
description:
Be the first to move your hiker back to his tent, avoiding the bear dens along the way. This is a basic roll-and-move, follow-the-trail game, which includes shortcut spaces for those fortunate to land on them, and also the Bear Den spaces, which forces the unlucky hiker to re-roll the die and move back the indicated number of spaces.

The six-sided die has a bear where the "1" would go, and would normally be treated as a 1. The "bear" prevents players from using the shortcuts, and if it comes up on a player's penalty roll (after landing in a Bear Den), that player must move back to Start.

This game, along with others in Channel Craft's Vintage Game Series, comes in a small tin. Movement is made with pegs, which rest in a hole after each move, making it a suitable choice for travel.

name: XX Olympic Winter Games: Torino
description:
A merchandising-game ordered by Italian Olympic committee and made by Italian "Fun Box".

Four boards, simulating runs and tracks of 8 different Winter Olympic disciplines.

Winner is the one that makes the most points.
Whoever wins gets the gold medal.

The box contains:
Dice
4 boards with runs and tracks
Colored pawns
Gold, silver and bronze medals

name: Death by Dice
description: Each player controls a character with six different traits, each represented by a different kind of dice (d6, d8, d4). Players choose which traits they wish to attack in and the players roll dice for the attack. Twisted little characters duke it out with dice. A fast-paced, strategy dice game played head to head using a combination of character attributes, special abilities, and lots of dice. (From the website) There are two editions to choose from: Nursery Wars - the gang from the Mother Goose tales gone horribly wrong, includes Ma Goose, Bo Peep, the Mice and One Angry Sheep; and the Gangland Edition, featuring 20s style mobsters such as Knuckles, Malice, and The Shadow. A single game can be played in five minutes, but has a Boss/Minion variation for those who want more dice and strategy options. Each set of Death by Dice includes two character boards and rules. 10 sets in all, dice not included.

name: Monopol Här  nu-utgåvan
description: In this newest edition of Stockholm monopoly you use credit cards instead of paper money. There are also new streets and new values to celebrate the 70th anniversary of Monopoly in Sweden.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Willi Wackel
description: The object of this game is to maintain the balance of poor Willi who is at the top of the ladder painting; you continually add paint buckets and hope he doesn't tip over.
publishers: Dujardin, Goliath Games, Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: DHV Round 1
description:
Drinking. History. Violence. A bar brawl of historical proportions. Round 1 includes two characters: Mahatma Zombie and Sintaclaws, and can be combined with DHV Round 2 to support up to 4 players.

As the attacker, play attacks, struggles, or booze, and the defender plays defends, struggles, or boozes.

Alternate cards until one player chooses to pass, wherein all the cards are resolved in reverse order.

Some cards will be blocked, some cards will be enhanced or reduced based on what was played, and many cards will deal damage to the opponent.

Refill your hand, reverse roles, and continue until sober.

Available from RobotMartini.com.

Combines with:

DHV Round 2

name: Real Soccer
description:
This Swedish table soccer game claims to be the only soccer simulating game in the world where players are freely moving. The secret is a Swedish patent that allows a player and the metallic stick, that is used to move the figure under the "grass", to have a magnetic connection that is not disturbed by other sticks or figures. Open/closed 106 x 49,5cm x 6,1cm / 54,5 x 49,5 x 12,2cm, weighs 3,9 kg.

There are five players per side, one goalkeeper, two defenders and two attackers. The goalkeeper and the two defenders can only move on one half of the gaming surface and the attackers on the other half.

This game is similar to Real Hockey

name: Monopoly: Puerto Rico
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A licensed Hasbro Monopoly variant set in Puerto Rico.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ohana Mana
description:
From the publisher:

This fun, educational, game teaches about the Hawaiian culture and the strength of the family, as well as the dangers of living on a volcanic island.

Throughout the game, Hawaiian words are followed by the pronunciation and the definition of each word in parenthesis to assist the players in learning about the Hawaiian culture. (Additional notes regarding the pronunciation of Hawaiian words are provided at the end of the game book.)

Each player has a 4-member 'ohana (oh-hah-na) (family) that they move around the board. Along the way, players gain mana (mah-nah) (spiritual energy) by doing good deeds to spread aloha (ah-loh-ha) (love), encountering cultural and geological sites, and answering questions about Hawai'i.

When two members of the same family meet on a space, they form a Family Bond which no player can pass unless they have enough mana (mah-nah) (spiritual energy). If a player has enough mana (mah-nah) (spiritual energy), they can also capture other players and send them back to Start. However, there are many environmental hazards which will keep players from reaching the top of the volcano. Therefore, players must be very careful not to collect too many kapu (kah-poo) (danger) cards!.

Good luck and mahalo (mah-hah-lo) (thank you) for spreading lots of aloha (ah-lo-ha) (love)!

name: MIG 4
description:
A traditional quiz game in Swedish. M.I.G stands for Mobile Intelligence Games. It is very small and easy to play everywhere. A very good game to bring on a trip.

Two dice are rolled, one to decide category and one to decide if you have a 'M.I.G-chance' and the other decides in what category the question is. If the player didn't roll a 'M.I.G-chance' they have to answer the question correct to have another roll of the dice. If the player has a 'M.I.G-chanse' they have the opportunity to score, either way it's the next players turn.

The first player to correctly answer a 'M.I.G-chance' in each category is the winner.

The questions come in 5 categories:

Now & Then (Nu & då)
Culture & Showbiz (Nöje & kultur)
Home & Away (När & Fjärran)
Sports & All sorts (Sport & blandat)
Nature & Science (Natur & teknik)

The game contains 312 cards with a total of 1560 questions.

name: Crocodile Chomp
description:
A reaction game for children. The crocodile is hungry and tries to catch the frog; the frogs try to flee when the crocodile gets activated.

One player is the crocodile player and turns over cards with various animals. When an awake and hungry crocodile shows up, the crocodile player hits the button to close the big mouth, and the other players hit their buttons to make their frogs jump away. If your frog gets catched, you get a bite marker; there are also penalties for trying to flee at the wrong moment (for example at the sleeping crocodile card).

A player with 5 bite markers is out of the game. Last frog player wins; the crocodile player can't win.

According to the box cover, the game needs 2 batteries. They are only necessary for the voice output, not for the mechanic.

name: E=M6 le jeu
description:
Close to Pandemic, with an environmental theme.

In this cooperative game, players face five major crises (melting north pole, ocean pollution, deforestation, air pollution and human impact) and attempt to save the Planet.

Players must plan their strategy together to stop these crises.

There is no specialists, but players draw a number of cards depending of their location, they can travel and use their cards as abilities to cure crisis.

It's an educational themed game to educate children about environmental issues.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Mäuse Trio
description:
Can you avoid three cats and dispose of all your cards.

The cards are actually called Guckloch-Karten and are triangle shaped (to represent a slice of cheese). Further more each card has six 'faces'. Each 'face' will either be a cat, or a mouse, or a hole. The holes mean that when it is placed on a stack, the 'faces' on the card underneath the holes will show through.

The game is played in rounds and a round ends when one player has no cards left.

Each player gets a stack of cards. The board is plastic and represents a cheese. In a turn a player takes the top card of his stack and chooses which side to play. Then he lays the card in the sliced area of the board. Then the next player does the same, and so on.

The object is to lay a card so that at least 3 mouse faces are visible. If this is acheived, the player can play another card. And so on, but no more than 3 cards can be played in a single turn. Should a player play a card that has three cat faces shown, that player must take up all the cards played so far and put them at the bottom of his stack. If you use your last card, you win the round and receive a cheese token.

The first player to get three cheese tokens, wins.

name: Sagas
description:
In this lightweight fantasy game you get a random race (elf/undead/human/orc or demon) and a random saga (fight/duel/treasure/mist/crown).

The races all have a leader and 3-4 soldiers. Elf, undead and human have 1 character with a ranged attack.

Each saga has a different goal. Fight saga is a battle between all characters. Duel is just the leaders fighting it out. In Treasure saga you´ll fight to get the most treasure chests. Mist saga is a bit like chinese checkers were you´ll have to get your characters over on the other side and stop your opponent getting across. The crown saga is a battle to have most characters around the crown at games end. The end of the game is random. An hourglas will start at a given time, and when you draw a red hourglass the game ends. The board is also randomly drawn. You´ll start at opposite ends.

The 5 races has small variations in their stats(move/dodge/attack and defend) and a few characters can shoot, if line-of-sight is good. Each round you can move and attack (close combat or ranged). If you start your turn in combat you´ll have to dodge to be able to move away from combat. All characters have 1 life, so if a character is hit and fails to defend it is dead. You have to roll equal-to or above your stat.

From the back of the box:

An easy and challenging game for the whole family. You are in charge of a group of warriors and must win the saga by using strategy and fantasy. The different groups, sagas and sceneries make the game a new adventure every time you play.

Each player selects a team of generic fantasy creatures, ranging from humans and ełves to undead and demons. Each team consists of 4 to 6 pieces.

When teams have been selected, one of the players rolls a ten-sided dice to determine which saga the players will play. These range from simple "Death matchs" to gathering chests.

Now the players form the board by placing lagre hexagon map pieces. Each map pieces contains smaller hexagons and terrain features like houses, trees and rocks.

Each saga (scenario) has a trigger. When a certain point in the game is reach, for example by losing half of your team, a set of "Time piece" markers is placed beside the game board. Each full turn a marker is turned and when a red time piece is revealed the game stops.

In the end points are calculated by simple measures such how many playing pieces you have left or how many treasure chests you've got.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: CAPO
description:
CAPO is played with two decks: CAPO cards and Territory cards. CAPO cards represent the city's five mafia families and are numbered from 1 - 10 (#1 being the CAPO) and also contains two Polizia (police) cards. Territory cards depict the city's districts.

The game's objective is to collect 4 Territory cards of the same color. Territory cards can be obtained by winning a round or winning a 'Battle'.

During a round players try to be the first to get rid of their CAPO cards and win a Territory card. Players can get rid of their cards by playing one card, two cards (a duo) or a combination of 4 cards (a CAPO hand).

Some cards have special features. The #9 (Cugine) for instance allows a player to challenge another player for a 'Battle'.

name: DrunkQuest: Drink Cozy
description: Provided during the various Kickstarter campaigns, the drink cozies feature a -3 drink indicator and give the user a permanent -3 drinks on any monster they must defeat.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Cheese Louise
description:
Any way you "slice it", Cheese Louise is a speedy test of cheddar challenges! Reach, spin and swap pieces of cheese to cover all the tasty toppings!

Each slice of bread contains a different combination of condiments -- peanut butter and jelly, pickles and ketchup, mustard and olives. Cover the toppings with the cheese slices so none of the fixins' can be seen through the holes of the cheese.

The player who finds the correct combo of bread and cheese first wins the card. But who will cover all their fixins' first? Combine speed and visual thinking skills and you'll be the BIG cheese!

name: Bau Cua Tom Ca
description:
The game bau cua tom ca is a traditional Vietnamese dice game primarily played during lunar new year/Tết/Chinese new year celebration. The game set consists of a gameboard and three six-sided dice. Each side of the dice displays one of the six characters of the game (Deer, Gourd, Rooster, Fish, Crab, and Prawn). The game board also displays all six characters that correspond with the dice.

Bau Cua Tom Ca is also known as Bau Cua Ca Cop or simply bầu cua in Vietnam, but its also played in China known as Hoo Hey How. Variations of this game also exist in other cultures such as Britain and France.

How to play:

To play, you will need a dealer (the house) and 1 or more players. There is generally no limit to the amount of players that can play which is one of the reasons it makes for a great party game. Each round starts after the dealer shakes the dice (covered in a dice bowl/plate. Once the dice have been shaken, players are allowed to guess the at the dice and place wagers on 0 or more character spots on the game board. Once all wagers have been placed, the dealer reveals the dice, by uncovering the dice. If the 1 or more of the dice match the player's wager, the house (dealer) must pay the player the amount equal to the player's wager. If the multiple dice match the player's wager, the dealer must pay the player his wager times the number of dice that match. If none of the dice match the player's wager, the dealer takes the wager.

name: Chicago
description: Simple dice game, normally played for drinks. Every round one of the players is the active player. The active player rolls three dice and is allowed to reroll them up to two times. He then adds the dice' values, which are 100 for a 1, 60 for a 6 and pip value for all other numbers. Then in turn all other players must try to achieve a higher number with maximal as many rerolls as the active player. If a player rolls a Chicago, which is a 300, all other players loose and he proceeds to be the active player.

name: Piraci z Odległych Mórz
description:
Take the role of a dangerous pirate and be the terror of distant lands. Complete missions, take part in incredible adventures and fight other players for the title of the most dangerous pirate. But watch out, the other pirates are not the only concern.

Players sail their small boats across the archipelago of the islands by rolling dice. On each island there is a different type of goods that is needed to fulfill the mission. There are sharks on the board that can attack players. There is also a middle field called "The Bermuda Polygon" that can make it easier or harder to move depending on player's luck. The adventure cards can also be played to modify the rules of the game or give special one-time bonuses.

name: Rail Raiders Infinite: Huckleberry's Riverboat Roll
description:
Description from the publisher:

Huckleberry's Riverboat Roll is an exciting addition to the sci-fi western board game, Rail Raiders Infinite. When players are ready to take a break from snagging booty and ducking the Lawbots in Rail Raiders Infinite, they can gather around the poker table and play to take their fellow player's double dollars.

Huckleberry's Riverboat Roll is a betting dice game, the object of the game is to win every other player's $$ tokens, using the custom poker dice. Players achieve this by playing a series of rounds, where players roll their dice and build a hand, bet on the hand, and then either win by having the best hand or by having every other player fold. Players' hands stay hidden behind the beautifully illustrated double-sided dice blinds and are only revealed once the betting is done.
categories: American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Zuiderfruit
description:
Zuiderfruit is created by HenMar Games in order of Zuiderspel, a boardgame fair in the Netherlands, for their 10th aniversary.
Zuiderfruit is a family game in which the players collecting the best fruits. The best fruits makes the most points.

Zuiderfruit is a game about harvesting fruit. A farmer is working together with his monkey to harvest the fruit. The more fruit he is bringing home, the more points the farmer will get. The monkey can be very naughty for the other farmers.

In a turn, you must trow 2 dice. You have to make actions with each die. You can walk with the farmer to collect the fruit, climb in trees with your monkey to harvest the fruit, or sending a bee into a tree to make some new fruit.
At the end of the game, the farmer with the most pionts will win the game.

name: The Game Changers
description:
Welcome to The Game Changers — eighty cards that can spice up ANY game you play! Yes, that's right, take any board or card game you like, and use one of the changers to mix things up! You decide how you'd like to change your favorite tabletop games.

This game — well, expansion for all games really — adds eleven possible modules to spice up your game experience. Pick a changer you would like to use, and add it to the game of your choice.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Sports
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Monopoly: Polska jest piękna
description: Monopoly Polska is a beautiful game designed for everyone who loves to play board games. In this edition, you travel around Poland with your family or a pack of friends. Buy the most beautiful places that you meet on your way and fields of service providers. Invest in houses and hotels, collect rent from your real estate. Exchange with other players. There are many ways to take the best places on the board. Invest wisely, be a tough negotiator - there is only one winner. Find your own way to get a fortune!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Flucht aus Berlin
description:
Trapped in the German capital.
In this thrilling escape adventure, all players have to work together to find an escape route from Berlin in good time during 8 different puzzles. The tricky puzzles lead you to the most popular sights of the metropolis - past the Brandenburg Gate, to the Museum Island and along the Berlin Wall. In a handy card format, this puzzle game transforms both a trip to Berlin and a cozy game evening into an exciting escape experience.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Gefangen in der deutschen Hauptstadt.
Bei diesem packenden Escape-Abenteuer müssen alle Spieler zusammenarbeiten, um rechtzeitig einen Fluchtweg aus Berlin zu finden. Die kniffligen Rätsel führen sie zu den beliebtesten Sehenswürdigkeiten der Metropole – am Brandenburger Tor vorbei, zur Museumsinsel und entlang der Berliner Mauer. In einem handlichen Kartenformat verwandelt dieses Rätselspiel sowohl eine Reise nach Berlin als auch einen gemütlichen Spieleabend in ein spannendes Escape-Erlebnis.

—description from the publisher

name: El Gran Descamisado
description:
El Gran Descamisado is a board game that combines strategy, general culture, consensus, chance, attention, verbal dexterity and mental agility. Through seven games that refer to the main milestones in the history of Peronism, an attempt will be made to obtain the seven "Peronist emblems" to become El Gran Descamisado.

To start the game, the players will concentrate their Peronist pawns at the “starting point” and will return there each time their game turn ends. In their corresponding turn, each partner must turn the historical clock. When the needle stops, it will indicate the game to be played, associated with a certain event in the history of Peronism. Each of these games may be individual, in pairs or in a group, as appropriate and will allow to win a Peronist emblem. This dynamic will be repeated until someone meets the ultimate goal of obtaining the 7 emblems.

"Pact of Loyalty": Game of pacts and agreements. Loyalty (and trust) ensures that both parties are favored. If ambition wins, it will become an all-or-nothing challenge.

"Trivia Compañera": Classic question and answer game about curious and historical data of Peronism.

"Choosing a candidate": Voting game where everyone chooses who they think best represents the topic of the slogan that summons them in the electoral act.

"The Renunciation": A game of strategy and chance, where three slogans must be answered blindly, accepting the consequences.

"Peronometer": Fun group game where attention and concentration will allow you to succeed in not stumbling in Peronist calls and gestures.

"La Censura": Classic game where you must guess a censored word from the clues and guidance of your partner, who will also be limited in not mentioning the prohibited words.

"Viva Perón": Verbal skill group game, showing creativity and ingenuity to create linguistic combinations against the clock.


El Gran Descamisado es un juego de mesa que combina estrategia, cultura general, consenso, azar, atención, destreza verbal y agilidad mental. A través de siete juegos que remiten a los principales hitos de la historia del peronismo, se intentará conseguir los siete “emblemas peronistas” para convertirse en EL GRAN DESCAMISADO. 

Para iniciar la partida los/las jugadores/as concentrarán sus peones peronistas en el “punto de inicio” y regresarán allí cada vez que finalice su turno de juego. En su turno correspondiente cada compañero o compañera deberá girar el reloj histórico. Cuando la aguja se detenga, ésta indicará el juego a desarrollar, asociado a determinado suceso de la historia del peronismo. Cada uno de estos juegos podrá ser individual, en duplas o grupal, según corresponda y permitirá ganar un emblema peronista. Se repetirá esta dinámica hasta que alguien cumpla el objetivo final de obtener los 7 emblemas.

Juegos:
1) 1945: 17 de Octubre “Día de la Lealtad”. Juego: “Pacto de lealtad” Emblema: Escudo PJ
2) 1946: Primera Presidencia. Juego: “Trivia compañera” Emblema: Marcha Peronista
3) 1947: Voto femenino. Ley 13.010. Juego: “Eligiendo candidato/a”. Emblema: Carnet de afiliación
4) 1951: Cabildo Abierto del Justicialismo. Juego: “La Renuncia”. Emblema: Bombo peronista
5) 1952: Segunda Presidencia. Juego: “Peronómetro”. Emblema: Choripan y vino
6) 1955: Golpe de Estado y Proscripción. Juego: “La Censura” Emblema: No me olvides
7) 1973: Tercera Presidencia. Juego: “Viva Perón”. Emblema: Dedos en V

“Pacto de Lealtad”: Juego de pactos y acuerdos. La lealtad (y confianza) asegura que ambas partes salgan favorecidas. Si gana la ambición, se transformará en un desafío a todo o nada.

“Trivia Compañera”: Clásico juego de preguntas y respuestas sobre datos curiosos e históricos del peronismo.

“Eligiendo candidato/a”: Juego de votación donde todos y todas eligen a quien creen que mejor representa el tópico de la consigna que los convoca en el acto eleccionario.

“La Renuncia”: Juego de estrategia y azar, donde deberá responderse a ciegas tres consignas acatando las consecuencias.

“Peronómetro”: Divertido juego grupal donde la atención y concentración permitirá salir airoso/a de no trastabillar en los llamados y ademanes peronistas.

“La Censura”: Clásico juego donde se deberá adivinar una palabra censurada a partir de las pistas y orientaciones de su compañero o compañera, que también se encontrará limitado/a en no mencionar las palabras prohibidas.

“Viva Perón”: Juego grupal de destreza verbal, debiendo demostrar la creatividad e ingenio para crear combinaciones lingüísticas contrarreloj.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Negotiation, Pattern Recognition, Voting

name: DICE PARK: Dungeons of Doom
description:
DICE PARK: Dungeons of Doom is a roll&write for 1 to 100 players ages 8 and up.

During 30-45 minutes games, players will have to use their dice to create the most frightening dungeon.

Roll your dice (5 in total) and use them to create a path in your Dungeon, place creatures and score the most points to become THE Dungeon Master!

—description from the publisher

name: Mountain, River, River, Sun
description: An extremely simple game, with extremely simple rules, that will nonetheless test your powers of observation, planning, and focus. Try to match the sequence on the goal card with the larger symbols on your cards, while simultaneously preventing your opponent from doing it first with theirs. Trickier than it sounds.

name: Pizzaria Maluca
description:
English:

The players must be true Pizza Makers, each one having to prepare a diferent recipe of pizza. In each slice of pizza is indicated the recipe to prepare it. During the preparation, some misfortunes can occur as lose or gain ingredients. The one who complete your slice of pizza first wins the game

Portuguese:

Os jogadores vão se transformar em verdadeiros pizzaiolos, cada um tendo que preparar uma pizza difrente. Em cada pizza estão indicados quais os ingredientes necessários para prepará-la. Durante a preparação, podem ocorrer alguns contratempos como ganhar ou peder ingredientes. Quem completar sua pizza primeiro vence o jogo.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Garfield Party Game
description:
The Knack of Partying with Garfield.

Forget your diet. Forget your manners. This game is made for gluttons. Attack the snacks and snatch your favorites - when you've grabbed eight, you've got the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: F.X. Schmid, Karto-Myynti Oy (Finnish Publisher), Murfett Regency, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Qube: Ympäri maailmaa
description: Trivia game about geography, cultures and travel destinations. Has 500 different questions and is small enough to carry with you when traveling.

name: The Island of Misfit Friends
description:
Island living was your dream - An island full of friends and a king who you thought was fair and kind. Boy, were you wrong. When candy was discovered on the island, the king got greedy and your friends got mean and unhappy. Now you want off the island. Matter of fact, everyone wants off the island.

The king will figure out your objective once SOMEONE leaves the island. Be the first and the only...

Manipulate the board to get three candies in a row to collect the candy, bribe the islanders to get wood, cloth, tools and rope, and hopefully get off the island. Watch out for the king, he has
quite the temper!

The goal is to collect wood, cloth, tools and rope to build and boat and be the first one off the island. You also will need to slow your "friends" down as only one will make it off the island. The King will see to that!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: Hatfields & McCoys
description: A wargame of the feud between the Hatfields and McCoys. Pieces are individual clan members and some have special abilities. Stills produce moonshine, which can be saved as victory points in case the game ends in a wedding, or consumed to make your pieces riled up to fight more fiercely. Game ends when one side is wiped out, or in a wedding. If a young male clan member of one side fights a young female clan member of the other side who's been skinny-dipping and one whups the other without getting riled up, there's a wedding.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Electronic Family Feud
description:
Come on down and play Americas favorite guessing game and face off against family and friends, This fast paced exciting electronic tabletop version of the hit television game show, Survey says--you're going to have a great time!

Contains - 1 game console, 1 stabilizer foot, 1 instruction manual and 2 score pads. Requires 4 "AA" batteries

The electronic unit will ask a question and each person writes down their top answers. When they finish, they advance the game and it will display the correct answers. The unit will ask if a person and got each answer right and if so, which opponent. The unit tracks the scores with the highest winning going to the final round!

name: Krasserfall
description:
Welcome to the annual competition at the Krasserfall!
Everyone wants to be in the race, nobody wants to finish first.

Why? The end of the route is a thundering waterfall! Who doesn't wants to land in the safety net at the fall gives everything so that the boats with their own crew drift as slowly as possible towards the abyss. Or, better yet, he quickly changes boats, or has someone else change boats. Whoever wins six medals first wins the game!

Four boats are mounted on long sheer plastic stripes, with the far end over the table edge and weighted by a big fish. The boats are occupied by crew members of the players.

In turn, the players roll a die, and (depending on the roll) either move a boat towards the waterfall, or let a crew member switch the boat. At some point, the boats will slide towards and down the waterfall (table edge). The crew members of the last boat in the race score 1-2 points (depending on size).

A player wins when he reaches 6 points after multiple races.

name: Snail Trail
description: The object of the game is to reach the Ladybug at the center of the snail-shell first. The board is a simple jigsaw puzzle, with the usual gorgeous Ravensburger illustrations and quality. The jigsaw board is put together, and players start by placing their pieces on their matching color bug at the start of the trail. By strategically distributing rolls between each of their two pieces, players can use their skill to win the race. Ages 6 to adults can play this game, and enjoy it equally.

name: Shake
description:
(from publisher's website:)
Roll the dice or pay the price. Shake is the ultimate dice game of risk and reward. It’s a roll of a die and then you make the call. Go for it and Shake – it can make you a big winner or break you and leave you with nothing. Shake is easy to learn and hard to stop. It’ll keep the whole family on the edge of their seat. The question is…..are you going to Shake! Includes 12 Shake dice, Shaker Case, instructions, and score pad.

name: Klussen met Koeien
description:
"Klussen met Koeien" is a humoristic card game from The Game Master which is called "Handy Cows" in English.
The game can roughly be translated as "Renovating with cows" or "Total Make over".

Just like the earlier "Koe zoekt Boer" (Happy Cows) it is inspired on realty TV shows. In this game the inspiration is found with Home Make-over programs.

The cows have big plans with the farm. Bertha, Gretha, Johanna, Jacoba en Klara search the best bulls who have the best tools to do the job. Of course the girls like a bull with heavy tools. But the bulls are nowhere in sight when the heavy works begins. It's time to search for the bulls to get them in action.

In this game you are the foreman who has to keep the bulls at work. Bulls with heavy tools give high victory points, but they have several weaknesses. Some of the bulls are not "doing it" in a safe way. Other bulls are lazy, hungry, noisy, bull shitters or not very smart or handy.

The game works as a standalone but can be combined with "Koe zoekt Boer" (Happy Cows) and "Gooishe Koeien" (Trendy Cows).
There also is a special card that is an expansion to "Koe zoekt Boer". This is the Power Bull, which allows you to take over a turn of another player. This way turning the nice teasing game Koe zoekt Boer in a really nasty party game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Skarb Zakonu
description:
Skarb Zakonu - "The Treasure of the Order" is a game of explorers. Players start in a library built - according to the legends - on ruins of a medieval castle of the Teutonic Order. Rumore are that there is a great treasure of the order hidden somewhere underground.

In addition to usual game components like pawns, game cards, and a two-floor board this game contains a DVD disc with more than 600 quests and riddles (a DVD player with the "random order play" feature is required). Players solve the puzzles and answer the questions using their DVD pilot, and according to their results they are instructed to move their pawns, draw cards or perform other activities.

name: Borderline: USA Edition
description:
This Crazy Eights variant was designed by TV star John Davidson and his wife.

Players start with hands of 8 cards which come from a deck consisting of states, bodies of water, Canada, Mexico, and wild cards. The cards have the name of the location on one side and a map on the other side, showing contiguous locations.

The object is to void your hand by playing a card with something that shares a borderline with the last card played. Wild cards when played are automatically considered a match and can then be named as any location in the deck except for those in the player's hand. If a player cannot play a contiguous card, cards are drawn from the deck and added to the player's hand until a card can be played.

Instead of drawing, a player can play a card that does not share a borderline and hope to not be challenged. Challenges can happen after any play. If the challenging player is correct, and the card played does not share a borderline, then the challenged player has to take back the card and take a card from the challenging player's hand. If the challenge is incorrect, the challenger takes a card from the deck and the challenged player gets another turn.

name: Karma Mini Round
description:
Description from the publisher:

Your goal in Karma Mini Round is to get rid of all your cards, although in this elimination game everyone wins except for the last player holding cards.

Each turn, you must play a card of equal or higher number to avoid picking up the entire discard pile. Move through your cards faster by playing doubles. The deck includes four types of Karma cards; they can get you out of a jam, but be careful because in this game what comes around goes around...

name: Czółko: Bez Cenzury
description:
Czółko: Bez Cenzury is a simple Polish party game use silly moves, accents and weird performances to convey the word or phrase on the card that’s on your friends head to help him or her guess it!

Use multiple exciting game variant like Bomb or Platypus to limit ways one can show the card contents!

The Uncensored Crew quickly sets off any adult party. Gather friends, partners or acquaintances and using the forehead as a game board, show your teammates a password from the 18+ category! The dungeon will provide you with an authentic explosion of laughter thanks to the bomb rule - forbidden passwords, and various ways of presenting passwords will add to the pictorial fun of the whole fun. Simple rules, slogan and instant gameplay for a recipe for an unforgettable event from Czółko: Bez Cenzury!

name: Cupcake Race
description:
Cupcake Race is a simple children's game for 2-4 players.

Players 'race' to complete their cupcake first, which involves spinning and moving around the board to the 'PARTY' at the finish line.

Stops along the way include Mix it, Bake it, Frost it, and Top it, each with a corresponding accessory to add to your cupcake, along with sprinkles of various shapes and colours.

The contents are of very high quality plastic, with a sturdy game board and box, however the game itself will likely entertain only the youngest players (ages 4+).

From the Box:
There's a party tonight, and you (and your opponents) have been asked to bring the cupcakes. The Race is on! Be the first player to MIX, BAKE, FROST, and TOP your cupcake by visiting all 4 corners, and collect sprinkles along the way. The first player to reach the party with a completed cupcake and a sprinkle of each color wins the cherry to put on the top! "Mix it, Bake it, Frost it, Top it! So Much Fun, You Just Can't Stop It!"

name: Hol's der Teufel
description:
All 38 cards are shuffled upside-down and evenly dealt to the players. Every player gets a total chip
value of '20'.

Each player must play one card when it is their turn. The starting player begins and plays one of his Devil cards onto the table. Then its the next players turn. The starting player must play a Devil card in one of the colors of the cards in the hand of the player to his left.
