categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Talent
description: Game contains 25 square tiles with labyrinth like graphics on them and a sand timer. Players alternately draw and place tiles to build enclosed areas and to connect the point values of the gold coins within the areas they closed.

name: Angelina Ballerina's Dancing Game
description:
Roll the dice and move around the board. When you land on an Angelina Ballerina space, draw a dance card, and then stand up and perform the depicted ballet step or position. The first person to collect 4 dance cards wins, but first they must perform a ballet routine using all 4 steps or positions shown on their cards.
Also includes a "Memory" variant in the rules, using the dance cards.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Black Stories 1+2
description:
Black Stories are morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

This was published as a special collector's edition with 110 stories, containing the 50 stories from Black Stories, the 50 stories from Black Stories 2 and 10 additional fan made stories.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: ID: The Identity Game
description:
"An adult conversation game for 3 or more players"

Example of play:

Pick a Personality Card: You're Julius Caesar. (Don't tell anyone).

Announce your category: You're a Political, Military or World Leader.

Then get players to guess who you are by giving clever answers to Question Cards.

Q: If you were a type of clothing, which would you be?

You might answer: A toga.

Q: If you were a type of food, which would you be?

You might answer: A salad.

Contents:

324 Personality cards
216 Question cards
150 Plastic chips

name: Trading Routes
description:
The South American Jungles are just bursting with little native tribes that aren't quite self-sufficient, but definitely quite up to being taking advantage of!

That's where you come in! You've just appointed yourself to do a little bartering on their behalf by connecting tribes based on what they produce and what they need. If you can get the last tribe on a route to produce what the first tribe on a route needs, the route will be completed and become yours!

Naturally there's a whole bunch of other greedy players trying to compete for the same routes and they'll do anything from thrown in a few ancient ruins to boost the value of a route to starting and stopping tribal wars!

TRADING ROUTES is another card game in Van der Veer Games' QuickPlay DBGC (Don't Busta Grey Cell!) series.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Sensationen
description:
Goal: Your Reporter should get the hottest Stories for your Newspaper.

In three separate races four multi color reporters each race for the hottest stories. Before beginning, the players bet on the reporters, who might bring the three Stories. Each round a player secretly determines, which race of the three races should be started or continued or which race is not run this turn. Now all fellow players determine which reporters are to run. After that, it is determined on which course the reporters will run.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Think Links
description:
From the box:

"50 games to develop thinking skills"
Game consists of a pack of cards with pictures or words on them.
publishers: De Bono Games, Field Educational Enterprises of Australia, Sydney, NSW

name: Skyline
description:
Players take turns moving their own Helicopter pawn around the board to land on an unoccupied square. Individual board squares may be colored to match one player’s color, or in a neutral color. The color of the landing site indicates which player (whether or not that is the active player) places one floor of a new building at this square.

The active player must then pay points to owners of all buildings over which the Helicopter has just flown. The pay rate is based on the total floor count for each color involved, and escalates steeply with increased floor count.

Turn ends with one additional floor of the appropriate color being added to each building flown over.

Some players may be eliminated early when unable to pay. Game ends when one player cannot move (cannot reach an empty square), or when one player has no more floors to place. Player with the most points wins.

name: Desire
description: Desire is a quick-playing card game that features women in outfits that are two sizes too small. I'm not sure how that relates to the game play, but that's the only detail I can speak of for now other than the title, so there it is.
publishers: Big Fun Games (Board Game), Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Story
description: Players alternate telling a themed story, weaving into the tale objects from the five illustrated Story cards face up on the table. When hearing an object named, the first among the other players to place their hand on the correct card claims it, replaces it with a new card from the draw pile and becomes the new storyteller. Storytellers are encouraged to be deceptive, for instance saying "fog" when there is a "frog" card on the table. If a player falls for the bluff, the storyteller earns a card. The player with the most cards in their collected stack when the deck runs out is the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: The Gender Gap (2nd Edition)
description:
From the box:

Gender Gap 2 is a game that tests both adult men and adult women on their ability to predict how other players really think about present day issues and situations. The questions are designed to be both topical and likely controversial, with the hope that it will create exciting discussion among the players regarding moral, ethical, relationship, parental and lifestyle topics. Gender Gap 2 deals with situations that are top of mind but sometimes never discussed.

Brief description:

Players take it in turn to act as a reader, reading aloud a statement relating to gender roles (i.e. "European men are more secure in their masculinity than North American men"). The reader than picks a rating from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree) and everyone else secretly tries to guess the readers choice.

The choice and all guesses are revealed simultaneously. Correct guessers roll the dice to move forward, everyone else moves back a number of spaces equal to the difference between the guess and the actual answer.

name: Movie Trivia Cards
description:
So you reckon you're the ultimate movie buff? Well get your film fanatic friends round and battle it out with our Retro Movie Trivia Game. Covering all the classics from Indiana Jones to Bridget Jones.

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Fascination (The Electric Maze Game)
description:
This game is basically a race between two players navigating the same maze.

Two large plastic reversible gameboards are used. The boards have a linear maze molded on one side and a circular maze on the other. The boards have "finish" holes at the top that each contain a metal contact. A wire leads from the board to a column that has lights in each players colour.

When the steel marbles used to navigate the maze all come into contact with their respective finish holes the column lights up in that players colour, indicating victory.
publishers: Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Endless Games (I), Parker Brothers, REMCO Games

name: Sukkube
description:
Sukkube is an abstract game in which each player represents a character of the circus: The Tamer, the Lion, the Presenter, the Clown, the Strong Man, and the Dancer. If fewer than six players are in the game, assign the remaining positions to the "bots", which will play automatically.

They are distributed, discoveries, five cards to each character.
The cards are played according to the rules.
These cards allow to rotate the cube, which is nothing other than the box itself of the game.

When any character ends his cards, or can not play any according to the rules, the round ends and the character on the upper face of the cube (the Dominator) earns a point. You rotate the cube of 180 degrees and the character that was at the bottom end of the previous round (the Sukkube) is the first to play in the new run. First player to reach 5 points Wins.

The game will test the predictive power of the players, having played all cards on the table.

Seven play variants let you experience different moods.

name: Atlantic, Chicago and Pacific Rails
description: Railroading game played out on an abstract map of the entire USA. Although not in the 18XX series, is in its vein as the center of interest and expertise is in management of the stock market, here represented by a matrix. Stock splits, dividends, bankruptcies and shareholder meetings are simulated. Meanwhile players move their pawns around the map's outer edge via card play or die roll. Not really a successor to Pacific Northwest Rails with which it shares cards, chips and cash. This many-faceted system is difficult to grasp in just one play,

name: Okänd planet
description:
The year is 2384. The Thornus planet is being surveyed by space explorers from Earth. The experts sent out has built six home bases to explore the planet and its resources.

By mistake one expedition takes with it the complete set of ignition keys to the space rockets on the planet. Without these keys the rockets cannot be started and thus it is not possible to leave the planet. The expedition is closely monitored by all bases, but what must not happen still happens - the expedition vanishes without a trace!

As a player you must form a rescue team and be the one to find the missing keys.
(Translated from the Swedish rules text)

Each player puts together a rescue team that braves the dangerous planet surface in order to move to the six scattered key sites of a lost expedition carrying the keys to all the rockets used to leave the planet. When you have found one of the three pairs of matching keys, return to any home base and point out the two identical key counters to win the game.

For your expedition you may choose 4 different members. You can choose between a captain, a doctor (who may heal wounded members), a technician (who may repair the terrain car), a zoologist, a geologist, and up to three soldiers (who collect food). Bringing along a varied team increases the chance your expedition contains a member with a chance of overcoming/avoiding the various hazards (terrains and events) you encounter on the planet.

Each turn you may you do one of the following:
- Move
- Hunt for provisions (only if there's at least one living soldier in your expedition)
- Repair the car (only if you brought along a technician and he/she is still alive)
- Perform surgery on a wounded expedition member (only if you brought along a doctor and he/she is still alive)


If you choose to move (drive the car), draw an event card.
If you move into difficult terrain, stop, and draw a terrain card.
Each turn, roll a die. If you roll 1-3, one piece of Provisions have been used up.


Terrain and event cards generally contain hazards that are bad for you: your car takes damage, a member of your expedition becomes wounded, you lose one turn, etc. Most cards specify one or two types of crew that is given a chance of negating the effects, should your expedition contain it.

Event cards can also mean you found scattered objects from the missing expedition. Collect enough and you are given a chance to look at and memorize one of the six key counters regardless of where your expedition is.

The game only exists in Swedish. Okänd planet = Unknown planet. Publishing year was 1984.

name: Playing Shakespeare
description: The board shows a wheel of Shakespeare's plays, split between the Comedies, Tragedies and Histories. Played in teams, you must get your pawns on 3 each by successfully completing quotes from the categories. Not guessing leads to miming. There are 37 plays, so you'd better know your Pericles from your Troilus & Cressida. The game includes a biography and digest of the plays and is supported by the Royal Shakespeare Company.

name: Big Bucks Baseball
description:
Not a stats based game and not a "replay" game. Teams are fictional and can be built based on fixed points or amount of money the team has. Players are of three average, good, exceptional and cost different amounts of money to "hire".
Money can either be a fixed amount in pick up games, or using the advanced economy rules, can be obtained from running concessions and selling broadcasting rights.

The dual-fold, multi-color game board folds for easy storage. Each comes with three teams of ten sculptured ABS figurines, each with individually stenciled numbers. A designated hitter is included on each team. Since the whole family can play BIG BUCKS BASEBALL, one set of figurines is female.

The game also includes 3 special challenging dice, 32 player upgrade snap rings, 12 ball/strike markers, 10 concession/broadcast replicas, 2 miniature game baseballs, 90 pieces of currency, 32 special event cards, 2 reproducible score sheets, and a complete instruction booklet and quick start guide. All of this is packaged in a compact 10-inch by 10-inch durable game box.

The game uses a unique system of roulette type spinner based on batter and pitcher's experience (3 levels) to determine the outcome of each pitch. Once a pitch is hit the defensive team can still field the ball using a system of color coded dice. Careful through, failing the fielding roll will increase the effectiveness of the hit (error). Also there are event cards such as injuries and automatic player upgrades (having a good night) which influence the game randomly.

name: Plus One
description: "Plus One, the 4-sided electronic computer, remembers every flip, every flop. You and your opponent alternately tumble Plus One down an invisible path on the gameboard by adding one move every turn. The course... of course... gets longer and more difficult with every turn! Listen to Plus One's guiding tones and watch its color caps for clues. But stray from the path and Plus One gives you the "razz"... you've lost! Plus One is the 4-sided electronic computer with the one-track mind. Give it a tumble for unforgettable fun!" It's very much like a board game version of Simon in which you move a pyramid shaped electronic device around a triangular board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Maze, Memory, Puzzle

name: Robo Force
description: Three dimensional game that uses the popomatic dice system. Be the first robot to rescue a Uni-Bot from evil Nazgar's tower and carry it to the space ship. Geared toward the 12 year old boys and younger crowd because of the hands on gameboard with knock 'em over, zap them off pieces and parts.

name: Sprint
description:
Build a bicycle racing track (rally-style) using varying puzzle-linked pieces, then race teams across the circuit, jostling for the better finish positions. Random events enliven the race.

Diset has another game of the same name ("Compact Sprint"), but the latter is a completely different children's animal racing game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Battle For Smithville II: An R.I.P. Cardgame
description:
The Battle for Smithville II is a two player card game. It was published in R.I.P. magazine #6.

Included in the game are rules and sheets of cut-apart cards.

Part rummy, part concentration, players play, then flip cards to match adversaries. If the adversaries battle, the player gains points. The one with the most points after all of the cards have been played, wins.

name: Zombie Nation
description:
Zombie Nation, the Battle for More than Smithville (Part IV), is a game for two players that continues the battle started in Zombie Rampage (q.v.). This game was published in R.I.P. magazine #4.

The game contains a map of the U.S., 3 pages of rules and one sheet of cutout counters.

The Zombie player has sent out mystical Graveyard Icons across the U.S. and the Army has been called in to put a stop to any further uprisings. To win, the Zombie player must destroy all of the Army forces. The Army player must destroy all of the Zombies and their icons.

name: The Mall Game
description: The Mall Game, Richmar Incorporated, 1977. I assume that this one was sold at shopping malls in the seventies. Somewhat Monopoly-like. You buy a lot and then lease stores. Although it looks pretty dull, this is a *fantastic* game as far as looking back at so many stores that no longer exist and the great seventies USA mega-mall boom in general. And who couldn't like a game where young players shop at the now-defunct Fredericks of Hollywood for a fancy nightie?
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Bluenose
description:
Bluenose is a fishing game based on the famous Canadian sailing ship Bluenose. The object of the game is to navigate your ship out to the fishing grounds and return safely with a catch of fish which are sold at market. The prices of the market are controlled by cards. The price of half of the fishing commodities are known and the other half hidden at all times. Navigation out to the fishing grounds is done by rolling a die. In addition, there are wind currents to speed up movement and shallows and rocks to avoid. The paths closer to the rocks are riskier, but generally faster. A collision with rocks causes a shipwreck and the loss of your catch.

The first person to reach the agreed-upon amount of money (through selling fish at market) is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bias, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TerraTopia
description:
TerraTopia was released by The Nature Company chain of stores as a product for their children's group, Kids' Club for Nature. There was a comic book about the characters used in the game, a group of five kids who each had the ability to turn into a different animal.

The game is cooperative. The kids have been placed on the planet TerraTopia and have to each find their colored stone before the planet's three moons meet (or something along those lines). The players can choose to travel around the board together or separately.

The game was designed by Peter Olotka, one of the Eon Products team, and his son Greg. The game definitely shows some of the Eon originality in the mechanics. The players have to recover their stones by overcoming challenges at various locations on the board. There are a large number of possible challenges, generated by randomly placing generic challenge markers (e.g., "Fog") at the various locations and having a booklet which describes exactly what Fog means at each location. The players have to be able to explain to each other how they would use their character's "powers" (shape-changing and normal talents) to overcome the challenges.

name: The Lawyers Game
description:
Your chance to be a Judge, part of the Jury and a Defense Lawyer in a courtroom drama that will crack you up. Starring such notorious criminals as Mr. I.M. Greedy accused of insider dealing, Xerox Van Gogh accused of forgery, and Princess Kleptomania of Kuwait accused of shoplifting, you will be working with a choice of nearly forty dubious defendants.

Each player must take a case to explain away the known facts on their Crime Card in under two minutes, suffer the cross examination of their fellow players and succeed in predicting the jury's verdict following your stirring defense.

Any actual knowledge of the law may be a handicap, so top lawyers will probably do well.

Contents: 36 Crime Cards, 6 Innocent Cards, 6 Guilty Cards, 1 Timer, 1 Plastic Tray, Instructions.

name: Bird Brain
description: A "cagey card game" LOL! Looks like the idea is to get rid of your cards based on the spinner that tells you what colored card to choose. Interesting plastic set-up. Looks good for kids.

name: Starwords
description:
From the box:

At last, a co-operative word game! Everyone makes words to cover as many Star Spaces as you can. But each word must be about what you see in the picture. The picture changes. Letters get recycled. Letters are given away. Discuss, share & compare ideas in a natural, friendly way. Yes, you can look up words in the dictionary. No, you don't have to hide behind your letters. Word wizards can play the Advanced Version in which dice are rolled to see what kind of word has to be formed. Antonym? Adjective? Adverb? Noun? Verb? Rhyme?

Family members, students, or friends who simply enjoy word games will find STARWORDS a very refreshing treat! Nervous beginners can play along side of experts. Each makes their best contribution. Play for fun, not blood.

name: Yep!
description: Playing the Yep cards with one hand only, while the other you're holding on your card pile, and react on right color card.

name: Rummikub 500
description:
Players lay down runs and sets on a game board marked out in a grid with each player having his own color quadrant. The runs and sets can tie together like a crossword puzzle. The player to go out first gets to score all the runs and sets that start in his own color as well as any that may connect with them regardless of their location on the board. The first to reach 500 points wins.

This is the game that ties Rummy to Scrabble and makes it loads of fun.

name: Andersonville
description:
"Andersonville is a very simple card game for three or four players. Its theme is based on life in the notorious Andersonville prison camp that operated in Georgia during the American Civil War. Originally designed to hold 10,000 men, the 26 acre camp would end up holding 33,000 prisoners during its busiest month of operation. Between the months of February 1864 and April 1865, 13,000 Union prisoners died there.

The object of Andersonville is to finish with the most Survival points. To achieve this end, players will need to use strategy, bluff, and some diplomacy."

Panzerschreck Magazine, Issue 7, Winter 2001-02.
This card game has four Player Card decks (numbered 1-10) and a 46 numbered Action cards, Survival chits, and Health markers. Special rules are given for solitaire and two-player versions.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Civil War, Bluffing, Card Game, Civil War

name: Chameleo Chameleo
description:
The players token is always allowed to as many spaces as the virus on the board shows. Virii and tokens always move the same number of spaces.
The goal is to place a large number of tiles of the same color in one space. But you always have to place the color that the virus shows.

name: The Berenstain Bears Messy Room Game
description: It's a challenging competition to clean up the messiest room in all bear country, brother and sister's outrageous room. Just be the first to fill your puzzle frame with all nine clean pieces and you win.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Raggedy Ann A Little Folks Game
description:
Raggedy Ann is a junior game for little children. It's fun-filled with brightly colored pictures of Raggedy Ann and her friends. Players build pictures of Raggedy Ann and Witch Wiggle, using cards obtained by matching the spin of the spinner with characters on the board.

The 1954 "yellow" version of the game contains 32 cards: 24 Raggedy Ann cards (four sets of six cards, each set making a complete picture of Raggedy Ann) and eight cards with the head of Uncle Clem on them. As players complete their pictures of Raggedy Ann, extra cards (duplicate Raggedy Ann cards and Uncle Clem cards) are kept in their hand. Players can choose, on their turn, to draw from other players' hands instead of spinning the dial or if the pile he spins to is empty.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Liar's Poker
description: The objective of the game is to successfully bid the serial number on your Liar's Poker money so that you become the wealthiest person in the game, thereby forcing your opponents out of the game. The game includes Liar's money and a spinner which determines odds paid to and collected from the individual players.

name: Froggles
description:
The gameboard is a turnable device. At the beginning of the game put the frogs in the holes in the board.
When the board turns a spring is randomly activated and the frogs leap out of their holes.
Each player has a net to catch the leaping frogs.

If there is no frog left, the game ends. The player that caught the most frogs wins the game.
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Oonie Moonie Goonie!
description: Turn over your cards one at a time. Watch your opponents turn over theirs. Match three-of-a-kind and shout OONIE MOONIE GOONIE. Children and adults alike will love playing this fast-paced matching game. The one who collects the most cards is the winner.

name: Herz an Herz
description:
Theme
Almost non-existent. Cards are numbered and have hearts printed on them.

Goal
Gaining the most points by laying down cards in columns/rows in descending order.

Game play
There are 100 cards numbered 1-100. These cards are grouped into 4 groups of 25 (1-25, 26-51,...), with the groups being different from each other in background colour.
Additionally, there are four jokers (one for each colour; can be used as a number of your choice within that colour's range), two super jokers (that can be used as any number), and 4 thief cards (allow you to steal another player's lowest card and place it in your own display as long as its value is lower than the lowest card already in your display).
At the start of the game, some cards are removed if playing with fewer than 4 players. The remaining cards are shuffled and placed in a face-down stack.
Players take turns. On your turn, you draw the top card from the stack and decide if you want to keep or discard it.
The first card that you keep is placed in front of you in landscape orientation. Below this first card, you can later put additional cards. These are placed in two columns. Each card that you put down has to have a lower value than the previous card.

A round ends when

a player has accumulated two rows with 6 cards each, or
the draw deck has been exhausted.


Points are counted as follows:

Each row with two cards counts two points.
If both cards in a row are the same colour, you get an additional point.
Complete rows with a coloured joker also get you a bonus points (rows with super jokers don't).
Rows with only one card count zero points.


The game ends after 4 rounds, and the player with the highest total score wins the game.

name: Words from Words
description: Roll the die and move around the board. If you land on a letter square, draw a card with a long word on it. You have 60 seconds to find the longest word using the letters in the card word. You move a variable number of spaces depending on the length of the found word. The other players can challenge you by spelling out a longer word. There is a small dictionary that lists all spellable words for each card word. Game includes over 400 word cards, 25 tokens for scoring, 1 d6 and a 1 min sand timer.

name: What's My Line?
description:
From the old time television show of the 1950's. (remember Dorothy Killgalen and Bennett Cerf!).

That's one down and nine to go.... From the show that coined the phrase, "is it bigger than a breadbox?" What's My Line is the classic guessing game. Players ask yes or no questions to unravel the unusual occupation of the guest contestant. Get a no answer and play moves on to the next guesser. With photos of actual people, a TV screen to put them in, and blindfolds like the ones on the classic game show, What's My Line is destined to evoke memories, laughter and hours of endless fun.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling
publishers: Endless Games (I), Lowell Toy Mfg., Noris Spiele, Past Times, Pepys (Castell Brothers), Whitman

name: Spin to Win
description:
CONTENTS:
colorful board
plastic transparent over board with holes to hold the spinners
4x 3 spinners

PLAY
Each player takes 3 tops of the same color and spins one top per turn from his colored bay, which is his starting area.
The tops will stop in one of the numbered holes (2-3-4 o 5)
The players write down their scores after the 3 turns and start all over again.

You can play to 100, 200 or more points.

name: Natural Selection
description:
From the publisher, Alien Menace:

Natural Selection is the thrilling prequel to the bestselling Alien Menace game, Sucking Vacuum! Did you ever wonder how that monkey got on the International Space Station? What trials did our small hairy friend rise above to secure his place on the doomed station? It’s a great story packed with love, drama, intrigue and monkeys throwing poop. And unlike George Lucas, the guys at Alien Menace know how to make a prequel.

As the role of the great apes in exploration expands, more advanced testing is required to develop a higher level of human/simian synergy. The International Space Station provides just such an opportunity. Join the eight great apes in their quest to be chosen for this monumental mission!

Monkeys are funny...Everybody loves monkeys.

name: Stalinallee
description: Simple game asking for knowledge about Stalinallee, Berlin, about 1950, with some more or less humorous elements drawn from GDR everyday life.

name: Pizza Fraction Fun
description: Time to make a pizza! This clever game teaches fraction concepts and skills using slices of pizza to identify fraction denominations. Children play seven different games to practice identifying fractions, matching fraction equivalents and performing fraction addition and subtraction by building pizzas. Game includes 13 double-sided pizzas (one side shows fractions) and three double-sided spinners providing different levels of learning. Age 6 - 12

name: The Magnetic Football Game: Super Soccer
description:
A playing surface or pitch which is made from metal with a wooden surround and painted with the appropriate pitch marking, two goal posts, five players, all with metal bases, and four playing sticks with which you control your players and the ball from the underside and which you use to score goals. It stand of four detachable legs.

There may be an earlier version that dates as far back as the 50's.

name: The Big Book of Board Games
description:
The Big Book of Board Games is a 9¾"×12½" softcover coloring book with fourteen classic games to color and play, including: The Royal Game of Ur, Nine Men's Morris, The Game of Goose, Snakes & Ladders, Chinese Checkers, Shove Ha'penny, Awithlaknannai, Backgammon, Glückshaus, Alquerque, Pachisi, Go-Bang, Asalto, and Senet.

ISBN: 0-89844-002-5
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Out of Control
description: Played with a deck of 92 cards (two sets of cards numbered 1-10 in four colors, along with 12 wild cards), the object of Out of Control is to be first to complete a succession of cards from 1 to 10 in ascending order in a single color. A six-color die adds the twists to the game, with each color on the die representing a different instruction/action (such as "take a card from another player and add it to your hand").

name: eenie meenie minie moe
description: In this elimination game, you must be able to tell the truth from a tall tale. Here are four statements, one of which is a lie. Can you tell which one? eenie: Vesustrapphobia is the fear of beautiful women. meenie: A flounder’s eyes start out on both sides of its head but end up on one side. minie: Paul Revere was a dentist. moe: noodles poached in pear juice is a popular Dutch dessert. If you answer this correctly, you have to move forward one space and follow the instructions on that space. Might be advantageous, might not. So you’ll need a dash of strategy with your smarts. The answer? The Dutch are gagging! moe is a lie. Game comes with a game board, 6 tokens, 750 question cards and a rules sheet.

name: Kasserine: The Baptism of Fire, February 1943
description:
Beautiful map and beautiful, readable counters in a remake of a game originally part of Four Battles in North Africa.

Rules for combat were modified from the original. The game simulates the battles between Allied and Axis forces near the end of the North African campaign of World War II. Little historical background is included in the game materials.
publishers: Fresno Gaming Association History Games, History Games

name: Taz-Mayhem
description:
Taz playing cards is a deck of 52 cards plus 2 jokers featuring the Looney Tunes Tasmain Devil that can be used Standard Deck Playing Card Games. In addition each of the standard 52 cards is marked with one or two trails that go from middle of one side of the card to another. Rules are provided in English and French for the Taz-Mayhem game which uses these trails as well as the traditional card features.

Two players start with seven cards each. On your turn you add card to the pattern on the table, you must follow suit if you can. If you can't play you must draw a card from the deck, but can play that card if appropriate. The person playing the highest card of a round draws an additional card from the deck. The winner is the first person to get rid of all their cards.

From the back of the box:

##@!&**%^#!!!
Follow Taz throught a high energy games of Taz-Mayhem, game rules included.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Turtle Picnic
description:
From the package:
The turtles are on a picnic, and they need your help to find food! Turn over lily pads to reveal colorful snacks. Then flip the shell on a turtle's back - if the colors match, you keep the snack!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Richard Petty Racing Trivia Game
description: Like trivial pursuit but all about stock car racing and Richard Petty, Great game for that racing fan or for the Richard Petty collector. 1,000 questions. Categories: Pure Petty, Daring Drivers, Rolling Thunder, Hot Tracks, & Super Sponsors.

name: NFL Power Sweep
description:
Game description from the box:

"NFL Power Sweep is a game of both offense and defense. A player cannot win by concentrating on one phase of the game and neglecting the other. While advancing on an opponent's goal, he must also protect his goal. A player should be particularly aware of the position of both his and his opponent's backs at all times. They are the "power men." Their versatility provides the offensive thrust of the game, and the need for good defensive planning."

Basically, this is a game of Chess with football players.

name: Barbie: The Princess and the Pauper Game
description:
From the Manufacturer:

The only board game based on the Barbie video "Barbie as The Princess and The Pauper". Journey through the enchanted forest and help to rescue the princess.

From me: You roll dice and move around the enchanted forest, trying to bring the princess and the pauper (both of whom look surprisingly like Barbie) together.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: MASK: Raid and Rescue Game
description:
VENOM (Vicious Evil Network of Mayhem) has captured several MASK (Mobile Armored Strike Kommand) Super Vehicles. Your mission, as a member of the MASK force, is to locate and recover these valuable Super Vehicles. But beware! VENOM spies have infiltrated the MASK force. Disguised as MASK members, these VENOM agents can surface at any time and take back your Super Vehicles. Good luck!

The object of the game is to be the first player to collect 5 pairs of MASK Super Vehicle and/or Boulder Hill Bunker cards.

Ages 6 - 12

name: Pagoda
description:
From the box:

The classic Chinese game of tower building
On each turn try to complete the tower on the purple base.
One move allows you to break a stack at any point and place it on another...
... but you must have your three sections one on top of the other to win!

Components:
12 tower sections, 3 each in 4 colours
1 roof
1 purple base
1 game board
1 die

Based tenuously on the tower of Hanoi, each player has 3 tiers in their colour, and attempts to assemble the complete tower. They get a number of actions determined by the die, and only win if they can (a) assemble the complete stack, and (b) have all their pieces together.

name: Hatz Fatz
description: A fast and action filled card game where the players are trying to hunt the most valuable animals in the forest. All the cards are spread out on the table with their back side up, forming the forest. When it is a player's turn, he can either reveal a new animal in the forest by flipping a card, or start a hunt for one kind of animal by playing a card from his hand. If a hunt is initiated, all players simultaneously try to pick up as many animals as possible of that type. At the end, the value of each caught animal is decided by how many times that kind have been hunted.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Cosmopoly et megapoly
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #27

Players try to buy as much land to build as many building as possible to enrich themselves and drive other players bankrupt.

name: Main basse sur la ville
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #39

Four former adventurers try to seize power in a city by gathering economic, religious and military power.

name: Astro Launch
description:
From the box cover:

A new exciting space game

Similar to Parcheesi/Aggravation/Trouble however players can take a short cut across the globe back to home if they are lucky with the roll of the die. A precursor to the "Pop-O-Matic", the die is rolled via a knob on each side of the game that pulls and releases a small spring-loaded "plunger" under the die.

name: Kids Rule!
description: It’s the first game where kids get to be parents! Kids, if you’re tired of hearing “Because I said so” as the answer to your questions, here’s your chance to turn the tables. Each question is a scenario that most parents must face at some point while raising their children. Your son comes home with blue hair on the night of your brother’s wedding. What do you do? But the answer isn’t what the parents want, it’s what the kids want, because in this game – Kids Rule! The game questions were written by parents, and the answers were selected entirely by 8-14 year old children at the San Francisco School in San Francisco, CA. Everyone will have fun trying to guess how kids would behave if they were in charge. It’s a great way for parents and children to bond, understand one another, and discuss the myriad of issues that they will both face as the youngsters grow from kids to adults. (The kids’ answer, by the way, is to make the son wear a scarf or tie that matches the hair!) Game comes with 216 question cards, 4 playing pieces, game board, and instructions.

name: Liars Bluff
description: Very similar to Liar's Dice. Instead of rolling dice, players are dealt cards with poker hands on them. Examples: Jack-high hand, a pair of sevens, four queens. There are no straights, flushes, or full houses, only a specified card and the number of copies of that card in the hand. Each player is dealt the same number of cards (1 - 7). Players then bid on the combined hands of all players. A player that bids seven kings is betting that there will be seven or more kings total in everyone's hands. To bid, each player must bid either a higher number of matching cards, or the same number of a higher ranked cards. (So, to overbid seven kings, bid seven aces, or eight or more of anything.) When players think someone has bid more than the cards will support, they call "liar". Once everyone around the table has called "liar" rather than keep bidding, the cards are shown. If someone is called a liar, but the cards prove him right, he wins the pot of chips accumulated during the bidding. If he loses, the chips remain in the pot for the next hand.

name: Disney Presents: Follow That Mouse Game
description:
This is a childrens memory game with a Mickey Mouse theme. In the basic game, each player takes a board with 6 shapes of various colors on it. On a turn, you draw a tile from the centerboard and look at it. If it matches the color and shape of a space on your gameboard, you place it on the empty board space. To win, be the first player to fill your 6 spaces with matching tokens.

In the advanced game, players use the reverse sides of their boards. Each board depicts a different land at Disney World. Play is the same for the basic game, but you must match the pictures on the tokens to the corresponding Disney ride depicted on your 6 board spaces.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tip the Scale
description:
From the publisher's web site:

Test your balancing ability with this fun and fast-paced game where you must balance "Tipsy, the Scale" with various objects in your hand! Add a Bowling Ball to one side - a Bushel of Apples and a Rooster to the other to equal 11 pounds on each side! Balance the objects and collect the cards, or otherwise add an object and let the next player try. But watch out for the "Tip the Scale" card that will tip all of the cards back into your hand!

name: Life is Ruff
description:
From the instructions:

"Concept:

Life is a cycle of paychecks, bills and taxes that make it seem almost impossible to 'get ahead.' It has even been said that there are only two certainties in life...death and taxes. Today, of course, there is a third certainty...INFLATION!!

LIFE IS RUFF is about the cycle of income vs. outgo. As in reality, the proper investments can help you beat inflation and ride the waves of a fluctuating economy. In somewhat simplified terms, LIFE IS RUFF offers the player the same investment opportunities he has in real life and gives each player the opportunity to make investment decisions. But any opportunity not taken may be lost, for inflation hits when you least expect it.

There are those who will gamble, who will feel lucky, who will try to beat the odds and make a killing. For those we have included the stock exchange and futures market. There is a fortune to be made there, or lost. A player may choose to speculate in real estate, buy a home to get a tax break or keep his assets liquid by renting. All of these choices, and more, are yours and after all LIFE IS RUFF is only a game...or is it?

OBJECTIVE:

Each player attempts to obtain a survival package of items that have intrinsic value and are counter-cyclical to inflation. (Their value rises with inflation instead of declining.) Players, of course, must have cash to purchase these items (gold, silver, food storage, collectibles, diamonds, property) and the purchasing power of the dollar declines as the game progresses causing prices to "rise." The player who has the greatest number of survival assets (points) when RUNAWAY INFLATION strikes (making paper money worthless) is the best prepared and is the WINNER."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Junior fantasi
description: Drawing game for children. The players draw an assignment which they have to draw and the other players have to guess what it is.

name: Besiege
description:
BESIEGE is an interesting game of strategy and skill, where players can choose to be either the defenders of a castle, or the attackers trying to scale the walls, or batter down the gates. No dice are involved - movement and combat is decided by cards held by the players. The interesting part is in deciding when and where to play specific cards.

In addition to the various siege weapons, the players must contend with dwindling water supplies and disease. The game provided an interesting insight into the mechanics and psychology of siege warfare, while remaining an easy to learn, and fast paced game.

The game actually contains two separate versions of the game - a quick and easy version for younger players, together with the full-length version.

name: You Must Be Joking
description:
From the back of the box:

You Must Be Joking is the sensational game that plays on words and contains thousands of witty and pun filled cards designed to confuse and amuse you. Clues are read aloud and players try to spot their double meanings which will lead them to the correct answer. The results are always hilarious.
publishers: Action GT, Canada Games Company Lmt.

name: Fliegenfänger
description:
The gameboard represents a gully grid. A game about horse droppings and flies.

The circular game board is divided into six sectors of different color. Each sector has 15 empty fields (cobble stones). Every player selects one sector as his home turf. The aim of the game is to fill all fields of a single sector with tokens (flies) but keep your own sector clear. Players roll dice and move special tokens (horse droppings) to attract the flies into the sector of their opponents. The player whose home sector holds the fewest fly tokens at the end wins the game.

Flycatcher is a derivative of the game Circus Roncalli which was published by Schmidt in 1986.

Edition Spielbox No. 61
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Miss America Pageant
description: This game recreates The Miss America Pageant with players competing in the Swimsuit, Talent, Personality and Evening Gown competitions. The game uses a spinner shaped to look like a television camera. On your turn, you spin the spinner and advance the number of spaces indicated. If you land on a competition space, you draw a card that tells you what score you received for that event. When you have cards from all the competitions, you place your contestant piece on one of the 3 Semi-Final spaces and start a new contestant. It is possible for a player to have 0, 1, 2 or 3 contestants in the Semi-Final judging. When all 3 Semi-Finalist spaces are filled, the player with the highest point score moves her contestant to a Finalist space. A new round is then played and so on until all 5 Finalist spaces are filled around the base of the camera. The spinner is then spun and the contestant in front of the camera pointer is named 4th runner up and removed. This process is repeated eliminating 1 contestant at a time. The remaining contestant is named Miss America, and the player who controls her wins the game.

name: Orbit
description: The object of this track game is to be the first player to move each of his or her 6 space ships from Earth to another planet. On your turn you spin the spinner and advance a ship the number of spaces indicated. When you reach a planet, you must "orbit" it by following the track arrows around it. If you land on a space marked with a red triangle, you may leave orbit and head for another planet through the connecting path. If you stop on a space with a ship pictured, you may land on the planet. If you land on an opponent's ship, you send that ship back to earth. The first player to land all 6 of his or her ships on 6 different planets is the winner.

name: The Great Victorian Cycle Race
description: "Join the eccentric Victorians"... This simple and atmospheric die-based race game poses Victorians racing different kinds of late-19th century bicycles across a decorative game board. Players collect equipment that helps (oil can, lantern) overcome obstacles. Made in England.

name: Pocket Trivia: Gen-X 80s & 90s
description:
Trivia game about Generation X consisting of 52 cards with 16 questions on each card. Lots of 1980s and 1990s trivia.

One player takes the top card from the deck and reads a question aloud. The person to the card reader's left gives an answer. If incorrect, the next player (clockwise) guesses, and so on. If correct, the person who guessed correctly keeps the card; this person becomes the reader; he reveals the next card from the deck and reads it aloud. If nobody guesses correctly, the answer is revealed and nobody gets the card.

Play continues until no cards are left in the deck. The winner is the person who has the most cards.

name: Myths and Legends
description:
Greek MYTHS & LEGENDS To Learn While You Play

A deck of 52 nicely illustrated cards consisting of 13 Greek myths, with 4 cards per myth. The object of the game is to collect the most points by collecting myth cards telling the stories. It is played in the manner of The Game of Authors or Go Fish.

For example, the Voyage of Odysseus myth includes cards for Odysseus, Scylla, Charybdis and Penelope. A phrase that is one-quarter of the myth is told on each card's text.

Other myths include Zeus Conquers, Heracles' Labors, Apollo's Island, Aphrodite Marries, Athena's City, Jason & the Argonauts, Persephone Kidnapped, Leda & the Swan, Helen Abducted, Theseus Kills Minotaur, Rhea's Trickery, and The Afterworld.

There is also a pronunciation card: Charybdis = keh RIB dis, Elysian = ee LEESH en, etc.

name: Yankee Trader
description:
Players start from San Francisco on an around the world trading trip. By buying and selling wisely at various ports around the world players may make a profitable voyage.

Players start with 10,000 in cash which is used to invest in various goods that are available at different ports along the way.

First player to get to New York gets a bonus payoff for being the fastest finisher.

Whoever makes the most money on the trip wins the game

name: Allowance
description:
From the Publisher:

Allowance provides a great way to teach young people about earning and saving money, as well as wisely making special purchases. Game cards indicate a task like mowing lawns and cleaning the garage. Choices are made, as in real life, whether to spend money on ice cream, or put it into savings. Coin chips from one cent to fifty cents and currency from $1 to $5 are included.
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Educational, Math, Number

name: Bible Books
description:
Bible card game designed to help children learn the order of the books of the New Testament.

Players try to get rid of all the cards in their hand by playing them into stacks on the table. A card cannot be played unless it is later in the bible than the top most card.

First player to get rid of all their cards wins.

name: San Francisco in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in San Francisco, California. It has spaces such as Ghiradelli Square, Alcatraz, Cow Palace, Golden Gate Bridge, Nob Hill, Chinatown, and Cable Cars. The tokens include a bridge, heart, Trans America Building, sailboat, trolley car, and a fortune cookie. Cards include local events and staples of life in San Francisco.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Montreal in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Monteal, Quebec. It has spaces such as Festival Juste Pour Rire, Centre Molson, Place Jaques-Cartier, Parc Des Iles, Ville Souterraine, and Vieux-Port. The tokens include a hockey skate, snowman, bagel, stadium, sax, clown or mime. Cards include local events and staples of life in Montreal.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Reading Roadway USA
description:
From the manufacturer:

Travel the USA discovering fascinating facts while building reading comprehension skills. Players take turns spinning and moving their cars across the country reading aloud fun-filled facts based on the state they landed on. The first person to comprehend and correctly answer the trivia question asked collects a souvenir. Be careful, spin a tornado and you could go whirling! The first player back to their home state with 4 souvenirs wins.

name: Six Victorian & Edwardian Board Games
description:
From the book cover:

"Here are six authentic board games from the Victorian and Edwardian period ready to play. Everything you need is here - the playing boards with their charming illustrations, counters and full instructions.

Chosen by Christie's expert, Olivia Bristol, each game is in its original form. Family entertainment as it was enjoyed 100 years ago."

Includes the following games:
The Prince's Quest
A Day at the Zoo with Daddy
Cycling
The Wonders of The Deep
A Trip to Mars
The Tailess Donkey
publishers: Michael O'Mara Books, Saint Martin's Press

name: The Pollution Game
description: The Pollution Game allows students to simulate in a game the progressive contamination of our environment and then try to reverse the contamination to preserve the environment. During this game, students will experience the antagonisms and frustrations of trying to change technology and social behavior.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading, Voting
publishers: Eductional Research Council of America, Ernst Klett Verlag, Harlekin, IWA Rechenschieberfabrik

name: Triple Flips 3: Wild Animals
description:
Triple Flips 3 includes Save the Whale, Call of the Wild, and Cheetah Race.


Save the Whale is a game for 2-4 players. As the whale moves slowly around the outside of the main playfield, players try to exit the playfield directly on or adjacent to the whale, scoring 10 or 5 points respectively. The goal is 25 points. About 2/3 of the playfield's spaces have arrows depicting valid exit directions from that space.



Cheetah Race is pretty much a rethemed, 2-player version of the solitaire game Curse of the Pyramid from Triple Flips 2: Monsters. Each of you is racing agains your own "time", as well as each other.



Call of the Wild is a game of progress for 1 player. You have four animals to progress along their respective tracks. The tracks vary in length from 11 spaces to 19 spaces. In ten turns, you try to get the four animals as close to the goal as possible. Each turn, you roll the die, and choose an animal to move. If you roll a 1, then you roll again, and move an animal double the second roll.

name: Symbiote
description:
An organism-swapping card game for three or four players.

Object: To end the game with the most points in symbiotic pairs and royal symbiotes, ideally while hosting the symbiote. Keeping control of the Symbiote makes it easier to gather royal and paired symbiotes.

You Need:

* A poker deck.
* A double-sided symbiote / parasite marker, like a CD-R from a failed burn.

Players try to make symbiotic pairs (a pair of cards that adds up to 10) or royal symbiotes (a Jack, Queen, and King.) If a player has the symbiote in front of them on his turn, he can draw additional cards. Tens can be used to change the symbiote into a parasite, which will hinder the player who has it.

The game ends when there are no cards in the draw pile at the start of a player's turn. Flip all of your symbiotic pairs and royal symbiotes face-up and add up their values. If you end the game with the symbiote, score an additional point for every symbiotic pair or royal symbiote you have. If you end the game with a parasite, then lose one point for every symbiotic pair or royal symbiote you have.

The player with the highest score wins. Ties go to the player with the symbiote (or without the parasite).

name: Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? Junior Detective Edition
description:
This is a newer edition of the "Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego" game but redesigned for younger players.

FROM THE BOX:
"Attention Parents of Junior Detectives:
Your children don't need to read to track Carmen Sandiego! That's right, America's most popular master thief is now appearing (and disappearing) in a new game designed to introduce young children to world geography.

Players secretly hide color coded pictures of Carmen Sandiego beneath countries, then search for pictures of their color. Kids will have so much fun searching for Carmen that they won't even notice that they're learning the sizes, shapes, and locations of the world's nations and oceans.

Carmen Sandiego already stars in the nation's top-selling geography games for ages 8 and up. Now, kids under 8 can discover what their older brothers and sisters already know-- hunting for Carmen is a fun way to learn!"

CONTENTS:
World Map Game Board
World Map Playing Pieces
33 Country/Region Cards
12 Carmen Sandiego Picture Tokens
4 Pawns
Complete Instructions

Ages 4-8
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents, Video Game Theme

name: Picasso
description:
PICASSO - How quick on the draw are you?

From the box:

"Be quick on the draw, then put a title to someone else's masterpiece. Whether you're an artistic genius or just a doodler, PICASSO is a riot of fun!

Pick a card to see which title, phrase or saying you have to draw. Each player has his own card, so everyone is drawing something different.

Race to complete your drawing. The first player finished yells 'Stop'. Now see if you can recognize what each of the others has drawn. Is that a picture of Pigs? could it be Animal Farm? Pigs might fly? Surely not Hamlet?

It's a quick draw game that'll have you in stitches, but be warned - PICASSO might drive you to abstraction."

name: Revlon's $64,000 Question Quiz Game
description:
Based on televisions sensational quiz game.

From the rules:

The $64,000 Question Quiz Game is and educational and entertaining game for children and adults based on the popular television program. There are 12 different categories, each containing 55 questions with a grand total of 660 questions. They begin at a simple level for $64 and become increasingly difficult on the climb to the $64,000 question. Any number of players can play."

name: JINGO
description:
Jingo covers a whole host of picture bingo games, centered around a litany of topics. The base description on this entry comes from an existing entry for Space Jingo, but all of the Jingo games operate in roughly the same manner.

From the introduction for this: "Space J-I-N-G-O! is a special treat that you and your friends/students will enjoy playing again and again. It is fun! It is educational! You will learn facts and trivia, both modern and historical, about the solar system and space exploration. Mysterious places, famous faces, scientific data and current events...it's all here. Everyone, young and old, will enjoy playing Space J-I-N-G-O! and will learn a fact or two."

The game comes with 30 Gameplay cards for the Bingo portion, with 2 player aids/rules, a spelling list, 44 clue/question cards. You have to provide the markers to place upon the spots of the cards. There are 4 games in one! You can use just the A clues, or the B or C ones, or mix them all up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Animals, Children's Game, Civil War, Educational, Horror, Nautical, Religious, Sports, Transportation

name: Alphabet Lotto: Farmyard Tales Games
description:
From the box:
Your Child will have fun and learn valuable pre-reading skills, such as word and picture matching, with Poppy & Sam and the animals from Farmyard Tales.

Developed with the Child Development Unit at Nottingham University.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory

name: Manta Manni
description: board game dedicated to opel MANTA a famous german sport car late 80's...

name: Die Wackelpudding-Jagd
description:
In the center of the board, there are wobble puddings in a clearing. Players roll a die and move their 'little monster' to collect them and bring them back to their home. But the puddings are guarded by a dragon, which may be moved when the players roll its symbol. Players can be send home like in pachisi, with the capturing player also capturing the pudding.

The game ends when all 10 puddings are distributed. They have 1-3 points on the bottom side, and the player with the highest total wins.

name: Romantic Rendezvous
description:
Two games of love, intimacy and adventure. This game provides any couple from 18 on up, married, dating or living together, an atmosphere of fun while experiencing a romantic, intimate, pleasurable time together. Romantic Rendezvous extends the relationship’s foundation so a couple can grow closer, laugh and delve into the joys and delights of being together.

The board game offers over 120 different activities that are detailed on a beautifully designed board. During the game, you and your partner will have the opportunity to experience intimate sharing; romantic, loving, and playful activities; meaningful and informative communication; wishing, hugging, kissing and touching. The board game also provides bonuses and interesting twists that can add plenty of excitement!

The card game is a game of self-expression and communication, giving and receiving and will add some spice to your love life. The game consists of 54 Romance Cards that contain fun, playfully adventurous and intimate activities for you and your partner.

Playing the two games together adds an exciting dimension and creates the Romantic Rendezvous Experience. However, neither game is dependent on the other.

Playing is easy and both players WIN at every turn!

name: Looney Laundry
description: Looney Laundry is a game designed for children ages 4 and up. The object of the game is to be the first player to successfully discard all their laundry pieces into the talking, electronic laundry hamper. After each roll and subsequent movement, the players push the hamper's eyes where he will either tell you what a good job you're doing, lose a turn or burp and eject the pieces that were discarded out of the tray. The ejected pieces are now part of that players hand in which they now have more pieces to get rid of. First player to get rid of all the pieces wins.

name: World Wise European Edition
description:
(Back of box):PUT THE WORLD IN YOUR HANDS with this great new educational family card game! No matter what your age or education level, no matter how little or how much you know about geography, you can be equally competitive. Parents and children can play and learn together. Prepare for an upcoming vacation or sharpen your knowledge for a business trip. Or just relax and have fun.

There is a card for each country on the European continent and each body of water bounding Europe, as well as wild cards and super wild cards. Each player must play a card whose geographic location shares a boundary with the card that was last played. Bluffing and using wild cards add strategy to the play.

Exciting and educational for 2-8 players, Ages 9 - 99

name: Doubles Backgammon
description: Four rows of points, placed opposite each other on an octagonal board, allowing two teams of two to play. Each team attempts to bear off all their team's checkers, while blocking the opposing team from doing the same. Modern BACKGAMMON rules are used.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: DCP, Limited, Make Your Move, Inc.

name: Give & Take
description:
The players' goal is to be the first to surround the game board with their tokens. Spinner results determine whether players may place tokens on their track, block an opponent, etc. Rules include three versions: regular, advanced, and team play.

A 2002 Parents' Choice Approved Award Winner.

name: Cross Card
description:
"No bad card will exist.
But one failure, the next one will laugh.
You need the right turn at the right time in this hot mixture of Card and Board game." (written on the Box)

Every Player try, with playing one card/Round on the Board, to finish 5 in a row. At the End of game you get the points.
You get different Points with
Pairs
two pairs
triples
"Poker"
"Flush"
"Streets"
"Full House"
...

A quick game with short rules.

name: Miniluuppi
description:
This game was published in Finland at the dawn of information technology to show people what it was all about. The game board shows what would have then been a state-of-the art computer room; an input to the left, ie. card readers where the players start from, with lines running via disk storage to the central processor, from which data is sent to the matrix printers at the output on the right. In the middle, as flavour graphic, the operator is inserting a reel of magnetic tape into a magnetic tape data storage unit. The idea is to get your 'program' (set of pawns of the same colour) from your punch card reader through the CPU and into the printers, preferably your own as it nets more points - but pawns may end up in other people's printers too, giving them points, and being the one who ends the game by getting all of their pawns into the printers gives a good bonus too. A 'random colour generator' (turning disc built into the game board) at the CPU tends to mess things up however, as it may send the player on a loop (which the second part of the name of the game, 'luuppi', refers to) within the CPU, or to an opponent's printer. Winner is the player with most points from all parts of their program at game end.

(The 'Mini' in the name of the game presumably refers to a minicomputer, which was the next step up from the single-user microcomputer just becoming available to the public; large operators such as banks and government agencies would own their own mini-computer to which various users would connect via terminals, using 'computing time' allocated to them.)

name: Trivial Pursuit: Olympic Edition
description: Expansion set for the well known Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition game. The German version with the Olympic themes: Olympische Schauplätze (Olympic cities), Medaillengewinner (medal winners), Winterspiele (Winter Games), Sommerspiele (Summer Games), Olympische Höhepunkte (Olympic highlights) and Fünf Ringe (five rings). With 250 cards - i.e. 1,500 questions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Playmix

name: Tom & Jerry: Das grosse Rennen
description: Five characters from the Tom & Jerry comics are taking part in the large running competition. The players are moving their characters based on what the color dice show. Who will be the first to cross the line? Tom, Jerry, Tuffy, Spike or Tyke?
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Kirjalito, Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Pixelator
description:
Kid Galaxy, best known for its remote control toys, enters the board game category with the Pixelator, a futuristic strategy board game with an electrobotic module that has a mind of its own.

The Kid Galaxy web site describes Pixelator as "a fascinating new strategy game" that "incorporates a unique, patented 'color recognition' technology."

More from the web site:
"Drive the Pixelator into your opponents home base to win. Play specially colored cards to maneuver Pixelator. The Pixelator magical all-knowing eye 'sees' the color and moves accordingly."

Pixelator is for 2 players or teams, ages 6 and up.

name: Abenteuer Reiterhof
description: Players 'ride' on a course and have to answer questions about horses from five categories. These include e.g. how to care for a horse, feed and medicine, breeding, etc. For players 10 years and older.

name: Heimgolfi
description: This is basically trick golf for the dinner table: The game parts allow to set up 10 "official" obstacles (the courses have a length of about 30cm) and the player take turns of trying to hit the ball in the hole.

name: El juego de Makinavaja
description:
The boardgame of Makinavaja, character created by Ivá in the pages of the satirical Spanish magazine " El Jueves ".

In this game every player is a delinquent who tries to commit a series of assaults, robberies and pulls in the streets of Barcelona. Taking care that the police doesn't detain him and takes it to the jail

name: Pirat Über Bord
description: The players try to place their pirates and barrels on the wobbly ship without knocking down the other pirates. A spinner is used to decide on what level the pieces should be placed.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Nautical, Pirates

name: The Road Runner Game
description:
The Road Runner Game consists of a deck of cards and 8 flat cardboard cutout figures of The Road Runner and 1 Wile E. Coyote figure, both characters from the Warner Brothers cartoons.

The cards are numbered and have brightly colored and patterned backgrounds (one background per set of numbered cards). The cutouts are about 10 inches tall.

The Road Runner and Coyote cutouts are placed in the center of the table. One less Road Runner than there are number of people playing are used.

The players try to collect a full set of numbered cards. The first one to do so lays his cards down and grabs a Road Runner figure. Everyone else grabs a figure as quickly as possible. The last person to grab a cutout (or perhaps a faster person, but one who grabbed the wrong figure) gets the Coyote.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Alien Assault
description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

Players must advance toward and defeat in battle the boss alien on three levels to win. Defeat means starting a level all over again.

name: Placar
description: This game simulates a soccer match. Two players roll dice, moves your teams and try to mark the biggest number of goals.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Das große Frankenquiz
description: Trivia/Knowledge game from Kosmos (big box) about questions and facts from the South-German and Bavarian region, Franconia.

name: Money Matters for Kid$ game
description:
From the Instructions:

Objective: The objective is to save $30, give 10% to the church, then land on the correct Goal square to buy the item shown on your Character Card.

Teaching Goals: The game is based on Lauree & L. Allen Burkett's "Money Matters for Kids" and reinforces that we should tithe/give 10% of our money to the church, set aside 50% of our money in Saving, and spend the remaining 40%. This game demonstrates the importance and benefits of giving to God and emphasizes the value of doing extra to earn money-not just depending on an allowance. Children also learn to count and divide money.

Aimed at: Children aged 5 to 10.

To Play: Roll the die. Move your pawn the number of spaces shown on the die. Follow the rules for each square.

name: Bottleneck
description: Two player game with the objective being to move all nine of your playing pieces through the bottle neck on the board to the opponents game area. Alternately players roll a die and spend the points to move pieces. Pieces can cross others but must end their move in an empty space. Unlike checkers/draughts, there is no capturing. Game is from Pepys of England and probably originated in the mid 1940's.
publishers: Gazebo Games UK Ltd., Ideal, Pepys (Castell Brothers)

name: Knowalot
description:
Knowalot is a fun new trivia game with a difference. Each question card has a short summary of a well-known subject but with key words and phrases missing. All you have to do is fill in the blanks. The subject could be anything from the Spice Girls to the Space Race.
How do you play Knowalot?
You read out the subject on the card. Everyone then bids on how many they think they'll get right out of five possible answers. A question on your favorite movie, bid five. If you get all five right, you win a brain, five brains and you've won!

name: Maisy's Counting Game
description:
This is a game that helps teach children counting skills.

From the back of the box:

Count the objects on each card, then identify and assemble each matching pair. The cards are uniquely cut so that only the correct matches will fit. The game is over when all pairs are matched. Everyone wins!

name: Top Banana
description: Top Banana is an adventure game based on the banana industry. It is a real life game combining skill and ability with some of the chance happenings of the banana business. In the game the players buy plantations and transport bananas to market to raise money and cover their expenses.

name: Stranded
description:
In Stranded, Time Machine travel takes you to great events in American history! From the Mayflower's landing at Plymouth Rock to the Wright Brothers' takeoff at Kitty Hawk. From Paul Revere's biggest date to the Gold Rush of '48. But the trick is: getting from one to the other without getting stuck! Fun and suspense mount as every move makes return to the present a little bit tougher. Simple but well-timed strategies are key to being the last remaining player and winner of the game. Fast-paced, friendly, and educational too, STRANDED is for 2 to 4 players, ages 8 to adult. Approximate playing time is 30 minutes.

Contents: 1 Game Board, 1 Set of Rules, 4 Movers, 1 Color Die, and 48 Colored Time Machine Circles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Das Eisenbahnspiel
description: Travel around Germany by train in this hard to find game. "Board" is a rolled up inside a triangular tube. Players try to visit as many German cities as possible using specific rules and some dice rolling.

name: Duckys
description: All sorts of things are happening on the water lily pond. Four pairs of ducks are now proud parents, and all of the ducklings have escaped from their nests and are now sitting on the island in the center of the pond. The parents face the difficult task of finding their baby ducklings so they can bring them back to their own nests.

name: Magori
description:
From the publisher:

Little wizards use their magic to change stones into gold. Some little wizards may get help from the fairy, if they can find her. But watch out: the magic stones try to escape. The game contains 10 gold pieces, 10 magic stones, 8 picture cards, 1 action dice, 1 magic basket and 1 magic wand.

name: Teddies on Tour
description:
Four teddies are about to start a big journey and have to get their belongings ready to pack in their suitcases. However, suitcases should look tidy and therefore the children have to find the right pairs (tooth brush and water glass, for example).

Ages 3 and up.

name: Monopoly: Cricket Australia Charity
description:
Monopoly variant.
UK edition board square: replacement.
Mayfair: Don Bradman; Park Lane: Steve Waugh;
Regent St: Ricky Ponting; Oxford St: Shane Warne; Bond St: Glenn McGrath;
Coventry St: Adam Gilchrist; Leicester Square: Justin Langer; Picadilly: Matthew Hayden;
The Strand: Mike Hussey; Fleet St: Andrew Symonds; Trafalgar Square: Simon Katich;
Vine St: Brett Lee; Bow St: Michael Clarke; Marlborough St: Shane Watson;
Pall Mall: Damien Martyn; Northumberland Ave: Jason Gillespie; Whitehall: Michael Kasprowicz;
Euston St: Shaun Tait; Pentonville Rd: Daniel Cullen; Angel Islington: Stuart Clark;
Whitechapel: Brad Hogg; Old Kent Rd: Stuart McGill;
King's Cross: Mark Taylor; Marylebone: Greg Chappell; Fenchurch St: Ian Chappell; Liverpool St: Allan Border
Electric Company: Ashes Urn; Water Works: Allan Border Medal;
Income Tax: LBW; Super Tax: Caught Behind;
Chance: One Day; Community Chest: Test.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Semantic
description: A game very much in the vein of Trivial Pursuit. Semantic requires players to answer questions based on the meaning of words. Players must complete a path around the board answering questions as they go. Movement is based on a dice roll.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Game, Set & Match
description:
Game, Set & Match is a Tennis board game that uses a die and deck of cards for playing shots, and a board and pawn to show the position of the ball on court.
Players serve by rolling a die marked Ace/Let/In/Out, then if the ball is in play, cards are played for each shot of the rally that determine the stroke played and the position of the ball on the court. Singles or doubles can be played.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Koalabröderna: På flygtur med Frank och Buster
description:
Swedish children´s game themed on the Koala Brothers. Players are flying around trying to be the first to visit all their friends. Each player is given 4 tiles, each picturing one of the 9 friends. Up to 9 tiles per player can be used `for a more complex game´. Players roll the die and move on the square grid on the board, visiting squares where the friends are. Friends must be visited in the same order as the tiles in front of the player. Squares are either empty or have a picture of a friend or an airplane. The airplane shows the direction that players must leave that square. First player to visit all 4 (or more) friends is the winner.

Contents:
Game board
4 pawns
36 picture tiles
Die

5 years and up

Note: This game is not identical to Die Koala Brüder: Auf Geht's Nach Haus!(GameID: 21833).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pyjama Party
description:
A card game for children (8+ years).

From the publisher: "An incredibly funny girl's game to liven up pyjama parties. Tears of laughters, secrets, revelations : unforgettable moments to share with friends and to write in a secret book."

name: Nya Pratmakarna
description:
Basically a new edition of Pratmakarna, but with four kinds of tasks. Teams of players describe and try to guess words, understand words spoken backwards, and come up with as many words as possible within a time limit.

Contents:
320 cards with 1320 tasks
2 pawns
Clock
Rules

name: Super Sentence Cube Game
description:
"Roll out the words - roll out the laughter - making sentences before the timer runs out"

This game consists of 25 dice with words on each side, a dice cup and a large sand-timer. Players roll the dice and make sentences with the words. A sentence with 7 or more words scores a bonus 50 points, using all the dice scores a bonus 50 points, and the score for a sentence is the square of the number of words in it.

This game is published in India where apparently "FLET" and "ATER" are words. The dice are not cubes, they're shorter in one dimension than the others.

name: The Atonement: Miracle of Christ's Love
description: The Atonement: Miracle of Christ’s Love from the Latter Day Saints is a captivating activity game involving many aspects of the Plan of Salvation, including choices, sins, good works, ordinances, spiritual gifts, trials, missionary work and temple work. Players interact in both Earth Life and in the Spirit World and are eventually judged and assigned to a degree of glory. The game was created by Kathryn Matthews over a period of 12 years. Her son, Jonathan, suffered from kidney failure at a young age which prompted her to donate her own kidney to him.
