Over the following ten years, Jonathan suffered deteriorating health and required constant tending until his death in 1999. It was during this difficult time that Kathryn found comfort in learning the doctrines of the Plan of Salvation and spending time creating a learning activity that teaches about the joy it brings.

name: Count Across
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Test your math and strategy skills against the luck of the roll. Simply roll the dice and add or multiply the numbers. Then claim a space on the number board. First player to connect four in a row wins. Learning math has never been such a fun challenge for both kids AND adults! Ages 6 & up.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: The Battle for Destainia
description:
You start off by picking one of the Character cards to determine what type of person you will be. Each Character starts off with items that have different strengths and weaknesses. You must use your items to your advantage in knowing who to attack and who not to attack when and where. This is a game of strategy and the player who is experienced will have a definite advantage over a beginner. It was made so that luck is not as important as skill and strategy. You can bribe the different people in the game to attack your opponents and take their items from them. You may battle opponents when you land on the same square as them deciding which items to use in each different situation. You may warp to different areas of the board using the tunnel either to attack an opponent or strategically move into a position which is more beneficial. Receive money when passing the Castle to be able to buy items when you land on the store squares. Pick up Destainia cards and follow the instructions of the card which may be to your advantage or to your peril. The object of the game is to move along the board purchasing different items from stores along the way. Each item you buy has points, and once you have achieved enough points you will be able to challenge and defeat the Sorcerer. Instead of like other games where you have to be the last player alive, this is a race to the finish where everyone is trying to defeat the Sorcerer and claim the Medallion. The action is fast paced and there is never a dull moment. Destainia the game includes 100% cotton canvas material for the board, 6 different color pawns, 2 dice, 60 plastic coins, a drawstring pouch, instructions, 143 playing cards, and a convenient clear plastic tube to put everything in, which is easy to store.

Home Page: www.destainia.com

name: Mizzouopoly
description:
This variation of Monopoly is based on the campus of the University of Missouri, Columbia which is affectionately known as Mizzou.

The object is to buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home . . . or make the Dean's List and collect a $200 scholarship. Play the traditional version or the 1 hour version. Fun for any alumnus, present or future student or fan.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Heaven and Hell
description: A draw and discard game where only one player can be saved from the flames of Hell. Will it be you? Players collect cards in a race to save their souls by acquiring the best hand. 31 trumps all. Beware of the “Hell” cards, because everything changes when the devil rears his ugly head

name: How To Host a Teen Mystery: Roswell That Ends Well
description:
You are invited to attend a luau and all-night star gazing party at Allen Ian Abduxion's Point Doom beach house. But when you arrive, you discover that someone at the party has been involved in extra-terrestrial foul play. As you assume the role of one of these eight suspicious characters and solve the mystery, you and your guests will enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward blackmail, deceit and conspiracy.

Characters: Ariel LeSalt, Dexter Terrestrial, Endira DeWorley, Klaus N. Counter, Twyla Zoan, "Speed-O" Leitner, Carey O'Reagun, Koushpa Tater

name: Oz Quiz
description:
Australian Trivia Game

Over 2000 Questions in the following catagories:

People
Places
Slang
Sport
Animals & Plants
History

And the wacky activity "Up The Creek" category.

Packaged in an Australian esky!

name: Monopoly: Oxford Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Oxford, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Monopoly: Aberdeen Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Aberdeen, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Shirt Tales Card Game
description:
A children's card game. The object of the game is simple enough get 5 cards of the same color or the same animal and you win the round. Win two rounds and you win the game.

The cards feature a monkey, tiger, panda, raccoon, and a mole each wearing blue, yellow, pink, green, and purple shirts. The artwork is simple and appealing to children.

Ages 6 - 10

name: Going Underground: Zoo Edition
description:
Going Underground: Zoo Edition is the first game from Bright Sparx. It's played on a map of the London Underground and the idea is to catch animals that are on the loose. The counters representing the animals are spread across the board, face down. Each player gets the cards for five animals and the first to collect their set and get back to the zoo wins the game. There is an educational aspect as each card carries information about the animal depicted and the game is aimed at children and families.

Home Page: http://www.goingunderground.co.uk/

name: Atomic Business
description:
Each player controls diplomats trying to sign a nuclear contract with the democratic republic of Nasombia.

The first player that successfully brings a nuclear contract in his briefcase wins the game, many briefcases are fakes to trick opponents.

name: Super Mario Bros. GuraGura Game
description: 3 Mario games in one. In one mode, you play a basic balance game as you try to place figures on a tower without having it topple. The other game utilizes a launcher to fling your characters at targets.

name: Kunst & Kennis Spel: The Art & Expertise Game of the Rijksmuseum
description: This Dutch/English language game, made in Holland, is a cross between a trivia game and the old game Masterpiece. Players answer questions about 100 paintings in the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam, and then use their points to add the painting to a collection, careful that it may be a forgery.

name: Vancouveropoly
description:
Vancouveropoly is a wealth acquisition game. The object is to obtain the most money and businesses. Players start with $2500 cash which is used to buy the un-owned businesses that they land on. A player must pay rent to the owner if the business is already owned. The rent increases if the business has one or more retail outlets or an office tower.

It will be helpful to compare this game to it's cousin, Monopoly;
- there is no element of bidding for un-purchased properties, although players are encouraged to "make your own deals!"
- Money paid for Socks or Bonds cards is put in the centre as a jackpot for landing on the Free Parking square
- On rolling doubles, a player may move the the token the sum of both dice, or double that amount. The player does not get to roll again after rolling doubles.
- There is no payment for passing Go on each lap of the board, so financial resources are more limited.
- Players pay $100 to get out of Court (Jail).
- The game ends when one player becomes bankrupt.

The game is very commercial. The board and the Stocks and Bonds cards read like advertisements for local businesses. They often include real world addresses and phone numbers. There are two Coupon cards included with the Stocks and Bonds cards that appear to be intended for use as real-world coupons at those businesses.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mission Space
description:
The games in the Adventure series involve you in the search for the mythical Jonah Expedition which vanished 20 years ago. The few bits and pieces of information remaining indicate that Doctor Jonah was on the verge of discovering the vestiges of an ancient civilization...


A unique scenario and fun-filled technique
Captivating role-playing
Game boards that can be assembled for playing on 1-3 universes
Collectible games with extended Internet play option


Game Objective

The adventure continues... deep in space! Your investigation of the disappearance of Dr Jonah and his expedition brings you to other planets. Aboard a space ship, at the wheel of a moon buggy or in a space base control room, your journey is sure to be full of ups and downs! You have to go head-on with unidentified objects and avoid the numerous traps waiting for you along the way, because only the most courageous will be able to uncover the true secret of the Jonah expedition!

name: Inchworm
description: Inchworm combines many different game mechanisms in a unique way; e.g. piece placement, Mancala-like sowing, stacking, and turning pieces into prisoners by surrounding them. The strategy of the game is deep and rich. There is a fair handicap system to balance the game if one player is noticeably stronger than the other.

name: 1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Set I, Group I
description:
From the Back of the Box:

1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition...

Happy triviaphiles will recognize the Q&A's in this set from Set I of the award-winning Game of Trivia by the Avalon Hill Game company.

Now - we make these same questions & answers available for devotees of Trivial Pursuit, without having you pay for a complete game.

Here - in this box - are 1,650 additional Q&A's, color-coded for play with Trivial Pursuit (and other similar games of trivia).

And... if 1,650 of them aren't enough, check out the additional groups - labeled 1 thru 4 - to complete the set of 6,600 additional questions and answers.

OMNI Magazine - December '84 - selected Game of Trivia by The Avalon Hill Game Company... "best trivia game of the year, based on its variety of questions and low ratio of arguable answers."

GAMES Magazine - September '84 - editors' choice for GAMES 100 because... "Game of Trivia plays more like a true board game, and there's no reason why you can't use the questions for Trivial Pursuit."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Odisea en el Bosque
description:
From the publisher:

A fantastic and dangerous travel game, a lot of fun for the whole family.

name: Diabolo
description: The goal is to bring one pawn to the center of the maze, using the chips like bridges or barriers.

name: Strawberry Shortcake Berry-Go-Round
description:
The Color-Matching Carousel Game

"As soon as a player gives the Strawberryland Character Cards a spin on the Berry-Go-Round, everyone tries to make them stop. If a player is lucky, the card that lands in front of her will match a picture on her game board. Players then try to match all the pictures on their boards. When they do, they'll be ready for the most important part of all--capturing the Purple Pieman! The first one to do it wins the game."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Madame Planchette's Horoscope Game
description: The horoscope game is a basic set collection game with cards being drafted and discarded resulting in each player having a reading of their horoscope with finished hands.

name: Blow by Blow: Pakistan Invades India 1965
description:
This is a wargame about the pivotal battle of Assal Uttar 1965 which was one of the largest tank battles after World war two.

The Pakistanis launched an offensive to cut off the supplies to the city of Amritsar in the Punjab which was vital to tilting the war in Pakistan's favor.

The Pakistani offensive was spearheaded by its Elite 1st Armored division comprised of M47 and M48 Patton and M24 Chafee tanks.

The Indian defenders had the 4th Mountain Division backed up by Sherman and AMX tanks but had the advantage of plentiful recoilless rifles, defending in poor terrain(sugar cane fields and rice paddies) as well as reinforcements in the form of the Indian 2nd armored brigade composed of Centurion tanks.

The battle was pivotal and led to the loss of many Pakistani tanks.

The area of the battle is referred to as Patton Nagar which means Patton city due to the large number of Patton tanks captured and destroyed during the battle.

Contains:
• One 11" x 17" map
• Set of 280 ½" playing pieces representing ground combat units.
• One rulebook
• Charts and tables

name: Sportz Dice: Golf
description: Players roll special fairway dice and putting die to determine shot location and number of strokes for a round of golf.

name: Jihad
description:
JIHAD

Strategy game about the "holy war".
Each player plays a God and tries to convert countries to his beliefs. He has to win over 5 countries to his beliefs to both end and win the game.

name: Das Reiniger Spiel
description:
Extraordinary equipped game from the sixties, even in German player circles scarce and obscure.

Game consists among others of: 3 grey factories, 10 red advertisement pillars with ads from the time produced, 10 brown laundry company headquarters, 15 orange franchise houses, 15 white drop-by stations, 150 ! chimneys in 6 player colours and much more!
All these are made of wood, the small houses have all holes drilled into where the chimneys can be fixed to mark the owner!

Aim of the game is to build a laundry imperium (the RÖVER company for which this game was made as promo was once the largest one in Germany) in order to attract the most customers of all players.
Extremly tricky is the fact that there are only 3 factories for 6 players, so first come, first serve...
But if you don't succeed, all is not lost!

Must be one of the most beautiful and playable roll-and-move games, still much decision making involved.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Ferrari Il Gioco Ufficiale
description: A Monopoly variant where the properties are models of Ferrari automobiles and the players are car collectors. The winner is the player with the most money when the last Ferrari is acquired.

name: Pictures Domino
description:
The game is intended to develop the child's imagination by creating associative connections between each pair of pictures.

Cards are divided equally among the players, face down. Each player then, turns up his cards to the pictorial side. The players decide who will be the first. The latter places one of his cards at the centre of the table, and the next player is to attach to this card another one with an associative connection with it.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Diver Dan, Tug-O-War Game
description:
Based on the television spots:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diver_Dan

Game consists of spinning a spinner that is attached to the board and moving your peg that is also attached. Get to the end of your underwater rope first and you've won!
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: The Assassination Game Le
description:
A game for the piecepack.

A three-player game in which one of the players (the 'Victim') attempts to get to the four Secure Bases on the board and then return to the start position (the 'Safe House') without being eliminated by the two other players (the 'Assassins'). If the Victim is eliminated, the Assassin that eliminated him becomes the new Victim. Play continues until a Victim reaches all the Secure Bases and returns safely to the Safe House.

name: Cat & Mice or Holes & Traps
description:
(translated: Cat and Mice - A Fun Race)

Probably from the 1950s. A simple roll-and-move game where up to 5 players are mice (small pottery balls), trying to reach the end of a tilted course (with holes for spaces, similar to Hänsel und Gretel: Ein Märchenspiel), one player is the cat (a larger ball), allowed to move in both directions, trying to catch all mice.

The cat never can fall through the holes, the mice can (and have to start over).

The board is raised and has a track on it. Each point along the track is a hole. Some holes are bigger than others. The playing pieces are circular, like a ball.

One player is a cat, the others are mice. Everyone moves along the track by a die roll. The mice must escape from the cat player who has a big advantage. If a mouse player lands on one of the bigger holes then it will fall through the hole and out of the game. The cat playing ball is too large to fall through a hole so he doesn't mind which space he lands on.

The cat wins if all the mice are caught or the mouse who gets to the end of the track first, wins
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Bears, Foxes & Hares
description:
A game for Icehouse pieces (the rules are written with the Rainbow Treehouse set in mind. If you are using the Xeno set or your own stashes, adjust the color reference accordingly. You will need one pyramid of each size of 5 different colors.)

The animals in different parts of the forest have sent teams to compete in the annual contest. Each team has a grumpy bear, an impatient fox and a nervous hare. They all race to get to the center of the board. Along the way you will have opportunities to push your opponents out of the way, pin them motionless, leap over them, swap places with them and hitch a ride with them.

name: Wild West: The Gunfight Game
description:
A miniature wargame-like game where each player controls a character, moves around on a town street and tries to shoot the opponents.

All components (characters, street and houses) are paper based, except for some plastic chits.

A separate board is used to control loading etc of gun. Actual shooting occurs with dice rolling and card drafting.
categories: American West, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Lose a Turn, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Touring Scotland
description:
An entirely new map game requiring skill and judgment.

Exciting, interesting, and educative.

A competitive game for 2-4 players in which the chief cities and towns are visited.

Object

Each player is dealt eight cards (two of each color).

The player arranges the cards, so as to form a journey by the shortest route, starting and finishing at the nearest large town to where the players live, or to where the game is being played. Players then set off on their journeys. Along the way watch out for collisions, traffic lights, and ferries!

Corresponding numbers on the cards and towns to be visited are given, to enable very young children to easily identify their route.

The winner is the first person to have visited their eight towns and returned home.

Contents:

1 playing board
32 cards in 4 colors
4 metal cars
1 die
1 wooden dice shaker
rules

name: Rochester On Board
description: Rochester On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Minnesota. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Women's Shelter Inc.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Drag Race
description:
Two hot rods face off across the track. The flag falls and the wheels spin. Who will blink first?

Drag Race, an abstract race game of second guessing in second gear, requires two matching Treehouse sets, an 8 x 8 board and a pair of screens.

Full rules can be found on the Icehouse Games Wiki.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: The Race Through Space
description:
Can you win the space race to the intergalactic space station? From fiery Mercury, beyond Pluto and into the depths of space, you and up to 5 friends must battle past asteroid storms and alien ships to reach the space station with life-saving supplies!
Contains board, 6 space shuttle markers, spinner and electronic dice.
A variant of snakes and ladders with the spinner directing whether you go up the board or down in certain spaces.
The dice is a small sphere you tap it then flashes-beeps over two seconds and shows you a random dice face on LEDs.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: High School Musical 2 DVD Game
description: 2 to 6 players move around the board showing off their knowledge of the movie by answering questions. The game includes a board, a DVD, and 6 character movers. For fans of the movie Ages 8 and up.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Arkham Terror: Experimental Therapy
description:
ARKHAM TERROR: EXPERIMENTAL THERAPY

Patients at Miskatonic State Hospital for the Insane receive state of the art therapy – 1923 state of the art! There is something going on here. The players take on the roles of doctors and patients. Each turn they make up clues that show what is actually going on. After a plot is uncovered they must stop it.

In this Engle Matrix Game players pick a character to champion. Each turn they buy the right to make up what action happens next in the game. Action are not automatic. They pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a dice rolling contest. At first the players uncover(make up) clues that reveal what the evil plot is. One they've created their enemy they work together to save the world... or at least most do. Players can opt to be evil and try and bring the plot to fruition. Since different plots emerge each time the game never plays the same way twice.

Most of the characters are mentally ill but this doesn’t stop them from helping. They were probably saving the world from Lovecraftian monsters before being committed anyway.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map, character sheet booklet, rules booklet, scenario booklet, wooden counters, plastic gold coins, and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 13 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order

name: 1000 Vragen Quiz
description: In this game you simply take cards from the pile and ask the question to your neighbour. A simple quiz game with 1000 questions. It is released by two publishers which both have made different questions. However some questions are based on knowledge for which you have to live in the Netherlands.

name: UNO: Fraggle Rock
description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the television series, "Fraggle Rock." This version of Uno has a special card/rule which does not correspond to any card in regular Uno, the "Travelling Matt" card, which allows a player to see other players' cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Reggie Bush Special Edition
description:
An Uno variation based on Reggie Bush, star running back for the NFL New Orleans Saints football team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: exclusive "All Purpose" card and rule celebrating Bush's versatility as a running back, receiver, and kick returner.

name: Hunt
description:
Hunt is a game for 2-4 players hunting each other across a moving play field of a deadly nature using any two Treehouse sets. Players move large and medium pyramids around the board, creating a maze, while trying to keep their stack of small pyramids alive.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition

name: Skat Cat
description:
Caution - Skate Cat is coming!

Quick, Save your tons! Otherwise The crazy cat pushes them away! 7 tons on one another! Sounds easy!
Skate Cat runs like mad into your tons to destroy the towers.
Skate Cat is an electronic game figure. It reacts by sounds like "Skate Cat"! Then the skate board runs across the game field.
The players who could save his ton tower wins the game.

name: Die wilden Fussballkerle: Bolzplatz
description:
Story: Willi the coach hurries the team along the show-jumping course. To become fit, the players race to be the first to reach the finish line with his three members. But the trainer not only looks at his stop watch, he also has integrated some obstacles. Only a player who reacts quickly and keeps his nerves can win the game.

The game includes a board (two-sided) with an obstacle course and a shortcut, three team members per player, a die, and a timer. The timer gets started, and the active player tries to race his pieces along the track. He rolls the die, moves one of his characters the full amount, rolls the die again, moves the same or a different character, and so on until the time runs out. Then the next player gets to act.

The track depicts barrels which act as obstacles; no player can land on such a space. The characters of other players are either treated as obstacles, or moved back to the next free spot if somebody lands on their space. The finish space needs to be reached with an exact die roll. The player who first finishes the race first with all his characters wins the game.

name: Scrabble: The Simpsons Edition
description:
This is a Simpsons-themed version of Scrabble with a variant board, 10 special action tiles with Simpsons character, and additional words and names from the Simpsons made legal with bonus points for spelling them.

This was an exclusive for the Borders chain of US bookstores. It is completely distinct from the Scrabble: Simpsons Edition published by Mattel in the UK. A file with information on the differences between the editions is located at that game's entry.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Hi-5 Activity Board Game
description:
Based on the Australian children's show "Hi-5" players (or teams) take turns drawing an Activity Card and following the instructions. These can be to sing, dance, act, count or name words. If successful they move along the track according to the card text (e.g. move ahead 2). Some cards may also push players back. The first player to reach the finish wins.
Ages 3 and up
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: International Football Whist
description: The game is played with 4 players in teams of two. 44 cards are used, consisting of 4 teams numbered 1 to 11 representing footballers from England, Ireland, Scotland and Wales from the 1940s. The object of the game is to move the ball counter into your opponents' goal and thus score. The ball can only be moved along the lines drawn on the playing board. This is achieved by winning tricks as per normal whist. However, trumps are chosen by the starting player who moves the ball onto a team's badge (which become trumps) on the playing board. The winner of the trick may move the ball one space. If the trick is won by leading with a trump, 2 spaces may be moved. When a goal is scored, the ball is returned to the centre spot and the player to the left of the scorer starts. The game ends when the cards are exhausted twice, once for half time and again for the end of the match.

name: Destination Brighton & Hove
description:
A game of taxi driving through Brighton & Hove. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Brighton & Hove's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Battle Bots
description:
“The concept behind this game is the programming of warrior robots that fight each other. Each robot comes equipped with 4 sensors, a rotating ablative shield and a turret mounted laser. Inspired by Robo Rally.”

The game is played on a square grid, the size of which depends on the number of players. Each player has two pieces, a robot model and a shield marker (the latter denotes the current facing of the robot’s shield). The players also use identical decks of 22 programming cards. These cards are gradually discarded as a player’s robot takes damage.

name: Roma Defendenda Est
description: This solitaire or two players game offers a series of “what ifs”, based on the historical situation following the Italian Armistice, signed 8th of September 1943. Starting from the historical position of the Italian and German divisions, one player, as the Italian, must try to save Rome from falling in German hands before the arrival of the American reinforcements through the air. But this game can also be played with a German opponent, or from the German perspective, with a single player try to reach the Eternal City before the American air transported units.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Ljómarallýspilið
description: This game is based on an international Rally competition held in Iceland for a few years, called the Ljómarally. A simple roll and move game where you try compete in the Ljómarally both on special (closed) routes and ferry (open) routes. Players can both compete in stand-alone rallies or a summer long championship.

name: Mutação
description:
One player plays is the mutant and can become any object in the environment in which they play. The others players have to discover the color, shape and position of the mutant.
The mutant can only answer the questions with yes or no.

name: The Game of Life: Black & Bitter Edition
description: Little is known, and little can be gleaned, about the mysterious entity known as The Game of Life: Black & Bitter Edition. The game has elements of classic Milton Bradley Life games, but there are two boards - one fits on top of the original board. How this affects gameplay is anyone's guess, as the rules and box are entirely in Japanese and no translation has of yet been uncovered.

name: Battle of the River Plate
description:
Battle of the River Plate is a two player card game themed on the WWII sea battle of the same name.

One player represents the Kriegsmarine and the other player the Royal Navy.

Through careful card play, players build sets of cards that represent attacks by the various ships that took part in the battle.

It is a free Print and Play game web published by BookRanger.
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, World War II

name: Snap It Up! Math: Addition & Subtraction
description: Match the value of shown with 3 cards that either add or subtract in a math equation. Part of a family of educational games with a similar mechanic.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Stockbridge
description: A double race game: each player has a car and a boat. They race round circuits which cross in four places, which have drawbridges. Their position can be "UP" for boats to go through or "DOWN" for cars to go over. When doubles are rolled on the dice, bridges change position, often depending on the vote of all the players. Cars and boats cannot stop. They are damaged by hitting other cars/boats or bridges, and then go slower. At the end, players score according to their finishing order and how damaged they are.

name: Change Change
description:
Change Change was published in A Gamut of Games.

In this solitaire game, the player takes eleven coins: four from each of two different denominations, two from a third denomination, and one unique. They are arranged randomly in a 3x4 layout, with an empty space in the bottom-right.

The player aims to transform the layout into one that is symmetrical around the horizontal axis by sliding the coins (like a slide puzzle), counting each slide as a 'move'. The usual target is to complete 7 rounds in less than 100 moves.
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: So You Think You Know Hockey?
description:
Description from box:

Test your hockey trivia knowledge with this action-packed, interactive board game for two or more players. Featuring 3150 challenging hockey trivia questions in seven exciting categories, plus a junior category for hockey fans of all ages!

name: La Course à la Vanille
description:
The aim of the game is to collect 10 cocoa, 10 tea and 10 vanilla tokens.
Players move using a die into several production areas in order to collect tokens and deliver them.
If there is a green spot on a production area, player must take an event card.
Components:
A board, 6 players token, 6 delivery cards, 180 goods token, 1 vanilla perfume bottle.

name: BalaGwari
description: This is a modern Manqala game with two rows of four pits each. Players start with 4 seeds in each pit and own the pits on the player's side of the board but this is one of the rare manqala games in which pieces are distinguishable, i.e., one player starts with white seeds and the other black. Sowing is anticlockwise starting in the pit adjacent to the starting pit and sowing one seed in each pit until the last seed is sown, without restriction on laps and sowing in the original pit if a sufficient number of seeds are in the original pit. Captures occur when the last seed is sown in an empty pit. That last seed and all seeds in the pits opposite it are captured. The winner is the player to capture more of the opponent's seeds and play continues until no more moves are possible.

name: Fairy Finds Game
description:
From the enclosed instructions:

Players (both readers and non-readers) work together in this co-operative game, using a combination of luck and simple strategy to help the fairies build a Fairy Ring. As with all fine fairy tales, there lurks a tricky troll in the background who would rather take over the beautiful Fairy Ring site for himself. A roll of the die can work in his favor, so players must figure out a strategy, using the fairy cards, to foil both the troll and lady luck.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Jet Set
description: In this game, the players have to place their cards onto stacks on the table. This is possible if the number on the card is half or double the value of the top card of any stack and the same color code. If that is not possible, players start new stacks, which count negative points at the end of the game. "Stop" cards close a stack, which then doesn't count negative points anymore. Whoever reaches a certain number of points, for example 25, loses.

name: Monopoly: Montpellier
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Montpellier, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: JUMBLE: 3 games in 1
description:
Originally sold as a Barnes & Noble exclusive, the 2008 incarnation of JUMBLE licensing comprises the following three modes of play:


Word Spin-Off - A spin of the spinner dictates your challenge, and the sand timer keeps the heat on. You have JUMBLE tokens with which you can buy hints or additional time.
Word Scramble - Race the sand timer to un-jumble the puzzles, trying to collect enough letters to spell a word.
Word Race - Race your pawn along a path, solving JUMBLEs along the way (under watch of the sand timer, of course).

name: Horse Luck
description:
The sassy pony named Lucky has again startled the horses at the “Happy Horses” farm. The horses take to their heels.
Who with a bit of luck and thought will be able to find most of their horses?

A memory game for 2-4 players.

name: Botanical Bedlam
description:
Botanical Bedlam is a surprisingly challenging puzzle game for two to six players. Players take turns choosing path pieces and flower beds, which all players must then place somewhere in their grid, which is kept secret from the others. The game ends when a player has no legal place to play a piece, whereupon everyone's grids are revealed, and the player with the longest, most scenic garden path wins.

Planning and spatial skills are key to winning a game of Botanical Bedlam, as is balancing risk and reward. Although long, intricate paths are the highest-scoring, the end of the game can come suddenly and unexpectedly, and incomplete paths are penalized.

(Description from http://www.bgdf.com/node/1255)

name: Thanks a Million!
description: An abstract roll and move game where the object is to complete a jigsaw of a cheque for £1,000,000 made out to the winner. There are enough jigsaw pieces to make several jigsaw cheques and the players win and lose jigsaw pieces as the game progresses. The player who is first to complete the jigsaw is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: New Kids on the Block Card Game
description: This is a rummy style game based on the once new New Kids on the Block. 72 cards in total.

name: Little Einsteins Blast Off Bingo
description:
The classic game of Bingo is so much more fun when starring all the Little Einsteins characters!

Teaches Problem solving, social interaction, nature, music, space, colors, and counting! This is a 4 themed versions of the classic game of Bingo in one box. For version there is a different set of cards and a different spinner. Themes are "Outer Space Bingo," "Nature Counting Bingo," "Little Einsteins Friends Bingo," and "Magical Instrument Bingo."

Each player spins the spinner in turn, and players place a token on the matching item on their Bingo board. First player to place tokens on all squares wins!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Scooby Snacks
description:
an Uno variant, with slightly different special cards. on top of standard +2, +5, or wild cards, theres a scooby doo card that makes every player give his cards to a person on his left.

players take turns playing of drawing cards. the winner is the first person go get rid of his last card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mens erger je niet! Achtbaan
description:
This is the new 3D version of the traditional game Pachisi.

From the publishers website:

An exciting race over the Mens erger je niet! roller coaster.

Throw your opponents of the roller coaster, but they are not lost yet: they go into the bear pit. Usually it ends badly for them there, but this is luckily not always the case.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pokémon Quick Shot
description: Get your best quick shots in to win. Load your shooters with marbles, press the trigger and action begins. With every hit you make your opponents piece goes flying out. But he/she is taking aim at your pieces too. The first player to knock out all opponents Pokemon wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Reserve Chess
description:
In this chess variant, every time you capture an enemy piece, you may take any one of your captured pieces and put it into your reserve. On your turn, instead of moving, you may take any piece from your reserve and put it on any
empty space on the board, except one that would result in a checkmate. When your pawns reach your opponent's back row, instead of promoting them, you may put them into your reserve.

name: Trivia Game Myths And Legends
description: 350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about characters, creatures and events from the world of fairytales. Get more right for the end, and you've won!

name: Wyprawa na Proxima Centauri
description:
Game is a unique adventure in Science and Fiction. It is an unforgettable journey of the first astronauts into Proxima Centauri - the closest start apart from the sun.
In the journey to Proxima Centauri - space ships will encounter different real and imagined situations, will meet U.F.O. and other civilizations.

This is a pretty simple game where one player aims to reach Proxima Centauri (rockets), while other one tries not to let it happen (UFO). On the top of it - there is a number of additional events in the space eventually - having impact on the game.

Game was designed originally in Poland and was never translated to other lanuages.

name: Paragon's New Aerial Dogfight Rules 1916-1918
description: 16 page rulebook for aerial dogfighting during the years of 1916-1918. The rules are designed for 1/300th, scale metal models. Comes with playsheets containing aircraft data.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Igels: Harz IV
description:
Harz IV is a freebee add-on to the game Igels. It was distributed during the Spiel 2006 and was also included in the magazine Games Orbit, printed by Pegasus Games.

The card is a reference to the social/unemployment benefit "Hartz IV" granted in Germany. Also, it is a word-play as the German word "Harz" means "resin" and this is were the card comes into play. Here is the card's text:

"Wer einmal in die Harzfalle tappt, kommt kaum noch vom Fleck. Harz klebt sofort vier beliebige Gegner zusammen, die in dieser Runde nicht mehr weiter gespielt werden können."

This translates roughly into:

Whoever falls just once into the resin(Harz)-trap makes hardly any headway. Harz immediately sticks together any four enemies, who cannot be played any further this turn.

The two cards Harz IV cards you get are simply shuffled into your standard card deck. They are of the "Unterstützungskarten" (support cards) type and can be played as any support card can in the support phase of any combat.

name: Zahlen-Denkfix
description: There are two spinners. One is spun to determine a result up to 20, the second one to determine how many number chips have to be used to get to that number. For instance, if the spinners show 16 and 3, you could use 7+5+4. The first player to place the correct chips (every player has different ones) on the table scores a point. The winner is the player with most points at the end.

name: Dino Danger
description: Each players pits his dinosaur against an opponent’s in this deck-dueling challenge, while watching out for Dino Danger. Players can learn about dinosaurs and their world in this prehistoric card game featuring action elements and a dino die to change up game play. It also comes with a dinosaur pocket guide.

name: Das Vermächtnis des Captain Hook
description: Each player controls 2-4 ships and transports goods from port to port. A wind rose influences movement (and is itself influenced by die rolls). The goods that are transported have a certain value (on cards) which is multiplied by 1, 2 or 3 depending on the distance traveled. An empty ship can attack another ship and possibly sink it (die-determined) to take over the goods.

name: Euro 2002
description:
Objective: Find the statue of the goddess to take her to Europe and European Parliament in Brussels, this statue is under a form of hide and change each item.

Each player has a pawn for a passport, money and choose a capital where to start looking.
The players are on the board turning over cards until he found the statue, then the other players have it stolen to the player who has found it before coming to Brussels.

Content:
1 board
4 passports
60 cards
32 tokens
4 pawns
1 die
Money

Products awarded the first prize in the competition for toys or games qque spread the idea of the euro.

name: Axis & Allies: Total War
description:
Axis & Allies: Total War is a war game based on Axis & Allies and its Europe and Pacific expansions. The game simulates the entire scope of World War II.

Up to six players can play on two different coalitions: the Axis which has Germany, Italy and Japan, and the Allies which has the USA, the UK, and the USSR. This version of A&A will feature the debut of a new combat system, the introduction of a lot of new units and a fantastic huge map. Players have at their disposal infantry, spec ops, armor, fighters, bombers, air transport, battleships, aircraft carriers, destroyers, cruisers, submarines and much more. All of the units perform differently and many have special functions. Players have to work together with their teammates in order to coordinate offenses and decide how best to utilize their production points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Lexico Suomi-Ranska
description: Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language! Win by getting rid of all your cards first!

name: Mathzee
description:
Translated from publisher website:

MathZee™ is a challenging math game for young and old. The diamond dice determine the numbers, you decide the math. But keep in mind, if all is said and done, there can be only one winner!

Additional info:

In each round one of the players throws the diamond dice. Next, all players try to make an equation with the numbers that the dice show. An incorrect equation means penalty points!
The game can be played at three different difficulty levels, making it suitable for both children and adults.

Contents:
5 diamond dice
1 hourglass
1 scoring pad

name: We All Scream for Ice Cream
description: Kid's game recommended for ages 5 to 10 years. Can be played by 2 or more players. Play individually, or in teams. Spin the spinner to see how many ice cream scoops you need to place on your cone, and to find out if you get to stand on two feet, or have to balance on just one. The first player or team to stack 7 scoops without dropping any of them wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Skull
description:
Post apocalyptic football game.
Based on the movie 'The Blood of Heroes'.

The aim of the game is to get a 'dogskull' onto a spike at the opposing end of the field while preventing the opposing team from doing the same.

The team of each player may choose between:
Runner: The only piece allowed to touch the skull and score points. (mandatory)
Chain: The piece with the greatest reach on the field and strong damage.
Pole: Fighting piece able to block front field spaces.
Net: Catch enemy pieces
Hook: Pin enemy pieces

Cards are used for movement and to determine the outcome of fights.

The game comes in a video cassette box, with board, tokens and cards.

name: Pocket Geni Classic
description: A simple, portable trivia game from Kärnan's range of Pocket Geni variants. 450 questions.

name: Nya Sverigespelet
description:
Nya Sverigespelet is a simple Swedish trivia game where players move around a map of Sweden and answer questions afterwards. This game is a modernisation of an older Sverigespelet (without the "Nya" ("New")), also by Eric Bojs.

Please note that this is not the same game as Dan Glimne's Sverigespelet from the same publisher. The name was re-cycled!

name: Keser Triathlon Spel
description:
A trivia game. Players roll the two dice and move along the board. The board is devided in three stages, swimming, biking and running. When a player lands on a question mark, he/she has to answer a question. Each stage has its own category of question.
The first player who arrives at the finish wins the game.

Keser is a Dutch employment agency.

name: Whitewater
description:
Can you make it through the rapids with a whole crew?

Place one of your rafts at the "Put In" point and try to maneuver it through the pockets to the "Take Out" point. Your crew is represented by steel beebees, and they fall out of the bottom of the rafts if you cross over one of the pockets.
You score a point for each of your crew who make it to the other side. Once both of your rafts are safely ashore, your opponent takes their turn.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: What's That Sound?
description:
Publisher blurb on side of the box: Can you tell the difference between teeth being brushed and wood being sawed? The first person to figure out which lotto board picture matches the sound heard on the cassette tape wins! WHAT THAT SOUND? stimulates a child's imagination and develops important listening, matching and memorization skills.

DIRECTIONS: The cassette tape features 36 sounds in four different sequences. You may start the game at any point on either side of the tape. Varying the starting point will give you a different game each time. As you identify each sound, simply cover the matching picture with a token. Parents may want to introduce this game or play it with younger children by helping them to name and identify each picture. Language skills and vocabulary will be expanded and children will then be able to further increase their knowledge and skills by playing as outline above.

name: Andrew Zimmern's Bizarre Game
description:
(From the Manufacturer)
Inspired by Andrew Zimmern, the globetrotting culinary thrill seeker comes a wild bluffing game about cultural oddities and weird foods from around the world. Do you know what Karkaday is? No? Well, you don’t have to. You just have to create the most convincing answer to trick your opponents into thinking it’s right. Hop around the bizarre globe and become the ultimate Travel Guru.

(From my geeky speculation)
Game play looks to be - draw region card, move pawn, draw Bizarre card and attempt to convince your fellow players that you already knew what the definition was.

(From Amazon)
Product Features:
288 Bizarre Cards
12 Excursion Cards
1 Timer
6 Game Pieces
1 Game Board

name: Nihonsyoki
description:
This is the oldest book in Japan for history related in Japan.
It is 30 volumes and is the fantasy story. The player are the editors for Nihon syoki.
They collect the category cards, and make the book, put the tile on the board corresponded the space. The spaces are connected by lines to some space.
These are the story's web.
The game is 6 rounds. The player has the 1 action on 3 each areas per 1 round. Get the category card, bonus card, make the book, change the order and so on.

45 Category card
3 Library card
12 Offering card
24 Point card
18 Bonus card
40 Player tile(10 per player)
1 Round Maker
4 Board(They can make any patterns)
1 Round / Action Board
1 Rule
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Deadliest Catch Sea Adventure Board Game
description: Now you can be the captain of your all-time favorite Deadliest Catch ship: Time Bandit, Wizard, Northwestern, or Cornelia Marie and compete for the most "red gold" aka Alaskan King Crag. Survive the hazards of the Bering Sea as you race to drop your crab pots and return to port with the largest crab count. The board game that recreates all the winning show action! Game includes quad-fold game board, 18 navigation cards, 20 crab pots, 6 hazard chips, Coast Guard chip, and 4 ship markers

name: Sinterklaasjournaal Bordspel
description:
The Game consists of 3 games: The Steamboatgame (Het Stoombootspel), The Giftgame (Het Pakjesspel) and The Memoryvariant.

All games are based on a dutch special-day: Sinterklaas. This is the dutch version of SantaClaus and is celebrated on december 5th each year.

In The Steambootgame players use there playingfigure to collect presents from the hold of the ship on the gameboard. They do no know the value of the present they took.Via stairs and rooms of 3 different colors they attempt to bring them to the deck, to secure them. To do so, they throw a dice with the 3 different colors on it. A player must stop in a room of that color. When 2 players are in the same room, they have to switch presents. Two special actions which are in some rooms give players the chance to look at another players present, or his own, or to catch up with another player who is at max two stories higher in the ship. If all presents are on the deck, the player with the highest value of presents wins the game!

In The Giftgame players buy a few small presents upfront. They agree on the amount of money to be spent. You can also use the chips in the game and play for points.In this game also the colordice is used to decide to what field on the gameboard the player moves his playingfigure to. On each field is a different symbol, each giving a different action. The possible actions are: Take a present, switch presents and open them up, give present away to the player with the fewest presents, all presents in front of the players are passed to your neighbour in a clockwise fasion. and finally open up a present. When there are no more presents in the pile, the game ends. When playing with chips in stead of real presents, the game ends as soon as the last chip is taken from the supply. The player with the most points wins!~

The Memoryvariant is just another memory: There are 2 pairs of 12 different colored-and-valued chips. Turn them up-side-down so the sack is showing, shuffle them, and try to find the matching pairs as in regular memory. The player witrh the most chips wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Flip-a-Longs: Knights of the Long Table
description:
From the designer

You have been invited to dine with royalty at the legendary Knights of the Long Table! In this far away land, players must have a keen sense of memory as they match cards to create scenes and build the longest table in the kingdom!

Flip-A-Longs cleverly combines puzzle play and memory matching to create an engaging new game that children and adults alike will "flip" for! Simply flip over cards, if you find a match, add it to your table to make yours the longest!

Who will be seated at your table? Mischievous wizards? Beautiful maidens? Brave knights? The player to match the most cards and build the longest table wins!

Dynamic game play and silly illustrations encourage memory, matching, counting, dexterity and more! Flip-A-Longs is a game the entire family can play!
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Memory, Puzzle

name: Liverpool
description:
Card game in an "old time game" edition. Similar to Phase 10, but you have 13 phases:
1. 2 sets of 3
2. 1 tun of 4 and 1 set of 3
3. 3 sets of 3
4. 1 run of 5 and 1 set of 4
5. 2 runs of 4 and 1 set of 4
6. 1 run of 6 and 1 set of 5
7. 3 sets of 4
8. 4 sets of 3
9. 2 sets of 6
10. 1 run of 7 and 1 set of 5
11. 1 run of 8 and 1 set of 4
12. 1 run of 10
13. 1 set of 10

On your turn you take a card from the stock or the discard. If you have all your card for the actual phase you can lay them out. If one person gets rid of all hand cards the round ends. "2"s are wild cards.

name: Ratio
description:
A small game collection containing four abstract game boards, 20 pawns and one dice. The four games are:

PAT: Try to reach the starting spaces of your opponent first.

WINGS: This is Nine Men's Morris.

START: A dice racing game; try exit your pawns before your opponent.

PYRAMIDE: While trying to get your pawns to the top, you get points for filled up levels.

name: Euro: In viaggio per l'europa con la nuova moneta unica
description:
From the back of the box:

"A trip across the EUROPE, both educational and fun, discovering of what will change with the introduction of the single currency. With a simple and gripping gameplay, you'll learn a lot of important notions, to be real EUROPE nationals and do the first shopping in EURO. Tailored for the whole family or group of friends who want to be prepared for this new important appointment."

Every player get an amount of money, and a "Travel Agency"; they use two pawns (one plastic, one cardboard with standup) one in a track where different things can happen, and one in a map of the European Union. Spinning the wheel, every player move the plastic pawn around the track, where it may get or lose money or tickets. Some special boxes on track are trivia boxes, and other are "Guess the price" trivia space: a player read from a quiz book a common object name, and the others must guess what price is in euro, putting the money on the "Travel Agency" and opening all at the same time. A square in the track is "Departure" where all players, using tickets (trains for a near country, boats are for countries connected by naval lines on the map, and planes are every non near coutry). After these moves, if there is only a pawn on a country, that player get a flag. If two or more are on that country, nobody gets that flag! Also, there are only three flag; when they are out, the player don't get the flag. The first to collect 6 flags wins.

The game has playing board, rulesbook, triviabook, various pawns, 6 "Travel Agency" player's screen to hide information, flags, tickets and cardboard Euro money.

name: Dan-Chi
description:
Dan-Chi contains 32 dual sided playing pices and a double sided board to play 6 different games (different variants)

Contents: 8 Red-White Guard Counters
8 White-Green Guard Counters
8 Green-Black Guard Counters
8 Black-Red Guard Counters
1 Double Sided Board - Front Board (6 by 6 square grid)
- Back Board (7 by 7 square grid, with center square missing)
Rules Booklet
Overview Leaflet.

The aim of the game is to get two of your guards onto a matching pair of Chi symbols printed on the board. The first player to do so wins the round and scores points based on the symbol matched, the guards lost and the opponents guards eliminated. As pairs of symbols need capturing, if an any time a player has only one guard left they are eliminated - leading to a secondary win condition.

In each turn a player moves two guards eliminating (jumping over and removing) any opponets within reach. Chi symbols can only be occupied if capturing is not possible. There are 6 games, but as the rules (and aim) for each are identicle these seem to be more like variants rather than fully fledged games.
Due to the mechanic of capturing these games play similar to checkers but the Chi matching alters the strategy quite well.

The six games are called: Tae Kwon Do (2 Players - Front Board), Aikido (4 Players - Back Board), Kung-Fu (4 Players - Front Board), Karate (2 Players - Back Board), Judo (2 Players - Front Board) and Jujitsu (2 Players - Back Board).

The theme of the game is martial arts, however this is not crutial and seems tacked on. The identical game would work, for example, with a space theme or a roman warrior theme. As with all abstracts the theme is not that important.

name: Find Out!
description:
Game inspired by the 'Find Outers' books by Enid Blyton.
44 cards. Players have to be the first to solve two mysteries, by collecting and laying out two sets of three cards.There are three 'Wild ' cards that do not belong to any set. Buster (the Find Outers dog) can earn you extra points. P.C. Goon cards lose you points and Inspector Jennings cards can cancel the effect of a Goon card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Big Fish Little Fish
description:
A trick-taking game for traditional playing cards. Features 'boasting' - a push-your-luck mechanic.

Each round, an auction is held for the right to be 'big fish', who will have a better hand and should win more tricks than any little fish. Unlike other card games, you bid points of your score - being a big fish carries a greater element of risk, since you need to regain at least the points you just lost in the auction.

A game lasts around 4-6 rounds, decided in advance. For 2 players, 4 rounds are recommended.

summary of a round:
- DEAL 6 cards to each player. Deal out a face-up 'dummy hand' of 6 cards.

- Have an AUCTION for the right to be big fish. The winning bid is deducted from the big fish's score.

- BIG FISH declares the trump suit, then exchanges any number of cards from their hand with cards from the extra hand.

- Each player BOASTS how many tricks they will win.

- Starting with Big Fish, PLAY out the 6 tricks. There is no need to follow suit and the first-played suit has no special significance.

- Players who took fewer tricks than their boast win nothing. Players who win at least as many as their boast SCORE points equal to their boast squared.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Island Fish Co.
description:
Fishing season and Stores want lots of fish. Out to sea we go, putting out bait, hauling in nets, watching out for Sharks, always paying attention to the weather reports. Take a risk and get that last catch in?

The four Island Stores put in orders for Fish of various kinds.
Players are members of the Island Fishing Co-op, each with their own Boat, but who work together to fill these Store Orders, and return Home safely before the Stormy Season makes fishing and deliveries too dangerous to continue. They get paid for their work and share the earnings!

Contents:

12 x 12" board,
4 fishing boats,
4 boat movers,
12 assorted fish,
4 sharks,
4 good weathers,
12 storms, and
16 assorted baits (4 are all-purpose),
the home supply depot

name: Poker Carré
description:
In Poker Carré, players add cards to a grid and try to create sequences of at least four numbers (e.g., 1-2-3-4), sets of at least three cards of the same suit, and sets of at least three cards of the same value.

Why is this difficult? The deck consists of 49 cards – seven suits of seven cards numbered 1-7 – and each player starts with a hand of four cards, while nine cards are randomly laid out in a 3x3 grid. On a turn, a player adds a card to the grid adjacent to at least one card already on the table, with the restriction that at least one of the adjacent cards must have a value exactly one higher or one lower than the card being played. That player then draws a replacement card. Once all the cards have been played, tally the points; the player with the highest score wins.

name: Party Alarm
description:
The players are divided into two teams and have to compete in 18 categories. The players try to fulfill tasks requested by cards. Most of these categories require the players to explain or tell something with a handicap, such as letting your tongue hang out while you pronounce a difficult word and such, forming a sentence which contains the same word twice in a row, etc.
For each fulfilled task, the team moves up ten percent on a kind of "fun indicator" (Stimmungsbarometer in German). At certain intervals, a "fitness test" is required before the team's pawn can move on to the next sector on the game board or eventually cross the finish line to win the game.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Ihmevekotin
description:
In Ihmevekotin ("Wonder machine"), players race around the board, trying to remember where the parts of their machine are scattered. Collecting parts requires doing mission cards, which require all sorts of activities, like making an ugly grin or buzzing like a bee.

The game has a purpose; it's goal is to teach how to express different emotions. The game itself is a fairly simple roll and move, with lavish production.

name: Name Your Price
description:
Some people would do crazy things for nothing more than a dare. Most of us though would want a hefty financial incentive to lose our inhibitions or challenge our morality. "Name Your Price" poses the question: How much?

One player reads out an imaginary situation, the group discusses it, and the player places a face-down card indicating how much money it would take for that player to act out. Then the other players make secret guesses on the value of that money.

Situations are purely hypothetical and might test your:

morality (eg Break into your best friend’s house)
or your modesty (eg Walk to your local store completely naked)
It could be embarrassing (eg Walk around your local shopping centre with a nappy on your head)
Or just downright painful (eg Pierce your tongue)

name: Grabbelen
description:
Grabbelen (Grabble) is a party game based on memory and card recognition.

On the table are 36 cards, and each card has a color (and symbol matching that color) and a number (1 through 6). A player rolls two dice – one with numbers, the other with colors – then all players look for the card that matches the color and number rolled. The first player to find the card takes it.

If the card isn't on the table, the first player to call out the name of the player who has it takes the card from its current owner.

The first player to accumulate a set number of cards wins.

name: Square-Up
description:
Square Up is a pattern matching game using a 2x3 portion of a 3x3 gameboard. Four players are shown on box top, but it may be possible that as few as two could play.

The players are dealt cards intended to match patterns on the board. The colors in the 3x3 matrix could be changed one at a time by rotation of an associated knob on the board. Assumable a player would rotate one of the knobs to his color on his turn.

name: Monopoly: Harley-Davidson Authorized Edition
description:
From the back of the box

There is a new major rally... and you've hit the highway. Two American Icons, The Monopoly Brand and Harley-Davidson, have joined forces to create the most popular board game on two wheels. Monopoly, the world's most popular board game, proudly introduces a game designed exclusively for the Harley-Davidson enthusiast.

Buy, sell and trade the great motorcycles, engines, rallies and all that makes the Harley-Davidson lifestyle what it is! Hop on your Electra Glide Standard or Heritage Springer, but be sure to ride clear of your opponent's properties--landing on the wrong space could cost you big!

Game includes: Game Board, Property Cards, Money & Banker's Tray, 2 Dice, Chance Cards, Community Chest Cards, Package of 32 Garages, Package of 12 Dealerships, & 8 Pewter Custom Game Tokens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Pigeon Wants a Match
description:
First the Pigeon wanted to drive a bus. Then the Pigeon found a hot dog. Now the Pigeon wants a match in this new game from University Games. Based on the Pigeon book series by Mo Willems, The Pigeon Wants a Match Game finds players trying to collect the most matches of hilarious images from the books. Color-coded borders and backgrounds make pairing tiles easy and fun for even the youngest matchers. The game is designed to help develop visual literacy and coordination skills. This game brings the fun of the books to kids in a new way.

The difference between The Pigeon Wants a Match and Memory is that The Pigeon Wants a Match has a tile that will allow you to gain an extra turn and one that will force you to lose a turn if you turn over a certain tile.

name: Бронепехота (Armored Infantry)
description:
Бронепехота ("Armored Infantry") is a sci-fi tabletop game with miniatures. Each player is the head of the military forces of one of the opposing star powers. The rules aren't extensive, but wide enough to cover many nuances of intense fighting in the Star Era. There are two ways of shooting: real and virtual. Some weapons actually launch plastic missiles. Virtual firing is resolved using dice rolls. The rules contain corresponding chapters if players wish to switch from one firing way to another. Warriors, cannons and fighting machines are snap together kits requiring no glue for assembly.

From the official rules of the game:

ARMORED INFANTRY is a sci-fi game that can be played by several players at the same time, each with their own army. To win, it is necessary to defeat the enemy army or complete some task - a mission. Missions can be very different, for example, to capture an object, destroy an enemy command vehicle, hold a line, etc.

Player armies consist of squads of armored infantry, manned combat vehicles, and artillery pieces. Their game parameters are indicated in special "documents" - Army Lists.

Each vehicle or squad of infantrymen is a separate unit. During the battle, players take turns operating their units – moving them, shooting at the enemy, or engaging the enemy in close combat. When one unit has finished its actions, i.e. has completed its turn, it is time for the next unit's turn, and so on. Each unit can only make one turn per round, so when all units have made one turn, a new round begins. At the beginning of each round, the players play the initiative, i.e. determine who will go first, who will go second, etc. If all soldiers - infantrymen and machine pilots - in the player's army are destroyed, then he is out of the game. The rest of the participants continue the battle without him. Thus, round after round, the battle continues until one of the players wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Do you speak English?
description: To make the first words in english very easy, children play the well-known games of lotto or memory or bingo and use 36 picture cards showing english words belonging to one of 9 groups: Family, animals, body, toys, at home, at school, food+drinks, clothes and seasons. Speaking and hearing in this game are very important so a grown-up who speaks English should be present during play.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: Potz Blitz
description:
Objective: be the first to get rid of all your cards

1. each player receives 5 cards (randomly) - other cards will be placed in a stack on the back onto the board
2. turn the top card and place it according the illustrated letter on the board
3a. player left to the starting may place a card with a letter, part of the previous placed card
3b. same player may place a new/additional card on the board if the leading letter is part of previous placed card (3a)
3c. player may continue according above mentioned rule
4. if he/she can't place an additional card next player may
act in similar way, but if no card can be played a new/additional card must be taken
5. if you empty your hand - you win
golden chip is used to mark the card last played
game was published for two different target groups
children and addults - see editions/images

name: Hungry Monsters
description:
From the publisher:
New children game from Tactic, where each player takes a roll of a small monster, who is looking to grow and get scarier.
Each player has a small board in front of them where they have 5x3 table of circles which needs to be filled with food.
Game has 12 different foods (drinks, hamburgers etc) Each row must have 5 different foods, but at least 1 drink.
When you are able to complete a row, you will receive a small special ability which helps you to get bigger faster and easier.
Monsters go around the board and collect food with different tasks (dice oriented tasks) and watch put from each other.
There are 4 monsters together and each one has their own abilities.
The first one to fill the board is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tournament Joust
description:
Tournament Joust is a 2 to 8 player board game depicting heroic Knight’s jousting in tournaments during the Middle Ages. The game can be played as a single day tournament or as a campaign with multiple Knights competing in different cities across England, finally leading up to the world championship.
The Basic Game – Players compete against one another in a single day tournament to find out who is the Champion Knight.
The game board consists of the graphical layout of the tournament list as well as each players lance tip location chart, horse movement card locations, Impact and stability charts, Knight reaction card locations, Aim card locations, and random lance tip movement charts.
Winning a match – Each match consists of three runs or passes, with the winner declared by breaking three lances across the Shield, Helm, or Crest. An immediate win will be granted by unhorsing your opponent or knocking his crest from his helm. In the event of a tie, the Knight with the most broken lances or strikes of his lance will win the match.
Winning the Tournament – The tournament is won by the knight who earns the most points from each match and jousts with honor. In the event of a tie, the Knight with the most match wins will be the tournament winner.
The game components consists of cards, tokens, markers, jousting figures, a single 10 sided die, a game board and rules.
Setup is relatively quick with minimal effort and game play can take around 30 to 45 minutes per jousting match.
The Advanced Game – Players compete in a campaign across Europe competing in Grand Tournaments to become the Grand champion. New rules cover fatigue, endurance, honor, and ransoms. Plus different skill levels and horse modifiers add taken into account for each joust. “Coming soon”
The Solitaire Game – Rules for solitaire play consist of single player games with random card sequences and lance tip movement changes that pit you against different types of Knight with different levels of expertise. “Coming soon”
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Hi-Life!
description:
The box advises "More Than a Game - An Excuse For a Party!
Gamble! Race! What a Pace! - Live Life to the Full With Father's Millions!"

This game is ideally played by equal numbers of opposite sexes. The game is played on the assumption that each player is the son or daughter of a very wealthy father. He sends them into the game of life with a gift of £10,000 and an allowance of £250 each time a circuit of the board is completed.
The winner is the player or marriage partnership that survives when other players have lost all their assets.

An abbreviated version of the game may be played where the first player or marriage partnership to reach £50,000 in cash and possessions is the winner, or the wealthiest player after an agreed time limit. The rules are the same for all versions.
How many games feature Boyfriends, Girlfriends, Marriage, Ascot, Casinoes, Auctions, Robberies and more?

Contents
1 Game Board.
Various Amounts of Money in Five Denominations.
33 Hi Life Cards(17 Blue/16 Pink).
12 Each of Boyfriend and Girlfriend Cards.
8 Married Cards.
16 Stock Cards.
24 Gift Cards(3 of 8 Different Types).
6 of Each - Car,Yacht and Cabin Cruiser Cards.
16 Investment Property Cards(4 of 4 Different Types).
8 Playing Pieces.
2 Dice.
1 Horse Marker.
1 Button Marker.
1 Set of Rules.

name: Paper Trails: Hiking!
description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the first to hike to the Trail’s end in the HIKING! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

name: Tall Tales
description:
The storyteller has 30 seconds in which to tell a "shaggy dog story" including three key words listed on a card taken at the start of that player's turn.

The trick is that the storyteller is trying to conceal which three words of the story are on the card.

After the story has been told, the other players may confer and jointly have three guesses as to which words were on the card.

name: Smithsonian Mission Museum: Case of the Missing Mummy
description:
From the Publisher:

A Mummy is on the loose in the museum! Your mission is to work together to reveal the spell that will stop the mummy from escaping into the city. As a team, you’ll decode secret messages, answer questions and complete puzzles to lead you to the spell that returns the mummy back to its case.

- Track the mummy using teamwork to collect the three artifacts on your mission card!
- Encourages positive teamwork and cooperative play
- Learn about Smithsonian’s coolest artifacts along the way!

Includes:
300 Challenge Cards
8 Mission Cards
16 Artifact Tiles
5 Movers
1 Red Revealer
1 Timer
1 Pad of Paper
1 Pencil
1 Set of Rules

name: BD: le Jeu
description:
The goal of the game is during 9 years (9 rounds of the game board) with two kinds of players - the authors and publishers, to compete or join forces to produce a maximum of comic books, and total and maximum points.

The aim of the authors is to acquire a maximum class while providing a minimum of money.
The purpose of publishers is to acquire as much money while ensuring a minimum of Fame.

The game ends when the first of the two editors has nine full turns of the game board and then the scoring begins where authors calculate their royalites, publisher calculate the books sold etc.

The FIRST and the Only Sexy Game. It's the G game...It's the G gift
Are you sexy enough to attract customers in your brothel? But above all, you're pretty sexy face the penalties? Conquest erotic positions and collect money from customers! Classic game board with a penalty, drawings sexy and squares joker to spend a pleasant evening with friends. It is possible play in 2 or more people, individually or in pairs.

Objective:
The purpose of the game is to let in more customers in your own brothel so that you will earn more than the other players.
