The players will form 2 groups: the first group will start from square number 1, the second group from square number 69. The board game is composed by empty squares (only with numbers), squares depicting erotic position and squares joker (with mouths). Every time that one player stops on a square with an erotic position he takes the corresponding card. Every time that the player stops on an empty square he will draw a penalty card. The winner is the player with the most money at the end of the game, or the one who has made the best performance.

The winner may choose a penalty for the other player or players. The box also contains a small billboard to take you on a journey, on weekends and holidays.

name: Cheptel
description:
Your goal is to be the first to have set up your herd of 10 cows, calves and bulls of the same color.
But beware! Your opponents are ruthless and will not hesitate to send you the worst nasties like drought, mad cow etc.

In his turn player play a card for his herd or nasty card for his opponent.

Player who set up his herd first avoiding the nasty cards is the winner.

name: Duck Soup...The Restaurant Game
description:
Think up a great name for your restaurant, then answer true/false and multiple choice questions about food, wine, cooking and related trivia, and earn Duckats.

Use your Duckats, skill and luck to improve your restaurant, by hiring Excellent dining room and kitchen staff, even if you have to steal them away from other players' restaurants. Be the first player or team to have ALL Excellent staff and the best restaurant and you win the game.

Sounds easy, but when you have to pay for renovations, plumbing problems or deal with a chef who wants to quit and work for one of your competitors, things start to heat up.

And remember, if you can't stand the heat, stay out of the kitchen.

name: Qube: Suomen kieli
description: A simple and quickly played trivia game about the Finnish language. The game comprises cards with 500 questions in five different categories, such as dialects, slangs and funny synonyms. The game also includes 49 special cards. The game box is designed to be small enough to carry with you when traveling.

name: Gwiezdny Inwestor
description:
An old style game. Players build their wealth by speculating on stock exchange, takes loan, investing in knowledge, expliot chances of life (means events).

Mechanic is standard -I go you go -. Interaction is little. Resources to buy are plentful and players really don't have to compete with each other.

Purpose of game is to collect the most wealth.

A game with lot of banking and 'economy' mechanics.
A loose adaptation of Monopoly in science fiction climate of future humanity - we have similar buying system and board to Monopoly.
Edition of this project was limited.

name: Disney Princess Magic Wand Game
description: Up to four princesses try to reach the Magic Castle first to open the big ball. The active player waves the (electronic) magic wand which then gives instructions about movement (mostly letting the princess move forward, but sometimes doing spells which change the path to the castle, let a princess swap places with another princess, etc. Some fields protect the princess from spells, other yield a diamond that can neutralize spells. The first princess to reach the castle is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: La bola de fuego
description:
"La bola de fuego" (The Fireball) it's a simple roll-and-move game in wich the players, taking the role of explorers, must enter a volcanic island and race against each other to catch some diamonds, avoiding the dangers that lurk within the place (Slippery caves, swaying bridges, crocodiles, octopuses and, of course, fireballs), and trying to escape first.

A quite lackluster game, trying to capitalize on the success of the more well-known Fireball Island (even directly stealing its front box artwork), made by knock-off specialist Falomir Juegos.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
description:
This game is a game with the motif of the boy liar Grimm's Fairy Tales. The aim is to shout a lie well, and to eliminate the other sheep.

Every time a player parent, shouted, "Wolf!" (This cry is referred to as the "Boys Shout!")

The parent player, chooses which card to place on the table. Select whether you want a lie and cry, or really call a wolf. Both the wolf and the lie cards have the same back.

Now the other players must decide whether the wolf really came. Villagers must choose whether they think the wolf-call is a lie, or if they will take up arms to fight off the wolf.

If the wolf is called, and the villagers have chosen correctly, the calling player will lose sheep. If the lie, and choose the villagers get angry, you will lose as opposed to sheep.

name: Qwikscore Soccer
description:
Statistical soccer game from the master of such quick replay games. Based on statistics culled from both the indoor and outdoor soccer leagues in America.

Each team is rated for each year and a simple dice roll decides the result. This way you could play a season in one evening, I think that was the aim of the designer.

name: Superstructure
description:
A building game where players are acquiring all of the elements the need to build a three-story tower. Players use cards to buy equipment from the stock -- H-beams and joints create substructures, and V-beams are used to build to the next story. The goal of the game is to be the first player to build a three-story building that consists of three substructures separated by V-beams, and a roof.

Game play consists of turns where players either buy materials, or use purchased materials to build building elements. Unbuilt raw materials are vulnerable to card-play from other players that may require them to give over unused materials, or may cause a player to return all unused materials to the supply. Additionally, some special action cards prevent a player from building until the player resolves a strike, either through the payment of money, or the play of a contract card.
publishers: Coolsville, Ltd., The Roger Jackson Company

name: De Magische Wereld van Pardoes
description:
De Magische Wereld van Pardoes is based upon a popular character of the Dutch theme park 'Efteling' and derived television series of the same name.

The game features a circular board, just like the previous games that have been released in the same series (Joris en de Draak, Raveleijn). In this case 74 spaces divide the starting square from the finishing square with an emerald.

The game is a typical roll-and-move game, combining some different genre elements. Before the game starts, players have to choose 1 of the 4 game's characters. Two of them (Pardoes, Pardijn) represent the heroes in the story depicted, while the two other characters (Rattar, Pantagor) are the villains in this game.

A basic turn consists of rolling 1D6 and moving your character the according number of spaces towards the finish.

The board contains a number 'white twinkles' and 'green lightnings' (4 of each), which work just like S'nakes and Ladders'. The white twinkles work as ladders for the heroes and as snakes for the villains; the green lightnings work the other way around.

The board also contains two sections with spinning arrows. If your move ends on a square in such a section, you spin that section's arrow and move to the square indicated by the arrow.

Other squares let you take an action card (some are to be executed immediately, others can be kept for later in the game) or invoke a duel between you and another player. Each of the duelling secretly chooses 1 card from a set of 3 (water, fire and wood) and reveal this card simultaneously. Water beats fire, fire burns wood and wood floats on water. The winner of the duel gets a bonus move.

A duel is also fought when a player lands on a square with another player's piece. In this case the winner of the duel gets to stay on the square where as the loser goes backwards the number of squares indicated by 1D6.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ratz Fatz Zahlen
description:
An educational game for children, focused on learning the numbers from 0-10. Like the other games in the Ratz Fatz series, this is a collection of games that can be played with the same material.

Central idea
A story or poem is being read, the kids listen, guess, rhyme and grab an object.

Components
10 wooden animals, 11 cards (showing a number one one side and the corresponding number of animals on the other side), one booklet with rules, stories, riddles and poems

Games that can be played:

1. Group and name: The players name the animals on the card and count them. Players are given different tasks (find a pet, all pets, a wild animal, the smallest, a black one, ...)

2. Sort by number: Cards are placed before/after another card according to the number of animals that are shown on it. The game can also be played with the number side.

3. Grab the animal: The animals or cards mentioned in one of the texts from the booklet have to be touched as quick as possible.

4. Memory game: Only six animals and/or cards are laid out on the table, the others stay in the box. When a number or animal is mentioned that is on the table, nothing happens. If one that is inside the box is mentioned, the players shout that word to gain one of the pieces from the table.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Number

name: Zeit-Collage
description:
Objective: depending on version
- acting by turns -
version 'Bilder-Orakel': - entering the game easily -
72 images out of the time range 1945 - 2002 are displayed in a 7x8 grid; (6) themes are: consumer products, everyday life, paragons, world affairs, miscellaneous, typical German - each associated with a colour;
(matching) history cards are shuffled; active player turns top card and tries to find the matching image - correct? 1 victory chip (own colour), placed upon image. Winner: first with 6 chips totally or '3 in a row/column/transversal' or '3 of a single theme'.

version Bilder-Dekade: - take out paragon images -
form a 6 x 10 grid;
active player throws 2 dice (decades 40-90 & coloured one - green is missing (paragons) = free choice);
choose a matching image: correct - place your chip -
judging see above;

version Bilder-Rallye': - take out 'consumer products' -
- acting simultaneously/game master alternates -
60 images are placed randomly upon the table; game master reads a history card: all other must place a chip upon an image
(only one per image); correct or wrong - you got rid of a chip; - winner: most correct chips
version Bild-Reporter: - take out 'consumer products' -
- acting simultaneously/game master alternates -
60 images are placed randomly upon the table;
game master describes a quality of an image - all others must place their chips - if a chip is matching: 1 victory point, wrong chips are removed

name: The Very Bad Game
description:
The Very Bad Game is a board game based on the wacky characters and themes of the immensely popular Bad Book series by Andy Griffiths - one of Australia's most successful writers.

How to play:
"For ages 7 and up, the game is easy to play and always fun. Players race around Badtown trying to find the 4 missing pieces of their lost pet. But it's not easy! They have to get past the weird and wacky folk of Badtown - who will send them every which way around the board for all kinds of very bad reasons. And watch out - the whole town may even blow up! It's a lot of nonsense and riotous family fun!"

Three dice are used - The Bad Die, The Very Bad Die and The Highway Die (which is used to cross the highways).

The game is expected to be the must-have companion to the Bad Book Series and the perfect gift for the hundreds of thousands of Griffith's fans. Developed in partnership with Andy Griffiths, The Very Bad Game is a genuine extension to the books - including 200 hilarious Very Bad Cards.
It is cetain to bring hours of family fun with excellent game play, laughter, the enjoyment of reading and a little strategy. It is also a visual treat! Just like the books, the game includes hundreds of illustrations and a stunning game board by Terry Denton that bring the world of Badtown to life as only Terry can.
(Source: Relatively Creative website)

name: Mia and me: Rettet die Einhörner!
description:
A children's card game set in the universe of the 2011 live action/CGI animated television series "Mia and me".

Background story: Centopia's unicorns are in danger! Collect as many unicorn tears as possible, find all parts of the golden Trumptus and skillfully use the elves' weapons to fend off the evil Panthea.

Aim of the game: Collect the most valuable cards to reach the highest number of points and win the game. The game ends when all pieces of the Trumptus have been found. The unicorns will be safe from Panthea!

Gameplay: The cards are shuffled and placed in a face-down stack. The youngest player turns over the top card. He/she may also turn over several cards. But it is possible that he/she doesn't get to keep any of them so players should consider carefully how big a risk they are willing to take.

The cards and their significance:
The ring: With this ring, the elves are calling each other for help. The player puts this card in front of him/herself and his/her turn is over.
The Trumptus: When all the pieces of the Trumptus have been found, the unicorns are safe. The card is placed at the center of the table, where the individual pieces form a picture of the Trumptus. The player's turn is over. If there are elven or unicorn cards in the middle of the table, the player gets to take them and put them in front of him/herself.
A crying unicorn: This card is particularly valuable. It stays in the middle of the table until the active player's turn is over. The player may turn over another card if he/she wants.
Elf with water bracelet: This card helps the player in the battle against Panthea. The card stays in the middle of the table until the active player's turn is over. The player may turn over another card if he/she wants.

A player who doesn't want to turn over another card may end his/her turn and take all the open elven and unicorn cards. But first he/she has to fight a duel with Panthea. With luck, he/she will be able to fight off Panthea's snake lassos. For the duel, the 6 chips are thrown into the air. Then players count how many green and blue symbols can be seen. More blue than green symbols: The player wins the duel. Equal number: If there is an elven card in the middle of the table or in front of the player, he/she can still fend off Panthea. The snake lasso and an elven card are set aside and the player wins the duel and gets to take the cards. More green than blue symbols: The player loses the duel. The open elven, unicorn and snake lasso cards are returned to the card stack, which is then shuffled again and it's the next player's turn.

End of game: The game ends when all six Trumptus cards have been turned over. Players count the points on the cards they have collected. The player with the highest number of points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Telmivät tenavat
description: Physical action game for children. Move frogs on roll-and-move track. Special spaces on track will instruct players to perform different physical activities. The game teaches basic board game rules and encourages physical activity.

name: Denti
description:
From the package:
Dental care - healthy eating - an educational game

They players roll alternately a die and move their pawns (styled like a tooth) along the track on the board. The first player moving its pawn on the last field wins.
There are some arrows on special fields of the board that move the pawns forward or backwards. That depends on the picture drawn near to it (eating sweets moves you backwards, brushing your teeth moves you forward).

name: Boss
description: Boss is a tactical strategy game revolving around invading dungeons, defying the terrifying lords that dwell there and engaging in intense combat. In Boss, 1-4 players will cooperatively compete against different dungeon lords known as bosses, combating their powerful abilities with teamwork and strategy. Boss is a new type of dungeon delving game aimed at getting the players to the most important and exciting part of an adventure game – the boss battle. Instead of spending hours plodding around fighting small weak whelps and plundering pointless treasures, Boss will put you face to face with monstrous creatures from square one.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Real-Time, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Fight on Tatooine Battle Game
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

One of the many Angry Birds Star Wars Battle Games, this set includes Han Solo bird figure, the set exclusive Greedo pig and Ponda Baba pig figures.

Set includes 3 figures, 6 blocks, 1 cantina arch, 1 LIGHTSABER launcher and instructions.

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Monopoly: Quimper
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Quimper, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bungees
description:
This is a very light (but difficult-to-master) dexterity game with collectable figurines made of a rubbery material. The game board is magnetic, and so is the bottom of every figure.

There are several modes of play, but all of them involve flicking your figurine(s), trying to get them to land on certain spots of the game board.

The figurines are mostly sold in single, blind-purchase booster packs (although there are some other packages available).

name: Wall-e: Un cadeau pour Ève
description:
It's a Wikinder evolution featuring the little robot of the famous movie.
Each player tries to clean the planet, collecting rubbish along the 7 continents and bringing it to the central rubbish tip, where it will be converted into beautiful coloured cubes. The one who is be able to collect the greatest number of cubes can try to conquer the heart of the little female robot Eva.

name: Snip Snap
description:
Game designed to teach people about the new currency that was due to come into effect in Britain in 1971. Leans heavily on Snap but neatly expands the idea of seeing matching cards. You had to be alive at the time to know how people were worried about getting rid of pounds, shillings and pence. A decimal based currency is so much easier and sensible but the British people took some time to get used to it. Games like this helped.

Rules:
1. Any number of persons may play this game.
2. One player deals the cards in rotation until the pack is exhausted, giving a conversion table to each player.
3. Each player keeps his cards, without looking at them, face down on the table in front of him. Then as his turn comes round he turns up the top card and places it before him, making another stack.
4. If the top exposed cards on any two piles
(a) two identical decimal currency cards (e.g. two cards both reading ‘25 new pence’), any player may call 'SNIP’:
(b) two identical old currency cards (e.g. two cards both reading ‘10/-'), any player may call ‘SNAP’;
(c) two cards expressing the same value but in different currencies (e.g. ‘1/-’ and ‘5 new pence’), any player may call ‘SNIP-SNAP’.
5. If the call is correct, the caller picks up the two piles concerned and adds them, face downwards, to his hand. If the call is incorrect, the caller must give each player one card face downwards from his hand.
6. The player who eventually holds all the cards is the winner.

name: Memo
description:
From box bottom:
Here is a chance to test your memory! The object of the game is to find the 15 numbers, starting with No. 1 and continuing through in sequence to No. 15. To start: all the counters are placed face down on the board. In turn, lift a counter and check the number on the bottom. If it is not number 1, replace it, trying to to memorize the numbers and positions of replaced counters. Then try to find nr. 2, and so on. When the counters are found in the correct order, they are placed, right side up, in their proper places on the edge of the board. You can play alone or against an opponent. Simple rules with a score card.

name: Octonauts: Fische retten
description:
Octonauts: Fische retten is an easy roll and move game for children.

According to the result of a die roll, you can move a fish on the bord.
The first player to reach his boarder areas with four fishes is the winner.

name: Enter The Arena
description:
Enter The Arena is a competitive strategy based card game for 2 to 4 players. The game is intended for audiences aged thirteen and older, and has a play time of 15-30 minutes. As in the real Gladiatorial arenas of old, fighting prowess alone is not all that is required for success. The love and adoration of the crowd is no less important if one seeks to triumph in the arena.

This game is played using Attack, Defense, Style, and special Prowess cards which are all used in their own unique way, and are the tools you will use to be victorious in the arena. Enter The Arena is played in a series of trumps that continue until the game end conditions are met. Every turn you can either go on the Attack or Defend yourself against incoming attacks. Properly gauging your opponents reactions and moves is an important part of the game. Each player is sent into the arena with the same "tools" to defeat the other gladiators. How and when you use them is up to each player as the game develops. Augmenting your attacks or defense with Style cards is another integral part of the gameplay. Gaining the favor of the crowd is another potential way to win the game rather than defeating the other gladiators.

Adding another level of strategy to gameplay are the Prowess Cards. These cards have various effects that can be used to increase your chances in the arena and/or hinder your opponents as you battle for victory.

Enter The Arena is designed to be fun, strategic, and fast-paced with the ability for anyone to seize the upper hand at a moments notice with a properly executed combo. Be careful though because leaving yourself defenseless will in turn leave you at the mercy of your foes.

name: Circus Divas
description:
In Circus Divas, a two-player dice-buying game, you play the owner of a Depression-era circus going from town to town parting fools and their money. But in order to do that, you need to hire some help and, ultimately, earn more than the rival circus that keeps hitting the same towns you do and draining your profits.

Each player can hire performers for his or her circus from a common pool. Those performers each allow the player to roll one additional die for profit, from the lowly d4 to the mighty - but unpredictable - d20. But these performers can prove to be real divas. When a performer rolls a 1, he or she throws a diva's tantrum and has to be consoled - or he or she will quit. And if you're consoling one diva, you can't console another if they should have a tantrum, so choose carefully.

The first player to reach $100 in savings wins. Play time takes about 15 minutes and requires at least one d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, and d20 to play. Counters for money are also helpful, but pencil and paper could work just fine. Enjoy it, and please let me know what you think!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Adventurer: Card Game – Promo Cards
description:
These are additional cards made by gaming industry veterans and bonus cards that can be added to enhance Adventurer: The Card Game. They were made available from retailers, web orders, and other venues:


Golden Portal: Found only in the Limited Edition Castle Deck
Shade the Trickster: This is a Guest Designer Card by Gary Gygax. This is available from the website and from select retailers. We also have the great honor in knowing this is also the very last thing Gary designed before he passed away in March.
Warden's Pool of Darkness: This is a Guest Designer Card by James M. Ward and pays homage to the great gold box Dungeons and Dragons game he help create to the computer. This is available from the website and from select retailers.
Blunderbuss: This is a Guest Designer Card by Chris Clark. This is available from the website and from select retailers.
Slooch the Cleric: This is a Guest Designer Card by Tom Wham. This is available from the website and from select retailers.
Count Lodrac: These are extra Lodrac cards that you can add to your game to increase the chance of finding the vampire and likewise speeding up the game. This is available from the website and from select retailers.
Lodrac's Twin: This is an extra hero card that you can add to your deck to allow for more players.. This is available from the website and from select retailers.
Crown of Immortals: This card is free when you refer a friend to buy the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Capes and Villains
description:
This is a card and dice driven game for 1-10 players (that scales up to 5v5+ in Tag Battle and Multiplayer Modes) that pits super heroes and villains in a quick and frantic battle to see who can whittle the others' health down to zero the quickest. The dice act as accuracy levels while the cards rapidly execute Attacks, Defense, and Special Moves. Each individual character has their own Character Abilities, Tactics, Basic Attacks/Defense and Super moves to change the flow of the game as well.

In Capes and Villains, you are already in the heat of the battle. There are no preparation or equipment phases, no pre-planning or gradual movement into battle. Nope, you are there, getting your cape tightened around your neck or dishing out the pain yourself. Gameplay should seem a bit crazy and even spontaneous at times, but believe us when we say that under the mask is actually a lot of strategy.

Another Alternate gameplay scenario includes multiple players going up against one Super Villain. "Overpower" dice are added to expand on special abilities of a character's Super Villain persona (located on the back of each Character Card) to turn them into a super villain caliber.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Garden Trade: The card game
description:
You are a merchant who buys fruits from gardeners and sells them to customers in the market. Each turn you choose one of the following actions:

1) Buy one fruit from a gardener
2) Sell any number of fruits to customers
3) Draw a card and adjust pricing in market
4) Manage (swap) customer queue

The player who makes the most money from trading wins !

Most of the time when each player buys or sells any card, it will affect other players because the other players have to wait longer to buy or sell to get a decent price. And every game turn, there will be change in pricing which will cause each player to change their tactic dynamically otherwise player can lose opportunity to make money from trading efficiently.

So there is no down time in the game because even during other player's turn, you must carefully watch out for change in pricing and decide on your own next tactic!

It is designed for 2 - 5 players and end within 20 minutes.
Fast and dynamically tactical game play.

name: WuzzIts
description:
Wuzzits is a super silly matching game where your goal is to find and assemble the Wuzzit monsters with the most points by drawing, discarding and trading cards with other players.

Featuring wild and wacky art that kids absolutely love. Each of the 62 cards is either a top or bottom half of one of the 30 different Wuzzits. The first player to correctly assemble 3 complete Wuzzits (top & bottom) ends the round and then players add up their points based on how many monsters they were able to complete.

name: RE:VERSUS
description:
RE:VERSUS is all about getting points on the board and stealing from your opponents! Combine your cards to score quickly, but beware -- the other side is out to get your points too!

There are 83 cards in the deck. They are numbered 1-10, twice. There are also 2 Re:Versus, 2 Wilds and 2 combo Re:Versus/Wild cards.

Each card has a white half and a black half. The two players (or two teams) each choose a color and draw seven cards. They must then play these cards in sets of three (either three-of-a-kind or a run of three) according to the number that is on the side of their respective color (white or black).

Each turn includes drawing a card, scoring (by laying down a Meld of three cards, as previously explained), and discarding a card. Melds (or sets) are scored by adding their values (e.g. three 2's would be 6 points; a run of 4, 5, 6 would be 15 points). Melds can also be stolen from the other player by setting down the same Meld, but in your color. The opponent's Meld that the active player matched then goes into the active player's hand.

Special cards in the deck allow for "wilds" in the sets as well as the two players switching colors.

A turn ends after the active player has discarded a card.

The game ends when one player has scored 100 points.

name: Monopoly: The Hobbit – The Desolation of Smaug
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from The Hobbit.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wing It
description:
Wing It - The overland, underhand birdwatching challenge.

Race around the British countryside to be the first to spot unusual birds and at the same time hamper other players to prevent them from getting there first.

A Chough has just landed at the RSPB reserve on Ramsey Island and as you jump in your boat to be the first to get there you discover one of your opponents has hidden your paddles. However, don’t worry, they can’t get there either, because you’ve just punctured the tyres on their bike.

Wing It is a great fun family board game, requiring a little cunning, some guile and the employment of underhand tactics in order to win. Utilising official RSPB illustrations, calling on the experience of RSPB wardens and using actual RSPB reserves, Wing It combines an authentic birdwatching game with family entertainment.

You might ruffle a few feathers but remember the early bird wins.

name: Tactic Tiles!
description: 72 tiles, each containing three colored squares: blue, red, and yellow. The squares are arranged differently on each tile - no two tiles are the same. Each player has a hand of three tiles. You take turns placing a tile (and then drawing another), matching the colored squares. You score points when you create a three- or four-corner match, and when you match two or three different colors on the same play. The game ends when all tiles are played. The highest score wins.

name: Tüdelbüdel: Das Plattdeutsche Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build North-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting North-German dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: Walters Verjaardagsshow Spel
description:
Walters Verjaardagsshow Spel is based on a popular television show on Belgian television channel VTM that aired in 1989.

Players compete against each other in several rounds to gather different colors of keys.

After six rounds all players go to the vault, the gamemaster throws a colored die into the vault and then after lifting it, the player who has the key that matches the die face it has landed on, wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cosmic Rally
description:
Cosmic Rally is a fast paced, space racing card game for 2-6 players. Average laps can finish in less than 30 seconds! Race as many or few laps as you like. Tournament play (5-20 laps) lasts 30 minutes.

Players select a pilot and ship which determines the number of cards they must discard per lap. Players win laps by getting rid of their cards first. Watch out for other pilots as they try to slow you down with rockets and mines. Each lap will require you to dodge space hazards as well.

name: Het Gulden Florijnen Spel
description:
Collect as much money as you can as you follow with your coins a certain route multiple times from start to finnish. The first player that collect 10.000 florijnen is the winner.

De bedoeling van het spel is om met muntstukken en fiches een aantal keren de aangegeven route op het spelbord van start naar finish te volgen. Tijdens het spelen moet zoveel mogelijk geld worden verzameld. Degene die als eerste 10.000 florijnen heeft, is winnaar !

name: Fingo!
description: Discover how quick your wits are in this fast-paced matching game for 2 to 5 players. The rules are simple. Take 10 cards and lay them out on the table. Each card illustrates two hands, each with anywhere between 0 to 5 fingers raised. On the count of three, the players raise one hand, showing any number of raised fingers (between 0 and 5). With their other hand, players quickly try to pick up as many cards as possible that match any two raised hands among the players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: BEEP. BEEP. ATTACK!
description:
What is more fun than building a Robot? Destroying other Robots! Fast to play and an easily expandable design to add more destruction!

So what is BEEP. BEEP. ATTACK!?

Step one:

Build a robot.

Step two:

Wait for another robot to be built.

Step three:

ATTACK!

BEEP. BEEP. ATTACK!

A Casual/Filler style game that involves building Robots and destroying each other. Unfortunately, you are a dumb Robot and are forced to replace your parts as you acquire new parts of the same type, but luckily for you, you can always salvage that good part you just dropped off.

Make no mistake you must be able to destroy the enemy robot, but an all glass cannon build will surely let your opponent destroy you unless you get the Weapon, "Thrusters" or are playing a Variant mode! Sometimes the best offense is a little defense!

Expansion coming at end of year adding in a few new cards that add to the dynamics such as: Augments, Group Salvage, and more Parts including some with Options to not replace!

name: Lemonade Stand: The Game
description:
Build a lemonade stand and let it flourish or flounder with Lemonade Stand Board Game. 2 to 6 players can learn the basics of business by caring for their own virtual lemonade stand. Kids can purchase their own ingredients, set their own prices, and choose a location for their business. As they move across the board, they'll face challenges like weather, advertising, and customer experience. A fun game for the whole family. Includes instructions, dice, cards, and boards. Ages 7 and up.

All players begin the game by building their virtual Lemonade Stand and buying ingredients to make lemonade to sell
As players move around the board they learn about the many factors in running a business
Learning that it's all about location, advertising, weather, selling price & customer experience
Fun for kids and parents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Intercardinal
description: Intercardinal is an asymmetric N-in-a-row game. Players take turns placing pieces on a 12x8 board. The first to make a row of 4 contiguous pieces of their colour in a North/South direction (the short side) or 5 in an East/West direction (the long side) wins. Diagonal lines do not count.

name: Monopoly: Lippe
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Lippe, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Horrible Histories
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the theme Horrible Histories, a series of illustrated history books.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The B.I.A. (Bovine Intelligence Agency)
description:
The BIA is a game of two teams. One team are the loyal agents with the yellow agent tokens and the other team is the double agent with the blue agent chip. Players are not allowed to ever reveal their agent chips to the other players unless they are killed.

During a player's turn, the player can choose one of the available action cards to perform. Once all action cards have been used they are flipped back over and can be used again.

Loyal agents are trying to defuse danger zones while double agents want to make them happen more.

The game ends when one of the following conditions are met:
1.) Three disasters have taken place.
2.) All danger zones are gone from the board.
3.) If an agent has been killed and there are no more agent chips left.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game

name: Jr. RangerLand Skunk in the Campground
description:
Outer Box Description:
In this hilarious game, players draw cards and match pairs. But beware! If the skunk sneaks into your hand, you lose the game. The cards are filled with funny jokes and fun animal facts to share around the campfire.

Setup: Shuffle the Deck. Deal out the cards one at a time to all of the players. Some players may get an extra card. Cards in players hand are always kept hidden from other players. Any cards making pairs are laid down in front of players at this time. Compass cards are not used at this time.

Game Play: The player to the left of the dealer draws one card from the dealers hand. If a pair is made, the pair is laid down immediately. The person now offers cards to the player on his/her left.

Compass Cards: The compass cards are "reverse" cards. If the person who is about to draw holds a compass card, he/she may place it at the center of the table, and then draw a card from the player on his/her opposite side. The order of offering cards reverses until another compass card is played. The game play direction may change up to 3 times as each compass card may only be used once. If a player draws a compass card from another player, it cannot be used until his/her next turn. When there are two players, a player may play a reverse card instead of drawing.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor

name: Kieszonkowy Geek
description: 12 promotional cards for the Polish version with themes to attract the board gamers: board games, video games, role playing, comics, horror, sci-fi etc.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game

name: En la escena del crimen
description:
Solve the maximum number of crimes to become an expert in criminal investigation.
The goal is to solve a series of crimes and do it before the opposing team. A player reads the case and the rest will be detectives. Any player of the team makes a question to the master, he responds with YES or NOT, then any player of the other team makes another question. When a team has enought clues, try to resolve the case. If the explanation is correct, the team wins the game if not, the other team ask again. The team that resolved the crime before the other, wins the game.

name: Bamse och tjuvstaden
description: A childrens game based on the film with the same name. The game mechanic is dice-rolling with very few choices.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pride Deck
description:
Pride is card system similar to a standard poker deck. It's has 4 suits (clubs, diamonds, hearts, spades) and 52 cards plus 2 jokers. The face cards have no pictures, they are like the numbered cards but with a letter. What makes pride different is each numbered card is a different color of the rainbow. There is a different US state on every card and each card has a die.

There are many different games you can play with pride.

name: Alice in Wonderland (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

Two variants on the traditional game on one board - a race through the stories and a traditional game based on scenes instead of cities.
The race uses Ticket to Ride pieces and principles but the game is to move from the initial falling asleep as far as possible through the stories to the second awakening at the end of the looking glass epic. The winner has the most points.

The Ticket to Ride "normal" fan expansion follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game with an Alice theme (scenes from the stories take tje place of cities). The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop). You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the scenes, each with a value to be earned by visiting that scene. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.

name: Sheep Happens
description: Sheep Happens is a look into a ridiculous world where incredibly dumb sheep will have to figure out how to save themselves from the angriest, craziest, and most bizarre goats you've ever seen. A card game where you need to steal and imprison enemy players sheep, using powerful and dumb goats to attack them, while you defend yours. Defend from your opponents attacks placing fences in front of your sheep, using traps or scrolls from your hand and If you have any goat cards in your hand, attack your opponents in order to capture as many sheep as you can. Each captured sheep is worth one point, and the first player to reach seven, five or three points, wins the game.

name: Nextbol
description:
The game consists of 2 items: poles and balls.The balls’ holes are the connection point of the items. Each of the 2 players picks a colour with its 44 items: 12 balls and 32 poles.

RULES FOR 2 PLAYERS

The game starts with the player who selects the white items. The player can choose to start with a pole or a ball. Each player plays their turn using only one item at a time: a pole or a ball.
Every piece played must be linked to the pieces played beforehand. As the poles are inserted in the ball holes a three dimensional figure will begin to form. Once an item is placed, no changes or modification can be made.

AIM OF THE GAME
A player wins the game if during their turn they manage to:
• Insert 3 poles more than their opponent in any played ball
or
• place in a straight line 4 balls of the same colour.

Given that each ball has 6 holes and each player wins by placing 3 poles of the same colour more than their opponent the winning possibilities are 3-0 or 4-1. The players build up a three-dimensional network where there are different diagonals (2D or 3D) that allow placing 4 balls of the same colour in line. The game is considered a draw when both players use up their pieces and no player can place 3 poles more than their opponent into a ball or 4 balls of the same colour in line. Positioning and placing the pieces of the game in a clever way is part of the winning strategy.

In order to create a solid structure and to minimise the risk of the structure breaking during the game, we suggest placing the poles firmly in the ball holes.

RULES FOR 4 PLAYERS
The same rules for 2 players apply. Pairs of 2 players start the game with 44 elements each, playing on alternate turns and interposing one player of each couple.

name: サッカーしょうぎ (Soccer Shogi)
description:
Combine soccer and shogi in one game.

In this game, both players need to control a team, 6 players token, and let them shoot the ball to another player's goal. Once you shoot the ball to the goal, you will get one point. The player who get two point win the game.

In your turn, you can choose 1 action from below 2 actions "twice".
1. Move a active player (no matter it's take the ball or not)
2. Pass (or shoot) the ball
You can move the same player in one turn.

In this game, player moving is special. Besides moving to adjacent empty space, you can, just like Chinese checkers, let player jump over another player any times.
user summary

Soccer Shogi is a game of new-sense that makes players have fun with intellectual soccer.
Dribble, pass, and shoot, as you foresee how the opponent will move, move your player tokens, and take the ball token.
Each goal gives one point to the player. The first player who gets two points total wins.

頭脳派サッカーが楽しめる、将棋のような新感覚ゲームです！
敵の動きを先読みしながら、選手ゴマを動かし、ボールゴマをうばって、ドリブル→パス→シュート！
ゴールすると1点。
先に2点取れば勝ちです。
publisher's summary

name: Monopoly: Lech Poznań
description: Known all over the world Monopoly now in Lech Poznań edition. Build tribunes and stadiums. Go through football training and visit Station Kolejorz without leaving your house. Travel with the team to european cup games, Celebrate the Polish championship with friends, high-five the legendary Lech players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Roll to Control
description:
From the publisher:

Roll to Control is an entertaining "new classic" board game, where 2-5 players compete to control the most colored zones on the game board. It was just named "Best of 2015" by Toys Bulletin as one of the "Best games you have never heard of" in a "100% Independent Review".

The game contents include 360 Scout markers (one set of 72 for each player in 5 different colors) 21 Caprocks, 5 Captain player pieces used to move each player around the perimeter of the board, 2 – twelve sided multi-colored dice, a game board that measures approximately 19″ x 20″ and a nicely illustrated set of rules.

To play the game, players alternate turns by rolling one die and moving their captain from the space occupied on the perimeter of the game board to the matching color on the perimeter as shown on the die. Once there, there are several options open to the player, depending on the types of figures outlined on the space landed on. If there are one or more hexagons outlined in black, the player can place that many Scouts in the colored zone that matches his die roll. If there is a "half-hexagon" mark on the space, the player can replace any one of the Caprocks, positioned in the colored zone matching the die roll, with one of his/her Scouts.

An optional move that can be made on a player’s turn is a challenge, and this can only be done if the space is marked for a challenge, either a regular challenge or a wild challenge. When a player performs a challenge, he chooses another player’s Scout which is adjacent to his own Scout in the colored zone that matches his die roll, or in the case of a wild challenge, he may opt to choose an adjacent player’s scout in any zone or even one that is in an adjacent colored zone, which greatly expands his choices. But the challenge must originate from the zone color that matches the die roll. To complete a challenge, each player rolls one 12 sided die, and the winner is determined based on a colorwheel that is conveniently located both on the game board and inside a player’s storage box. The colors are arranged in a circular pie-chart manner, and the colors, starting at the top of the circle, beat the colors as they are displayed clockwise around the circle, much like the hands of a clock. In other words, the color located at 12 beats the color at 1, and the color at 7 beats the color at 6. The challenge winner replaces the losing Scout with one of his own. Challenges can continue as long as the player who initiated the challenge continues to win.

The last and most exciting part of a player’s turn involves a closer look at those C-Traps. There is bit more here than first meets the eye. If at any time during a turn, that player’s Scouts form a C shape by surrounding any competing Scouts, regardless of color, all Scouts caught within the C-Trap are replaced by Scouts of the player controlling the C-Trap. In order to complete a C-Trap, there must be a minimum of 4 Scouts to surround 1 competitor Scout. But, as the game progresses, careful placement of Scouts can create gigantic C-Traps and suddenly change the entire face of the game board. Players can easily lose 10 or more Scouts on a single turn. The game ends when all of the hexagons in all of the colored zones are covered by Scouts or Caprocks. The player who controls the most zones out of the 12 colors is declared the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Drip Drop
description:
It´s raining and players race to home and can only move on from hideout to hideout so they don’t get soaked.
The youngest player goes first, then take turns clockwise! When
it’s your turn, throw the die and step forward onto the colored field shown on the die. If you threw pink, then step on the next field with a pink mushroom, if you threw green, step on the next field with a leaf, if you threw blue, go to the next field with a rock! These little drawings show where you’ve hidden from the rain. If you’ve reached the tree stump cottage at the end of the path first You win the game.

name: Matadoon!
description:
マタドーン (Matadoon!) is like a bull-fighting game, but the players aren't fighting the bull; instead they try to control the bull in order to hit the other players.

On the square grid of the game board, players take turns placing three of their four tiles face down, after which the bull starts running. The bull always goes straight, but when it steps on a tile, the tile is revealed and the bull's new direction is determined. When the bull hits a wall for the second time, it stops moving.

Use the tiles wisely to hit your opponent. A player falls prone and can no longer move once hit and is eliminated when hit for the second time. The last survivor wins the game.

Publisher's summary
牛「と」戦うのではなく、牛「で」戦う闘牛！
闘技場にマントチップを配置して、牛の動きを操り、対戦相手にぶつけろ！！

name: Picnic Party
description: Picnic Party is a children's game. The game has a board, and is card driven. The players play as ants and the winner is the first one to the picnic basket, the goal, on the board. All players draw a card, they then compare their numbers, the player with the highest number moves the number of steps that he/she has more than the card is the second highest. There is four shortcuts on the board. Includes a board, 4 ant game markers and 48 cards. Game board measures 16” x 16”.

name: COOK-a-BOX
description: Cook-a-box is a fun game for children, where they can learn English and Greek words by completing different recipes. In each round, player collect and exchange ingredients in order to complete their recipe card, and the first one to do so wins the game. Players need to be careful, because if they collect too many ingrediens they do not need, they are out of the game. (from Rulebook)

name: Stevepunk (fan expansion for Council of Blackthorn)
description:
Stevepunk is a mysterious character representing the farthest reaches. He tells wild stories of incredible flying machines and steam powered weapons. Everyone loves him, but no one really trusts him.

This is a fan made expansion for Council of Blackthorn. Copies of this were handed out at Gen Con 2016 by Stevepunk himself.

Stevepunk claims: This expansion is banned in 7 states and 2 Canadian provinces.

Stevepunk adds 1 additional Council Member to choose from at the beginning of the game with unique actions and abilities. Player tokens and council member card included.

name: Spicy Games
description:
Four total games included in the 'set'. See individual game entries for more information

Add a dash of fast-paced fun to your life! Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and only 10 minutes to play. Each of the four games has a unique fast, fun game play! Get all four great games together with a unique spice rack!

COFFEE BREAK: Take a break from the daily grind and brew up some fun with Coffee Break, the quick and easy dice game for the whole family. Think fast and stay alert or you'll get creamed! Coffee Break

SUGAR CUBES: Sweeten your fun with Sugar Cubes, the quick and easy game of words and wit. Sprinkle out the dice and spoon on a little creativity to beat the timer and taste sweet victory! Sugar Cubes

SALT AND PEPPER: Sprinkle on some fun with Salt & Pepper, the quick and easy guessing game featuring the dynamic duo of spices. A dash of intuition and a hint of good luck are all it takes to win! Salt and Pepper

CHEATERS' CHILI: Cheaters' Chili is a quick and easy bluffing game that will fire up the fun with your friends and family. Can you keep your cook when the heat is on? Cheaters' Chili

name: Prove It!
description:
Bet who can do the task best, and then Prove It™! There are four categories: Mad Skills (use your skill!), Know-How (use your noggin!), Fingers Crossed (it’s all about luck!) and Buddy System (teamwork!). For example, a card may read, “Bet how far you can launch a card, flicking it finger-football style!” Now the two competitors bet back and forth until one person ends the betting by saying “Prove it!”, and now the other player must perform the task to get the point!

Contents: 85 2-Sided Task Cards, 15 Proof Cards, Hoop, Cup, Ball, Finger Spinner, Moe the Timer, Rules

name: King and Cafe
description:
User summary:

王さまとカフェ (King and Cafe) is a game of speed, where players are vying to fill the most cafe orders for the king.

At the start of the game, one player is chosen as king, while all others take the role of local cafe managers. Each player draws a hand of seven cards. There is a pile of order cards for the king and ingredients for the managers. The king briefly displays all of their order cards and then the managers are allowed to adjust their hand of ingredients.

At the beginning of each round, the king chooses an order card and plays it face up to the table. All of the cafe managers then race to gather the ingredients from their hand and touch the standee of the king. The first player to successfully complete the order, receives the order card and its points.

Managers are then allowed to discard and draw until they have a hand of seven cards in preparation for the next round. After seven rounds have passed, the cafe managers tally up the value of the order cards they completed. The player with the highest total wins.

name: My Mighty Crystals
description: My Mighty Crystals is a colorful family board game, with lovely 3D miniatures characters. It's a race for 2-4 players along a path on which you will collect mighty crystals and meet funny creatures that you can control with your crystals. Each player can collect a maximum of three crystals, and more crystals are offered at the end of the race depending on the order of arrival. The player who owns the most crystals wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Miniatures, Racing

name: Least I Could Do: The Card Game – Sloppy Seconds
description:
You've played the men, you've played the ladies, now it's time to play the rest. Brave the bars after the gold's been mined and see if you can find a diamond in the rough. Just beware, you might have to get freaky to get their attention.

Fully compatible with the original Least I Could Do: The Card Game, and the Ladies Night! Expansion, Sloppy Seconds lets you play characters like Harry the Homeless Guy and Mick's Mom trying to pick up miscellaneous dates like Llama and the Suck For A Buck girl, using actions like Golden Shower, Movember, and a surprising number of pandas.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Sad Piggies
description:
Description from the publisher:

Sad Piggies - A card game of pigs wanting to die honorably. It is a highly strategic, party game for 2-4 players trying to help the silly and prideful pigs to die in their preferred honorable death than being slaughter by farmers. You can expect an emotional rollercoaster with your friends during the 15-20mins fast-paced gameplay by constantly plotting how you going to sabotage your friends to win the game by being the most "helpful" person to these pigs.

Disclaimer: This game can rekt your friendships. Period.

name: Moonshine Shutdown
description:
Illegal winemaking is, in whatever age, the best way to make a fortune in the black market. It is also a crime that the police force is eager to solve.

Now within a closed area, there's secret winemaking activity going on. Meanwhile, the police has found out about the activity and is waiting for the winemakers' arrest. Can the winemakers get away with it? Can they make a big fortune out of it eventually?
In Moonshine Shutdown, players play the winemakers who try to brew as much wine as possible before the police lock down the area. Whoever makes the most wine earns the most points and wins the game.

name: Finding Dory: See Search Game
description:
Help Dory find her family and friends! Dory and her friends are playing Hide and Seek. Where are they hiding? Be the first to find three, and you win.

The game is played on a large board printed 19" x 28" board printed with a pattern of dots designed to obscure pictures of the movie characters. Each player has a diving-mask-shaped viewer designed to reveal the character's picture. Players take turns turning over a card depicting a movie character. Players then race to use their viewers to find that character on the board. The player who finds the character claims the card. First player to three cards wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Barnstormer!: A Game of Daring Deeds
description:
Barnstormer! is an exciting game that requires skill and practice. Each player takes a wooden parellelogram shaped shooter and three wooden discs of one color. The discs are that player's "airplanes". The player places his shooter about 12 inches from the edge of the board. They then try to use their shooter to launch their airplanes into the air, and land their airplanes in the safe zones that score points while avoiding the dangerous zones that lose points.

The first player to 500 points wins.

name: Graduation Photo Records
description:
User summary
Graduation Photo Records (グラデュエーション・フォトレコーズ！) is a photo-placement game by the Japanese publisher TRI Fol:um -Repens-. The game was released for the Game Market 2017 Kobe in Japan.

In this game, you play students about to graduate from high school. They have little time before their graduation to get ready a photo album with memories of their days as student friends.

A tabletop game where your objective is to collect photos of your youth life and create your student yearbook. Gameplay itself is simple: draw a photo, and mount them on the board. Though, each player character has hidden objectives (like which kind of photo they like, or who they are in love with), and since so, their interests should have some conflicts.

There are no special events in the game, but with many beautiful photos in a common Japanese school days settings, the nostalgic atmosphere should be appealing to many.

Gameplay
You play as one of eight character, and each character has hidden objectives. The deck of photos is like printed photos shot on film, not digital prints. Each turn, you may 'shoot a photo' (draw a photo from the deck and place it face down in front of you), 'develop/print' (turn one of your face-down photos face-up), or 'layout on board' (place your printed photo on the shared album board).

The board doesn't have a grid, you may place the photo anyway you like. You may overlap any previously placed photos with just one restriction: at least one character's face must be fully visible from the underlying photos.

When the 'endgame' photo is drawn (it is loaded somewhere near the bottom of the deck), you tally points based on your hidden objectives.

The gameplay itself has low language dependencies, but the 8 student ID cards (with the face of the character and their hidden objectives) have Japanese on them. The photo itself has some handwritten Japanese scribbles with their character names, and some objectives refer to the other characters by these names ("4pts: have 2 or more photos with Miki at the end"). Therefore, if you cannot read JP letters well, you might struggle to properly recognise the names as they are presented. So the game needs a little more than a crib-sheet or memory, you need to be able to spot these names easily.

Publisher summary
写真を撮影、現像して
隠した想いを達成しつつ
あなた達だけの卒業アルバムを作るボードゲーム
～写真を重ねて創り出す、あなた達だけの卒業アルバム～

■簡単な概要！
①写真を撮影、
②現像して、
③アルバムを編集していく
――というボードゲームです。

各プレイヤーごとに秘めた思惑を達成しつつ、
素敵な卒業アルバムを仕上げましょう！

青春が描かれた写真カードを集めて、思い出の卒業アルバムを作成するボードゲーム。
システムとしては、写真を引いてアルバム台紙に置いていくだけのシンプルな物。
ただ、それぞれが隠し持った点数目標(写真の好みや意中の相手によって差別化されている)に向かって利害関係を作っている。
特別なイベントは無いが、日本の学生が思わず「懐かしい」と思えるような透明感のあるイラストとノスタルジックな世界観が魅力的。

name: Gobby
description:
Mouthpiece game similar to Speak Out and Watch Yo Mouth!.
There are 2500 phrases, 20 mouthpieces and sand timer.

Player must say a phrase with a mouthpiece until somebody guesses it or timer runs out. If one phrase is guessed but there are still time left He/She may continue.

The player or team who collected the most cards wins the game and becomes the Gob Master

name: Kalteva torni
description:
Kalteva torni is a dice game for 2-4 players. The game consists of 4 dices and 24 diagonal cylinder pieces in 4 different colors.

Each player gets 6 diagonal cylinders and a dice. Players roll dice and the highest number starts. Then players roll dice and start to build a tower. Each round cylinder pieces are added to the tower according to the dice roll.

The game ends when:

one of the players has none of the cylinder pieces left without knocking the tower down. Other players count their left over cylinders and get a point for each.
the tower is knocked down. The player who knocked it down gets one point for each cylinder in the tower and other players get a point for every cylinder they have left.


The game is played multiple rounds which are determined before the game starts. After every round the points are counted and the player who has the least points at the end of the game wins.

name: Fireworks Battle
description:
A group of seven cats have been training very hard to master their profession – shooting the best fireworks in the world. Although rookies, they hope to one day become as expert as their master. After so many years, the day is coming...

Each player uses a tile to hit on a heap of tiles in turns. If the knocked tiles land face up, the player takes a number of them. Whoever scores the most tiles wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Maratón Mónaco
description:
A trivia game. Up to four players or teams can play. The players advance in a track of 42 spaces (or "kilometers", hence the name of the game) by answering questions about six main themes.

In this version of Maratón in addition it is possible to bet in the answers of the other players, which are getting lost if the answer is wrong and being able to recover moving back the player marker a space in the board.

name: Paolo Tortellini
description:
In Paolo Tortellini players collect sets of foods to win. Each player is dealt 5 cards and draws one additional one each round, trying to get two sets of three cards each.

Essentially, it's a children's version of Rommé where you have to collect two sets of three cards each out of 8 sets of 4 cards.

name: 5-Minute Hydra Slayer
description:
A sequel to 5-Minute Dragon Slayer. This time, a 4-headed hydra is attacking your peaceful fantasy town!

Solitaire game. Each turn you choose 2 adjacent areas on the body of the monster to target, and roll dice. If you want to reroll you must remove one of your possible target areas, or lower your armor value by 1. Then you use your rolled dice to attack a part of the monster you were targeting, or to activate a spell.

Next, a die roll is used to determine which attack the hydra uses against you, and a second die roll to resolve that attack.

Continue until you kill the hydra, or the hydra kills your hero.

name: Clue Jr.: Spongebob Squarepants Edition – The Case of the Missing Jellyfish Net
description:
On a player's turn they will roll the die. If the die shows blue, that player secretly looks under any blue character pawn; yellow, that player secretly looks under any yellow item pawn; a number, that player moves any character pawn that number of spaces around the game board and then follows the instructions as indicated on the space the pawn ends its movement on.

On the bottom the blue bases is a sticker of a case for the net or a time. On the bottom of one of the yellow bases is a sticker of the net, the rest depict an X.

When you look at the bottom of a base, mark on your detective sheet the knowledge you gained.

The object of the game is to determine who stole the net (the character whose base has the case for the net), at what time of day (the only time that won't be crossed off), and where they left it (the item whose base had the sticker for the net).

At the end of your turn, if you can correctly answer the above questions, you win!

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Play That Tune
description:
Play that tune is a trivia/party game where players have to guess songs in team.

One player draws a card where 3 songs are noted with increasing difficulty. That player should pick one song and play it with a kazoo. The other team members have to guess the song. The harder the song the more points the team scores for discovering.

The game material consists of cards with songs written on them and 4 kazoos, each of a different color.

name: Sussed?: Out of the Blue
description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Sussed All Sorts is a family friendly quiz with a twist: instead of general knowledge, you’ll be answering questions about each other! As you read aloud a series of real and imaginary scenarios, you’ll be given choices to make. Whoever can suss you out scores. Who has the most points wins.

Over 200 topics to talk about including parallel universes, hot tub cinemas, crime networks, DNA sequencing, extinction of bees and the secret to happiness (to name a few!). So, who've you got sussed?

—description from the publisher

name: Disney Pixar Fanimation Game
description:
Disney Pixar Fanimation is a Disney Pixar themed board game. The board is customizable and consists of four interlocking board game sections that each have two unique sides. These board can be set up with between 2-4 sections depending on how long you want the game to be.

Game-play consists of spinning a spinner to determine how many spaces you move. You will land on a colored space that corresponds with three decks of cards. The decks are "Pardner Up" (pick a partner, draw a card, then do as the card says), "Head 2 Head" (pick an opponent, draw a card, then do as the card says), or "Go Solo" (hand the card to the player to the left, and you do what the player reads). If you successfully complete the card or win the challenge, you follow the bonus rule for the board game section that you are on.

The goal is to be the first player to the finish line.

name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary – Walk With Me & Clear Scenario Pack
description:
“Walk with Me” is a Scenario designed for two Survivors (either two players, or one player controlling a Survivor and an Ally).

While the memorable The Walking Dead scene that serves as the inspiration featured Michonne and Andrea on a stealth mission to a downed helicopter while Woodbury rivals and Merle hunt them down, the scenario can be played with almost any two Survivors.

“Walk with Me” makes heavy use of Rivals.

The event deck is now called Lay Low, during the campaign they were referred to as Walk with Me

"Clear" reunites Rick and Morgan in a battle of sanity while Michonne and Carl retrieve a memento.

In this three-Survivor Scenario, you return to Rick’s hometown in search of supplies, trying to grab an important memento while you’re at it. When you arrive, you unexpectedly discover another remnant of the past waiting for you: Morgan, Rick’s first friend after the apocalypse, who now stalks the streets of the town consumed by madness, driving away Walkers and people alike.

In terms of gameplay, Morgan behaves a lot like a Rival. Each round, after the Survivors have taken their turns, Morgan performs a Reaction based on the Approach type of the Event selected by the Leader.

Normally, when faced with an enemy as dangerous as Morgan, the simplest answer in the cold, harsh world of The Walking Dead would be just to kill him. However, in this Scenario that course of action actually causes you to lose! Your goal is to SAVE Morgan, pulling him out of the dark pit into which he has fallen. If you can get through to him, there may be a way to bring back the good man that still lies buried in his heart.

You can save Morgan through Coordinate Actions. In “Clear,” whenever a Survivor near Morgan uses any Coordinate Action (whether it’s the standard Assist Action, or a Special Action like“Inspire” from Rick's “Born Leader” Survivor Card), there are two extra success effects he or she can choose from. The first lets the Survivor reveal the top card of the Clarity deck, and discard it if he or she wishes. This gives the Survivors a chance to either gain some insight into what Morgan will do next and adjust their plans accordingly, or to bypass something particularly dangerous altogether.

Clear Cards represent Morgan’s more lucid moments and are basically “safe” cards when drawn from the Clarity deck, since—unlike the Hostile Cards—they have no instructions for Morgan to perform. While no Clear Cards start in the deck at first, more and more can be added over time, as Morgan begins to listen to reason. These cards not only help make Morgan more manageable during each cycle through the Clarity deck, but also happen to be the goal of the Scenario. While the Survivors won’t be able to bring Morgan completely back, once all five Clear Cards have been moved to the Clarity deck, Morgan will be well enough for the Survivors to leave him and head home.

Contains:
- double sided map tile
- 20 event cards
- Morgan clarity deck
- Merle rival board
- rival board

(from Kickstarter page)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Popeye: Bis ans Limit!
description:
To the limit! Popeye beats his way .. Nobody can stop him with the power of spinach, or not? Brutus gets in the way, but Olivia is at Popeye's side. Go with Popeye so far you can to score high!

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game play: The active player mixes all coasters and places the stack facedown in front of him. The active player now covers up coaster to coaster until he voluntarily or forcibly stops. Lots of coasters show a certain number of spinach cans, which the player adds over the individually uncovered coasters (from coasters to coasters).

Background: Each spinach can boost Popeye and bring more and more victory points! Only with the appearance of Popeye, the players can freely stop and hold his points. Oliva helps to increase the points quickly, Brutus breaks all points and the player has to stop. If a player achieves 54 or more victory points at the end of a complete round, he finishes the game. The highest number of victory points wins.

—description from the designer (translated)

Bis ans Limit! Popeye schlagt sich durch .. Mit der Kraft des Spinats kann ihn keiner aufhalten oder doch?

Brutus steht im Weg, aber Olivia ist an Popeyes Seite. Gehe mit Popeye soweit Du kannst, um stark zu punkten!

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Spieldeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: Der aktive Spieler mischt alle Deckel und legt diese als Stapel verdeckt vor sich ab. Der aktive Spieler deckt jetzt so lange Deckel nach und nach auf, bis er nicht mehr kann oder will.
Viele Deckel zeigen eine bestimmte Anzahl an Spinatdosen, die der Spieler über die einzelnen aufgedeckten Deckel (von Deckel zu Deckel) aufaddiert. Hintergrund: Jede Spinatdose stärkt Popeye und bringt mehr und mehr Siegpunkte! Nur bei einem Auftauchen von Popeye kann der Spieler freiwillig aufhören und seine Punkte festhalten. Oliva hilft die Punkte schnell zu erhöhen, Brutus macht alles zunichte und der Spieler muss aufhören. Erzielt ein Spieler am Ende einer kompletten Runde 54 oder mehr Siegpunkte, endet das Spiel. Die höchste Siegpunktanzahl gewinnt.

—description from the designer

name: Wells: Fountain of Youth (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
A 12-tile expansion that provides well tiles for the use with the forests, fishermen (or river) and mountains series.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Perplexus Mini: Spiral
description:
This is an excellent introduction to the concept of the Perplexus range. The difficulty of the spirals (make as many loops as possible!) is flexible because the course is double-sided. Take it anywhere, play it all the time, this mini 3D maze is perfect for discovering the world of Perplexus!

Contains a course of 20 stages in spirals, double-sided and a ball.

—description from the publisher

name: Orbs
description: Each player plays an alien race trying to escape the explosion of a nearby sun by moving their three artificial planets (orbs) out of the blast radius. Players build bridges and gates on the gameboard to bring their orbs outward into ever more distant orbits around the exploding center of their solar system.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Deadpool vs The World: Mini
description:
A mini version of Deadpool vs The World with a slightly different ruleset.

To play, select a player to act as the "Editor." Each player is then dealt one Caption card randomly. The Editor reveals a WTF? card, and each player secretly fills in the blank on their Caption card and submits it to the Editor face-down. The Editor mixes up the submitted cards, reveals them one at a time, and then chooses his/her favorite as the winner.

The main differences between the mini version and the regular version of the game are: the mini version lasts only one round, whereas the regular game lasts a number of rounds; in the mini version, players are only giving one Caption card, whereas in the regular game they have a hand of Captain cards to choose from.

The mini game comes with: a rules card, 2 WTF? cards, 5 Caption cards, and a marker.

The mini game was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #222 (August 2018).

name: Myth: Avatar of Stone Banner Saga Crossover expansion
description: Two cards for Myth from the Banner Saga warbands kickstarter campaign.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Drinking Games for People Who Never Drink Except When They Do
description:
A collection of 50 drinking games broken into six different categories: active, drinking, improv, team, word and stupid.
