Some games are old standards (but with a new twist), while others are little known. Whether it be a pregame, vision quest or full-blown mass cult suicide - there's a game here to suit every get-together!

From the creators of the game, "DRUNK STONED OR STUPID," games are customizable to play with or without drinking.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Pikmi Pops Lollipop Chase
description:
Help the Pikmi Pops fill their Pikmi trees with lots of lollipops! To earn a lollipop, you may need to dance, sing, or even tell a story. Some special places on the board will unlock surprises! Be the first player to collect four different lollipops to fill your Pikmi tree and win! Game includes one exclusive sweet scented Pikmi Pops plush.

—description from the publisher

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone: Diagon Alley Chapter Game
description:
This is a game in the Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone Chapter Game series, in which games are contained in a portable box designed to look like a book, and the theme of the game corresponds to chapters in the book Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.

In this roll-and-move game, you are trying to collect all six tokens before your opponent.

On your turn, you roll two dice. One die determines how many spaces you can move, and the other die determines how many spaces you must move the Malfoy figure. To win the game you must first collect the Gringotts Token, then you must collect each of the other five tokens by visiting the various stores on the map. If you land on a space with Malfoy, or he lands on the space where you are standing, you lose the token you most recently acquired. The first player to collect all six tokens and return to the "Leaky Cauldron" spot wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tree Swing Cartoon Game
description: Tree Swing Cartoon Game, a.k.a. 顧客が本当に必要だったもの (What the Customer Really Needed), is a card game in which you build a tree swing of sorts step by step with cards to satisfy the demands of customers.
publishers: Hanshakaijin Circle (反社会人サークル)

name: Warhammer: Chronicles 2004
description:
Warhammer: Chronicles 2004 is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 128-page softcover book is a compilation Warhammer articles, combined with revised or previously unpublished material.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Riddle Cube: the Game
description: Riddle Cube is a quick, family game where up to 4 players pull a malleable cube with elasticated string components to race to see who can construct the desired shape in a minute. Points are scored for the quickest player to construct the shape. Pretty simple game.

name: Legends: 2019
description:
Legends is a small scale high action skirmish game of super heroic improbable action.

It is a multi player game requiring a set of D6 and 1 to 3 suitably heroic miniatures. It plays out on a 2x2' table with as much urban terrain as players can muster. A game runs to roughly 30 minutes per player.

It puts players into the shoes of any lycra clad hero they might imagine, or other super powered individual, in a battle of extreme proportions. Models can run up buildings to launch themselves into the sky, slam through walls and pick up sky scrapers to hit their opponents with. Inspired by both the world of Marvel superheros and the extreme action of films such as Kung Fu Hustle Legends creates a world in which almost any imaginable action is possible with only a handful of mechanics and a couple of pages of rules. 

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Der Tunnel: Escape from East Berlin
description:
In Der Tunnel: Escape from East Berlin, a.k.a. 東ベルリンからの脱出, one player takes on the roll of the leader of a group that hopes to defect to the West and the other is an investigator with the secret police. The defector player wins if they are able to open the escape tunnel to West Berlin, and the investigator wins if they are able to arrest a certain number of the asylum seekers.

On their turn, the defector assigns a certain number of their members to different tasks such as tunnel construction, fund raising, or simply spending time in the city. These members are assigned face down.

The investigator places cards down on the different assignments hoping to arrest the defectors; the faces of the cards match the different members of the defectors.

The different members of the defectors have specialties, such as tunnel-digging. Arrested members can be released on bail. The game continues until one of the sides meets their victory condition.

name: Pont D'Avignon
description:
Nanodaption of Avignon: A Clash of Popes.


Based on Avignon by John duBois, as part of the January 2017 WGKS.

2-Player game of Faith, Fealty and Floods.

Secretly choose which hand wields the power of the church, in a tug of war for influence. Or build the bridge across the Rhône, to withstand a series of floods. Score after each Flood, and after 4, the player with the most influence wins.

Comes with 1 card and rules, supply a few tokens to play.

—description from the designer

name: Middara: The Pit Boss
description:
The Pit Boss Bounty Pack contains a Bounty Book, multiple new Initiative cards, two new Combatants, a new Boss Monster, new Monster Loot, and hidden Item cards for you to uncover.

The Pit Boss and his goons will test your meta-game knowledge like a party of grapplers facing a new dungeon master in 3rd edition. The Pit Boss will test your might and put your highly tuned group through the deepest sections of the Mines of Hyde. Beyond where even the most venerable warriors dare stray. And whether you end up living triumphantly as heroes, or rotting away as dead memories written on the pages of history books. One way or another, Bounties will earn your party fame in Middara.

PERFECTION THROUGH ADVERSITY
Bounty Packs expand the Adventure Mode with insanely hard and uniquely diverse side quests. These Side Quests can be attempted at lower levels than the intended difficulty recommends for an even hard challenge.

Each Bounty Pack adds a side quest that can be attempted during specific moments of the Adventure Mode. The Bounties of Elenia line of Bounty Packs represent all of the horrible monstrosities that threaten the realms of Elenia.

Each Bounty Pack contains a plethora of new content. New tokens, a new Bounty Book, new miniatures, new tiles that expand old sets, new unique loot, new upgrades, as well as optional content to change the possible combatants that might spawn in the Unintentional Malum Core Game and Adventure Expansions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Council of Verona (Third Edition)
description:
The Council is back in session!

Get ready to dive back into the world of Romeo and Juliet with the Council of Verona! The Montagues and Capulets’ family quarrel has reached a boiling point, and it’s up to you to settle their feud once and for all to decide who makes it to the council, and who gets exiled.

Rewrite the classic Shakespearean saga your own way by influencing the members of both families to either form a begrudging alliance, or kick them out of the city altogether. Poison your enemies, create unlikely bonds, and maybe even bring Romeo and Juliet together once and for all.

This all new third edition has brand new art, giving full color images to every single card in the game. Additionally, there have been some rule tweaks and minor balance changes to make the game a bit more competitive. Finally, players can stop worrying about how to hide their tokens with the addition of player screens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Novel-based, Renaissance

name: 1 Minute Debates
description:
You are challenged to find a witty answer to a question while trying to satisfy various conditions.
Sure, it`s easy enough to come up with an answer to a question such as «How do you survive on a desert island?». But what if you have only 1 minute and can use three words only, as many “O’s” as possible and at least one name of a food?

—description from the publisher

name: Geocaching: The Game
description:
Players move around the Geocaching trail to try to get the most trinkets from caches. The board has a main track and side tracks that can be used to help you toward your goal. Play is counter-clockwise and you must roll a die to move. Certain spaces, characters on the board, and GPS cards that you gain can send you elsewhere on the board, or even physically at the table. Others reward, help or hold you back. Once you get past the Finish (which you can only do if you aren't bringing Travel Bugs with you), you stay in the game, trying to protect your stash, until everyone else catches up. The person with the most Trinkets wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Humor, Print & Play

name: Arvaa missä?
description:
One player is a spy and other players (detectives) try to find him. The spy marks its hiding place in the spy booklet but does not show it to the others. Then the hourglass is turned and the game can start.

Other players try to find the hiding place of the spy from the board. Three cards are revealed. Those are the tools that the detectives can use. When all three cards are used, new three cards are revealed. They refer to different areas on the board. Are you on this row? Are you on the same space with cars or water? Seekers mark the spaces where the spy is not and try to find the correct space.

Different tools take different time to use (the time in minutes is marked on cards). If the hourglass is turned the seekers get a penalty minute. The spy gets as many points as it takes in minutes for the seekers to find. All players play once as a spy and the winner is the player who gets most points.

name: Lovelace & Babbage: Tantrum House 2019 Promo Card
description:
Promo card available through the Tantrum House 2019 kickstarter campaign.

This is a patron card that demands a 78 and gets you a yellow or a green influence.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Number, Real-time
mechanics: Action Queue, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Party, Party!
description:
Party, Party! is a game of risk and excitement. Because of his birthday, Mickey decides to have a super party! Your goal is to invite as many friends as possible.

Shuffle all the tiles (numbered 1 to 5) and lay them in a circle.

On your turn you throw the die and move Mickey Mouse that many steps. If the value of the tile is higher than the die, your turn ends. If the value is equal to or lower than the die, you have two options:

Claim the tile and end your turn, or
Cover the tile with the Mickey Mouse disc and throw the die again. You move Mickey again and if the second tile equals your die or is lower, you win both tiles. Otherwise your turn is over and you receive no tiles.


Mickey moves from tile to tile (clockwise) until there's only 1 tile left. Then, you simply throw the die for that last tile. Once the last tile is claimed, the game is over. The player with the highest total value of claimed tiles wins the game.

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – Menace of Darth Maul Starter
description:
This is a very simple CCG based on the movie Star Wars: Episode I.

Menace of Darth Maul Starter contains two customized 30-card starter decks.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Young Jedi: Collectible Card Game – The Jedi Council Starter
description:
This is a very simple CCG based on the movie Star Wars: Episode I.

The Jedi Council Starter contains two customized 30-card starter decks.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Shaky Shark
description:
Test your fishing skills and your reflexes against the Shaky Shark!

This hungry shark shakes and wobbles as you try to fish out the wreckage from his mouth. You'll need to most fast though, as the timer counts down and the shark will chomp down on your fishing pole!

Who will manage to get all the prizes out from Shark's mouth?

Hungry shark shakes and wobbles as you try to fish out the wreckage from his mouth. Times goes off unannounced and the shark's mouth closes on the losing player.

Components: 1 wobbling shark base, 4 fishing poles, 20 sea-themed play pieces, and instructions.

name: Laugh & Lose
description:
We've collected over 300 of the world's raunchiest, cheesiest and silliest dad jokes. Also includes 150 blank cards to record your own dad jokes.

The game's simple. One player reads a joke to the opposing player. If either player laughs, they lose a point. Deliver your own joke, instead of the one on the card, and you can earn double points.

At the end of each hand, players can tag in or out with other members of their team (if you feel a burst of giggles coming on.)

The game ends when a player or team reaches the agreed upon amount of points needed to win. A player or team wins when it collects enough points by not laughing at the joke more often than their opponent.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Little Flower Shop: Basket – Game Boy Geek promo card
description:
Promotional basket card offered during the Game Boy Geek - Season 8 - 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

This new basket card allows you to gain $2 and draw a random card.

name: The Bank Job
description:
You and your cohorts of crime have just pulled off the most successful bank heist of the century, including the theft of one of the world's most valuable diamonds. You must lay low for a week and guard your take; there's no honor amongst thieves here, and everyone wants the most they can get. Plus, rumors are there's a snake in your midst that might be out to get the prize jewel for themselves, and a rat could be trying to foil the whole operation.

Each player will be dealt a random crew card to tell you what your part in this band of thieves is. These are not hidden from other players, since teamwork is dreamwork, after all. Each person brings their own unique talent, or specialty, to the crew, usable throughout the game. You will also be given a random role card, possibly giving you a secret double agent part to play. These should not be shared and will affect how you can win the game. There are four regular crew member cards, one snake card, and one rat card. As with any squad, the more people you bring in, the likelier it is to have defectors.

The game is played over the course of seven rounds, or days. Every day will begin with players taking turns to choose their actions for the day by placing a token on the box next to the action of their choice. For morning actions, you will use the numbers on your crew cards to determine turn order. After that, turn order is based on the last round's actions going from top to bottom on the action card in the center of the table.

Your goal, as the thief you are, is to hoodwink your way through the week, exchanging loot with players and the score to end up with the best take for yourself. Don't get too greedy, though! If you end up with more than the score, your zealousness will be shown, and the crew will take you out. The prized diamond is also supposed to be shared, so any crew member holding it at the end will mark you for an early demise, as well. Additionally, the bank loaded a tracker into the loot that will get you caught and disqualified if you're holding it at the end.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Hot Potato, Prisoner's Dilemma, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Wizard School: Hank's Dirty Little Secrets
description:
In this (not really all that safe for kids) expansion "Hank's Dirty Little Secrets" you will find quite a few things that you will not find on a store shelf. These are all the cards that Hank wrote, and then made Karen draw, but really could not be put into the core game. A fair number of references to Hank's actual high school experience, which we wouldn't call racy, but we wouldn't call tame either.

33 extra cards to add to your Wizard school deck!

Also comes with a few postcards and stickers, a giant character card, a magical wand and a « sorry » coin.

name: UNO: Simpsons Edition
description: This version of UNO features Simpsons images on the cards, a new card type (Blinky Card) and it is housed in a box shaped like Homer's head.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Astromino: To Catch a Star
description:
A long time ago, many shooting stars fell to earth. Most of them fell upon a hill. It was eventually named the "Starry Hill". The faithful built places of worship upon this hill and gathered the falling stone gems. In present time you try to gather the gems also to collect resources and build your buildings. The person that is the most successful wins.

On your turn:
You will have 1 dice, then you predict the color and number of the next dice you will draw from the bag. Then assign your worker on the board. After drawing the die add the 2 numbers together if your prediction is accurate you will gain extra resources.

The game uses number prediction statistics, as well as worker placement.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Predictive Bid, Worker Placement

name: Brúnó Budapesten: Városnézés
description:
The Sightseeing board game presents Budapest to the preschool and primary school age group on four large boards. It is the smallest of the four games of different difficulty and theme, and those who can already read will find it age-appropriate. The game guides both Budapesters and non-Budapesters through the capital.

The Brúnó in Budapest board game contains 4 different games that are related to the book series Brúnó in Budapest.

The rules are simple and easy to follow in all 4 games and can be played in an average of 15-20 minutes.

Simplified, Erika Bartos's drawings introduce children to Budapest's famous buildings and public spaces in a perfectly recognizable way. The game is also suitable for children who like transport and means of transport.

The cube-based vehicle game is easy even for the little ones: the winner is the first to collect the six vehicles.

The second board is a classic party, where the winner will be the first to get from Vajdahunyad Castle to the Elizabeth Lookout Tower.

In the third game, we have to go around the border of the capital, and the surrounding settlements and the building drawings on the map and the numbers and boundaries of the districts help to get to know our capital.

The fourth answer table builds on the knowledge of Budapest.

The game is recommended for 3-10 year olds. It can be played by 2 to 8 players.

name: Stamp Collection Cats
description:
An auction game of furmidable negotiations for 3-5 players.
As you desperately try to trade your cat stamps with others to build the most valuable collection, the face down cards in the center will slowly reveal which cards are more valuable. Did you predict that the green cat stamps would be pretty valuable this game? Alas, it turns out green cards are worth the fewest points in this auction! Better try and sneakily trade one to another player.

name: Jolly Polly
description: A banana tree is shaking from the weight of the fruits and the parrots want to feast on them! Easier said than done as the tree does not stay still. Every time a new parrot lands on the tree, it shakes and moves. The first player to place all their parrots on the tree wins!

name: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Toni Darling
description:
Released as part of the Kickstarter Promo for Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest

PR22: Toni Darling (Extended Art)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Marmot
description:
Marmot is a simple placement game designed by Mark Steere to be easy to program.

Marmot is played on an initially empty hex board.

Players take turns placing a token of their color on any empty hex that is adjacent to no more than 1 token of the their color. As soon as one player is unable to make a placement, that player loses the game.

name: Aloha! Burger
description:
Let's have a nervous breakdown with the ingredient card. You can make a Kua Aina hamburger by stacking the cards you got!

Players take turns sitting and memorize the front of an ingredient card that is then placed face down. Next. ingredient cards are flipped over and players have to find the match. Players can keep flipping cards until they have made a mistake. Then the mistake card stays flipped over and the turn goes to the player on the left. When the order is complete that player takes all the ingredient cards. Turn ingredients into the most burgers to win the game.

A collaboration between Daiso and the Kua 'Aina Sandwich shop in Hawaii/London/Japan.

name: Black Stories Junior: Funny Stories
description:
Why did Oskar climb into a garbage can freshly showered? Why did Mrs. Öhmchen serve her burglar coffee and cake? Why was Tiago mistaken for a turkey? And how could the toilet flush expose a thief?

These funny and absurd riddles about disgusting ice creams, burning underpants, clumsy criminals or exploding dog poop are all a bit curious - and sometimes sheer unbelievable. The squeaky-clean puzzle stories are full of wit and can only be solved by clever thinking around corners and good deduction skills. Disbelief and spontaneous smiles included!

The black stories Junior are exciting puzzle stories on cards, which must be cracked together. Only the game leader knows the solution to the riddle because he reads the riddle on the front aloud and may also study the solution on the back carefully. The other players now try to find the solution step by step by asking questions and guessing.

name: Monopoly: Go Green
description:
It's time to go green! In the Monopoly: Go Green Edition board game, players buy, sell, and trade properties, and invest in greening them up. Build wooden greenhouses to collect more rent and invest in solar and wind utilities. In this edition of the Monopoly game, greenhouses and dice are made of FSC certified wood from well-managed forests, and tokens are made with plant-based plastic derived from sugarcane, a renewable raw material. The package, gameboard, game guide, money, cards, storage bag, insert, and money tray are made with 100% recycled paper.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Micomicons en el bosque
description:
What a mess! They have searched all the backpacks and the bag of goodies that you took to eat tonight at the bonfire have disappeared! In its place you have found a strange map with the signature of the "King Micomicon".

If you want to recover your sweets and perhaps find legendary characters and ancient treasures, you will have to enter the magical Forest of the Micomicons. Let the adventure begin!

Our objective will be to cross the magical forest of the Micomicons while we advance through the letters on the way until we reach the King with the objects that he asks us for matching our letters.

Players roll dice to move and pick up cards to deliver to the King. If they can't deliver to the king, they must move back 1plaec for each card in their hand.

In competitive mode, the first player who manages to reach the king and deliver the objects to him or, failing that, achieve what his roll of the dice indicates, will have won.

If we have played in cooperative mode, when one of the players reaches the king's card and they give him among all the objects he requests or get the action roll with the dice, they will have won.


¡Qué desastre! Han registrado todas las mochilas y la bolsa de chucherías que llevabais para comer esta noche en la hoguera han desaparecido! En su lugar habéis encontrado un extraño mapa con la firma del “Rey Micomicon”. Si queréis recuperar vuestras chuches y tal vez encontrar personajes de leyenda y antiguos tesoros , tendréis que adentraros en el Bosque mágico de los Micomicons. ¡Que comience la aventura! Así se nos presenta este juego que nos trae la editorial Enpeudejocedicions y que ha sido diseñado e ilustrado por Víctor Arenas.Nuestro objetivo será cruzar el bosque mágico de los Micomicons mientras avanzamos por las cartas de camino hasta llegar al Rey con los objetos que nos pide, en nuestras cartas.

El jugador robará una carta del mazo de cartas de objeto y podrá usar una de sus cartas de objeto de la mano dejándola sobre la mesa. Tras ver el resultado, llevará a cabo el efecto final de esa carta, que puede ser avanzar, retroceder o lo que se indique para finalizar su turno y dar paso al siguiente jugador.

En el modo competitivo, el primer jugador que consiga llegar hasta el rey y entregarle los objetos o en su defecto conseguir lo que su tirada de dados indica, habrá ganado.

Si hemos jugado en el modo cooperativo, cuando uno de los jugadores llegue a la carta del rey y le entreguen entre todos los objetos que solicita o consigan la tirada de acción con los dados, habrán ganado.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tables-Tastic
description:
Tables-Tastic is a fun family maths game for children aged 6+ that will help children learn their multiplication tables up to 12 x 12 without even realising they are learning.

Players start with a hand of seven cards each and the aim of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their cards. Each turn starts with the player rolling two dice, giving a number between 2 and 12, and they can play if they have a card in their hand in the correct times table.

Special rules if you roll a 7, 11 or a double add an extra layer of both strategy and luck. Feedback from customers is that the children are so engrossed in trying to work out whether they can play that they don't realise they are learning maths by stealth.

All packs come with "times table checker cards" for children (or adults) who are less confident with their times tables. The game can also be played solo for extra practice.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math
